column1: recipe

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> oats <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shortening <NEXT_INGR> 8 tablespoons cocoa (heaping) <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup peanut butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 5 cups quick oats <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring milk, shortening, cocoa, and sugar to a boil for 2-3 minutes - melting the sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Add peanut butter and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir and add oats. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir again then drop by spoonfuls on wax paper. <NEXT_INSTR> Allow to cool and set. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chef Bob's Chocolate Oatmeal Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Orange Flavor <NEXT_INPUT> orange zest <NEXT_INPUT> cold lemon lime <NEXT_INPUT> lemon sherbet <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 Tbsp. KOOL-AID Orange Flavor Sugar-Sweetened Drink Mix <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. orange zest Safeway 1 lb For $0.79 thru 02/09 <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup cold lemon lime-flavored seltzer <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup lemon sherbet <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. thawed COOL WHIP Whipped Topping <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix drink mix, zest and seltzer in tall glass. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sherbet. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with COOL WHIP. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Frosty Citrus Float <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> granny smith apples <NEXT_INPUT> green bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> poultry seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> overnight <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> light cream <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> turkey broth <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb sliced bacon <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup reserved bacon fat <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 medium celery ribs, with leaves chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 granny smith apples, peeled, cored, and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium green bell pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon poultry seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 10 cups coarsely crumbled cornbread, dried overnight <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup pecans, toasted and coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup chopped fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup half-and-half or 1 cup light cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 34 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup turkey broth or 12 cup chicken broth <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the bacon strips in a single layer on a large rimmed baking sheet; bake in the upper third of the oven until crisp and browned, 10-15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Some strips of bacon will cook more quickly than others, so remove them as they crisp and drain on paper towels. <NEXT_INSTR> Crumble when cool. <NEXT_INSTR> As the bacon fat renders and accumulates in the baking sheet, pour it off into a small heatproof bowl; reserve 1/3 cup. <NEXT_INSTR> In a big skillet, heat the reserved bacon fat over medium heat; add in the onions, celery, apples, and green pepper; cook/stir until the onions are softened and translucent, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in poultry seasoning and cook for 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Scrape the vegetable mixture into a large bowl; mix in the cornbread, crumbled bacon, pecans, and parsley. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually beat in the half-and-half and egg; season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a lightly buttered casserole; drizzle with broth, cover, and bake in a preheated 350 oven for 30 minutes (uncover the last 15 minutes for a crusty top). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cornbread Dressing With Bacon and Pecans <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cornflakes <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> chickens <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 cups crushed plain cornflakes (from 8 cups whole cornflakes) <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbs smoked paprika, to taste <NEXT_INGR> 2.5 tsp salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c milk <NEXT_INGR> 3 chickens (3 to 3.5 lbs each), cut into 8 pieces each - I just use boneless breasts or whatever I have in the freezer <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbs fresh parsley for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1. Preheat oven to 350. Line 2 baking sheet with aluminum foil or spray with non-stick cooking spray <NEXT_INSTR> 2. Combine crushed cornflakes in large bowl with paprika, salt, and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> 3. Lightly beat eggs with milk in a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> 4. Dip chicken in egg mixture, shake off excess, then into crumbs, coating well. Place on baking sheets, leaving space between pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> 5. Bake, in batches, for 1 hour or until golden brown and cooked through. <NEXT_INSTR> 6. To serve, arrange chicken on large tray and sprinkle with parsley <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spiced-Up, Oven Fried Chicken  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shallot <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pink <NEXT_INPUT> young mustard greens <NEXT_INPUT> dates <NEXT_INPUT> pomegranate seeds <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon finely chopped shallot <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 small pink or red grapefruit <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb young mustard greens, trimmed and cut into 1/2-inch pieces (2 cups) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup dried dates, pitted and chopped <NEXT_INGR> Garnish: pomegranate seeds <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Stir together shallot and lime juice in a small bowl and let stand 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk in oil, sugar, and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut peel and any white pith from grapefruit with a sharp knife, then cut sections free from membranes. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss mustard greens with dates in a large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Just before serving, toss greens with dressing and salt to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide salad between 2 plates and top with grapefruit sections. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Grapefruit, Mustard Green, and Date Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mushroom <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> fresh breadcrumbs <NEXT_INPUT> steak sauce <NEXT_INPUT> fresh parsley <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground chuck <NEXT_INPUT> ground lean pork <NEXT_INPUT> ketchup <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 lb mushroom, coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups fresh breadcrumbs <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons steak sauce <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons fresh parsley, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried thyme <NEXT_INGR> salt & pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 lbs ground chuck <NEXT_INGR> 12 lb ground lean pork <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup ketchup <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, beaten <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 375F. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook mushrooms & onion in butter over med-high heat until soft. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add breadcrumbs, steak sauce, parsley, thyme, salt, pepper to bowl; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> In separate bowl, combine beef, pork, ketchup, and eggs; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Pack half meat mixture into large loaf pan, pressing to create an even layer. <NEXT_INSTR> Pack all of mushroom mixture on top, then cover with rest of meat mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 1 hour, 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove loaf from oven & let stand 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour off juices, then unmold meatloaf onto serving plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice & serve hot. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mushroom-Stuffed Meatloaf <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ricotta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> fruit seasonal <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 3/4 ounces ricotta cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup vanilla yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons honey <NEXT_INGR> fruit seasonal, to serve <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine ricotta, yogurt and honey and mix until smooth. Serve with fruit. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Honey Ricotta Dip <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> ginger ale <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> almond extract <NEXT_INPUT> tea <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 qt. water <NEXT_INGR> 2 qt. ginger ale <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. almond extract <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. strong tea <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all ingredients in large container. <NEXT_INSTR> Add ice or ice ring. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes a gallon of punch. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Almond Tea <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> shallots <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 package of spring greens (any brand, there'll all the same) <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup of shallots or sweet vidalia onion <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves <NEXT_INGR> 4 strips of bacon (low-sodium) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup of extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup of balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper for taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add eggs to boiling water and boil for 15 min. with lid slightly ajar. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Dice shallots or onions. Set aside. Mince garlic. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Slice bacon stips in 1 inch pieces and add to pre-heated non-stick skillet. Fry on medium high heat until slightly crisp. Drain in pan lined with a sheet of paper towel. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Drain off 1/2 of the bacon fat reserving the other half in the pan. Add the olive oil to the pan. Add the shallots or onions and garlic. Saute until onions or shallots becomes opaque over medium heat. Add the balsamic vinegar. Simmer for about 2 minutes or until the dressing reduces. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Poor dressing over spring greens. Dice boiled eggs and add to salad. Add bacon pieces. Toss.Divide among 2 plates. Sprinkle each serving with freshly ground black pepper and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Nicole'S Warm "Oh My God, I'M So Stuffed" Salad  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Layer <NEXT_INPUT> angel food cake <NEXT_INPUT> Layer <NEXT_INPUT> strawberry-banana Jello gelatin <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> Layer <NEXT_INPUT> mandarin orange <NEXT_INPUT> fruit cocktail <NEXT_INPUT> Layer <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla pudding mix <NEXT_INPUT> fresh berries <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Bottom Layer <NEXT_INGR> angel food cake, broken into pieces or poundcake <NEXT_INGR> 6th Layer <NEXT_INGR> 1 (3 ounce) box strawberry-banana Jello gelatin <NEXT_INGR> 5th Layer <NEXT_INGR> 3 -4 bananas, sliced round <NEXT_INGR> 4th Layer <NEXT_INGR> 1 can pineapple chunk, drained <NEXT_INGR> 3rd Layer <NEXT_INGR> 1 can mandarin orange, drained <NEXT_INGR> 2nd Layer <NEXT_INGR> 1 can fruit cocktail, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1st Layer <NEXT_INGR> 1 (3 1/2 ounce) box vanilla pudding mix <NEXT_INGR> 1 container Cool Whip <NEXT_INGR> fresh berries (to garnish) (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Prepare jello and pudding according to directions on box; put in fridge until set, about 4 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Follow directions as above, using the cool whip and berries as top garnish. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill until served. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve in a punch bowl or glass trifle bowl. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> 7 Layer Punchbowl Dessert <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tuna mixed <NEXT_INPUT> shallots <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> yellow pepper <NEXT_INPUT> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> flat-leaf parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/3 pounds tuna mixed, swordfish, snapper, and/or cod, cut into 1 inch chunks <NEXT_INGR> 12 shallots small, halved <NEXT_INGR> 1 red pepper large, deseeded and chopped coarsely <NEXT_INGR> 1 yellow pepper large, deseeded and chopped coarsely <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium zucchini sliced thickly <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon dried oregano <NEXT_INGR> flat-leaf parsley chopped, optional <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Thread the fish and vegetables, alternating, onto skewers. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine the oil and oregano in a small bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook the skewers on heated oiled grill or grill pan, basting with oil mixture, for about 5 mins or until browned all over and just cooked through. Sprinkle with parsley, if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fish Kebabs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> thin spaghetti <NEXT_INPUT> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (8 oz.) box thin spaghetti <NEXT_INGR> 10 to 12 chicken breasts, cooked and cut into bite size pieces or 5 c. chicken <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. slivered almonds <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans cream of mushroom soup (undiluted) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. Parmesan cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into a large Pyrex dish, then sprinkle with almonds and cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> If you do not want to use cheese you can use crushed potato chips. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook in a 350° oven for 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 10 to 12. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Tetrazzini <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pine nuts <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup pine nuts <NEXT_INGR> 3 cloves roasted garlic, mashed (see page 255) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup firmly packed smoked tomatoes (see headnote) or sundried tomatoes packed in oil, drained and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 cups bleached all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tablespoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 to 2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, chilled and cut into pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup grated 5-month-aged Asiago cheese (grated with the large holes) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons thinly sliced green onions (white part only) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 to 3/4 cup buttermilk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 400F. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange the pine nuts on a baking sheet in a single layer and bake until golden, about 5 minutes; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> (Keep checking; they burn easily.) <NEXT_INSTR> In a bowl, stir together the tomatoes and the roasted garlic, making sure the garlic breaks up and is evenly distributed. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually cut in the butter with a pastry blender or 2 knives until the mixture resembles small peas. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the tomato garlic mixture, pine nuts, grated cheese, green onions, cream, and 1/2 cup of the buttermilk. <NEXT_INSTR> Using your hands, mix all the ingredients until they are incorporated. <NEXT_INSTR> If the dough is too dry to hold together, add more buttermilk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the dough is pliable and can be formed into a ball. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix as lightly as possible to ensure a light-textured scone. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Pat the dough into a rectangle. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a well floured rolling pin, roll out the dough to about 3/4 inch thick. <NEXT_INSTR> With a sharp knife, halve the dough lengthwise into 2 long, rectangular pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut each piece into 2-inch rectangles, then halve each rectangle on the diagonal to make small scones. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake on an greased baking sheet until the scones are golden and no longer sticky, about 15 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Savory Smoked Tomato-Asiago Scones <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cranberry juice <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> frozen lemonade <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> ginger ale <NEXT_INPUT> orange <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 pt. cranberry juice <NEXT_INGR> 6 oz. can frozen orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 6 oz. can frozen lemonade <NEXT_INGR> 4 1/2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 (No. 2) can pineapple juice <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> juice of 1 lemon <NEXT_INGR> 1 qt. ginger ale <NEXT_INGR> thinly sliced orange <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the first 7 ingredients and chill. Before serving, add ginger ale and orange slice for garnish. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 36 (4 ounce) servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cranberry Punch <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> small red cabbage sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2-4 garlic gloves chopped <NEXT_INGR> red pepper flakes to taste <NEXT_INGR> olive oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> cut cabbage into strips <NEXT_INSTR> dice garlic <NEXT_INSTR> add olive oil to pan with red pepper flakes and garlic sautee till fragrant <NEXT_INSTR> add cabbage <NEXT_INSTR> cook till soft then add rice wine vinegar <NEXT_INSTR> cook till vinegar is reduced <NEXT_INSTR> turn off burner cover and let sit <NEXT_INSTR> very good cold <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Red Cabbage By Elizabeth  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> All-purpose <NEXT_INPUT> Whole Wheat Flour <NEXT_INPUT> Baking Powder <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> Nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> Cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Brown Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> Eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> Cranberries <NEXT_INPUT> Flour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup All-purpose Flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Whole Wheat Flour <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 teaspoon Baking Powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoons Baking Soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Brown Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cups Vegetable Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cups Unsweetened Applesauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 Large Eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Mashed Cooked Sweet Potato <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Dried Cranberries Tossed In The Below Amount Of Flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Flour <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 350 F. Grease an 8"x4" loaf pan. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, whisk together flours, baking powder, salt, baking soda, nutmeg and cinnamon. <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium bowl, whisk together sugar, brown sugar, vegetable oil, and applesauce. Add the eggs and whisk until combined. Whisk in the vanilla and the sweet potato. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, and mix until just combined. Combine the dried cranberries and flour in a small bowl. Fold cranberries into the batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan. Bake for 45-60 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bread comes out with a few moist crumbs. Remove pan from oven and set it on a rack. Let the bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn it out onto a wire rack to cool completely. The bread will cut much easier if you let it cool. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet Potato Cranberry Quick Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vodka <NEXT_INPUT> blackberries <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 liter vodka <NEXT_INGR> 600 g blackberries <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pour the vodka into a large, sterilised Kilner jar or similar container. Add the blackberries and the sugar, then seal tightly and give the jar a good shake. Leave in a cook, dark place for 3 days to allow the flavours to infuse, shaking daily. <NEXT_INSTR> Strain the berries and vodka through a fine sieve lined with a muslin or a new, clean, damp, J cloth. (it's important that the fine debris in the mixture is removed from the liquid, otherwise it will ferment and spoil the vodka.) You may have to do this a few times to remove all traces of the fruit. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the vodka into sterlised bottles or jam jars and seal them securely. Keep chilled and consume within 8 weeks. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Blackberry Vodka <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> oranges <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 to 10 carrots, cut in half and unpeeled <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. fresh orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 oranges, peeled and sliced in rings <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Wash carrots, scrub with stiff brush and cut in half. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until just tender. Melt butter or margarine in heavy skillet. Add sugar and orange juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Let bubble 2 to 3 minutes. Add carrots, tossing now and then to glaze well over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with orange slices and sprinkle with nutmeg, turning now and then so carrots and oranges are thoroughly glazed. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve at once! <NEXT_INSTR> Yields 6 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Carrots A La Orange <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cranberry juice <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> frozen lemonade concentrate <NEXT_INPUT> ginger ale <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 48 ounces cranberry juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate <NEXT_INGR> 32 ounces ginger ale <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix together the cranberry juice, orange juice concentrate, lemonade concentrate, and sugar, stirring until concentrates and sugar are dissolved well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the 32 ounces of ginger ale and enough water to make 1 gallon of punch. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir gently. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with fresh cranberries and orange slices, if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cranberry Punch <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> catsup <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> dry mustard <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> wieners <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 c. minced onion <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. catsup <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. dry mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. paprika <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. wieners, cut in 3rds or 4ths <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine butter and onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over medium-high for 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1/4 cup water and remaining ingredients, except wieners. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook on high for 2 1/2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add wieners and cook on high for 3 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cocktail Wieners <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> POUPON <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> Mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> red potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> OSCAR MAYER <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1-1/2 cups GREY POUPON Country Dijon Mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup KRAFT Extra Heavy Mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/4 gal. Small red potatoes, cooked, quartered King Sooper's 5 lb For $1.88 thru 02/09 <NEXT_INGR> 2 qt. medium tomatoes, seeded, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups OSCAR MAYER Bacon Pieces, 3/8 inch <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup green onions, sliced <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix mustard, sour cream and mayonnaise with wire whisk until well blended <NEXT_INSTR> Add to combined remaining ingredients in large bowl; mix lightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate until ready to serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dijon Red Potato Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> dill weed <NEXT_INPUT> Accent <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic powder <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. dill weed <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. Accent <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. sugar or Equal <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. oregano <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix ingredients together and pour over vegetables. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill 4 to 12 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Best raw vegetables: <NEXT_INSTR> carrots, celery, broccoli, cauliflower, mushrooms, cucumbers. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Vegetable Marinade <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pinto beans <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> bean seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb dry pinto beans <NEXT_INGR> 6 slices of thick sliced bacon, cooked and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons bean seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup cilantro, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes or (14 ounce) can fresh diced tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 (12 ounce) can beer (important ingredient) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook bacon, drain on paper towels and chop when cooled. (I usually saute some onion in the bacon grease and put everything into the pot of beans) <NEXT_INSTR> Cook beans according to instructions on package. <NEXT_INSTR> After 1 and 1/2 hours of cooking beans, add bacon, bean seasonings, cilantro, tomatoes and beer. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and continue to cook for an additional 30 minutes or until beans are tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately or refrigerate overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> You can add fresh jalapeno at the same time you add the tomatoes for an extra kick! <NEXT_INSTR> *I use Texas Spice Company Bean Seasoning and it is sold only at all H*E*B Grocery Stores. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Borracho Beans (Drunk Beans) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> marjoram <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> ground ginger <NEXT_INPUT> ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> red snapper <NEXT_INPUT> rolls <NEXT_INPUT> Scotch <NEXT_INPUT> Escovitch <NEXT_INPUT> Scotch <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> tarragon <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> black peppercorns <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> yellow bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons dried marjoram <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons dried parsley <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons paprika <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon ground ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tablespoon ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tablespoon kosher salt, plus extra for seasoning the fish <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 skinless red snapper fillets (about 5- to 6-ounces each) <NEXT_INGR> 4 soft rolls, split and griddled with butter <NEXT_INGR> Scotch Bonnet Aioli, recipe follows <NEXT_INGR> Escovitch Pickled Peppers, recipe follows <NEXT_INGR> 2 Scotch bonnet peppers <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1 small clove garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> Juice from 1/2 lemon <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon honey <NEXT_INGR> 1 sprig tarragon <NEXT_INGR> 1 sprig thyme <NEXT_INGR> 5 black peppercorns <NEXT_INGR> Pinch kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 red bell pepper, julienned <NEXT_INGR> 1 yellow bell pepper, julienned <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 onion, sliced <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Whisk together the flour, marjoram, parsley, paprika, ginger, pepper and salt in a shallow bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Season 2 of the red snapper fillets all over with salt, then dredge them in the seasoned flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Shake off any excess flour and place in the skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until golden brown on one side, 2 to 3 minutes, then flip and cook on the other side until cooked through, an additional 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Wipe out the pan and repeat with the remaining 2 fillets and oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Sandwich Build: Spread a thin layer of Scotch Bonnet Aioli on the bottom and top of your toasted roll. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the filet of snapper and finish with some Pickled Peppers. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat with the remaining ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> This dish can be served warm or cold. <NEXT_INSTR> Eat this beast of a sandwich like it may be your last. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the peppers in a small skillet and char them on all sides over medium-high heat, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn off the heat and let the peppers continue to soften in the pan. <NEXT_INSTR> When the peppers are cool enough to handle, wearing gloves, scrape out the seeds and then mince and scrape the peppers into a paste-like consistency. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together the minced peppers, mayonnaise, garlic and lemon juice in a small bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine the vinegar, sugar, honey, tarragon, thyme, peppercorns and salt in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn off the heat and add the bell peppers and onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool to room temperature. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Snapper Escovitch-Wich Pickled Peppers and Scotch Bonnet Aioli <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Vegetable Stock <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> arborio rice <NEXT_INPUT> sherry <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan <NEXT_INPUT> fresh basil <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Shrimp <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 cups Vegetable Stock (p. 204) or Chicken Stock (p. 206) or a combination of the two <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons plus 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup each finely diced onion, celery, and fennel bulb <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup arborio rice <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup sherry or white wine <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup grated Parmesan or Grana Padano cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons each chopped fresh basil and snipped chives <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup diced fontina or mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INGR> Roasted Shrimp <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring the stock to a boil in a small saucepan, then reduce the heat and keep warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt the 2 teaspoons oil in a heavy-bottomed skillet over medium heat and sweat the onion, celery, and fennel for about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the rice and stir for 23 minutes, then add the sherry and stir until it is absorbed. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a ladle, start adding the stock a cup or so at a time, and stir until the liquid is absorbed. <NEXT_INSTR> About halfway through add a little salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> When all the stock is added, taste the rice. <NEXT_INSTR> It should be tender but not mushy. <NEXT_INSTR> (Its okay if the rice is still a little firm, as it will continue to cook after it is removed from the heat.) <NEXT_INSTR> Add the Parmesan and the herbs, then remove it from the heat and let cool a couple of minutes before stirring in the fontina. <NEXT_INSTR> Check the seasoning one more time, then pour the rice into a pan and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes (until the rice is cool enough to handle). <NEXT_INSTR> Use your hands to form 3- to 4-inch cakes (they should be a little smaller than hockey pucks) and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, prepare shrimp. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute the cakes (two or three at a time so as not to overcrowd the pan) until golden and crispy, 34 minutes on each side. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve the warm cakes alongside the roasted shrimp. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Risotto Cakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> elbow macaroni <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> salad dressing <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 oz. pkg. elbow macaroni <NEXT_INGR> 12 oz. can Spam, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. diced Velveeta <NEXT_INGR> 1 pod green pepper, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. salad dressing <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. vinegar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook macaroni according to package directions. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain well. Combine macaroni, Spam, Velveeta, pepper and onion in a large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix salad dressing, milk and vinegar. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour dressing over macaroni and toss well. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Confetti Macaroni Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ham <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 c. cooked, diced ham <NEXT_INGR> 6 or 8 medium potatoes, cubed <NEXT_INGR> 5 boiled eggs <NEXT_INGR> 6 Tbsp. self-rising flour <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook potatoes until almost done. Add ham and flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Then add grated or chopped boiled eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Salt and pepper to taste. Add water so that it has a good consistency. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Potato And Ham Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> old-fashioned oatmeal <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> whole wheat flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> flax seed <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup butter or 1/4 cup margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup old-fashioned oatmeal <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups mashed bananas (I used 3) <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup macadamia nuts <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons flax seed meal <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine sugar and butter until creamy. <NEXT_INSTR> Add egg, mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add oatmeal, bananas, and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine remaining ingredients in a seperate bowl, and then add to banana mixture until just moistened. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare a loaf pan with cooking spray & flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in 350 degree oven for 1 hour or until tester comes out clean. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Breakfast Banana-Nut Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> potatoes <NEXT_INGR> chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Peel potatoes and dice. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in large pot and cover with water. <NEXT_INSTR> Add onion, salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until tender. Water will cook down, add milk and butter to your pleasure. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Potato Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> cracker crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> cream-style corn <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> dabs of butter <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> broccoli <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 eggs, slightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. cracker crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream-style corn <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> dabs of butter or oleo <NEXT_INGR> paprika <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 oz.) pkg. chopped broccoli, cooked and drained <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Beat eggs until fluffy. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the remaining ingredients except butter and paprika. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into greased or buttered casserole dish. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Scalloped Corn And Broccoli <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> basmati rice <NEXT_INPUT> wild rice <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> peanuts <NEXT_INPUT> saffron <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup basmati rice or 1 cup jasmine rice <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup wild rice <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon butter <NEXT_INGR> 4 -6 garlic cloves <NEXT_INGR> 2 12-3 cups chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup peanuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch saffron <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Soak the wild rice in 1 cup warm water for about 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside while you melt the butter & olive oil and crush the garlic and measure the rice etc. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter and olive oil over low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add drained wild rice, basmati rice and the garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Brown on low heat, stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Maybe about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer ingredients to larger pot and add 2 1/2 to 3 cups of chicken broth. <NEXT_INSTR> (More broth if you want a softer rice). <NEXT_INSTR> Cook on low heat until rice is done, about 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Fluff once after about 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> 5 minutes before it is finished add a pinch of saffron and the peanuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in gently. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with any meat or chicken dish. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Wild About Rice <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sweet potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> white-wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> scallions <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/2 pound sweet potatoes (2 large) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 4 teaspoons white-wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 scallions, thinly sliced <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Peel potatoes and halve lengthwise. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut lengthwise into 3/4-inch-thick wedges, then cut wedges crosswise into 1-inch pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Steam potatoes in a steamer over boiling water in a large pot, covered, until just tender, 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> While potatoes steam, whisk together mustard, vinegar, and salt in a large bowl, then add oil in a slow stream, whisking until emulsified. <NEXT_INSTR> Add hot potatoes to dressing and gently toss to combine well. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool salad to room temperature, about 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add scallions and salt to taste and gently toss. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet-Potato Salad with Mustard Viniagrette <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flavour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg (4-serving size) Jell-O Instant Pudding, any flavour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tub (500 mL) Cool Whip or Cool Whip Light Whipped Topping, thawed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> PREPARE pudding as directed on package. <NEXT_INSTR> FOLD in whipped topping. <NEXT_INSTR> SPOON into dessert dishes. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill about 30 min. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Creamy Mousse Delight <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> bell peppers <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> oleo <NEXT_INPUT> Ro-Tel tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Velveeta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> peas <NEXT_INPUT> spaghetti <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 c. chicken, boiled <NEXT_INGR> 2 large bell peppers <NEXT_INGR> 2 large onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick oleo <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 oz.) can Ro-Tel tomatoes (spicy hot) <NEXT_INGR> 2 lb. Velveeta cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 oz.) can peas <NEXT_INGR> 1 (7 oz.) pkg. spaghetti <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Boil chicken until tender; let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove meat from bones. Cook spaghetti in 2 cups water or leftover chicken broth. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute onions and peppers in oleo. <NEXT_INSTR> Add cheese and stir until melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Add tomatoes and chicken and mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in cooked spaghetti; add peas last. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in evenly. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 35 minutes or until bubbly hot. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes a 3-quart casserole. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Rotel <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> Uncle Ben <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> green bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> chicken bouillon cubes <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tsp. vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. Uncle Ben's converted brand rice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped celery <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped green bell pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 large clove garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 4 chicken bouillon cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. tomato sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add oil, rice, celery, onion, green bell pepper, garlic and cumin to skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute over medium heat, stirring constantly, until rice is brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine water and bouillon cubes in medium saucepan; bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to rice mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in tomato sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat just until mixture simmers. Cover; continue to simmer 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand covered 10 minutes before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mexican Rice <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> bread <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 eggs, separated <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp (1 ml) grated nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 6 cups (1425 ml) milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound (about 8 thick slices) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp (10 ml) vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> bread, cut into 1-inch cubes (about 8 cups (1900 ml) loosely packed) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup (175 ml) plus 6 tbsp (90 ml) sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 stick (4 tbsp) butter, cut into small pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp (2 ml) ground cinnamon <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the egg yolks,milk,vanilla,3/4 cup of the sugar,cinnamon,and nutmeg and whisk until the sugar dissolves. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the bread pieces in a large 10-cup rectangular or oval casserole dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the yolk and milk mixture over the bread and let it set for about 30 minutes, mashing the bread occasionally with a fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat the oven to 300 degrees (150 C.). <NEXT_INSTR> Dot the top of the bread and milk mixture with the butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the casserole in a larger baking dish or roasting pan and fill the dish with enough water to come halfway the sides of the casserole. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for about 1 1/2 hours, or until the pudding sets and a knife inserted into the pudding comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the pudding from the oven and remove from the water bath. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the egg whites with the remaning 6 tbsp (90 ml) sugar until they form stiff peaks for a meringue. <NEXT_INSTR> Increase the oven temperature to 425 degrees (225 C.). <NEXT_INSTR> Spread the merringue evenly over the top of the pudding, going all the way to the edges of the casserole. <NEXT_INSTR> Return the casserole to the oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for about 15 minutes, or untill the meringue is lightly browned. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the oven and cool on the counter for about 15 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Marcelles's Bread Pudding <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> oil <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> savoy cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> red chili <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable bouillon cube <NEXT_INPUT> tagliatelle <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> prawns <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tbsp oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 None onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 None savoy cabbage, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 None red chili, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 None orange, juiced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp crushed vegetable bouillon cube <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb fresh tagliatelle <NEXT_INGR> 1-2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb raw prawns <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat 1 tbsp oil in a saucepan, add the onion, cabbage and chili and saute for 2-3 mins. Add the orange juice and 1/2 cup water and bring to a boil. Mix in the crushed bouillon cube then cover and simmer for 10-15 mins, until the cabbage is tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook the pasta in salted boiling water according to the package instructions. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, heat the remaining oil in a frying pan, add the garlic and prawns and stir-fry for 3-4 mins until cooked through. Season. Drain the tagliatelle then toss with the cabbage and prawns. Serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spicy Prawn And Cabbage Tagliatelle <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla bean <NEXT_INPUT> lrish cream liqueur <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> sugar + <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/2 cups heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 None vanilla bean, seeds scraped out <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup lrish cream liqueur <NEXT_INGR> 8 None egg yolks <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup granulated sugar + 1/2 tbsp <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 300°F. Combine heavy cream, vanilla bean seeds and vanilla bean in a saucepot. Place over medium-high heat and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat, remove vanilla bean and add Irish cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, whip egg yolks and 1/3 cup sugar until pale and fluffy. Whisk in 1/3 of hot cream then add remaining cream. Strain and distribute between shallow ramekins. Place in a deep baking dish and fill with boiling water halfway up the sides of ramekins. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 1 hour, until custard is just set. Remove from water bath and let cool. Cover with plastic wrap and chill overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Just before serving, sprinkle remaining sugar evenly over each chilled custard. Use blowtorch to caramelize. Allow to harden before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Irish Crème Brûlée <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> corn kernels <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> asian rice flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> egg whites <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups frozen corn kernels, defrosted <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 7 tablespoons granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 egg yolks, large <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons fine asian rice flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup evaporated milk or 14 cup cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 4 egg whites, beaten to soft peaks <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add the two cups of corn to the 1/2 cup milk and process until blended semi smooth, set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the 1/2 cup butter room temperature with the sugar until fluffy. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in the egg yolks one at a time, and continue to beat until thick smooth creamy. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the blended dry ingredients with the evaporated milk, to make a smooth batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in the corn mixture, or beat in with beaters. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat your egg whites with a pinch of salt, until soft peaks form. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold the beaten whites into the corn batter, folding not to deflate, some whites showing is okay. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour slowly into a 8 inch greased cake pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 30- 35 minutes at 350 degrees until toothpick comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> It will be a very dark golden brown, may take longer, just make sure jiggle is gone from centre of cake, and the toothpick or tester is clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool in pan on wire rack. <NEXT_INSTR> When cool dust with icing sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve alone with a cup of coffee or with fresh berries. <NEXT_INSTR> This recipe can be doubled. <NEXT_INSTR> Do not freeze. <NEXT_INSTR> Keep leftovers in fridge. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Corn Cake Gluten Free 2012 <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> salmon <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> liquid smoke <NEXT_INPUT> Tabasco sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 (6 ounce) salmon steaks <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb butter (or margarine) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons liquid smoke <NEXT_INGR> 3 dashes Tabasco sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Baste steaks every 3 minutes or so with a mixture of the last 5 ingredients, as they are grilling. <NEXT_INSTR> When finished cooking salmon will flake easily with fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with lemon juice, pepper and garlic powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on serving platter and spoon more barbecue sauce over salmon. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Barbecued Salmon Steaks <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> Chinese <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> tofu <NEXT_INPUT> Salad oil <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> warm pepper <NEXT_INPUT> pita <NEXT_INPUT> alfalfa sprouts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 pound mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 pound Chinese pea pods <NEXT_INGR> 2 carrots <NEXT_INGR> 2 green onions <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound hard tofu <NEXT_INGR> Salad oil <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp. peanut butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon warm pepper sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 (6 inch) pita <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 (4 ounce.) pkg. alfalfa sprouts <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Slice mushrooms; cut pea pods into thin strips; shred carrots, chop green onions. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut tofu lengthwise in half, then cut each half into 1/4 inch thick slices. <NEXT_INSTR> In skillet over medium heat in 1 Tbsp. <NEXT_INSTR> oil, cook tofu in batches till lightly browned on both sides; remove pcs to plate as they brown and add in more oil, if necessary. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Peppery Tofu Stir Fry Pita Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pork sausage <NEXT_INPUT> grated cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Bisquick <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. pork sausage (mild or hot, whatever you prefer) <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sharp grated cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. Bisquick <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. crushed red pepper (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Roll in balls and cook at 350° until brown, about 10 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sausage Balls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> oatmeal <NEXT_INPUT> whole wheat flour <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 ounces butter (softened) <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces Butter Flavor Crisco <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 cups quick-cooking oatmeal <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon table salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup chocolate chips (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup peanut butter chips (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350. <NEXT_INSTR> Cream butter, sugar and egg together in mixing bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add baking powder, salt, vanilla and baking soda. <NEXT_INSTR> Add both flours. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix thorougly. <NEXT_INSTR> (makes still dough). <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in using spoon or spatula, chips (raisins, walnuts, etc). <NEXT_INSTR> On baking sheet sprayed or lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil, drop roughly 1 Tbsp of mix 2-inches apart. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 10-14 minutes or until done. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool on wire rack. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Oatmeal Nirvana Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 egg whites <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons water <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 4 egg yolks <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon butter or 1 tablespoon margarine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Beat egg whites until frothy. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water and salt; continue beating about a minute or until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat yolks at high speed of electric mixer until thick and lemon colored (about 5 minutes). <NEXT_INSTR> Fold yolks into whites. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat butter in a 10 inch skillet with an oven proof handle. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in egg mixture, mounding it a little higher on the sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over low heat for 8 to 10 minutes or until eggs are puffed and set and the bottom is golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Place skillet in a 325 degree (163 celcius) oven; bake for 10 minutes or until a knife inserted in the middle comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Make a shallow cut off center of the omelet. <NEXT_INSTR> Place your fillers on the larger half of the omelet. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold the smaller half over the fillers. <NEXT_INSTR> Slip omelet onto a warmed plate. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Souffle Omelet (Puffy Omelet) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken stock <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> serrano <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> freshly squeezed lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> avocado <NEXT_INPUT> tortilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 quarts chicken stock, preferably homemade, or 1 quart commercial chicken broth and 1 quart water <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 serrano or jalapeno chile, seeded if desired and minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound tomatoes, peeled, seeded and diced, or 1 (14-ounce) can, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shredded cooked chicken breast <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 1 to 2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice (to taste), plus thin slices of lime for garnish <NEXT_INGR> 1 avocado, cut in small dice or thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> Corn tortilla crisps for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring the chicken stock to a simmer, add the onion, garlic and chile, and simmer 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the tomatoes, and simmer for another five minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Taste and adjust salt, then stir in the chicken breast and chopped cilantro. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and let sit for five minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the lime juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide the avocado between four soup bowls. <NEXT_INSTR> Ladle in the soup, place a slice of lime on each bowl, and serve with crisp corn tortillas. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Soup With Lime and Avocado <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cream-style <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> corn muffin <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (No. 2) can cream-style corn <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 8 oz. sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) box Jiffy corn muffin mix <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick margarine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients except margarine. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into a 9 x 11-inch pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt margarine and pour over batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake until like cake, uncovered, for 30 to 35 minutes at 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut into squares and serve hot/warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 4 to 6. <NEXT_INSTR> Recipe may be doubled. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Corn Pudding <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> egg noodles <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups chicken, cubed <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) package egg noodles, frozen <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter in frying pan. Add cubed chicken, salt and pepper. Saute until brown and completly cooked. I always brown this up quite a bit otherwise the casserole can be bland. <NEXT_INSTR> Coat casserole dish with non-stick cooking spray. Combine ingredients. You may top with buttered croutons or breadcrumbs if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake covered at 350 for 45 minutes. If using croutons or breadcrumbs remove cover when there are approx 10 minutes left to bake. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Noodle Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lobster <NEXT_INPUT> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> dill <NEXT_INPUT> fresh chives <NEXT_INPUT> lemon zest <NEXT_INPUT> dinner rolls <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 lb cooked lobster, finely chopped shopping list <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb cooked shrimp, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons chopped fresh chives <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon grated lemon zest <NEXT_INGR> 24 small soft dinner rolls <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Stir together all ingredients, except rolls, with 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper, then chill, covered, until ready to serve. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut down into tops of rolls to split them, but do not cut all the way through, and fill each with 1 rounded tablespoon seafood. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shrimp And Lobster Eggrolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> TOMATOES <NEXT_INPUT> Green Tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Flour <NEXT_INPUT> Onion Powder <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic Powder <NEXT_INPUT> Eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Bread Crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan Cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Cajun Seasoning Mix <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Vegetable Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Sour Cream <NEXT_INPUT> Horseradish <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Lemon Juice <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> FOR THE TOMATOES: <NEXT_INGR> 4 Large Green Tomatoes, Sliced 1/4-inch Thick <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 Tablespoons Onion Powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 Tablespoons Garlic Powder <NEXT_INGR> 4 Eggs, Beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cup Panko Bread Crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cups Parmesan Cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tablespoon Cajun Seasoning Mix <NEXT_INGR> Salt And Pepper, to taste <NEXT_INGR> Vegetable Oil, Enough For Frying <NEXT_INGR> FOR THE SAUCE: <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Sour Cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Horseradish <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves Minced Garlic <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Fresh Lemon Juice <NEXT_INGR> Salt And Pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Make the sauce: Combine sour cream, horseradish (feel free to add as little or as much as you want), minced garlic and lemon juice in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Then put it in the fridge to let the flavors develop. The longer the better! <NEXT_INSTR> For the tomatoes: Salt each side of the sliced tomatoes and place them on a cooling rack to dry out a bit. This should take about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Make your assembly line. In the first bowl combine flour, onion powder and garlic powder. In a second bowl add the 4 beaten eggs and then in a third bowl combine bread crumbs, parmesan cheese and Cajun seasoning. <NEXT_INSTR> Add enough oil into a heavy skillet or pot to come up about 1/4 of an inch. Heat to medium low. <NEXT_INSTR> Dredge tomatoes in flour, then in the egg and then in the bread crumbs. Drop the tomatoes into the oil and cook until golden brown on each side. Don't crowd the pan. Do this in a couple of batches if necessary. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with sauce. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fried Green Tomatoes With Horseradish Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> whole wheat flour <NEXT_INPUT> flax seed <NEXT_INPUT> soy protein <NEXT_INPUT> poppy seeds <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 egg whites <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup brown sugar, tightly packed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tablespoons lemon extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lemon juice (to mix with milk) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup fat-free evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups zucchini, grated <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups carrots, grated <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup flax seed meal <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup soy protein <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons poppy seeds <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 ounces sliced almonds <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Prepheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a cake pan (9x13) with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together milk with lemon juice, set aside for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat together egg whites, brown sugar, and oil. Then add vanilla, Lemon extract, zucchini, carrots and the milk and lemon juice mixture. Mix together well. <NEXT_INSTR> In a separate bowl, combine flour, flaxmeal, soy protein, poppy seeds, baking soda, salt, almonds. <NEXT_INSTR> Add dry mixture to the wet mixture until just blended. Spoon mixture into prepared pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 35 minutes or until wooden stick inserted into the middle comes out clean. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Poppy Seed High Fiber Bars <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> quinoa <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa powder <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> coconut oil <NEXT_INPUT> almond butter <NEXT_INPUT> unsweetened applesauce <NEXT_INPUT> maple syrup <NEXT_INPUT> almond <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 cups cooked quinoa (1/4 cup dry) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 flax eggs - 2 tbsp golden flaxseed meal + 6 tbsp water <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup coconut oil <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup almond butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup unsweetened applesauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup maple syrup <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons almond extract <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon sea salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup dark chocolate chips <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Prepare flax egg by combining flaxseed meal with water & sitting in the refrigerator for 30 minutes <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 350 degrees <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare an 8x8 baking dish with cooking spray if not non-stick <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl or standing mixer, combine all ingredients and mix well <NEXT_INSTR> Add batter to baking dish <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 35-45 minutes until a toothpick can be removed cleanly <NEXT_INSTR> Allow to cool in the pan 30 minutes before cutting <NEXT_INSTR> Cut with a plastic knife for a clean cut <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Double Chocolate Quinoa Brownies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon sticks <NEXT_INPUT> lemon slices <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> apple cider <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. pineapple juice <NEXT_INGR> 4 cinnamon sticks <NEXT_INGR> 3 lemon slices <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 qt. apple cider <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix sugar, cinnamon, lemon slices and water. Boil 5 minutes. Strain. Add lemon juice, orange juice, pineapple juice and apple cider. Heat, but do not boil. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hot Drink <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> green chilies <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> hot pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic salt <NEXT_INPUT> cumin <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> pastry sheets <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 -3 cups finely chopped southwestern seasoned cooked chicken <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 ounce) can diced green chilies <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped green onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 3 ounces cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon paprika <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 1/4 ounce) package frozen puff pastry sheets, thawed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a bowl combine all ingredients except for puff pastry. Mix well; chill until ready to use. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove half of the puff pastry from the refrigerator at a time. On a lightly floured board, roll pastry to a 9 x 12 inch rectangle. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut into 9 small rectangles. <NEXT_INSTR> Place about 2 T. filling across the center of each rectangle. <NEXT_INSTR> Wet edge of pastry with water and roll pastry around filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Crimp ends with a fork to seal. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat with remaining pastry and filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Place seam side down, on lightly greased cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate until ready to bake. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 425 for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chickaritos <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> white rice <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup white rice <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp chopped onion any <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp kale chopped finely <NEXT_INGR> 1 shredded carrot <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash salt and pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup grated parmesan <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp olive oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add all ingredients except parmesan. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook rice seasons and veggies til done. <NEXT_INSTR> About 10 minutes on medium high. <NEXT_INSTR> Add parmesan cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> And serve.. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> rice pilaf my way <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> dubliner cheese <NEXT_INPUT> swiss cheese <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> onion flakes <NEXT_INPUT> chives <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (9 inch) unbaked ready-roll pie crusts (at room temperature) <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups dubliner cheese (freshly shredded) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 1/2 cup swiss cheese or 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese, freshly shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups minced ham (fully cooked) <NEXT_INGR> 4 slices canned pineapple (cut into tidbits, blotted dry on paper towel) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup half-and-half cream <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tablespoon dried onion flakes <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon dried chives <NEXT_INGR> 2 pinches cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°F. <NEXT_INSTR> Unroll the room temperature pie crust into a 9-inch Pyrex pie plate, or into a 10-inch Corningware quiche dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Loosely place the shredded cheeses over the pie crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Top the cheese with the minced ham, and the pineapple tidbits. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine the half & half, eggs, onion flakes, dried chives, cayenne pepper, and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour cream mixture over cheeses, ham, and pineapple in the pie crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake the quiche at 350F for 40-45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool on a wire rack for at least 15 minutes before slicing the quiche. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dubliner, Ham, And Pineapple Quiche <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> stock <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 lb. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 gal. stock <NEXT_INGR> salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put a cup of the flour in a shallow bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Make an indent with your fingers; break 1 egg into the dent, add a shake of salt to egg and mix with a fork to gather the flour into the egg. <NEXT_INSTR> Do this until you can use your fingers to roll and knead the egg sponge you have made. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead the sponge until it is firm and not sticky. Roll out on a flat surface with flour sprinkled on it. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut into strips as wide as you like. <NEXT_INSTR> I use a pizza cutter for this. <NEXT_INSTR> Do this with each egg. <NEXT_INSTR> Use more flour as needed. <NEXT_INSTR> You can dry the noodles or drop them as is into boiling stock and simmer for 1 hour, covered. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Homemade Egg Noodles <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> jello <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> bottles ginger ale <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> apple juice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. hot water <NEXT_INGR> 1 large pkg. jello (the color you want punch to be) <NEXT_INGR> 6 pkg. Kool-Aid (the color you want punch to be) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) frozen orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 16 oz. bottles ginger ale (can refrigerate) <NEXT_INGR> 3 cans pink frozen lemonade <NEXT_INGR> 4 cans (46 oz.) pineapple juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 qt. apple juice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt sugar in hot water. Heat but do not boil. Add jello and Kool-Aid. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool. Add orange juice, lemonade, pineapple juice and apple juice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Punch For 100 <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cauliflower <NEXT_INPUT> panko breadcrumbs <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> dill <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 head cauliflower <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup panko breadcrumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup parmigiano-reggiano cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dill, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400 F degrees. Coat baking sheet with cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Break the cauliflower into florets. Try to make pieces as uniform as possible. NOTE: tiny pieces are still okay to cook, but you may want to remove them from the oven before the larger pieces are done. <NEXT_INSTR> In a shallow bowl, beat the eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> In a second shallow bowl, blend the breadcrumbs, salt, pepper, dill, and shredded cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Dip each cauliflower floret in the egg mixture, making sure it's fully coated, then in the breadcrumb mixture and place on the prepared baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for about 40 minutes or until golden brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Baked Breaded Cauliflower <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> strawberries <NEXT_INPUT> banana <NEXT_INPUT> non-fat <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup orange juice (or 5-Alive any flavour) <NEXT_INGR> 4 strawberries, cut up <NEXT_INGR> 1 banana (I peel, chop into 3 or 4 chunks & freeze) <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup non-fat vanilla yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 3 -4 ice cubes (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine everything in a blender, give it a whirl until the fruit and ice cubes have been pureed, pour into a glass and enjoy. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> My Favorite Smoothie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> All-purpose <NEXT_INPUT> Cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> Icing Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1-1/2 cup Butter, Softened <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups All-purpose Flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Icing Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash Kosher Salt <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cups Jam (apricot Or Cherry) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 300° with the rack in the center. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the butter. Sift in the flour, cornstarch, icing sugar and salt. Mix until a soft smooth dough forms, just until combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll half the dough on a lightly floured surface or between two pieces of parchment or wax paper. Roll out to just over 1/8 inch. Cut out into 2-inch circles or whatever desired shape. Place on an ungreased or parchment-lined baking sheet. Repeat with remaining half of the dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake the cookies for about 15 minutes, rotating the sheets halfway through. You do not want these to brown! Cool ten minutes on the sheet then move to a wire rack to cool completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread jam on one cookie and sandwich another on top. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shortbread And Jam Sandwiches <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> cream of coconut <NEXT_INPUT> frozen lemonade <NEXT_INPUT> Vodka <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 7 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 46 oz. can Dole pineapple juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of coconut <NEXT_INGR> 12 oz. can frozen lemonade <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. Vodka <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring water and sugar to a boil and let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend cream of coconut with lemonade in blender to mix together. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix all and freeze. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir a few times while freezing. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 7-Up to serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pina Colada Slush <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tenderloin <NEXT_INPUT> pate <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire <NEXT_INPUT> phyllo pastry <NEXT_INPUT> sweet Marsala <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 (4 oz.) tenderloin steaks <NEXT_INGR> 1 can pate <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire <NEXT_INGR> 6 sheets frozen phyllo pastry, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. sweet Marsala wine <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. plus 1 1/2 tsp. cornstarch <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Trim fat from steaks. <NEXT_INSTR> Panbroil 1 1/2 minutes each side. Drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on rack in broiler pan coated with spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle 1/4 teaspoon Worcestershire over each. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread pate on top of each steak. <NEXT_INSTR> Lightly coat each phyllo sheet with cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in half. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold again to form 6 1/2 x 4 1/2-inch rectangle. Snip strip from end. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Drape rectangle over each steak. Tuck under; crumple strip into a ball. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on top. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 425° for 15 minutes or to desired doneness. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine consomme, wine and cornstarch. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir well. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with steaks. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Individual Beef Wellingtons <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> fresh garlic <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> lamb <NEXT_INPUT> yellow bell peppers <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Vegetable-oil cooking spray <NEXT_INPUT> pitas <NEXT_INPUT> cucumbers <NEXT_INPUT> fresh tbsp lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> fresh garlic <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp chopped fresh garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp oregano <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 tsp freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3/8 tsp kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 lb lamb, cut from the leg into 12 equal-sized cubes <NEXT_INGR> 2 yellow bell peppers, cored and cut into 1-inch strips <NEXT_INGR> 1 red onion, cut into 8 pieces <NEXT_INGR> 16 cherry tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> Vegetable-oil cooking spray <NEXT_INGR> 4 whole-wheat pitas <NEXT_INGR> 2 cucumbers, peeled and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 fresh tbsp lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup nonfat Greek-style yogurt (such as Total brand) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp chopped fresh garlic <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For souvlaki, mix first 5 ingredients to make a marinade and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Distribute lamb, bell peppers, onion and tomatoes among 8 skewers. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in a large shallow pan with marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate at least 3 hours, rotating skewers once. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a gas grill to medium, or use a charcoal grill and allow the coals to turn a light-ash color. <NEXT_INSTR> Coat grill with cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill until lamb is medium rare and lightly charred, 5 to 8 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Rotate to cook evenly. <NEXT_INSTR> To cook in oven, broil on metal skewers 6 minutes, rotating until evenly browned. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill or toast pitas. <NEXT_INSTR> For sauce, puree cucumbers and a pinch of salt in a food processor. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in a fine-screen colander and squeeze out the juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Reserve juice and discard pulp. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk cucumber and lemon juices in a bowl with yogurt. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in garlic; season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with pitas and skewers. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lamb Souvlaki with Yogurt-Garlic Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> dough <NEXT_INPUT> whole wheat flour <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> light brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> Sweet <NEXT_INPUT> apples <NEXT_INPUT> light brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> Water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> For the dough <NEXT_INGR> 4 1/2 cups whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup light brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> Sweet, spiced apples <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium-large Honeycrisp apples <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons light brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 splash Water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, slowly pour the buttermilk into the flour. Mix until a dry and "shaggy" dough forms. Let sit while you work on the apples. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel and chop the apples, and mix with sugar, cinnamon, vanilla extract and a splash of water. Place in a baking pan lined with parchment paper. Fold the parchment paper over the apples and bake for 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the apples from the pan and toss in strainer to remove excess liquid. They will retain some liquid...it's ok. Let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Go back to the dough. Mix in the cinnamon, nutmeg, sugar, vanilla extract, salt and baking soda. Once the apples have cooled a bit, add them to the dough mixture. Adding the apples should be the key to giving your dough the right amount of moisture. If not, add a bit more buttermilk. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss some flour onto a counter/chopping block, remove dough from bowl and place in the center. If the dough is too wet to remove cleanly from the bowl, add a bit more flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn the dough a couple of times to form into a ball. Use a sharp knife to make an "x" on the top of the ball, going about a quarter inch deep. Brush the top of the dough with a light layer of heavy cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake at 450 degrees for 25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce the oven temperature to 400 degrees, and bake for approximately 20 more minutes. When the dough has risen completely and is turning light brown on the top, it's done. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the oven and let cool before cutting. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve: swirl a bit of honey into good butter for an extra touch of sweetness, or top with butter and apple butter! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Soda Bread With Sweet, Spiced Apples <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> salmon <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 beaten egg <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. soft bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 oz.) can salmon, drained and flaked <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. butter, melted <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a bowl, combine egg, milk, soft bread crumbs, melted butter, <NEXT_INSTR> chopped onion and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Add salmon. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix thoroughly. Shape into a loaf in a greased shallow baking pan or loaf pan. Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.	Serves 4. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Salmon Loaf <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>
