<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> blueberries <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> lemon cake <NEXT_INPUT> containers <NEXT_INPUT> frozen whipped topping <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallow creme <NEXT_INPUT> lemon curd <NEXT_INPUT> blueberries <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 cups fresh or frozen blueberries <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1 package lemon cake mix (regular size) <NEXT_INGR> 2 containers (6 ounces each) lemon yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 1 container (8 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup marshmallow creme <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup lemon curd <NEXT_INGR> Additional blueberries, optional <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°. Toss blueberries with cinnamon; spread into a greased 13x9-in. baking dish. Drizzle with half of the melted butter. Sprinkle with cake mix; drizzle with remaining butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake until golden brown and fruit is bubbly, 45-55 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat together yogurt, whipped topping, marshmallow creme and lemon curd. Serve dump cake with yogurt mixture and, if desired, additional blueberries. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Berry Dump Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken quarters <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking potatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 chicken quarters, with skin <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup lemon juice, fresh tastes best, but bottled works too <NEXT_INGR> 2 -3 garlic cloves, minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 -3 sprigs fresh rosemary, removed from stems <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 4 large baking potatoes, with skin on cut into quarters, lengthwise <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place the olive oil in large baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken and potatos into baking dish, coat in oil by turning pcs. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour lemon juice over contents of pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with the minced garlic, fresh rosemary, salt and ground pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in 375 degree oven for approximately 1 hour uncovered, turning chicken once during baking time. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Chicken Vesuvio <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> cornmeal <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> garlic salt <NEXT_INPUT> celery salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> ground ginger <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> cooking oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 c. all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. cornmeal <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. dry mustard <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. paprika <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. celery salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. ground ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. dried thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 broiler-fryer chicken (2 1/2 to 3 1/2 lb.), cut up <NEXT_INGR> cooking oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all ingredients except chicken and oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Place about 1 cup flour mixture in a paper or plastic bag. <NEXT_INSTR> Shake a few chicken pieces in the bag at a time, coating well. <NEXT_INSTR> On medium-high, heat 1/4 inch of oil in a large skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Brown chicken on all sides; remove to a large, shallow baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 45 to 60 minutes or until done. <NEXT_INSTR> Recipe makes enough coating for three chickens. <NEXT_INSTR> Store unused mixture in airtight container. Serves 4 to 6. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sunday Fried Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> applesauce <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cooking oil <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> allspice <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/4 c. applesauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. cooking oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 tsp. nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 tsp. allspice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped pecans <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine applesauce, sugar, oil, eggs and milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift together dry ingredients and stir into applesauce mixture and beat well. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> frozen broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 medium onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups chopped cooked ham <NEXT_INGR> 150 g chopped frozen broccoli <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups grated mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INGR> 8 manicotti <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup margarine <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Saute onion in margarine until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Add ham, drained broccoli and 1/2 of cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook manicotti until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Rinse. <NEXT_INSTR> Stuff manicotti with ham mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt margarine in saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add flour, cook and stir one minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Add milk and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining cheese and stir until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread 1/2 c cheese, sauce over bottom of a baking dish and arrange stuffed manicotti over sauce and pour remaining sauce over top that. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with parmesan cheese, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375F for approximately 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> 4 servings of 2 manicotties each. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Manicotti With Ham and Cheese Stuffing <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> ground cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Spring Hill <NEXT_INPUT> thin <NEXT_INPUT> recipe Southwestern Beef Marinade <NEXT_INPUT> lard <NEXT_INPUT> green bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> white <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> clove of garlic <NEXT_INPUT> New Mexico <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> Sour cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Southwestern Beef Marinade <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup low sodium soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium cloves of garlic, minced or pressed <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons New Mexico chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> Spring Hill Ranch's Beef Chicana <NEXT_INGR> 3 pounds thin-cut round or sirloin steak, about 1/2" thick <NEXT_INGR> 1 recipe Southwestern Beef Marinade (above) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons lard (or canola or vegetable oil) <NEXT_INGR> 1 green bell pepper, 1/2" chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium white or yellow onion, sliced into thin strips <NEXT_INGR> 1 14.5-ounce can diced tomatoes, drained (liquid reserved and used to adjust the texture if needed) <NEXT_INGR> 1 8-ounce can tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium clove of garlic, minced or pressed <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon New Mexico chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> Cooked rice or noodles or warm flour tortillas <NEXT_INGR> Sour cream, grated cheese, chopped cilantro, shredded lettuce and/or salsa for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Put your steak into the freezer for half an hour or so to make it easier to slice. Slice the steak into 1/8" thick slices, about 2-3 inches long. Marinate the beef strips with the Southwestern Marinade in the refrigerator for 1-3 hours <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the lard in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown the beef strips in batches. Combine all the beef strips, green bell pepper and onion in the pan. Pour the diced tomatoes and tomato sauce in and season with the garlic, chili powder, cumin, salt and pepper. Stir well. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes (stirring occasionally), then remove the lid and simmer an additional 15 minutes. Serve over rice or noodles or in warmed flour tortillas. Garnish as desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spring Hill Ranch'S Beef Chicana <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> light corn syrup <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> pecan <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup firmly packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8-ounce) carton commercial sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons light corn syrup <NEXT_INGR> Dash of salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups pecan pieces <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine sugar, sour cream, syrup, and salt in a medium size heavy saucepan. Slowly bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves. Cover and continue to cook 2 to 3 minutes to wash down sugar crystals from sides of pan. Uncover and cook, stirring occasionally, until mixture reaches soft ball stage (234°). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat; stir in butter and vanilla. Beat with a wooden spoon until mixture is creamy and begins to thicken. Stir in pecans. Quickly drop candy by rounded tablespoonfuls onto waxed paper; let cool. Remove from waxed paper, and store in an airtight container. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Plantation Pralines <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> firm <NEXT_INPUT> mozzerella <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> fresh basil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 firm, ripe tomatoes, cored and sliced <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces fresh mozzerella <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp (30 ml) minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp (15 ml) fresh basil, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp (5 ml) salt <NEXT_INGR> 4 tbsp (60 ml) extra-virgin olive oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a mixing bowl toss together the garlic, basil, salt and olive oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate until serving time. <NEXT_INSTR> Alternate sliced tomatoes and slices of FRESH mozzerella on small salad plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle with dressing. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mozzarella and Tomato Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

(optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In large, heavy saucepan, bring first 6 ingredients to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook til veggies are tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix milk& flour together and add to veggies. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook, uncovered, until boiling, STIRRING nearly constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the cheese, salt, pepper& ham. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir til cheese is melted. <NEXT_INSTR> ***Iusually double this recipe***. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cheesy Potato & Ham Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> thin spaghetti <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> snow peas <NEXT_INPUT> sweet red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> fresh basil <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> Pepper <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> grated nonfat Parmesan cheese topping <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> lime zest <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 package (7 ounces) thin spaghetti <NEXT_INGR> 4 garlic cloves, minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons reduced-fat margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined <NEXT_INGR> 1 package (6 ounces) frozen snow peas, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium sweet red pepper, julienned <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons minced fresh basil or 1 tablespoon dried basil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> Pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup white wine or reduced-sodium chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup grated nonfat Parmesan cheese topping (no substitutes) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup fat-free milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon grated lime zest <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Caramelized Onion-Cranberry Compote. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> cloves <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. hot water <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tbsp. shortening <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 to 3/4 c. raisins (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put the ingredients in a saucepan and boil for 5 minutes. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red lentils <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> green serrano chile <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> cumin seeds <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> turmeric <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> Honey <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup red lentils, washed and soaked for 1 hour, drained <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 green serrano chile, split and seeded <NEXT_INGR> 1 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 large tomato, diced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cumin seeds <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon paprika <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon turmeric <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> Honey, for drizzling <NEXT_INGR> Optional garnishes: chopped fresh cilantro, yogurt, lemon or lime wedges <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the lentils, garlic, chile, ginger, onions, tomatoes and enough water to cover in a medium saucepan over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring the mixture to a boil, and then lower the heat and simmer until the lentils are tender, 30 to 45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk the cooked lentils to release some of their starch and break them down further. <NEXT_INSTR> Warm the oil in a small saute pan over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the cumin seeds and cook until they are sizzling and spluttering. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the paprika and turmeric. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the seasoned oil onto the lentils (be prepared for a big sizzle). <NEXT_INSTR> Stir to combine; sprinkle with salt and a small drizzle of honey. <NEXT_INSTR> Ladle into soup bowls and garnish with cilantro, a drizzle of yogurt, lemon or lime wedges. <NEXT_INSTR> From Food Network Kitchens; after further testing and to ensure the best results this recipe has been altered from what was in the actual episode. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Red Lentil Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> white rice <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> skinless <NEXT_INPUT> apricot <NEXT_INPUT> Italian-style salad dressing <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> yellow onion <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup white rice <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup apricot jam <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Italian-style salad dressing (such as Wishbone(R)) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup dried minced onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 ounce) can diced pineapple, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 yellow onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 red bell pepper, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). <NEXT_INSTR> Bring rice and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown chicken breasts on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine apricot jam, Italian-style salad dressing, and dried onions together in a bowl. Place browned chicken in a baking dish and pour jam mixture over the chicken; bake for 15 minutes. Add the pineapple, chopped onion and chopped red bell pepper; continue baking until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink inside, another 15 minutes. Serve over cooked rice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet And Sour Chicken Using Italian Dressing And Apricot Jam <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> serrano chili <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> avocado <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup chopped red onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> salt, pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 serrano chili, seeded and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 1 avocado, peeled,seeded and mashed <NEXT_INGR> 1 tomatoes, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> combine all ingredients in a bowl, stir well, serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Salsamole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> whole wheat bread dough <NEXT_INPUT> beef <NEXT_INPUT> turkey <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> provolone cheese <NEXT_INPUT> swiss cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> red peppers <NEXT_INPUT> radish sprouts <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> horseradish <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> honey mustard <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> green olives <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (1 lb) frozen whole wheat bread dough, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb thinly sliced roast beef <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb thinly sliced turkey <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb thinly sliced ham <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb thinly sliced provolone cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb thinly sliced swiss cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb thinly sliced cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 ounce) jar roasted red peppers <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup radish sprouts or 1/2 cup bean sprouts <NEXT_INGR> 4 -5 leaves leaf lettuce <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons prepared horseradish <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons honey mustard <NEXT_INGR> 3 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> green olives, for garnish (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> You will also need: 1 8-inch round cake pan, 3" deep. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray 8 inch cake pan with non stick spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Form the thawed dough into an 8-inch round loaf and press into cake pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350F for 20 to 25 minutes or until bread sounds hollow when tapped. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool 5 minutes and then remove from pan and cool thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Once cooled cut the loaf horizontally into 4 equal slices, (these will be the"cake" layers). <NEXT_INSTR> To assemble the"cake", line the same baking pan with enough plastic wrap to hang over all sides 8 inches. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread bottom slice of bread with 2 tbsp of butter and 2 tbsp of horseradish. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with roast beef, provolone& roasted red peppers. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread second slice of bread with remaining butter& horseradish and place it horseradish side down on top of roast beef layer. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread the top of the second bread slice with 2 tbsp mayonnaise and then top with turkey, swiss cheese and sprouts. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread third slice of bread with remaining mayonnaise and place mayo side down on top of turkey layer. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread top of third bread layer with 2 tbsp honey mustard and top with lettuce, ham and cheddar cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread cut side of loaf top (fourth layer) with remaining honey mustard and place mustard side down on top of ham layer. <NEXT_INSTR> Place assembled"cake" in plastic lined pan and bring plastic wrap around cake to cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate 4 hours, (to make the cake more compact and easier to"ice" place a large pan on top of the cake and weigh down with heavy object such as canned food while refrigerating). <NEXT_INSTR> To ice the"cake", beat cream cheese with an electric mixer until light& fluffy. <NEXT_INSTR> Carefully remove cake from 8 in pan, unwrap and place on cake serving platter. <NEXT_INSTR> Using an offset spatula neatly spread the top and sides of the"cake" with cream cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a#21 tip, pipe remaining cream cheese along bottom to make shell border and then garnish with olives at every second shell. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate until ready to serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> "We Thought It Was A Layer Cake Sandwich" <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Ham <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 oz Devils Ham (or left over shredded ham) <NEXT_INGR> 8 oz cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup Goya Fancy Pimentos (Roasted) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp sugar <NEXT_INGR> Enjoy! <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Recipe for about 2 cups worth of paste. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> In a food processor add all ingredients and pulse until you have a smooth but thick consistency. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cuban Bocadito Spread  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> extra large fresh shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> ground walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. extra large fresh shrimp <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, lightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. ground walnuts <NEXT_INGR> vegetable oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails intact. <NEXT_INSTR> Rinse well and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine flour, pepper and salt; stir well. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine milk and eggs; stir well. <NEXT_INSTR> Dip shrimp in egg mixture; dredge in flour mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Dip shrimp in egg mixture again and dredge in ground walnuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Place coated shrimp on a wax paper lined baking sheet; cover and freeze 2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Fry shrimp, a few at a time, in deep hot oil (350°) 3 minutes or until golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain on paper towels. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 3. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Walnut Fried Shrimp <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> potato chips <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. potato chips, crushed (5 c. uncrushed) <NEXT_INGR> sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> In large mixer bowl, beat butter on medium speed until softened (about 30 seconds). <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1/2 cup sugar and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat until fluffy. <NEXT_INSTR> With mixer on low speed, gradually add flour and potato chips, beating until well mixed. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop by rounded teaspoons about 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten dough with fork dipped in sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden. <NEXT_INSTR> With pancake turner lift the cookies onto a cooling rack. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 36 cookies. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Potato Chip Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. shortening <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. Hershey's cocoa <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 c. all-purpose flour (unsifted) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 c. milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Grease two 9-inch round cake pans. Cream butter, shortening, sugar and vanilla until fluffy. Blend in eggs. Combine cocoa, flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in bowl. Add milk and blend. Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hershey'S Disappearing Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> salmon <NEXT_INPUT> peanut oil <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> ground ginger <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 (4 ounce) fillets salmon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup peanut oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons green onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 teaspoons brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons ground ginger <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons crushed red pepper flakes <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place salmon filets in a medium, nonporous glass dish. In a separate medium bowl, combine the peanut oil, soy sauce, vinegar, green onions, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes, sesame oil and salt. Whisk together well, and pour over the fish. Cover and marinate the fish in the refrigerator for 4 to 6 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare an outdoor grill with coals about 5 inches from the grate, and lightly oil the grate. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill the fillets 5 inches from coals for 10 minutes per inch of thickness, measured at the thickest part, or until fish just flakes with a fork. Turn over halfway through cooking. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Firecracker Grilled Alaska Salmon <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onions <NEXT_INPUT> green peppers <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> perch fillet <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 tablespoons chopped onions <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons chopped green peppers <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb frozen perch fillet, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Saute onion and green pepper in oil in a heavy saucepan till tender. Stir in tomato sauce, brown sugar, lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce. Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat, and simmer 15 min., stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Place fish fillets in a greased 12 x 7 x 2 in baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Spoon sauce on top and bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 10-15 min., or till fish flakes easily with a fork. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Baked Fish With Barbecue Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> green beans <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> Gorgonzola <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound fresh green beans <NEXT_INGR> 8 oz. sliced mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup crumbled Gorgonzola <NEXT_INGR> 1 T. fresh chopped basil <NEXT_INGR> 1 T. fresh chopped thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1 T. fresh extra virgin olive oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Steam green beans to al dente; set aside. Saute mushrooms in olive oil to desired tenderness; add herbs, green beans, and Gorgonzola; heat until cheese is melted. Voila! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Marie'S Green Beans With Mushrooms And Gorgonzola  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> fresh-ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> frozen petite peas <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 cups canned crushed tomatoes (from one 28-ounce can) <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon fresh-ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound cheese tortellini <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 pound ham, cut into 1/4-inch dice <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup frozen petite peas, defrosted <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large stainless-steel frying pan, melt the butter over moderately low heat. Add the onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until starting to soften, about 3 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes with their juice, the salt, and the pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the cream and cook for 1 minute longer. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook the tortellini until just done, about 4 minutes for fresh, 12 minutes for frozen. Drain the pasta and add it to the pan with the sauce. Stir in the ham and peas and cook until warmed through, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Variations : Substitute 1/4 pound sliced prosciutto, cut into thin strips, for the ham. : Stir in 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, cut into thin strips, with the ham and peas. <NEXT_INSTR> Wine Recommendation: A light, fruity, and very crisp Italian red will cut the sauce's creaminess and refresh the palate. Valpolicella is a perfect choice. For a treat, bypass the well-known commercial brands and seek out a Valpolicella Classico from a small estate. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tortellini With Ham, Peas, And Tomato Cream Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> mayo <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> tiny shrimp <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. mayo <NEXT_INGR> onion <NEXT_INGR> 2 hard-boiled eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans tiny shrimp <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend together cream cheese, mayo and onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together eggs and shrimp. <NEXT_INSTR> Put 1/2 cream cheese mixture in bottom of a buttered dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with 1/2 shrimp and egg mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat layers; sprinkle with paprika. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 1/2 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Must keep warm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shrimp Cracker Spread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> walden farms <NEXT_INPUT> non-fat <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> banana <NEXT_INPUT> cubes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 tablespoons walden farms calorie free chocolate syrup <NEXT_INGR> 3 ounces non-fat vanilla yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces skim milk <NEXT_INGR> 12 banana <NEXT_INGR> 6 ice cubes <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve and enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Walden Farms Chocolate Banana Smoothie - Sugar Free <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> onion powder <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> salmon fillet <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> all-purpose <NEXT_INPUT> russet potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> dill <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon onion powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon celery seed <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 pound) salmon fillet, skin on <NEXT_INGR> 5 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium russet potatoes (about 1 pound), peeled and cut into 1/4-inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons snipped fresh dill <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Soak the plank for at least 1 hour and up to 24 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> First, prepare the salmon. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, combine the salt, pepper, thyme, garlic powder, onion powder, and celery seed. <NEXT_INSTR> Rub liberally onto the flesh side of the salmon. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare the plank for grilling according to the instructions (see Notes). <NEXT_INSTR> Place the salmon, skin side down, on the toasted side of the plank. <NEXT_INSTR> Close the lid and grill for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the salmon is flaky around the edges but still opaque in the center. <NEXT_INSTR> Once it has coole slightly, remove the skin, gently break the salmon into small chunks and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Next, prepare the chowder. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the milk in a medium saucepan over low heat until it is nearly simmering; do not let it boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, melt the butter in a 3- to 4-quart heavy saucepan over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onion, salt, and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the flour and cook for 3 minutes, stirring often. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk in the heated milk until the mixture is smooth, then add the potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Increase the heat to medium-high and cook until the potatoes are just tender, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the salmon chunks and dill and simmer just until heated through, about 2 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Salmon Chowder <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs (lightly beaten) <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 quart water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring water to boil <NEXT_INSTR> Mix all ingredients (except the butter) together, batter will be sticky. <NEXT_INSTR> Push batter through a colander or use a spaetzel maker (you can also use a zip lock bag with a corner cut and "pipe" it, which I recommend if you don't have the maker) into the water <NEXT_INSTR> Allow to cook for 2 minutes or until the dumplings float <NEXT_INSTR> Rescue your dumplings from the water either with a slotted spoon or by simply draining the water <NEXT_INSTR> Toss your yummies with the butter and enjoy! <NEXT_INSTR> Source: Taste of Home 2008 <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spaetzel dumplings <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onions <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 lbs onions, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon kosher salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine ingredients in a large skillet and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until onions break down and are completely soft (they will be a lovely medium to dark brown), several hours. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Melted Onions <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ginger <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> turkey <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 egg, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup minced fresh cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 2 green onions, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger, or more to taste <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound lean ground turkey <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup bread crumbs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Whisk egg and soy sauce together in a bowl; add cilantro, green onions, ginger, garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix turkey and bread crumbs into mixture and mix well; form into 4 patties. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Place patties in the hot skillet; cover skillet and cook, turning once, until burgers are no longer pink in the center, about 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Thai-Style Turkey Burgers <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pastry patty <NEXT_INPUT> shredded gruyère <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 frozen puff pastry patty shells (10-oz. package) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup shredded gruyere or Swiss cheese <NEXT_INGR> cayenne <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> On a lightly floured board, roll 6 thawed frozen puff pastry patty shells (10-oz. package) into 4-inch-wide rounds. Sprinkle each round with 2 tablespoons shredded gruyere or Swiss cheese (3/4 cup total); sprinkle lightly with cayenne. With rolling pin, gently press cheese into pastry. Place rounds slightly apart on a 12- by 17-inch baking sheet. Bake in a 400° oven until browned, 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Nutritional analysis per pastry. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Gruyère Pastry <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> boneless skinless chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> instant white rice <NEXT_INPUT> VELVEETA <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1-1/4 lb. boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups sliced fresh mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 1 carrot, coarsely chopped (about 1/2 cup) Target 2 lb For $3.00 thru 02/06 <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped onions <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (14-1/2 oz.) fat-free reduced-sodium chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup instant white rice, uncooked <NEXT_INGR> 6 oz. VELVEETA, cut into 1/2-inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook and stir chicken in large saucepan sprayed with cooking spray on medium heat 3 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Add vegetables; cook 5 to 7 min. <NEXT_INSTR> or until chicken is done and vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in water, broth and rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to boil; simmer on medium-low heat 10 min., stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> ADD VELVEETA; cook on low heat 5 min. <NEXT_INSTR> or until VELVEETA is completely melted and mixture is well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in pepper. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chunky Chicken & Rice Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sausage <NEXT_INPUT> rioja wine <NEXT_INPUT> black peppercorns <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> flat leaf parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 lbs good quality spanish chorizo sausage <NEXT_INGR> 8 fluid ounces rioja wine <NEXT_INGR> 5 black peppercorns <NEXT_INGR> 3 dried bay leaves, crumbled <NEXT_INGR> flat leaf parsley, for serving <NEXT_INGR> toothpick <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Prick the sausages all over and place into a dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the wine over the sausages, then add the black peppercorns and crumbled bay leaves - cover and leave to steep in the marinade for 24 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain the chorizo sausage and cook them on a well oiled, medium-hot griddle pan for about 6 minutes each side, or until evenly browned and crispy. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice the sausages thickly and skewer with a toothpick. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve alongside other tapas style dishes, such as olives, cubes of cheese and crusty bread. <NEXT_INSTR> This recipe can also be cooked on the barbeque - to great effect! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tapas Style Spanish  Rioja Marinated Chorizo Sausage <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 qt. tomatoes, peeled and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 stalk celery or leaves, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. paprika <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place all ingredients in a large kettle. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over medium heat until tomatoes are tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove bay leaf. <NEXT_INSTR> Force through strainer or process in blender. <NEXT_INSTR> Return tomato mixture to heat and cook until reduced to half the original volume. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into hot sterilized jars and seal. <NEXT_INSTR> Yields 3 pints. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tomato Puree Deluxe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa powder <NEXT_INPUT> frozen raspberries <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> powdered sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/4 cups granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup margarine or butter <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup all purpose flour sifted <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/3 cups cocoa powder <NEXT_INGR> 5 ounces frozen raspberries <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 ounces chocolate chips <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups walnuts chopped <NEXT_INGR> powdered sugar to dust, optional <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease and line a 12x8 inch jelly roll pan with parchment paper. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat sugar, margarine, eggs and vanilla together until combined. Fold in flour and cocoa powder until just combined. Fold in raspberries, chocolate chips and walnuts. Transfer to prepared pan and bake for 25-30 mins. Let cool in pan then slice into squares. Serve dusted with powdered sugar, if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Raspberry Brownies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> corn syrup <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. butter (not oleo) <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs, slightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. dark corn syrup <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. pecans, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream <NEXT_INSTR> butter; <NEXT_INSTR> add <NEXT_INSTR> sugar gradually and cream together until light <NEXT_INSTR> and fluffy. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining ingredients and blend well. Pour <NEXT_INSTR> into pastry shell. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake on lower shelf in moderate oven (375°) for 40 to 45 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pecan Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> watermelon <NEXT_INPUT> cucumbers <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> fresh mint <NEXT_INPUT> balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 cups cubed seedless watermelon <NEXT_INGR> 2 English cucumbers, halved lengthwise and sliced <NEXT_INGR> 6 green onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup minced fresh mint <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large bowl, combine watermelon, cucumbers, green onions and mint. In a small bowl, whisk remaining ingredients. Pour over salad and toss to coat. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> cheese soup <NEXT_INPUT> green chilies <NEXT_INPUT> flour tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> four-cheese <NEXT_INPUT> red peppers <NEXT_INPUT> capers <NEXT_INPUT> peppercorn <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs or 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can diced tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 2 (11 ounce) canscondensed nacho cheese soup, undiluted <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 ounce) can diced green chilies, drained <NEXT_INGR> 6 (8 inch) flour tortillas <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup four-cheese Mexican blend cheese <NEXT_INGR> 4 roasted red peppers <NEXT_INGR> capers, and <NEXT_INGR> peppercorn, and <NEXT_INGR> minced fresh cilantro, for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350F Place chicken in small saucepan with broth. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover; cook over low heat 20 minutes or until chicken reaches internal temperature of 180F Remove from heat and reserve broth. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut chicken into bite-size strips. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine tomatoes, nacho cheese soup and chiles in bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide nacho cheese soup mixture in half. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken to one half and 1/2 cup reserved chicken broth to other half. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon chicken mixture down center of each flour tortilla; roll up. <NEXT_INSTR> Tortillas will be very full. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour half of nacho-chicken broth mixture into 9- to 10-inch square glass baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange filled tortillas seam-side down in baking dish, packing tightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon on remaining nacho-chicken broth mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until filling is hot and cheese is melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with slice of roasted red pepper, cut into 3-inch triangle for "bandana." <NEXT_INSTR> Make cowboy face with capers, peppercorns or cilantro. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cowboy in a Shroud <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> skinless <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> hearts <NEXT_INPUT> lemon slices <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts pounded to 1/4 -inch thickness <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbs butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbs olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. dry vermouth <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. dried marjoram <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 1 can artichoke hearts, drained and halved <NEXT_INGR> 8 thin lemon slices <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1.	Combine flour, salt and pepper in a shallow dish. Dredge chicken breasts in flour to coat; shake off excess. <NEXT_INSTR> 2.	In a large frying pan, melt butter in oil over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned. Remove and keep warm. <NEXT_INSTR> 3.	Add garlic to pan; cook 1 minute. Add broth, vermouth, marjoram and bay leaf to pan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Return chicken to pan; add artichoke hearts and 4 lemon slices (put in the liquid). Cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes until liquid just begins to thicken and flavors blended. Discard bay leaf and lemon slices. <NEXT_INSTR> 4.	Arrange chicken and artichokes on serving plates. Pour sauce over chicken. Top each piece of chicken with a fresh lemon slice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Chicken Scallopini With Artichokes  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Chicken Breasts <NEXT_INPUT> Cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> Liquid Smoke <NEXT_INPUT> Olive Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Yellow Bell Peppers <NEXT_INPUT> Green Bell Peppers <NEXT_INPUT> Mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> Onions <NEXT_INPUT> Red Bell Peppers <NEXT_INPUT> Eggplant <NEXT_INPUT> Olive Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Ziplock <NEXT_INPUT> INGREDIENTS <NEXT_INPUT> Yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> Cucumbers <NEXT_INPUT> White Pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Dill <NEXT_INPUT> Lemon <NEXT_INPUT> BREAD <NEXT_INPUT> ITEMS <NEXT_INPUT> Grill <NEXT_INPUT> Scewers <NEXT_INPUT> BBQ <NEXT_INPUT> Strainers <NEXT_INPUT> Towels <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 large Boneless Trimmed Chicken Breasts (cut in 1" cubes) <NEXT_INGR> 1 TBS Each: Dried: Italian Seasoning - Oregeno - Cilantro - Basil - Red Pepper Flakes - Black Pepper - Cumin - Garlic Powder - Onion Powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 Bottle Liquid Smoke (3 drops) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup Olive Oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 large Yellow Bell Peppers <NEXT_INGR> 4 large Green Bell Peppers <NEXT_INGR> 2 large Packages Whole, Large Mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 4 large Onions (quartered) <NEXT_INGR> 2 large Red Bell Peppers <NEXT_INGR> 1 large Eggplant <NEXT_INGR> 1 can Spray Pam Olive Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 large Ziplock Bag <NEXT_INGR> 1 TZATZIKI SAUCE INGREDIENTS <NEXT_INGR> 1 pints Sour Cream & Greek Yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 2 Extra Large Cucumbers (de-seeded) <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 tsp White Pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tbsp Fresh Chopped Garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp Fresh Dill <NEXT_INGR> 1 Squeeze Lemon <NEXT_INGR> 1 BREAD NEEDED <NEXT_INGR> 16 Tortillas Or Tandori Breads <NEXT_INGR> 1 GRILLING ITEMS NEEDED <NEXT_INGR> 1 Gas Grill Or Charcoal Grill <NEXT_INGR> 12 Medal Scewers <NEXT_INGR> 1 Pair BBQ Tongs <NEXT_INGR> 2 Fine Mesh Strainers <NEXT_INGR> 1 Cheese Cloth Or Sturdy Paper Towels <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> WARNING: Always keep chicken away from any other kitchen items or foods. <NEXT_INSTR> If you cut chicken on a cutting board, wash and disinfect it and your knife directly after use. <NEXT_INSTR> Wash your hands as well after working with any meat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cross contamination can be a real threat. <NEXT_INSTR> Leave out all dried spices you'll use in your marinade listed below since you will need each of them again later at scewer construction time. <NEXT_INSTR> Wash and trim fat from your boneless chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut in to 1" cubes and place in your Ziplock bag. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 6 drops liquid smoke and massage chicken in bag very well. <NEXT_INSTR> Then add olive oil and all dried seasonings [except white pepper, lemon and dill] and massage again. <NEXT_INSTR> Place bag in fridge and marinate chicken for 2 + hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Massage chilled bag intermittently. <NEXT_INSTR> Wash your mushrooms and leave whole. <NEXT_INSTR> Also, chop your vegetables. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel, de-seed and shread the cucumbers like you would hash browns for your Tzatziki Sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Once completed, place your shreadded cucumbers in a fine mesh strainer and sprinkle/mix them with sea salt to help sweat/drain any excess water from them for an hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Then place your cucumbers in cheese cloth or sturdy paper towels and squeeze to remove any additional fluids. <NEXT_INSTR> This step is very important since nobody enjoys a runny Tzatziki Sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Now, make your Tzatziki Sauce by mixing 1/2 of your Sour Cream and 1/2 of your Greek Yogart together. <NEXT_INSTR> Then spoon into a fine mesh strainer for 1 hour to drain any excess fluid from them. <NEXT_INSTR> You can also alter your cream amounts to your personal preference. <NEXT_INSTR> If you're not fond of Greek Yogart, mix 75% Sour Cream to 25% Yogart or visa versa. <NEXT_INSTR> You can also use 100% Yogart or 100% Sour Cream. <NEXT_INSTR> After draining is complete, mix creams with your shreadded and fully drained cucumbers and other Tzatziki Sauce ingredients, [lemon juice, white pepper and dill] and refrigerate for at least one hour. <NEXT_INSTR> VEGETABLE SCEWER CONSTRUCTION: Feed all vegetables on to your metal scewers starting with your mushrooms, then Onions, Green Peppers, Red Peppers, Yellow Peppers and Eggplant. <NEXT_INSTR> Always start and finish with a mushroom as it will hold your vegetables on your scewers better. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray with Pam, all vegetables on all scewers and sprinkle the dried spices you used in your marinade over them. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray once again with Pam to seal those spices on your veggies. <NEXT_INSTR> CHICKEN SCEWER CONSTRUCTION: Feed your chicken on to your scewers and feed a small sliver of onion in between chicken pieces for even cooking and added flavor. <NEXT_INSTR> They also act as great temperature gauges. <NEXT_INSTR> When they turn black, move your chicken to a cooler spot on the grill. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray with Pam, all skewered chicken and sprinkle the dried spices you used in your marinade over the them. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray once again afterwards with Pam to seal those spices on your chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> GRILLING: Grill chicken and veggies until fully cooked but not burnt. <NEXT_INSTR> Keep veggies grilling on the cooler side of the grill and chicken at the hotter side. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn regularly for even grilling. <NEXT_INSTR> Your chicken shouldn't take that long to grill since they are only 1" pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> About 12-15 minutes at 425. <NEXT_INSTR> FOR BREADS: Spray one side of your tortillas [or other bread] with Pam and sprinkle with dried marinade seasonings of your choosing. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray once more to seal on those spices. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill quickly until the tortillas rises like balloons and are slightly charred. <NEXT_INSTR> SERVING: Smear chilled Tzatziki Sauce inside your warm grilled tortillas or other breads and place chicken and vegetables on top. <NEXT_INSTR> AUTHORS NOTES: Other meat, seafood, vegetable, fruit & bread options are: Pork * Beef * Lamb * Shrimp & Scallops * Or, Eggplant * Squash * Corn On The Cob * Purple Onions * Zucchini * Red Potatoes * Assorted Mushrooms * Mango * Pineapple * Apples * Cherry Tomatoes * Or, Tandori * Paratha * Naan & Pita Breads. <NEXT_INSTR> Lastly, your Tzatziki Sauce will taste exponentially better with a few hours of refrigerator time. <NEXT_INSTR> Also, this Tzatziki sauce goes great with fish dishes! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mike's Chicken Kebobs & Tatziki Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> low-fat buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> extra egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups low-fat buttermilk, at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs, separated, at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 2 extra egg whites, at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled <NEXT_INGR> vegetable oil, for cooking <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> {If you aren't going to serve the pancakes until you've cooked all of them, preheat oven to 200 F. Spray a wire rack with cooking spray and set it inside a baking sheet then place the baking sheet in the oven.} <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium bowl, whisk the flour, sugar, baking soda, salt and cinnamon together. Add the buttermilk and sour cream to a large measuring cup and whisk to combine. Whisk the egg yolks and melted butter into the buttermilk mixture until well combined. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Add the egg whites to a medium bowl. Use a hand mixer to beat them to soft peaks. Pour the buttermilk mixture over the dry ingredients. Whisk until just barely combined - the batter should be lumpy. Use a rubber spatula to fold the egg whites into the batter, again until just barely combined. It's fine if a few streaks of egg white remain. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Heat 1 teaspoon of oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet set over medium heat (or spray with nonstick cooking spray). Once the oil starts shimmering, use paper towels to wipe the pan so only a thin, even coating of oil covers the bottom and sides. Use a 1/8 cup measure (2 tablespoons) to portion the batter into the pan. Cook on the first side until the edges are set and bubbles form on the surface, about 2 minutes. Use a spatula to flip the pancakes and cook for an additional 2 minutes on the second side, or until golden brown and cooked through. {If not serving immediately, transfer the pancakes to the wire rack in the oven.} Repeat with remaining batter, adding more oil to the pan if necessary. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cinnamon Toast Cloudcakes  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>
