<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chickpeas <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> tahini <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (16 ounce) can chickpeas (drained and rinsed) <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 3 -5 tablespoons lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 tablespoons tahini <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cilantro, chopped (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend all ingredients together and add lemon juice and olive oil depending on taste. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hummus <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> container applesauce <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> semi-sweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INPUT> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> flour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (4 ounce) container applesauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons margarine (I use Brummell and Brown) <NEXT_INGR> 1.25 (12 ounce) bags semi-sweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGR> 3 egg whites <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups flour <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat applesauce, sugar, margarine, and chocolate chips over low-medium heat in saucepan until partly melted. Do NOT heat until smooth. There should still be visible chocolate chips in batter. In separate mixing bowl, mix flour, baking soda, salt, and flour. Add eggs and vanilla to mixture and blend. Add cooled chocolate mixture and mix. Pour batter into greased 9.5 inch pie pan or comparable. Bake 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until done. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Applesauce Chocolate Chip Brownies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chocolate chips <NEXT_INPUT> butterscotch chips <NEXT_INPUT> condensed milk <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> walnut halves <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. chocolate chips <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. butterscotch chips <NEXT_INGR> 1 can sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. coarsely chopped walnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. walnut halves <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt chocolate and butterscotch chips with milk over hot water in double boiler until chips melt and mixture starts to thicken. Remove from heat; add chopped walnuts and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend well. Chill about 1 hour until mixture thickens. <NEXT_INSTR> Line bottom of a 9-inch pie plate with a 12-inch square of foil. <NEXT_INSTR> Place 3/4 cup walnut halves in bottom of pan forming a 2-inch wide ring. <NEXT_INSTR> Decorate with rest of walnut halves. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill in refrigerator until firm enough to slice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fudge Scotch Ring <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> all-purpose <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> salad oil <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla extract <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 c. all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. salad oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (8 oz.) crushed pineapple, undrained <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. chopped pecans or walnuts, divided <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. chopped bananas (1 lb.), sliced and chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl; add eggs and salad oil stirring until dry ingredients are moistened. <NEXT_INSTR> Do not beat. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in vanilla, pineapple, 1 cup nuts and bananas. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon batter into 3 well-greased and floured 9-inch cake pans. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hummingbird Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fresh peaches <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> almond extract <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 c. fresh peaches, sliced or blueberries <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. almond extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 6 Tbsp. margarine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place sliced peaches on bottom of dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with lemon juice and extract. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift dry ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Add egg and mix with fork or hands until crumbly. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle over peaches. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle with melted margarine or butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375° for 35 to 40 minutes. Top with ice cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Use 10 x 6-inch baking dish. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Peach Cobbler <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sage <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> bread cubes <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> poultry seasoning <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 c. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoon crushed sage <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 Large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. minced celery <NEXT_INGR> 8 c. soft bread cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon poultry seasoning <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add in 1 lb. <NEXT_INSTR> of bulk pork sausage, crumbled and browned, with the remaining ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> You can substitute some of the sausage fat for the butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Stuff into the turkey and bake as usual. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sausage Stuffing (For Turkey) Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> dill <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> corned beef <NEXT_INPUT> beets <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons chopped fresh dill <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled, cut into 1/2-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 9 ounces thickly sliced corned beef, coarsely chopped (about 2 cups) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup coarsely chopped drained canned beets <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg, beaten to blend <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons vegetable oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix sour cream and dill in small bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and chill until ready to serve. <NEXT_INSTR> (Dilled sour cream can be made 2 days ahead.) <NEXT_INSTR> Steam potatoes until tender, about 8 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to large bowl; chill until cold, about 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in corned beef, beets and onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Working in batches and using on/off turns, coarsely chop mixture in processor. <NEXT_INSTR> Return mixture to same bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add egg; toss to mix. <NEXT_INSTR> (Can be prepared 4 hours ahead. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and chill.) <NEXT_INSTR> Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add corned beef mixture; cook until bottom is brown and crisp, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Continue cooking until brown and crisp on both sides, flattening with spatula and turning mixture over in sections, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to plates. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with dilled sour cream. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Red Flannel Hash with Dilled Sour Cream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> blue berries <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup (60 ml) margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup (225 ml) sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup (225 ml) sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp (5 ml) vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups (475 ml) flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp (5 ml) baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp (5 ml) baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp (1 ml) salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup (60 ml) sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup (125 ml) to 1 cup (225 ml) walnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp (5 ml) cinnamon or more <NEXT_INGR> blue berries, optional <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine ingredients for topping and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> To make batter, cream margarine, sugar and eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sour cream and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt and beat in. <NEXT_INSTR> Grease a tube pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in half of batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Add half of topping. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining topping. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees (175 C.). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Granny's Coffee Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> crescent rolls <NEXT_INPUT> hickory smoke-flavored <NEXT_INPUT> salad dressing <NEXT_INPUT> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> pizza cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tubes (8 ounces each) refrigerated crescent rolls <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup hickory smoke-flavored barbecue sauce, divided <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup prepared ranch salad dressing <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups cubed cooked chicken breasts <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups shredded pizza cheese blend <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 375°. Unroll both tubes of crescent dough and press onto the bottom and up the sides of an ungreased 15x10x1-in. baking pan, pressing perforations to seal. Bake 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, mix 1/4 cup barbecue sauce and salad dressing; spread over crust. In another bowl, toss chicken with remaining barbecue sauce. Arrange over top. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 15-20 minutes longer or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bbq & Ranch Chicken Pizza <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peas <NEXT_INPUT> corn Niblets <NEXT_INPUT> chopped meat <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 14.5 oz. can peas <NEXT_INGR> 8 oz. corn Niblets <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. chopped meat <NEXT_INGR> 2 lb. mashed potatoes <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put peas on bottom of pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour corn on top of peas. <NEXT_INSTR> Brown chopped meat and lay on top of vegetables. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with cooked mashed potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375° until mashed potatoes brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from oven and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shepherd'S Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> elbow macaroni <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> Tabasco sauce <NEXT_INPUT> American cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 12 lbs ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 16 ounces tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 12 lb elbow macaroni <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> Tabasco sauce, to taste (I do about 6-7 shakes) <NEXT_INGR> 12 lb American cheese (Velveeta is great, but I used Kraft Deli Deluxe slices and loved it) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown the meat with the onion and garlic in a large pan with a tight-fitting lid (to be used later). <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over moderate heat until onion is soft. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining ingredients, except cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and simmer on low until macaroni is cooked, 15-20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix one-half of cheese into mixture, then top with other half. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover pan again for another 3-4 minutes over low heat to let cheese melt. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mama's Macaroni Tempter <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tomato <NEXT_INPUT> goat cheese <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> rolls <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup sun-dried tomato, drained and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup crumbled goat cheese <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup toasted pine nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) can refrigerated crescent dinner rolls <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 375F. <NEXT_INSTR> In medium bowl, stir together sun-dried tomatoes, goat cheese and pine nuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Separate dough into 8 triangles. <NEXT_INSTR> Place about 3 tablespoons sun-dried tomato mixture down the length of each triangle. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll up each, starting at shortest side of triangle and rolling to opposite point. <NEXT_INSTR> Place rolls, point side down, on ungreased cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 16 to 19 minutes until golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Crescent Holiday Surprise <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> fresh spinach <NEXT_INPUT> mushroom <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup fresh spinach <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup mushroom <NEXT_INGR> 1 large onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1 honey mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 sliced cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add the olive oil to the pan then heat the pan <NEXT_INSTR> Add the chopped onion to the oil and keep stirring . <NEXT_INSTR> Add the spinach and mushrooms and keep stirring till the color darkens <NEXT_INSTR> Add the beaten eggs to the pan <NEXT_INSTR> Add the salt and pepper <NEXT_INSTR> Open up the bun and cheeses and heat it up in toaster or microwave <NEXT_INSTR> Add the mayonnaise, honey mustard and add the omelet on top <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spinach omelet in a bun <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> chicken breast <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> green beans <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 whole boneless skinless chicken breast, cut into 1/8 inch strips <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup vegetable oil, divided <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup roasted cashew nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb green beans, cut diagonally in 1/2-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium carrots, peeled and cut diagonally in 1/8-inch slices <NEXT_INGR> 1 stalk celery, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cornstarch <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine soy sauce and 1 tablespoon cornstarch; mix well. add chicken, and stir until coated; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> heat 1 tablespoon oil in wok until hot; add nuts, stirring constantly, until browned (about 3o seconds). remove nuts, and set aside. add another tablespoon oil to pan; add chicken, and stir-fry 1 to 2 minutes. remove chicken, and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> cut onion into 1/4-inch slices; cut slices in half crosswise. add remaining oil to wok, and heat to smoking. add vegetables and garlic; cover and cook 1 minute, shaking wok to prevent vegetables from sticking. remove cover; cook, stirring constantly, an additional 2 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> combine broth and 1 teaspoon cornstarch. add chicken and broth mixture to vegetables; stir until thickened. stir in cashews. yield: 2 servings. <NEXT_INSTR> southern living. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cashew Chicken For Two <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> cardamom <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup whipping cream <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cardamom <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter, melted <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Beat eggs and sugar until light and fluffy. <NEXT_INSTR> Whip crream and sour cream together. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift flour, baking powder and cardamom together. <NEXT_INSTR> Add alternately, with butter and cream mixture, to the egg mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix lightly together. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll out dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut doughnuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Reroll scraps and cut out doughnuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Have oil at 350 degrees Fahrenheit. <NEXT_INSTR> Deep fry, a few at time, until golden, 3 to 4 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Smultringer Norwegian Doughnuts <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> barbecue sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 pounds ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups fresh bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 (18 ounce) bottle barbecue sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, combine the beef, bread, onion, milk, salt and eggs. Shape into little meatballs, about 1 inch in size. Place the meatballs into a 9x13 inch baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 25 to 30 minutes. Pour barbecue sauce over the meatballs and bake for 35 more minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Barbecued Meatballs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> condensed milk <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> Nabisco vanilla wafers <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. cold water <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. vanilla or French vanilla instant pudding (4 serving size box) <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. (1 pt.) whipping cream, whipped <NEXT_INGR> 1 box Nabisco vanilla wafers <NEXT_INGR> 3 bananas, sliced and dipped in lemon juice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In large bowl, combine condensed milk and water. <NEXT_INSTR> Add pudding mix; beat well with mixer. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill for 5 minutes in freezer. Meanwhile, whip cream until soft peaks form. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from freezer; fold in whipped cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon 1 cup of pudding mixture into bottom of a punch bowl (or 2 1/2-quart glass bowl). <NEXT_INSTR> Add vanilla wafers on top of pudding, then layer with sliced bananas. <NEXT_INSTR> Continue layering, ending with vanilla wafers. <NEXT_INSTR> Keep chilled until serving time. <NEXT_INSTR> This makes a large, rich pudding! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Creamy Banana Pudding <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fat <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> clove of garlic <NEXT_INPUT> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> kidney beans <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 Tbsp. fat <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 chopped green pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 chopped red pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove of garlic chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. tomatoes (no. 2 can) <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. kidney beans <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. chili powder <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt fat in heavy skillet over low heat, add onions, peppers and garlic; stir gently about 3 minutes, or until soft and slightly brown. Remove garlic; add remaining ingredients. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chili Con Carne * Chow Mein Noodles <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> chili sauce <NEXT_INPUT> grape jelly <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 lb. ground beef (lean) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. minced onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 c. oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chili sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. grape jelly <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine beef, bread crumbs, onion, milk, egg, salt, Worcestershire sauce and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well and shape into 1-inch balls. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook in oil over medium heat for 10 to 15 minutes or until browned. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain on paper towels. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tasty Glazed Meatballs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onions <NEXT_INPUT> fresh garlic <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 onions (about the size of a tennis ball, with outer skin removed, no larger as you will not get the bacon or) <NEXT_INGR> 1 -2 tablespoon minced fresh garlic (or to taste) <NEXT_INGR> 4 -6 tablespoons oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup whipping cream (unwhipped) <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups grated parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 8 slices uncooked bacon or 8 slices pancetta, slices <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook the onions in boiling water until tender, but not falling apart (about 25 minutes). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from pot with a slotted spoon and cool. <NEXT_INSTR> When cool enough to handle, cut off about an inch off of top of onions with a very sharp knife, and finely chop the tops. <NEXT_INSTR> Trim the root end of the onions slightly, just enough so they can stand straight. <NEXT_INSTR> Scoop out about a heaping tablespoon from the center of each onion (make certain to keep the inside intact) and finely chop the center, adding to the rest of the chopped onions. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the hollowed onions to an oiled baking dish (I use an 11x7-inch for 8 onions, if you are only making 4 onions, then use an 8x8-inch). <NEXT_INSTR> Set oven to 375 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> In a skillet over medium heat, saute the chopped onions for about 3 minutes in oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in whipping cream and remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the Parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Fill the whole onions with some of the sauted onion and Parmesan mixture, then spoon the remainder of the mixture around the onions in the baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Wrap a piece of pancetta or a bacon slice around the middle of each onion and secure with a toothpick. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake the onions for about 40-50 minutes (depending on the size of your onions). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bacon-Wrapped  Baked Onions <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> light brown sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 cups whipping cream <NEXT_INGR> 10 large egg yolks <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> light brown sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°F. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring cream to simmer in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Using electric mixer, beat yolks and sugar in large bowl until pale yellow and slowly dissolving ribbon forms when beaters are lifted. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually beat in hot cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour custard into ten 6-ounce custard cups. Arrange cups in large baking pan. Add enough warm water to pan to come 1/2" up sides of cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake until centers are just set, about 45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove cups from water. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate until well chilled. <NEXT_INSTR> (Can be prepared up to one day ahead.). <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat broiler. <NEXT_INSTR> Press enough brown sugar through sieve over custards to lightly cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Broil in batches until sugar caramelizes, about one minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate until well chilled, at least one, and up to, two hours. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Baker'S Creme <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallow cream <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 cups sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 ounce) package semisweet chocolate pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1 (7 ounce) jar marshmallow cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup peanut butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine 1 1/2 cups sugar, 6 Tbsp. butter, and 1/3 cup milk in heavy 1 1/2 quart saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to full rolling boil, stirring constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Continue boiling 4 minutes over medium heat, stirring constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat; stir in chocolate pieces until melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 cup (1/2 jar) marshmallow cream and 1/2 tsp. vanilla; beat until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into greased 13 X 9 pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat with remaining ingredients substituting peanut butter for chocolate pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread over chocolate layer, cool at room temperature. Makes 3 lbs. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Ribbon Fantasy Fudge <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> boiling water <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> yeast <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. shortening <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. boiling water <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. cold water <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. yeast <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pour boiling water over shortening, sugar and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend and let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Add egg. <NEXT_INSTR> Add yeast to cold water for 5 minutes; add to above. <NEXT_INSTR> Add flour and mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate 4 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> About 3 hours before needed, roll dough on floured board and cut. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on pans or muffin tins. <NEXT_INSTR> Raise 2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 425° for 12 to 15 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Refrigerator Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> boba tapioca <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 14 cup boba tapioca <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Measure 2 cups of water for every 1/4 cup of boba being prepared into a saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring the water to a boil over high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the boba and stir gently until they begin floating to the top of the water. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn the heat to medium and cook the boba for 12 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the pan from heat, cover, and let the pearls sit for another 12 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> While the boba are cooking, make a simple sugar syrup to sweeten and preserve them once cooked. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring 1/2 cup of water to a boil over high heat on the stove or in the microwave. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat and stir in 1/2 cup sugar until dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside to cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Once the boba have finished cooking, drain them from the water and transfer them to a small bowl or container. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the sugar syrup over top until the boba are submerged. <NEXT_INSTR> Let sit until the boba are room temperature, at least 15 minutes, or refrigerate until ready to use. <NEXT_INSTR> Boba are best if used within a few hours of cooking, but will keep refrigerated for several days. <NEXT_INSTR> The boba will gradually harden and become crunchy as they sit. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Long-Lasting Chewy Boba for Boba/Bubble Tea <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable broth <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> sweet red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> yellow sweet pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> ground red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 medium potatoes, cubed (2 1/4 cups) <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups vegetable broth or 2 cups chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 small green pepper, chopped (1/2 cup) <NEXT_INGR> 1 small sweet red pepper, chopped (1/2 cup) <NEXT_INGR> 1 small yellow sweet pepper, chopped (1/2 cup) <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, chopped (1/3 cup) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup margarine or 1/4 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a medium saucepan combine potatoes and vegetable or chicken broth. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes or till potatoes are tender-- Do not drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, in a large saucepan cook the green pepper, red pepper, yellow pepper, and onion in hot margarine or butter till tender but not brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in flour, salt, black pepper, and ground red pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Add milk all at once. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook and stir for 1 minutes more. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in undrained potatoes- Heat through. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve, ladle soup into individual bowls. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chunky Potato-Pepper Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hamburger <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> onion soup mix <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> cream of celery soup <NEXT_INPUT> water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 lb. hamburger <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. onion soup mix (dry) <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans cream of celery soup <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix first seven ingredients together, roll by hand into small meatballs and fry in skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> When done, remove balls from skillet and remove excess fat. <NEXT_INSTR> In same skillet, pour in soup and water and heat through. <NEXT_INSTR> Add meatballs and simmer for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve over noodles <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Swedish Meatballs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chickens <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> Stove Top stuffing <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 chickens, cooked and boned <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 can chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 2 pkg. Stove Top stuffing <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put chicken into Pam sprayed 9 x 12-inch pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix soup and broth together. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour half of mixture over chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix stuffing mix with remaining broth and soup. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour on top of chicken mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter; pour on top of stuffing. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 35 to 40 minutes at 350°. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> oleo <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> fresh mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> chicken stock <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 Tbsp. oleo or butter <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped fresh mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. chicken stock <NEXT_INGR> 3 tsp. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 to 3/4 c. chopped toasted almonds <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Add mushrooms and onion; saute. <NEXT_INSTR> Add flour; blend well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add salt, pepper and chicken stock; cook until smooth and thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Add lemon juice and almonds. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve over baked chicken loaf. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Almond Mushroom Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> white vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> radish <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pork loin <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> ground pork <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> cucumber <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> jalapeno <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup distilled white vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup julienned carrot <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup julienned daikon radish <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> 12 lb boneless pork loin <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon finely chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb ground pork <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 8 (10 inch) French baguettes, split lengthwise <NEXT_INGR> mayonnaise, as needed <NEXT_INGR> soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup fresh cilantro, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 14 medium English cucumber, cut in diagonal slices <NEXT_INGR> fresh ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 jalapeno, sliced (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> To make the slaw: In a pot, add water, sugar & vinegar; bring to boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the vinegar mixture in a large boil & set aside to cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Once cooled, added the carrots & daikon. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside in the refrigerator for 30 minutes or overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> To make the filling: In a large pot, place pork loin & cover with water. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to boil over medium heat; simmer until cooked thorough, about 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> While the pork is cooking, in a large skillet, add oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Once the oil is heated add the ground pork, onions, garlic powder, black pepper & soy sauce.Cook for about 2 to 3 minutes or unil pork is cook through. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the stove & cover with a lid or foil to keep warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Once the pork loin is thoroughly cooked, place on a cutting board & cut into 1/4-1/2 inches thick slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with foil once all cut. <NEXT_INSTR> To make sandwiches: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread mayonnaise on baguettes. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on cookie sheet & place in oven for 5 minutes until the crust is hot & crispy. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the oven & make the sandwiches immediately in this order (it can get messy here):. <NEXT_INSTR> 2 pork loin slices. <NEXT_INSTR> spoonful ground pork. <NEXT_INSTR> drizzle with soy sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> 2-3 slices english cucumber. <NEXT_INSTR> 2-3 slices jalapeno. <NEXT_INSTR> cliantro. <NEXT_INSTR> slaw (you can also no add it to the sandwich & serve on the side- I prefer in the sandwich! <NEXT_INSTR> ). <NEXT_INSTR> black pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Close sandwich & you can either wrap in plastic wrap & store in the refrigerator or eat immediately. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Banh Mi (Vietnamese Subs) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> brown rice <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> ground coriander <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> frozen mixed vegetables <NEXT_INPUT> black beans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup brown rice <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> water (or broth, see directions for how much to use) <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup frozen mixed vegetables (the kind with peas, corn, carrots, greenbeans) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pour the can of tomato sauce into a liquid measuring cup. Add enough water or broth to reach a minimum of 2 CUPS if you're just making the rice and nothing else-- more like 2 1/2 cups total if you're cooking it with both the frozen veggies and beans. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the mixture into a heavy-bottom saucepan and add a dash or two of salt. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to medium. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in the olive oil and spices until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the rice and make sure it's covered in the liquid, then loosely cover the saucepan and let simmer for 35-40 minutes or until the rice has softened. There should be plenty of liquid in the pot for the mixed veggies and beans to absorb too, unless you're making just the rice by itself then nearly all the tomato-water mixture should've absorbed by now. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the pot from the heat element and onto a trivet/potholder. Add rinsed and drained beans and the frozen mixed veggies to the pot, and mix well. Cover fully and let sit for about 10 minutes so they can absorb all the liquid and defrost via all the steam. <NEXT_INSTR> Fluff with a fork and serve. Makes a great burrito and enchilada filling as well as a side dish! Although with some extra greens and cheese, it's often a one-dish meal for me. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Super Simple Vegan Spanish Rice & Beans <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> artichokes <NEXT_INPUT> lemons <NEXT_INPUT> Olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 whole globe artichokes <NEXT_INGR> 2 lemons, cut in half <NEXT_INGR> Olive oil for frying <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Prepare the artichokes by first peeling off the outer leaves that are tough and hard, beginning from the base, removing the leaves until you see they become more tender. Once you've done this, with a small, sharp knife, begin trimming the top points of the artichoke's remaining leaves, again working from the base up. When you reach halfway or so, cut the top half (or third, depending on how tender the artichokes are) of the artichoke completely off. Rub the artichokes all over with half a lemon. <NEXT_INSTR> Now trim the stem; chop the bottom off, leaving about 2 to 3 inches of stem and then trim it, peeling away the outer layer of the stem and the bottom of the artichoke so you have just the tender inner part of the stem attached. Place the artichokes in a bowl with the juice of 1 lemon until they are ready for frying. Drain completely and pat dry with kitchen paper before frying. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat about 3 inches of olive oil in a saucepan over low-medium heat and fry the artichokes gently (if you have a candy thermometer, this should be about 300° F or 150° C) for about 10 minutes, prodding them with a fork every now and then, letting them roll around to cook thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove and drain the artichokes on paper towels. When cool enough to handle (you can also pop them into the freezer for a couple minutes to do this quickly), help open up the artichoke carefully by teasing some of the leaves out and flattening the artichoke a little. <NEXT_INSTR> Turning the heat up higher (this time about 350°F or 180°C), deep fry the artichokes, head down (tongs are handy for this) for a couple of minutes or until crisp and a deep, deep golden brown. Drain on paper towels then serve while still hot, sprinkled with sea salt and some pepper. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Carciofi Alla Giudia – Roman Jewish-Style Artichokes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bittersweet chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> instant espresso <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> Kahlua <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolk <NEXT_INPUT> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> cream of tartar <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 ounces bittersweet chocolate, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon instant espresso, dissolved in <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons water <NEXT_INGR> 2 2 tablespoons Kahlua or 2 tablespoons Grand Marnier <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg yolk <NEXT_INGR> 2 large egg whites, room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash cream of tartar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup heavy cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> NOTE: The flavor of this mousse depends entirely on the chocolate you use. <NEXT_INSTR> Please use the highest quality chocolate you can. <NEXT_INSTR> DO NOT use Bakers chocolate. <NEXT_INSTR> Do not use chocolate chips. <NEXT_INSTR> I like Callabeut, but Sharffenberger, Valhrona, Giardelli-- all are options. <NEXT_INSTR> DIRECTIONS: melt the chocolate, espresso, and rum in the microwave on 50% power for about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk in the yolk and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a little dash of vinegar and a paper towel, wipe down the insides of the bowl of your mixer, and the whipping attachment. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the whites and whip until soft peaks form. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle in the sugar, beating on high until stiff, but not dry. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold a quarter of the whites into the chocolate to lighten it, then scrape the remaining whites on top of the chocolate and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the cream until it holds its shape (not too stiff) then scrape on top of the whites. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold everything together gently until no streaks of white appear. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn the mousse into your prepared mold, into pretty cups, into custard cups, or whatever you are serving it in and refrigerate until service, at least 2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Or just refrigerate in the bowl until needed as a filling for cakes or cream puffs, etc. <NEXT_INSTR> Note: This mousse is very rich and decadent, and it's my favorite because it holds it shape nicely when refrigerated. <NEXT_INSTR> This allows it to be formed into molds and terrines and be sliced or cut. <NEXT_INSTR> It is also a great spreading consistency, and my favorite thing to do with this mousse is use it as a filling for cakes. <NEXT_INSTR> I also like to fold more whipped cream into it (50% mousse, 50% whipped cream) and use it as a filling for eclairs, cream puffs and profiteroles. <NEXT_INSTR> The uses for this mousse are endless. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Velvet Mousse <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> lean ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> flour tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> guacamole <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 oz Fresh Crimini Mushrooms - 250 mg <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb lean ground beef - 250g <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp canola oil - 15 mL <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp Tex-Mex Seasoning Blend - 30 mL <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkt Mushroom seasoning blend -5 g <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup reduced sodium refried beans - 250 mL <NEXT_INGR> 4 large flour tortillas - 4 <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup cooked Spanish rice - 250 mL <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups shredded lettuce - 500 mL <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup salsa - 125 mL <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup guacamole (optional) 125 mL <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup fat free sour cream (optional) 125 mL <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup shredded part skim Cheddar cheese - 180 mL <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place the mushrooms in a food processor fitted with a metal blade. Pulse until finely chopped. Add the ground beef; pulse until well combined. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the oil in a large, nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms, Tex-Mex seasoning and mushroom seasoning. Cook for 10 minutes until mushroom mixture is browned. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Spread the refried beans over each tortilla. Spoon in rice, and top with the mushroom mixture, lettuce, salsa and optional guacamole and sour cream. Sprinkle with cheese, and roll up burritos. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Coat a hot nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Place the burritos, seam side down, and toast on both sides for 3 to 4 minutes until heated through. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Tip: Many brands carry Spanish-style rice that can be prepared in the microwave for a quick dinner. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Beefy Burritos  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> croutons <NEXT_INPUT> pasta sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (10 1/4 ounce) can pillsbury grands refrigerated southern style biscuits (5 biscuits) or (10 1/4 ounce) can refrigerated buttermilk biscuits (5 biscuits) <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/3 ounces shredded monterey jack cheese (1/3 cup) or 1 1/3 ounces cheddar cheese (1/3 cup) <NEXT_INGR> 10 refrigerated or frozen cooked meatballs, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup finely crushed seasoned croutons <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups pasta sauce, heated <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 375°F. <NEXT_INSTR> Line cookie sheet with parchment paper or spray with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Separate dough into 5 biscuits. <NEXT_INSTR> Split each biscuit to make 10 rounds. <NEXT_INSTR> Press out each biscuit half to form 3-inch round. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle each biscuit round with cheese to within 1/2 inch of edge. <NEXT_INSTR> Top each with meatball. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring sides of dough over meatball; pinch edges to seal. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush rounded tops and sides of dough with butter; coat with croutons. <NEXT_INSTR> Place seam side down on paper-lined cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375°F for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Place appetizer pick in each biscuit-wrapped meatball to form biscuit ball. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with warm pasta sauce for dipping. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Biscuit Balls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> red potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> sweet yellow pepper <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> fresh asparagus <NEXT_INPUT> mango salsa <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups chopped red potatoes (2-3 medium) <NEXT_INGR> 1 small sweet yellow pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped red onion <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cups cut fresh asparagus (1-inch pieces) <NEXT_INGR> 12 ounces frozen grilled chicken breast strips, partially thawed (about 2 cups) <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cups mango salsa, divided <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro <NEXT_INGR> Additional cilantro <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat; saute potatoes, pepper and onion until potatoes are lightly browned, 6-8 minutes. Serve with remaining salsa. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mango Salsa Chicken With Veggie Hash <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pastry <NEXT_INPUT> apple cider <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cooking apples <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> pastry for double crust 9-inch pie <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. apple cider <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 6 1/2 c. peeled, sliced Stayman, Winesap or cooking apples <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. water <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Line a 9-inch pie plate with half of pastry; lay aside. Combine cider and sugar in a large saucepan; bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Add apples; cook, uncovered, 8 minutes or until apples are tender. Drain, reserving syrup. <NEXT_INSTR> Add enough water to syrup to measure 1 1/3 cups liquid; return syrup mixture and apples to saucepan. Combine cornstarch and 2 tablespoons water, stirring well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to apple mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in cinnamon. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon mixture into pastry-lined pie plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with top crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375° for 45 to 50 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Apple Cider Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> dish pie shell <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 sticks butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 c. chocolate chips <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped pecans <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. shredded coconut <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 baked 9-inch deep dish pie shell <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Micro butter and chips in a 2-quart glass bowl for 1 1/2 minutes on High. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in pecans, coconut and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in eggs. Pour filling into pastry shell. <NEXT_INSTR> Micro on Medium (50) for 4 minutes, then on Medium-high (80) for 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Rotate dish 1/2 turn at 2 minute intervals (if using any microwave other than a carousel). <NEXT_INSTR> Stir once after 4 minutes and again at the end. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fudge Nut Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> Creole seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> okra <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> beer <NEXT_INPUT> Canola oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup self-rising yellow cornmeal mix <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup self-rising flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup medium-size raw shrimp, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Creole seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup frozen diced onion, red and green bell pepper, and celery, thawed* <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup frozen cut okra, thawed and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg, lightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup beer <NEXT_INGR> Canola oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Stir together cornmeal mix and flour in large bowl until combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle shrimp with Creole seasoning. Add shrimp, onion mixture, and okra to cornmeal mixture. Stir in egg and beer just until moistened. Let stand 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour oil to depth of 4 inches into a Dutch oven; heat to 350°. Drop batter by level tablespoonfuls into hot oil, and fry, in batches, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Drain on a wire rack over paper towels; serve immediately. <NEXT_INSTR> Note: Keep fried hush puppies warm in a 225° oven for up to 15 minutes. For testing purposes only, we used McKenzie's Seasoning Blend for diced onion, red and green bell pepper, and celery. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shrimp-And-Okra Hush Puppies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> egg <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 3/4 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped walnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. honey <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 c. ripe, mashed bananas <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. skim milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg white, stiffly beaten <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sift together dry ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Add walnuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine bananas, lemon juice, honey and milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Add flour mixture, a little at a time, beating well after each addition. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in stiffly beaten egg white. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into lightly oiled baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in preheated oven at 325° or until done. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Honey Banana Bread(Negligible Cholesterol)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shell macaroni <NEXT_INPUT> bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <NEXT_INPUT> cucumber <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> Italian dressing <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 box small shell macaroni <NEXT_INGR> 1 bell pepper, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tomato, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 cucumber, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 carrot, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 bunch green onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> Italian dressing <NEXT_INGR> Mrs. Dash <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook macaroni and drain. <NEXT_INSTR> In salad bowl, add macaroni, pepper, tomato, cucumber, carrot and green onions. <NEXT_INSTR> Add Mrs. Dash. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Thirty minutes before serving, pour small bottle of Italian dressing over salad and mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Best chilled. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pasta Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 medium bananas, mashed with a fork <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup (125 ml) oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs (or 3 egg whites) <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cups (350 ml) sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cups (350 ml) flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp (5 ml). baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp (1 ml). salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp (5 ml). vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup (125 ml) walnuts, chopped <NEXT_INGR> (walnuts for garnish - optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees (175 C.). <NEXT_INSTR> Grease loaf pan, or spray with Pam. <NEXT_INSTR> Put all ingredients into a large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine by hand (but don't over mix) until all dry ingredients are moistened. <NEXT_INSTR> Mixture will appear lumpy, but avoid urge to continue mixing. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into your loaf pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn out on a rack and cool before slicing. <NEXT_INSTR> Before putting pan in oven, I like to add a handful more nuts down center for garnish. <NEXT_INSTR> **Note: If you are baking both loaves at the same time, your cooking time will take about 15 minutes longer. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Bread by Tammye Jo - Banana Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> sweet milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 c. self-rising flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sweet milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix together and roll out on a lightly floured surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut with biscuit cutter and cook at 400° until light brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Good Biscuits <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cake mix <NEXT_INPUT> pumpkin <NEXT_INPUT> MIRACLE WHIP Dressing Family <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> powdered sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. (2-layer size) spice cake mix <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (15 oz.) pumpkin <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup MIRACLE WHIP Dressing Family Dollar $3.50 thru 02/07 <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. (8 oz.) PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. (16 oz.) powdered sugar (about 4 cups) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 350F. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat first 4 ingredients in large bowl with mixer until well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into 13x9-inch pan sprayed with cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 32 to 35 min. <NEXT_INSTR> or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool completely in pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat cream cheese, butter, milk and vanilla in large bowl with mixer until well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add sugar, beating after each addition until well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread over cooled cake. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pumpkin Spice Frosted Snack Bars <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> pine nuts <NEXT_INPUT> Pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more as needed <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt, plus more as needed <NEXT_INGR> 2 whole eggs <NEXT_INGR> 3 egg yolks <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups loosely packed basil leaves, rinsed and dried <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 clove garlic, peeled, or more to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil, or more as desired <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup pine nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup grated Parmesan, plus more for garnish <NEXT_INGR> Pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pulse flour and salt in a food processor once or twice. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the eggs and yolks, and turn the machine on. <NEXT_INSTR> Process just until a ball begins to form, about 30 seconds. <NEXT_INSTR> Add a few drops of water if the dough is dry and grainy; add a tablespoon of flour if the dough sticks to the side of the bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn the dough out of the food processor, sprinkle it with a little flour, cover it with plastic or a cloth, and let it rest for about 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> (At this point, you may refrigerate the dough, wrapped in plastic, until youre ready to roll it out, for up to 24 hours.) <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, in a food processor or blender, combine the basil with a pinch of salt, the garlic and about half the oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Process, stopping to scrape down the sides of the container if necessary, and adding the rest of the oil gradually. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the nuts and cheese, and pulse a few times. <NEXT_INSTR> The pesto should be well combined but still chunky. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring a large pot of water to a boil and salt it. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide the dough in half. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn one half of the dough onto a lightly floured surface and roll it into a large rectangle no thicker than 1/4 inch and ideally closer to 1/8 inch, adding additional flour sparingly as necessary. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat with the rest of the dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut into squares no larger than 4 inches across. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop the squares into the water and cook until tender, 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain, reserving a little of the cooking water. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss the handkerchiefs with the pesto, some salt and pepper, and a spoonful of cooking water, if necessary, to thin the pesto. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately, garnished with Parmesan. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fazzoletti (Pasta Handkerchiefs) With Chunky Pesto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground cloves <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> fruit <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup sugar (white or brown) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil (mashed banana, or applesauce) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons honey <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/3 cups all-purpose flour (up to 1 cup can be replaced with whole wheat for a denser loaf) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups fruit (pulp from juicing) or 1 1/2 cups vegetables (pulp from juicing) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350. Grease a loaf pan or small cake pan; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium bowl, whisk together the sugar, milk, egg, oil (or banana or applesauce), honey, vanilla (or other) extract), cinnamon, and cloves. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the milk mixture, then the pulp from juicing. Stir with a wooden spoon until combined, but do not overmix. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Remove the bread from the pan and cool on a wire rack or cut your cake into pieces. The cake is especially nice with cream cheese frosting! Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Juicer Pulp Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> meal mix <NEXT_INPUT> cooking oil <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> yellow creamed corn <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> peppers <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/4 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. self-rising corn meal mix <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. cooking oil or bacon grease <NEXT_INGR> 3 tsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 large onion, grated <NEXT_INGR> 1 (No. 2) can yellow creamed corn <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. grated Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 4 jalapeno peppers, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix well in a large mixing bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> I bake mine in one 9 x 13-inch Pyrex dish and a 9-inch skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 450° for about 30 to 40 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Aunt Velma'S Mexican Corn Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> celery <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> tuna <NEXT_INPUT> cashews <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> mein noodles <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 c. chopped celery <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 can tuna, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. cashews (optional) <NEXT_INGR> pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 (3 oz.) can chow mein noodles <NEXT_INGR> salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place celery, onion and butter in 1-quart casserole. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat in microwave on full power for 3 minutes or until celery and onion are tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in remaining ingredients using only 1 cup of chow mein noodles. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper, as desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with remaining chow mein noodles. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook in microwave on full power for 6 to 7 minutes or until heated through and temperature of 150° is reached. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tuna Oriental <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> chives <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> tarragon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. red wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. chives (or ends of green onions) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. basil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. tarragon <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all ingredients and whip with a fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 1 1/2 cups. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Vinaigrette Dressing <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> rolled oats <NEXT_INPUT> pumpkin seeds <NEXT_INPUT> germ <NEXT_INPUT> flax seeds <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> coconut oil <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <NEXT_INPUT> flaked coconut <NEXT_INPUT> mango apricot <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 cups rolled oats not quick cooking <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup pumpkin seeds shelled Sunflower or shelled <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup wheat germ <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup flax seeds <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup honey <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup coconut oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon kosher salt or sea salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups slivered almonds <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup raisins or dried cranberries <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup flaked coconut <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup dried mango apricot, pineapple or papaya into bite sized pieces <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 250 degrees
Total baking time 60 - 65 minutes <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl mix together the all the dry ingredients (not the fruit, nuts or coconut) <NEXT_INSTR> Spread this mix on 2 cookie sheets either lightly oil sheets or use parchment paper.
Bake 20 minutes <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in 2 cups of almond slivers.
Bake another 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir again.
Raise oven to 300 degrees for the final 20-25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> In the large bowl mix together:

 1 cup raisins or dried cranberries
 1 cup flaked coconut
 3/4 cup dried mango, apricot, pineapple or papaya into bite sized pieces <NEXT_INSTR> After baking oat mixture, scoop the granola off the sheet pans into the large bowl with the dried fruits. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well and cool thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Store in airtight containers up to 3 weeks. Serve with milk, over ice cream, with yogurt or however you love to eat your granola. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Super Easy Healthy Granola <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beef <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> apple <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> curry <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> mincemeat <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 lb beef, cut in strips <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup celery, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 apple, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon curry <NEXT_INGR> 34 teaspoon dry mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 2 12 cups chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons mincemeat <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt butter in a saucepan and add chopped onion, chopped garlic clove, chopped celery, and chopped apple. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook, stirring often, for about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> In a mixing bowl blend together flour, curry, and dry mustard; sprinkle over the vegetables, stirring well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add bay leaf. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in chicken broth, stirring rapidly with a whisk. <NEXT_INSTR> When the mixture has thickened, simmer for 15 minutes; stirring often to prevent sticking. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the chopped meat, milk, and mincemeat; simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Meat Curry <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> graham crackers <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 pt. heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 6 Tbsp. cocoa <NEXT_INGR> dash of salt <NEXT_INGR> 6 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 25 whole graham crackers (any flavor) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Beat cream, cocoa, salt and sugar until very thick and spreadable. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread about 1/4 on each graham cracker, standing each up on the long edge in front of the last one frosted, to form a continuous straight row. <NEXT_INSTR> Frost all sides and tops. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate overnight. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Frosted Graham Loaf <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> sweet milk <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 whole chicken or 4 breasts (reserve broth) <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sweet milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. self-rising flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook chicken until tender; bone chicken and tear into bite size pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Put into large baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt margarine. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sweet milk, pepper, salt and margarine to broth; bring to a boil. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> oil <NEXT_INPUT> peaches <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> pistachios <NEXT_INPUT> DRESSING <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> white balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> grain mustard <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tbsp oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 small peaches, pitted and halved <NEXT_INGR> 7 oz thickly sliced ham <NEXT_INGR> 2 heads baby Romaine lettuce, washed and leaves separated <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup shelled pistachios, toasted and chopped <NEXT_INGR> None None FOR THE DRESSING <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp white balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp honey <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp coarse grain mustard <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brush a grill pan with oil and heat on high.
