When cool enough to handle, tear into bite-size pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange the lettuce leaves, peaches and ham on serving plates and sprinkle with the pistachios. Whisk the dressing ingredients and season to taste. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Grilled Ham And Peach Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> baking paper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup finely grated parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 pieces baking paper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 200°C (400F). <NEXT_INSTR> Draw 5cm circles (2 inch) on the back of your baking paper as a guide to make your wafers. Use a good quality paper. <NEXT_INSTR> Line 2 baking trays with the paper. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle parmesan cheese over the circles to form the wafers. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 8- 10 minutes or until crisp and golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Allow to cool and set on the trays. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Parmesan Wafers- Quick And Simple <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Cookies <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> maraschino cherry juice <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> cherries <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> Topper <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallows <NEXT_INPUT> Buttercream Frosting <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> confectioners <NEXT_INPUT> Topper <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Cookies <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup brown sugar, firmly packed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup shortening <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup maraschino cherry juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 ounces unsweetened chocolate, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup cherries, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup walnuts, chopped <NEXT_INGR> Topper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 large marshmallows (for each cookie) <NEXT_INGR> Buttercream Frosting <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup cocoa <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup margarine <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> confectioners' sugar <NEXT_INGR> Topper <NEXT_INGR> 1 walnuts, piece (for each cookie) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350. <NEXT_INSTR> Cookies:. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together flour, baking soda, and salt, set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> With your mixer, mix brown sugar and shortening. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend in egg. Beat well, then stir in 1/2 of the dry ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Add Marachino juice and milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the rest of dry ingredients, and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend in melted unsweetened chocolate (you can use the kind that are already melted, or substitute 6 T. of cocoa and 2 T. oil), chopped cherries, and chopped walnuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop by spoonfuls on an ungreased cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 12-15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> While cookies are baking cut large marshmallows in half. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the cut side of the marshmallow down on hot cookies when they come out of the oven, so they will stick. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Frost cookies, then and put a nut on top. <NEXT_INSTR> Buttercream Chocolate Frosting: <NEXT_INSTR> Beat cocoa, margarine, milk and vanilla well. Add in confectionary sugar to desired consistency. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Sundae Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> honey <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry relish juice <NEXT_INPUT> ginger ale <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 honey whiskey <NEXT_INGR> 2 cranberry relish juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 ginger ale <NEXT_INGR> 1 ice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix cranberry relish juice, whiskey and ice in shaker. <NEXT_INSTR> Shake shake shake! <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into wine glass top off with ginger ale. <NEXT_INSTR> ENJOY! <NEXT_INSTR> Please see my cranberry relish recipe for the cranberry relish juice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sparkling Cranberry Cocktail <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> espresso powder <NEXT_INPUT> bittersweet chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 7/8 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon espresso powder <NEXT_INGR> 14 1/2 ounces bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped divided <NEXT_INGR> 5 ounces semisweet chocolate, chopped divided <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> IN A SMALL saucepan, combine cream and espresso powder, whisking well. Bring to a simmer over low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> IN A MEDIUM combine 8 1/2 ounces bittersweet chocolate and 2 ounces semi-sweet. Pour hot cream over chocolate, stirring until melted.Let chocolate cool. <NEXT_INSTR> WHEN CHOCOLATE is cool but not set whip with wooden spoon until lighter in texture and color. <NEXT_INSTR> ROLL tablespoonfuls of chocolate mixture between your palms to form balls Place on parchment paper and refrigerate to harden. <NEXT_INSTR> IN A SMALL MICROWAVEABLE BOWL combine remaining 6 ounces of bittersweet and 3 ounces semi-sweet chocolate. Melt in a microwave on medium for 30 second intervals until melted. Stir well. <NEXT_INSTR> DIP hardened chocolate pieces in melted chocolate, covering well. Place on parchment paper. When chocolate coating begins to set dust with cocoa powder and sprinkle sugar on top. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Espresso Truffles <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> turkey breast barbecued <NEXT_INPUT> salsa <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> olives <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound turkey breast barbecued <NEXT_INGR> 1 x salsa <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup cheddar cheese shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup olives ripe, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 x parsley leaves fresh <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cut turkey into eight 3/4 inch slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Place turkey in large skillet, overlapping slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Add salsa. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil, turn down heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add cheese and olives. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat one minute more until cheese melts. <NEXT_INSTR> Place turkey on serving platter. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with sour cream and parsley. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Turkey Mexican <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> frozen broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> grated cheese <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> oleo <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> crackers <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 pkg. frozen broccoli, cook and drain <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, well beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. grated cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick oleo <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> Ritz crackers <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend all ingredients and fold in broccoli. <NEXT_INSTR> Place cracker crumbs on top. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 325° for 30 or 40 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Broccoli Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chopped prune <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup chopped prune <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lemon, zest of, finely grated <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine ingredients in small saucepan. Cook over low heat until prunes are very soft. Puree with stick blender. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Prune Filling For Hamentashen <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Vanilla Butternut <NEXT_INPUT> Milk <NEXT_INPUT> Flour <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Powdered Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> Milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 sticks Butter, Softened <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 5 Large Eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons Vanilla Butternut Flavoring (or 1 Teaspoon Each Vanilla And Butternut) <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (5 Oz. Size) Evaporated Milk <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups Cake Flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoons Baking Powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Salt <NEXT_INGR> FOR THE GLAZE (optional): <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Powdered Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tablespoons Milk (or As Needed) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Do not preheat oven. Prepare a 10-inch tube or bundt pan for baking by spreading a thin layer of shortening or butter all over the inside of the pan. Sprinkle flour in the pan and shake until the entire surface is dusted with flour. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large mixing bowl, cream together butter and sugar until fluffy. This usually takes about a minute using a stand mixer. Add eggs one at a time, mixing after each addition. Add flavorings. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour evaporated milk into a measuring cup and add enough water to make 1 cup (8 ounces). <NEXT_INSTR> In a smaller bowl, mix together dry ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt. Add flour mixture to the butter mixture a little at a time, alternating with the milk until all has been incorporated and thoroughly combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour batter into prepared pan. Put pan in a cold oven. Do not preheat. Set oven temperature to 325°F and bake for 1 1/2 hours or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool slightly in the pan on a wire rack, about 5 minutes. After the pan has cooled slightly, put a wire rack over the cake and turn the pan upside down. The cake will come out of the pan and onto the rack. <NEXT_INSTR> While the cake is cooling, prepare the glaze if using (optional). Mix together powdered sugar, vanilla, and 1 tablespoon of milk at a time, until desired consistency, usually 3 tablespoons. Drizzle over cake while still a little warm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Butternut Pound Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. cocoa <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. cold water <NEXT_INGR> nuts, if desired <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sift together first five ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> (Nuts optional). <NEXT_INSTR> Grease 8 inch tin. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 30-35 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Wacky Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bread <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> cucumber <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Bavarian smoked ham <NEXT_INPUT> pickles <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 loaf French bread <NEXT_INGR> 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 to 2 bunches green onions, cleaned and chopped (green part only) <NEXT_INGR> 1 seedless cucumber, grated and squeezed to remove excess liquid <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> 5 eggs, hard-boiled and cut into fourths lengthwise <NEXT_INGR> 2 large tomatoes, cleaned without skin and cut in long cubes <NEXT_INGR> 2 (1/4 to 1/2-inch thick) slices Bavarian smoked ham, edges removed and cut into long strips (or equivalent) <NEXT_INGR> 6 to 8 pickles, peeled and cut in long slices (prefer Vlasic deli dills) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix together cream cheese, green onions and grated cucumbers and salt well. <NEXT_INSTR> Consistency should be that of easily spreadable cream cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Stuffed Bread(Ham, Pickle, Egg, Tomato)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> ground cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> skinless <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/3 cup butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup honey <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup Dijon-style prepared mustard <NEXT_INGR> 4 teaspoons curry powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch ground cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a medium bowl combine the melted butter/margarine, honey, mustard, curry powder and cayenne powder. Mix well. Place chicken breasts in a 9x13 inch baking dish and pour honey/mustard mixture over chicken. Cover and place in refrigerator. Marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove dish from refrigerator and bake, covered, in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove cover and bake about 10 minutes more, or until done and juices run clear (baking time will depend a little on how thick your chicken breasts are). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Curried Honey Mustard Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> garlic powder <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> Deluxe <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 small boneless skinless chicken breasts (1 lb./450 g) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. oil <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. (350 g) Kraft Deluxe Velveeta on Shells Pasta & Sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 large tomato, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sprinkle both sides of chicken breasts with garlic powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat oil in non-stick skillet on medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken; cook 1 to 2 min. <NEXT_INSTR> on each side or until browned on both sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from pan; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water to pan; bring to boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in Pasta; top with chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover; simmer on medium-low heat 12 min. <NEXT_INSTR> or until pasta is tender and chicken is done (165 degrees F). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove chicken to plate; cover to keep warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in tomatoes and Cheese Sauce; cook 2 to 3 min. <NEXT_INSTR> or until heated through, stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with chicken. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cheesy Garlic Chicken and Shells <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pork chops <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> chile ground <NEXT_INPUT> coarse salt <NEXT_INPUT> Orange large <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> honey <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 porterhouse (bone-in loin) pork chops about 3/4-inch thick <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons chipotle chile ground <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons coarse salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 Orange large <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons garlic minced <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup honey <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a small bowl, stir oil, ground chipotle, salt, orange zest and garlic together into a paste. Using a rubber spatula, spread chipotle mixture over both sides of pork. Let stand for 15 to 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare a medium-hot fire in grill. Place chops on grill and close lid. Grill over direct heat, turning once, about 4-5 minutes per side, until the internal temperature of the pork on a meat thermometer measures between 145 degrees F. (medium rare) and 160 degrees F. (medium). During the last 2 minutes, brush chops on both sides with honey. Remove from grill and let rest for 3 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> “Sweet Fire” Porterhouse Pork Chops <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> cooking barley <NEXT_INPUT> oleo <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 lb. mushrooms, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium size carrot, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. quick cooking barley <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. oleo, cut up <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In 2-quart casserole, mix all ingredients. Cover. Bake at 350° approximately 1 hour or until liquid is absorbed. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir occasionally. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Baked Barley And Mushrooms <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> rolled oats <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. rolled oats <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. pecans, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. cocoa <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large saucepan, bring sugar, butter, milk and cocoa to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat and add vanilla; stir for a few minutes to cool slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Add oats and pecans. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop mixture by tablespoon onto cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool and harden. <NEXT_INSTR> Each cookie contains 115 calories, 34% from fat. <NEXT_INSTR> Yields 30 large cookies. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> No Bake Oatmeal Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> semi-sweet chocolate bits <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 lb butter or 12 lb margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups sifted flour <NEXT_INGR> 6 ounces semi-sweet chocolate bits <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup finely chopped walnuts <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 375F. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine butter or margarine, salt & vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend well. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually beat in sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Take off the beaters and add flour and chocolate bits by hand. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread evenly in an ungreased 15x11" jelly roll pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with walnuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 30-35 minutes, until golden (not brown). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from oven and cut. <NEXT_INSTR> Allow to cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in covered tin and hide it! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dolores Miller's Toll House Kookie Brittle <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sausage <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Bisquick <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. sausage <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 c. Bisquick <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Grate cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Break sausage into small pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine sausage, cheese and Bisquick. <NEXT_INSTR> Form into bite size balls. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> May be frozen. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sausage Cheese Balls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <NEXT_INPUT> Bailey's Irish Cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pint whipping cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. butter <NEXT_INGR> 12 oz. chocolate chips <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. Bailey's Irish Cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat cream and butter to just boiling point; pour over chocolate chips in glass bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Let sit for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat in Bailey's until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill until firm. <NEXT_INSTR> Quickly roll into 1-inch balls. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll in cocoa powder or unsweetened drinking chocolate, chopped nuts or shredded coconut. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Truffles <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> scallions <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> cracked black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> low-sodium <NEXT_INPUT> peas <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> Crème fraîche <NEXT_INPUT> Pea shoots <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup (1/2 stick) unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 bunch scallions, finely chopped (white and green parts kept separate) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons cracked black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups low-sodium chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16-ounce) package frozen petite peas <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> Creme fraiche, for garnish (optional) <NEXT_INGR> Pea shoots, for garnish (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large soup pot set over medium-high heat, melt 3 tablespoons of the butter. Add the scallion whites, sugar, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring, until just fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the chicken broth and bring to a simmer, scraping up any bits from the bottom of the pot. Add the peas and half of the scallion greens (reserving the rest for garnish). Simmer until the peas are thawed and tender, about 3 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and let cool slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Using an immersion blender, blend the soup until it's semi-smooth but still has some texture. (Alternatively, puree the soup in batches in a standard blender.) <NEXT_INSTR> Return the soup pot to medium-high heat. Add the heavy cream and stir well. Cook until the soup is warmed through, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon butter until melted. Season to taste with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve, ladle the soup into serving bowls and garnish with creme fraiche and pea shoots, if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet Pea Soup From 'Kitchen Confidence' <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> nova <NEXT_INPUT> jumbo shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> water chestnuts <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb sea scallops, nova scotia,large <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb jumbo shrimp, raw and unshelled <NEXT_INGR> 2 lbs bacon, maple flavoured (your personal favourite) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) can pineapple chunks <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) can water chestnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon sea salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon black pepper, freshly ground <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lemon, juiced <NEXT_INGR> toothpick <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Set oven on Broil. <NEXT_INSTR> Wrap bacon slices, (cut if necessary) around the scallops, shrimp, pineapple chunks and water chestnuts fasten with 2 toothpicks. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with sea salt, fresh ground pepper and lemon juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Put under broiler, turning often, until bacon is golden brown and crispy. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately and enjoy! <NEXT_INSTR> Excellant served plain, or with seafood, daquiri or fiery Thai sauces. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mom'S Favourite Seafood  Appetizers <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> chicken breast <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> garbanzo beans <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> pita pockets <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb chicken breast, cut in 1-inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 (16 ounce) cans garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained <NEXT_INGR> 3 green onions, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 red bell pepper <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup parsley, diced <NEXT_INGR> 6 pita pockets <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon sour cream, per pita <NEXT_INGR> salt & freshly ground black pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine cumin and chili powder in a plastic bag. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken and shake to coat. <NEXT_INSTR> 2. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken; cook 5 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink, stirring frequently. <NEXT_INSTR> Take off heat, set aside to cool. <NEXT_INSTR> 3. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine remaining ingredients, mixing well. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Add salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> 4. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut top off pitas to open. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide chicken mixture among the pitas; top with yogurt or sour cream, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 6 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Chicken Pitas <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hamburger <NEXT_INPUT> nacho chips <NEXT_INPUT> beans <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> enchilada sauce <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound hamburger <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. nacho chips <NEXT_INGR> 1 can refried beans <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 ounce.) can enchilada sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 ounce.) can tomato sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown meat and drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Line bottom of casserole dish with chips. <NEXT_INSTR> Put meat on chips. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread refried beans over meat. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle cheese over beans. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour enchilada and tomato sauce over top, making sure which it is spread proportionately. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350 degrees till bubbly, approximately 30 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Tastes good served with lowfat sour cream and corn on the side. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mexican Stuff Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> lemon zest <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 bananas, very ripe <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 tablespoons buttermilk or 1 12 tablespoons sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon lemon zest <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup walnuts, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place bananas, eggs, butter, buttermilk or sour cream, lemon juice, zest and sugar in blender. <NEXT_INSTR> Whirl until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together flour, baking powder, and baking soda. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour banana mixture over flour mixture and stir just until flour is moistened. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in nuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn into greased 9-1/2" x 4-1/2" bread loaf pan or into two 3-1/2" x 7-1/2" nut bread pans. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350 degrees for 55-65 minutes or until bread tests done when skewer is inserted in center. <NEXT_INSTR> Allow to cool for 5 minutes in pan then turn out onto wire rack. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Nut Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chili <NEXT_INPUT> cornbread mix <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb chili (I recomend homemade) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (9 ounce) package Jiffy cornbread mix <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups rice <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350F. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare rice in water. <NEXT_INSTR> While rice is cooking, pour chili into an 8 x 8-inch baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare cornbread as per box instructions. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour mix over chili. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake until cornbread is browned and a toothpick comes out clean from the middle. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve over rice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chili Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> ketchup <NEXT_INPUT> oats <NEXT_INPUT> onion soup mix <NEXT_INPUT> lean ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> additional ketchup <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons 2% low-fat milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon ketchup <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons quick-cooking oats <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon onion soup mix <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb lean ground beef <NEXT_INGR> additional ketchup (for topping) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a bowl, mix milk, ketchup, oats and soup mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold beef into mixture and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Put into a microwave-safe mug or custard cup coated with cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and microwave on high for 3 minutes or until meat is no longer pink and a meat thermometer reads 160°. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain meatloaf and let stand for 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with ketchup if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Meatloaf In A Mug <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Mix <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> grenadine syrup <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> wooden skewers <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkt. Add all ingredients, except the garlic cloves, to a blender or food processor and process until smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Refrigerate <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Green Goddess Salad Dressing  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Crust <NEXT_INPUT> almond flour <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> apricots <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> liqueur <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Topping: <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Crust: <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/3 cups almond flour <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sliced almonds, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> Cheesecake: <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces dried apricots <NEXT_INGR> water to cover <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons amaretto liqueur <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste <NEXT_INGR> 3 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs, at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> Topping: <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 9-inch springform pan with parchment paper. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine almond flour, brown sugar, and almonds in a bowl. Add melted butter; stir with a fork until the mixture resembles wet sand. Spread on the bottom of the parchment-lined pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine apricots and water in a saucepan; bring to a boil and simmer until very soft, about 10 minutes. Drain; mash apricots into a pulp. Add amaretto; mix well. Sweeten with 1 teaspoon white sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat cream cheese, 3/4 cup white sugar, 1/2 cup sour cream, cornstarch, and 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract in a bowl using an electric mixer on low speed. Add eggs one at a time; mix well. Fold in 2 tablespoons of apricot pulp; reserve remainder for topping. Pour cheesecake batter into the pan, covering the crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in the preheated oven until edges are puffed and surface of cheesecake is firm except for a small spot in the center that will jiggle when the pan is gently shaken, about 45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat 1 1/2 cups sour cream, 3 tablespoons white sugar, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract together until combined. Remove cheesecake from the hot oven; spoon topping over the surface and return cake to the oven for 8 minutes more. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool to room temperature, about 1 hour. Refrigerate for 6 to 8 hours. Top with remaining apricot pulp. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Apricot Cheesecake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> italian sausage <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> black olives <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> red wine <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound mild italian sausage -- cut into 1/4" pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion -- chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic -- minced <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup black olives -- sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup red wine <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 cups crushed tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried basil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 pound spaghetti -- cooked as directed <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley -- optional <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In large frying pan, cook the sausages over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 5 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and add the oil to the pan. When oil is hot, add onions and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Return sausages to the pan. Add wine, stirring to scrape up any browned bits. Stir in the olives, tomatoes, basil, oregano, bay leaf and salt. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and let simmer until sauce has thickened slightly, about 15 minutes. Serve over cooked spaghetti, garnished with parsley if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spaghetti With Quick Tomato And Sausage Sauce  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> skinless <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> Swiss cheese <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> condensed cream <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves <NEXT_INGR> 4 slices ham <NEXT_INGR> 4 slices Swiss cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon paprika <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup dry bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon curry powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 sprigs fresh parsley, for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). <NEXT_INSTR> Flatten chicken breasts without breaking through meat. Roll each ham slice in a cheese slice, then roll up in chicken breasts. In a shallow dish or bowl season flour with salt, pepper and paprika. In a separate dish or bowl beat together eggs and milk. Dip chicken rolls in seasoned flour, then egg mixture, then bread crumbs. Heat oil in a large skillet and fry chicken in hot oil until golden brown. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> To Make Sauce: In a large bowl combine the soup, mushrooms, garlic powder, curry powder, wine and sour cream. Mix all together. Place browned chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour sauce mixture over chicken and bake in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley sprigs. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Saucy Chicken Cordon Bleu <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground turmeric <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> peanut oil <NEXT_INPUT> thin bamboo skewer <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 16 large shrimp, peeled (prawns) <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground turmeric <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons peanut oil <NEXT_INGR> thin bamboo skewer <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Dust the shrimps with mixed salt, turmeric and chili powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Bend shrimps into a half circle and thread on skewer through top and tail to keep this shape. <NEXT_INSTR> Put four shrimps on each skewer. <NEXT_INSTR> Shallow fry skewered shrimps until golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Burmese Fried Shrimp <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> turkey cutlets <NEXT_INPUT> shallot <NEXT_INPUT> wild mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> condensed cream <NEXT_INPUT> tarragon <NEXT_INPUT> ground black pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 teaspoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 turkey cutlets <NEXT_INGR> 1 shallot, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 ounce) package assorted sliced wild mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 -19 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add cutlets and cook 3 minutes a side, or until they just lose their pink color throughout; transfer to plate. Do not overcook! <NEXT_INSTR> Add shallot and mushrooms to skillet; cook 5 minutes or until browned and tender. Add wine; boil 1 minute. Stir in undiluted soup, tarragon, pepper, and 1/3 cup water; heat to boiling. Return cutlets with any juices in plate to skillet; heat through, turning to coat. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Turkey Cutlets With Tarragon And Mushroom <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Bake in 375° oven for 1 hour or until golden brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Diablo <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pastry <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> rhubarb <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> pastry (for 9-inch shell) <NEXT_INGR> 2 well beaten eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 4 c. sliced rhubarb <NEXT_INGR> butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine eggs, sugar, flour and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Add rhubarb and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange in pie shell. <NEXT_INSTR> Dot with butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with pastry strips to form a star design. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in very hot oven (450°) for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat to 350° and bake 30 minutes longer. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Rhubarb Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sweet potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable stock <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> baby arugula <NEXT_INPUT> crème fraîche <NEXT_INPUT> fresh chives <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lb sweet potatoes, peeled, cut into small chunks <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups vegetable stock, warmed <NEXT_INGR> 1 None medium onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 14 oz Arborio rice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> 9 oz baby arugula <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup creme fraiche <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp finely chopped fresh chives, plus extra stems, for garnish <NEXT_INGR> None None shaved Parmesan cheese, to serve <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400°F. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil, steam or microwave sweet potatoes until almost tender. Drain. Transfer to a large baking dish and drizzle with 1/2 tbsp oil. Sprinkle with sugar then roast for 30 mins, or until browned and tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat remaining oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring, until soft. Add garlic and rice. Cook, stirring, for 2 mins, or until well combined. Stir in wine and cook, stirring, over low heat until liquid is absorbed. Add 1 cup hot stock and stir continuously until liquid is completely absorbed. Continue adding stock, 1 cup at a time, until rice is tender, about 35 mins. <NEXT_INSTR> Gently fold in arugula, creme fraiche and sweet potatoes. Sprinkle with chives, chive stems and shaved Parmesan. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet Potato Risotto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

(4 serving size) Jell-O vanilla flavor pudding <NEXT_INGR> 1 envelope Dream Whip topping mix <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all ingredients in large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat at low speed to moisten. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat at medium speed for 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into 2 greased and floured 9-inch layer pans. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 40 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dream Pudding Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> Brown Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> Vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> Eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Pumpkin Puree <NEXT_INPUT> All-purpose <NEXT_INPUT> Cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> Ground Cloves <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> Maple Cream Cookies <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1-1/2 cup Butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups Dark Brown Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cups Real Maple Syrup <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 4 whole Eggs, Room Temperature <NEXT_INGR> 1 can Pumpkin Puree (15 Oz. Can) <NEXT_INGR> 2-1/2 cups All-purpose Flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoons Nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoons Ground Cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoons Salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 package Maple Cream Cookies, Broken Or Cut Into Pieces (350 Gram Package) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Line a 9x13 baking pan with parchment paper. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large microwave safe bowl melt your butter (this will take about 60 seconds but just keep an eye on it and heat it for 30 seconds at a time until fully melted). Then stir in brown sugar, syrup and vanilla. Let it sit until it comes to room temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, move oven rack to the middle position and preheat oven to 350 F. <NEXT_INSTR> Once butter/sugar mixture has come to room temperature, stir in eggs one at a time. Mix until until combined. Add in pumpkin and mix. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium bowl whisk together flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves and salt. Sprinkle dry mixture over wet mixture and fold it in just until no flour streaks remain. Fold in cookies. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into your prepared pan and even out the top with a spatula. Bake for 30-35 minutes, until a toothpick inserted comes out slightly crummy but not wet. Place pan on a wire rack to cool completely before cutting. <NEXT_INSTR> Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! <NEXT_INSTR> Notes: In Canada Maple Cream Cookies are available pretty much everywhere. In the US they are available at Trader Joe's. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pumpkin Maple Cream Cookie Blondies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> low-fat milk <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> kale <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking potatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 cups low-fat milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 bunch green onions, trimmed and finely sliced <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups finely shredded kale or other leafy greens <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbs. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> Salt and black pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 6 large baking potatoes, peeled and cut into even-size pieces <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook potatoes in boiling salted water until tender, about 25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, combine milk, green onions and kale. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain potatoes and mash thoroughly with butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually beat in milk mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve right away. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Emerald Mashed Potatoes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Place in refrigerator until congealed. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove, slice and serve with whipped cream. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Congealed Cake Dessert <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> food coloring <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> shortening <NEXT_INGR> food coloring <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For a smooth and thin make-up cream, blend one part cornstarch and two parts shortening with food coloring. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Homemade Make-Up <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tuna <NEXT_INPUT> rice noodles <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 -6 ounces ahi tuna steaks <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) package rice noodles <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup low sodium soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 limes, juice and zest <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves of minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons honey <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons of freshly chopped cilantro <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients with the exception of the tuna and the rice noodles in a glass baking dish or other non-reactive container. After mixing, pour the marinade into the dish and then place the tuna steaks in it and coat. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes to an hour, turning the tuna about half way through. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove tuna from fridge and let stand at room temperature for about 20 minutes or so. Remove tuna from marinade, shaking off any excess marinade and dry on paper towels. Reserve the marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring a pot of water to a rolling boil and remove from heat. Completely immerse the rice noodles in the boiling water and cover for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a saute pan or barbecue iron plate over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon of sesame oil. The oil should be hot but not smoking. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the tuna to the hot saute or barbecue plate and shake it a bit to make sure the tuna does not stick. Sear for 30 to 40 seconds on both sides. Remove and cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the marinade over medium heat until steaming. Drain the rice noodles add tuna steak and toss with the warmed marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with additional fresh cilantro and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Seared Ahi Tuna With Sesame Rice Noodles <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shell macaroni <NEXT_INPUT> Italian sausage <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> pizza sauce <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> Mozzarella <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. medium shell macaroni <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. bulk Italian sausage <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped green pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 oz.) can tomatoes, cut up <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 oz.) can pizza sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. thinly sliced zucchini <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. shredded Mozzarella <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook macaroni as package directs; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a skillet cook sausage and green pepper until sausage is browned and pepper is tender; stir occasionally to break sausage into bits. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain. Stir in tomatoes, pizza sauce and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in zucchini. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook 10 minutes or until zucchini is tender. Stir in macaroni. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook uncovered for 5 minutes more. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 5 to 6 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sausage Macaroni Skillet <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> graham cracker crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> Cooking spray <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chilled stick margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg white <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups graham cracker crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> Cooking spray <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 325°. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine first 3 ingredients in a bowl; beat at medium speed of a mixer until blended. Add crumbs and cinnamon; toss with a fork until moistened. Press crumb mixture into a 9-inch pie plate coated with cooking spray. Bake at 325° for 20 minutes or until lightly browned; let cool on a wire rack. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Graham Cracker Crust <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic salt <NEXT_INPUT> frozen broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> Velveeta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> egg noodles <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 6 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 6 chicken bouillon cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 packages chopped frozen broccoli <NEXT_INGR> 6 cups milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb Velveeta cheese, cubed <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces egg noodles <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oil in large pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add onion, saute' 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water and bouillon cubes. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat to boiling, stirring occasionally until cubes are dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Add noodles and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook, uncoverd 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in frozen broccoli and garlic salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn down heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add milk and cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Continue cooking until cheese melts. <NEXT_INSTR> Stirring frequently. <NEXT_INSTR> Do not allow to boil once milk and cheese has been added. <NEXT_INSTR> Can be left on stove on low heat for up to an hour or left on low in a crockpot. <NEXT_INSTR> Is still wonderful reheated. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Broccoli Cheese Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> instant vanilla pudding <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla wafers <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 large boxes instant vanilla pudding <NEXT_INGR> 5 c. whole milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 can Eagle Brand condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 small container Cool Whip <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. vanilla wafers <NEXT_INGR> 1 or 2 bananas <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Using a mixer, mix up vanilla pudding with 5 cups milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in condensed milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Then mix in Cool Whip. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, layer cookies, pudding and bananas. <NEXT_INSTR> Keep layering until pudding is gone. <NEXT_INSTR> Add cookies on top. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Pudding <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Rice Krispies <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 c. Rice Krispies <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. melted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. coconut <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix well and spread half of mixture in 12 x 8-inch cake pan. Spread on 2 quarts vanilla ice cream and top with rest of crumbs. Freeze. <NEXT_INSTR> When ready to serve, spread on 1 can of cherry or strawberry pie filling. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Ice Cream Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> blue cheese <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. lowfat sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce.) pkg. blue cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> Salt & pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients well. <NEXT_INSTR> May be thinned with lowfat milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill several hrs before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Blue Cheese Dressing Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> clam juice <NEXT_INPUT> red potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> marjoram <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup clam juice or 1 cup chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups red potatoes, cubed 1/2-inch <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup corn <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 celery rib, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 large bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon dried marjoram <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup milk, divided <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can clams, undrained <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all ingredients, except milk, clams, cornstarch, salt and pepper in slow cooker. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook on high 4-5 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Discard bay leaf. <NEXT_INSTR> Process chowder in food processor or blender until smooth; return to slow cooker. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in 3/4 cup milk and clams; cover and cook on high for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine remaining milk and cornstarch. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir into chowder. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook 2-3 minutes longer. <NEXT_INSTR> Season to taste with salt and pepper. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> White Clam and Corn Chowder <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> regular oats <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> peaches <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla low-fat <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup regular oats <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup sliced almonds <NEXT_INGR> Dash of salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 2 large egg whites <NEXT_INGR> 6 peaches, peeled, halved, and pitted <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups vanilla low-fat frozen yogurt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400°. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine first 4 ingredients in a medium bowl. Combine vanilla and egg whites in a small bowl; stir with a whisk until foamy. Add egg mixture to oat mixture, stirring until well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon about 1 tablespoon oat mixture into each peach half. Arrange peach halves on a baking sheet. Bake at 400° 13 minutes or until oat mixture is set. Serve with frozen yogurt. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Individual Peach Crisps <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beef broth <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> italian seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> frozen italian <NEXT_INPUT> pasta <NEXT_INPUT> loose pack <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (14 ounce) can beef broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can diced tomatoes with onion and garlic or (14 1/2 ounce) can Italian-style stewed tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon italian seasoning, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces packages frozen italian style cooked meatballs, or your own from the freezer,about 8 <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup small dry pasta, such as ditalini or 1/2 cup orzo pasta (elbows are ok) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup loose pack, frozen mixed vegetables <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon finely shredded parmesan cheese or 1 tablespoon grated parmesan cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Stir together beef broth, undrained tomatoes, the water and Italian seasoning in a large saucepan, bring to boiling. <NEXT_INSTR> Add meatballs, pasta and frozen veggies. <NEXT_INSTR> Return to boiling, reduce heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer covered, about 10 minutes or till pasta and veggies are tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Ladle soup into bowls and sprinkle with cheese. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Italian Meatball Soup - Quick <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Orange pack Duncan <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla instant pudding <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> Orange <NEXT_INPUT> Equal <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> orange rind <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 Orange pack Duncan Hines, supreme cake mix <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 ounces vanilla instant pudding mix pkg. <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 Orange <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Equal <NEXT_INGR> 4 pieces eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon grated orange rind optional <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a small saucepan, bring 4 tablespoons orange juice and 1/3 cup sugar to boil. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Orange Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> natural soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> small to medium white or red potatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. natural soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> salt or cayenne pepper or Italian seasonings to taste or any spice of your choice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Wash and thinly slice the potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix the oil and the soy sauce and whisk until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Using either a pastry brush or a spray bottle, brush or spray the slices on both sides lightly. Lay the slices on a baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Do not overlap. <NEXT_INSTR> Broil at the middle level for 7 minutes or until golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn and broil for 3 to 5 more minutes until golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Broiling time will vary, so watch the chips. <NEXT_INSTR> Dark chips will be bitter. <NEXT_INSTR> Season to taste, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> If made in advance, chips can be reheated in the oven. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Broiled Potato Chips(Low-Fat)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese soup <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> stack-pak Ritz crackers <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 pkg. frozen chopped broccoli <NEXT_INGR> 1 can Cheddar cheese soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 stack-pak Ritz crackers, crushed, but not fine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt butter and stir in crackers; reserve 1/4 of this for topping. <NEXT_INSTR> Precook and thaw broccoli in microwave (in boxes with ends open, 4 minutes each box). <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together broccoli, soup and cracker/butter mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Put remaining crackers on top. <NEXT_INSTR> Microwave 5 minutes on High. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Microwave Broccoli-Cheese Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> powdered milk <NEXT_INPUT> warm water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/8 cups powdered milk (Better Than Milk Soy Powder) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup warm water (filtered) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup sugar (raw cane) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add the milk powder and warm water together in the top of a double boiler. Stir well to incorporate. <NEXT_INSTR> Once the water in the bottom of the double boiler is gently boiling add the sugar and stir for a few minutes to make sure it is dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Put in a dish and cool. This milk substitute can be used in any recipe that calls for condensed milk. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Vegan Substitute For Sweetened Condensed Milk <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> White Onion <NEXT_INPUT> Carrots <NEXT_INPUT> Celery <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Bay Leaf <NEXT_INPUT> Tomato Puree <NEXT_INPUT> Thyme <NEXT_INPUT> Beef <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 500g Rump or Stew Beef (Cut into small chunks) <NEXT_INGR> 1 Large White Onion (Medium Diced) <NEXT_INGR> 2 Medium Carrots (Chopped into Small Chunks) <NEXT_INGR> 2 Sticks of Celery (Chopped into Small Chunks) <NEXT_INGR> 2 Cloves of Garlic (Minced) <NEXT_INGR> 1 Bay Leaf <NEXT_INGR> 1 TBSP Tomato Puree <NEXT_INGR> 3 Sprigs of Thyme
2/3 Sprigs of Thyme (For Garnish) <NEXT_INGR> 400ml Beef Stock (Roughly 4 OXO Cubes) <NEXT_INGR> 50ml Olive Oil <NEXT_INGR> Salt and Pepper (To taste) <NEXT_INGR> 300ml Brewdog: 5am Saint <NEXT_INGR> Beetroot Mash Potato (Ready Cooked, Made into x4 Small/Medium Sized Balls) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat the oil in a large, heavy based casserole dish over a moderate heat. Season the meat, then sear until golden/brown in colour all around. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the meat from the dish, drop in the onion, garlic, carrot, celery, bay leaf and sprigs of thyme. Sweat the vegetables for 6-8 minutes, stiring very occasionally until slightly softened and a slight change in colour. <NEXT_INSTR> Return the meat to the dish, increase the heat slightly and de-glaze the dish with the ale. (Ensure you stir the base to loosen any debris.) <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in the beef stock and bring the dish to the boil for a brief moment, whilst stiring in the tomato puree. Bring the dish back down to a simmer, and cover the dish with a tight fitting lid. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook gently for no more than 1 hour 30 mintues. Check and stir occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> When it's ready. Immediately turn off the heat. Discard the bay leaf and sprigs of thyme. Plate up 2 portions, and garnish with x2 balls of beetroot mash, and a sprig of thyme resting on top for each dish. <NEXT_INSTR> (Optional) My personal drink recommendation: Cabernet Sauvignon. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Beef Stew: Cooked In A Red Ale Sauce (Served With: Beetroot Mash Potato) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Lean <NEXT_INPUT> Chicken stock <NEXT_INPUT> Soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> Brown bean sauce <NEXT_INPUT> Chinese cooking wine <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic <NEXT_INPUT> coloring <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb Lean, tender pork in one piece <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. Chicken stock <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. Soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. Brown bean sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. Chinese cooking wine <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. Garlic, finely minced <NEXT_INGR> 6 dsh Red food coloring (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix stock, soy sauce, brown bean sauce, cooking wine, minced garlic, and food coloring. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over pork. <NEXT_INSTR> 2. <NEXT_INSTR> Marinate 3 hrs at room temperature or possibly overnight in the refrigerator. <NEXT_INSTR> 3. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 500F. <NEXT_INSTR> 4. <NEXT_INSTR> Place pork on rack over drip pan in oven, reduce heat to 350F, and roast for 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Notes: Yield - 1 lb <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bbq Pork (Cha Siu) Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fresh figs <NEXT_INPUT> Grand Marnier <NEXT_INPUT> pork loin <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> orange marmalade <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 fresh figs, cut in half lengthwise <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup Grand Marnier <NEXT_INGR> 3 lbs boneless pork loin <NEXT_INGR> 1 sprig fresh thyme, chopped <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup orange marmalade <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon brown sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Marinade figs in Grand Marnier for about an hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Butterfly pork loin lengthwise. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with thyme, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Put figs end to end down center of opened pork loin. <NEXT_INSTR> Close up and tie securely. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat left over marinade, brown sugar and marmalade in micro to melt. <NEXT_INSTR> Season outside of pork with salt and pepper and spread in marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake and baste in a 350-degree oven about 1 hour 10 minutes or until an instant-read thermometer reaches 155 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove and cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut into 1/2 to 3/4 inch slices, each showing a cut fig in the center. <NEXT_INSTR> Do not over cook. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Roasted Pork Loin With Figs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sweet butter <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> ground nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ground pepper <NEXT_INPUT> egg roll wraps <NEXT_INPUT> marinara sauce <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 tablespoons sweet butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups milk <NEXT_INGR> ground nutmeg, to taste <NEXT_INGR> salt, to taste <NEXT_INGR> fresh ground pepper, to taste <NEXT_INGR> 8 egg roll wraps <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups marinara sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups mozzarella cheese, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup parmesan cheese, grated <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt butter in a 1- to 1 1/2-quart pan over medium-high heat. Add flour and stir until bubbly. Remove pan from heat and gradually add milk, whisking until smooth. Return to heat and bring to a boil, stirring; then boil for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Season to taste with nutmeg, salt and pepper. Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Choose a small baking dish in which 2 egg roll wrappers will fit snuggly side by side. In dish, layer a fourth of the marinara sauce, two egg roll wrappers, a third of the Bechamel Sauce, a third of the mozzarella cheese, and a fourth of the Parmesan cheese. Repeat layers twice more, ending with marinara sauce, egg roll wrapper, and Parmesan cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in a 500°F oven until lasagna is golden brown on top and sauce is bubbly around edges (about 15 minutes). Let stand about 5 minutes before cutting in fourths to serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> 30-Minute Lasagna <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> INGREDIENTS <NEXT_INPUT> beans <NEXT_INPUT> chorizo sausage <NEXT_INPUT> black beans <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> avocados <NEXT_INPUT> freshly squeezed lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> fresh tomatillo salsa <NEXT_INPUT> queso fresco <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> grape tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> Salsa <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> coarse salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> INGREDIENTS <NEXT_INGR> For the beans: <NEXT_INGR> 4 oz. chorizo sausage <NEXT_INGR> 11/2 cups (1 15 oz. can) cooked black beans <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup water, veggie or chicken broth, plus more as needed <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper, to taste <NEXT_INGR> For the guacamole: <NEXT_INGR> 2 ripe avocados, split and pitted <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp. freshly squeezed lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 jalapeno, seeded, ribbed and finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2-3 tbsp. minced cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. kosher salt, plus more to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup fresh tomatillo salsa <NEXT_INGR> Crumbled queso fresco <NEXT_INGR> Diced red onion <NEXT_INGR> Cherry or grape tomatoes, quartered <NEXT_INGR> For the sour cream: <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup sour cream (or low fat plain greek yogurt) <NEXT_INGR> 1 chipotle in adobo sauce, seeded and chopped <NEXT_INGR> Squeeze of fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> For the Tomatillo Salsa: <NEXT_INGR> 8 oz. tomatillos, husked, rinsed and quartered <NEXT_INGR> 1 large clove garlic, peeled and roughly chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 jalapeno, seeded and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 to 2/3 cup cilantro, roughly chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. coarse salt <NEXT_INGR> Puree in a blender until chunky. DO NOT OVER BLEND! <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> To make the bean layer, heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Crumble the chorizo into the skillet and cook until evenly browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in the beans and then the liquid. Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to medium-low and continue to simmer until the beans are softened and most of the liquid has evaporated, about 5-7 minutes more. Remove the pan from the heat. Smash the beans and the chorizo together in a coarse mash, adding additional liquid if necessary a tablespoon at a time so the mixture is not dry. Taste and adjust seasoning as necessary with salt and pepper. Spread the bean mixture onto a large round serving plate. Chill while you prepare the next layers. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> To make the guacamole layer, combine the avocado flesh, lime juice, jalapeno, cilantro and salt in a bowl. Mash together with a fork until fairly smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning as necessary. Spread the guacamole layer over the bean layer on the serving plate. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Continue to layer with the tomatillo salsa, queso fresco, red onion, and tomatoes. Combine the sour cream with the chipotle and lime juice and blend together with a small food processor or immersion blender. Drizzle over the top of the dip. Cover and chill until ready to serve.* <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> *While many of the components could be made in advance (beans, tomatillo salsa, and chipotle sour cream), it is best to make the guacamole fresh and assemble the dip not too long before you plan to serve it. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mexican 7-Layer Dip  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Chinese chives <NEXT_INPUT> Eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Water <NEXT_INPUT> Soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> Mirin <NEXT_INPUT> Oyster sauce <NEXT_INPUT> Vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> slurry <NEXT_INPUT> Sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 bunch Chinese chives <NEXT_INGR> 2 Eggs <NEXT_INGR> 200 ml Water <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp Soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp Mirin <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp Oyster sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tbsp Vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 piece Grated ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1 Katakuriko slurry <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp Sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash Salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put water and the flavoring ingredients into a pot, and turn on the heat. <NEXT_INSTR> After bringing it to a boil, thicken with water-dissolved katakuriko. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in the vinegar and ginger last. <NEXT_INSTR> Put water and the flavoring ingredients into a pot, and turn on the heat. <NEXT_INSTR> After bringing it to a boil, thicken with water-dissolved katakuriko. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in the vinegar and ginger last. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a pan, and pour sesame oil (1/2 tablespoon). <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the eggs after it has warmed, and take the eggs out once they're cooked halfway through. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the remaining sesame oil, saute the Chinese chives, return the eggs from Step 2 to the pan, quickly fry, arrange on a plate, and cover with ankake sauce. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chinese Chive Omelette with Thick Ankake Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> quick-cooking oats <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> dates <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups quick-cooking oats <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup shortening <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups chopped dates (about 1 pound) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1 to 2 tablespoons lemon juice, optional <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cups confectioners' sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place oats in a food processor, cover and process until finely ground; set aside. In a large bowl, cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Combine the oats, flour, baking soda and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk, beating well after each addition. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll half of dough to fit a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking pan; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large saucepan, combine the dates, sugar, water and lemon juice if desired; bring to a boil. Cool for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread over crust. Roll remaining dough to fit pan; place over filling and seal edges. Bake at 400° for 15-20 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Combine glaze ingredients; spread over bars while warm. Cool on a wire rack before cutting. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Oatmeal Date Bars <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> loin chops <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <NEXT_INPUT> celery <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 rib or loin chops or 4 servings in cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 chicken bouillon cube <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. hot water <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. prepared mustard <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. cold water <NEXT_INGR> 1 (9 oz.) can pineapple <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 green pepper, cut in thin strips <NEXT_INGR> 1 tomato, cubed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped celery <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown meat without fat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add salt and water; simmer 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove meat and pour off fat. <NEXT_INSTR> In skillet, melt bouillon cube in hot water. <NEXT_INSTR> Add Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, pineapple juice, vinegar and mustard. <NEXT_INSTR> (I add a little brown sugar and a sprinkle of ginger.) <NEXT_INSTR> Combine starch and cold water. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in skillet mixture until thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Add meat to sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat and add veggies and steam for 5 to 10 minutes to get flavor but leave veggies fairly crisp. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve over rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 4. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet And Sour Pork <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> blueberries <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 cups crushed blueberries from about 2 quarts berries (slightly underripe berries work best) <NEXT_INGR> 6 cups sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch salt <NEXT_INGR> juice of half a lemon <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the berries and sugar in a large, heavy pot over high heat. Cook, stirring frequently, until the berries have released a lot of juice and have just begun to simmer. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the cinnamon, salt and lemon juice and return to a gentle, rolling boil. Boil the jam for about 40 minutes, stirring frequently, until it is quite thick and a small dollop spooned onto a plate and set aside to cool for a minute does not run when you tip the plate to one side. <NEXT_INSTR> Fill 8 one-cup glass jars, sterilized according to the jar manufacturer's instructions, and then process according to the manufacturer's instructions. <NEXT_INSTR> Once the jars have cooled, to make sure all of the lids are sealed, push down on the center of each. If the lid pops back up, the jar isn't sealed; you should refrigerate and eat any jam in unsealed jars within a couple of weeks. Properly sealed jars will keep in a cool, dry place for several months. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Wild Maine Blueberry Jam <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> green bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> stalks celery <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> bags navy beans <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> rice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 teaspoons canola oil (divided) <NEXT_INGR> 1 green bell pepper (chopped) <NEXT_INGR> 2 small onions (chopped) <NEXT_INGR> 4 -5 garlic cloves (minced or crushed) <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 stalks celery (chopped) <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb diced ham <NEXT_INGR> 2 (16 ounce) bags navy beans <NEXT_INGR> 2 bay leaves <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 6 cups cooked rice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Wash beans & add to stew pot, boil for 30-45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Brown ham in 1 tsp of oil until just brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove ham & add 1 tsp of oil, onion, celery, bell pepper & garlic, cook until soft. (If sticky, just add a LITTLE water.). <NEXT_INSTR> Add ham back to skillet and cook for an additional 5-10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add skillet mixture to beans & season with salt, cayenne pepper, & bay leaves. (You can use more or less of any of the seasonings to suit your taste. Taste the liquid to make sure that it agrees to your tastes.). <NEXT_INSTR> Cook in stewpot until beans are soft. (4-6 hours). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove 1 1/2 cups of beans & mash. Add mashed beans back to mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve beans over rice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> White Beans & Rice <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> shallot <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> head leaves lettuce <NEXT_INPUT> head radicchio <NEXT_INPUT> cherry tomatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 shallot, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 12 lb small shrimp, cooked and drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 head leaves lettuce, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1 head radicchio, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup cherry tomatoes <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine first five ingredients (olive oil - mustard) in a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in shrimp. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large salad bowl combine lettuce and radicchio, pour shrimp and dressing. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss add tomatoes and toss again. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shrimp and Radicchio Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sausage <NEXT_INPUT> sharp cheese <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> bread <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> dry mustard <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. bulk sausage or ham <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sharp cheese <NEXT_INGR> 6 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 slices bread, cut in 1/2 inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. dry mustard <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Spread cubes in buttered 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with sausage and cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine eggs, milk and seasonings. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well and pour over cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes or until set. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Breakfast Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Bisquick <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. grated cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> dash of pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs, beaten <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients with electric mixer; put in pie pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Zucchini Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> brown onions <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> ground coriander <NEXT_INPUT> red wine <NEXT_INPUT> chicken stock <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> kumara <NEXT_INPUT> cornflour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 lamb shanks or 8 french trimmed lamb shanks <NEXT_INGR> olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium brown onions, chopped coarsely <NEXT_INGR> 3 garlic cloves, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 3 teaspoons ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 3 teaspoons ground coriander <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup dry red wine <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups chicken stock <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons honey <NEXT_INGR> 2 kumara, about 500g, chopped coarsely (sweet potato) <NEXT_INGR> 1 -2 tablespoon cornflour, depending on how thick you want the sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat some olive oil in a pan, cook lamb until browned all over, drain. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large saucepan or casserole dish (depending on whether you want to cook on the stove or in the oven.)Add some more olive oil, cook onion and garlic until onion softens, add cinnamon, cumin and coriander, stir until fragrant. <NEXT_INSTR> Add wine, bring to the boil, reduce heat and simmer uncovered until liquid has reduced by about half (it doesn't have to be precise). Add chicken stock and honey, bring to the boil, and reduce heat again. <NEXT_INSTR> Return lamb to the pan and either cook covered in a moderate slow oven (170c) for about 1hr 30 minutes or on a low heat on the stove for the same time. Uncover dish and add the kumara, cook covered again for a further 50Min's to 1 hr until lamb is falling of the bone. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove lamb and kumara from dish cover with foil to keep warm. Strain liquid into another pan, mix a little water with the cornflour, bring the sauce to a boil over a high heat add cornflour and stir until mixture thickens. <NEXT_INSTR> To Serve: I served mine over spiced couscous topped with kumara and lamb and then poured the sauce over. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Moroccan Lamb Shanks <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> corn chips <NEXT_INPUT> pork <NEXT_INPUT> chili <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sliced cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 large onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 oz.) pkg. corn chips <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 oz.) can pork and beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 oz.) can chili <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 can hot water <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 lb. sliced cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place onions and corn chips in 2-quart casserole. <NEXT_INSTR> Add beans, chili and water; put cheese on top. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Mexican Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>
