Washington honey <NEXT_INGR> 1 - 12 oz. can condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. pumpkin pie spice <NEXT_INGR> 1 - 16 oz. can pumpkin <NEXT_INGR> Pastry for 9 inch single crust pie <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For filling, in a mixing bowl combine eggs, honey, evaporated milk, salt, pumpkin pie spice and pumpkin. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat well. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour filling into pastry lined 9 inch pie plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 15 minutes at 400 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat to 350 and bake for 45 minutes more or until knife inserted near the center comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool on a wire rack. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with whipped cream if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and chill. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 8 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Honey Pumpkin Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> pink lemonade <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 large container Cool Whip <NEXT_INGR> 1 can Eagle Brand milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 small can pink lemonade <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend milk and lemonade together, then add Cool Whip. <NEXT_INSTR> Add enough red food coloring to make pink. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into graham cracker crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with cracker crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pink Lemonade Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> stewing beef <NEXT_INPUT> salsa <NEXT_INPUT> red beans <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> red peppers <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> crackers <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb stewing beef <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) jar salsa <NEXT_INGR> 1 (20 ounce) can red beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 ounce) jar roasted red peppers <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 ounce) package goldfish crackers <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> At bedtime add one jar of your favorite salsa (mild, medium or Hot) to the stew beef. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook on low overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> In the morning Stir the mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the beans, diced tomatoes, roasted red peppers and chili powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water if you like a thinner chili. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook on low all day. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve, top with onion, cheese and goldfish crackers. <NEXT_INSTR> I have used chicken breast instead of beef. <NEXT_INSTR> It needs to be shredded in the morning. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Versatile Slow Cooker Chili <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground turkey <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> kidney beans <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> sage <NEXT_INPUT> marjoram <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lbs ground turkey <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons olive oil, basil infused if available <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 cups onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 8 garlic cloves, minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 (15 ounce) cans kidney beans <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons dried basil <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons dried oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons dried thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried sage <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried marjoram <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried thyme <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon dried rosemary <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups low sodium chicken broth <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large pot, begin browning ground turkey. <NEXT_INSTR> As the turkey begins to brown, add onions and garlic and continue to stir until turkey is fully browned. <NEXT_INSTR> Do not drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Add tomato paste and stir until fully incorporated. <NEXT_INSTR> Add tomato sauce and stir again. <NEXT_INSTR> Slightly rinse kidney beans (does not have to be fully cleaned) and add to pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in chicken broth and stir again. <NEXT_INSTR> Add spices to pot (basil, oregano, sage, marjoram, thyme, rosemary, pepper, and bay leaf) and stir until all ingredients are equally mixed. <NEXT_INSTR> Add olive oil and stir again. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil and immediately turn temperature down to low. <NEXT_INSTR> Allow chili to simmer for 1 hour to 1 1/2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Chili will be VERY hot so allow to cool before consuming. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove bay leaf before serving. <NEXT_INSTR> After cooling, chili can be divided into containers and frozen up to 3-4 months. <NEXT_INSTR> (To cook from frozen, allow chili to defrost about 30 minutes and warm in microwave until reaching desire temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> ). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Italian Chili <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <NEXT_INPUT> strawberry <NEXT_INPUT> cool whip sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 12 g jello strawberry-banana flavor sugar free low calorie gelatin <NEXT_INGR> ice cube <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup cold water <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup pureed strawberry <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup thawed cool whip sugar free whipped topping <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Boil 3/4 cup water. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir boiling water into dry gelatin mix in medium bowl at least 2 minutes until completely dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Add enough ice cubes to cold water to measure 1 1/4 cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to gelatin; stir until slightly thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove any unmelted ice. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate 10 minutes or until slightly thickened (consistency of unbeaten egg whites. <NEXT_INSTR> ). <NEXT_INSTR> Add pureed strawberries; stir. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour evenly into 6 dessert dishes. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with cool whip. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Very Berry Fruit Cups <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Onion <NEXT_INPUT> Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> Celery <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/4 c. Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp Dry mustard <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp Salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 sm Onion, minced fine <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. Vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp Celery seed <NEXT_INGR> 1 x Garlic clove <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients together. <NEXT_INSTR> I use my blender then I do not have to chop the onions. <NEXT_INSTR> This will keep several weeks in a jar with a plastic lid. <NEXT_INSTR> Don't use a metal lid, since the vinegar will rust the lid. <NEXT_INSTR> You can adjust the sugar and salt to suit your own taste. <NEXT_INSTR> We find which 1 1/4 c sugar is too much, and so is 2 t of salt. <NEXT_INSTR> The dressing is especially good on a fresh fruit or possibly spinach salad. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Aunt Ann's Celery Seed Dressing Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <NEXT_INPUT> cakes yeast <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. hot water <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. cold water <NEXT_INGR> 2 cakes yeast <NEXT_INGR> 5 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. shortening <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine shortening, salt and sugar in bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add hot water. Cool to lukewarm. <NEXT_INSTR> In cold water, dissolve yeast cakes and add to mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Add eggs (well beaten), then 3 cups flour and mix well. Mix remaining flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir thoroughly, but do not knead. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and put in refrigerator until ready to use. <NEXT_INSTR> When you remove from refrigerator to use, should be double in bulk. <NEXT_INSTR> Mash down with a little flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Make out rolls. <NEXT_INSTR> Let rise for 2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook 15 to 20 minutes in 350° oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush tops with butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Dough will keep, covered, several days in refrigerator. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dinner Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Oreo cookies <NEXT_INPUT> cookie crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate pudding <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (16 oz.) pkg. Oreo cookies, crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. cookie crumbs, reserved <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 large pkg. chocolate pudding <NEXT_INGR> 1 (12 oz.) carton Cool Whip <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick butter or margarine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Crush cookies. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter and mix with cookies. <NEXT_INSTR> Press into pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix cream cheese and Cool Whip together. <NEXT_INSTR> Put 1 cup of this over cookies. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat milk with pudding and pour over other two layers. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with remaining Cool Whip mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with reserved crumbs. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Oreo Surprise <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> graham cracker crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> cold milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 c. graham cracker crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. melted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 container Cool Whip <NEXT_INGR> 2 pkg. instant Jell-O pudding (any flavor) <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 c. cold milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine graham cracker crumbs, 1/4 cup sugar and melted butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Press firmly in bottom of a 13 x 9-inch pan. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Striped Delight <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> frozen flaked coconut <NEXT_INPUT> white distilled vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla extract <NEXT_INPUT> dish pie crust <NEXT_INPUT> topping <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. (4 oz.) melted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. frozen flaked coconut, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. white distilled vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 (9 inch) deep dish pie crust, unbaked <NEXT_INGR> Non-dairy whipped topping <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> "French" Coconut Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> coarse salt <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> anchovies <NEXT_INPUT> Nicoise olives <NEXT_INPUT> warm water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> active dry yeast <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> bread flour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Pissaladiere Dough (recipe follows) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup olive oil, plus more for pan and plastic wrap <NEXT_INGR> 4 medium garlic cloves, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 medium onions, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons coarse salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon fresh thyme leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley, coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 pounds ripe plum tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 24 anchovies <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup Nicoise olives, pitted and thinly sliced lengthwise <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup warm water (110F) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon active dry yeast <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil, plus more for bowl <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 9 ounces (about 1 3/4 cups) bread flour, plus more for dusting <NEXT_INGR> (makes enough for one 17-by-12-inch tart) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Lightly oil a 17-by-12-inch rimmed baking sheet, and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll out dough to a 17-by-12-inch rectangle, and fit into sheet, folding up the edges slightly to form a small lip. <NEXT_INSTR> Prick dough all over with a fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with oiled plastic wrap, and let rise in a warm place until slightly puffed, about 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat the oven to 450F, with a rack in the center. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add garlic, onions, and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook, stirring occasionally, until onions begin to brown, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add thyme and parsley; set aside to cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut tomatoes in half lengthwise, and scoop out seeds with a melon baller or small spoon. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice tomato halves lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick strips; distribute evenly over dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange the onions on top, then add anchovies in a decorative pattern to form X shapes. <NEXT_INSTR> Dot with olives. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 12 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Rotate sheet, and continue baking until crust is golden, about 15 minutes more. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from oven; using a large spatula, transfer to a cutting board. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice into pieces, and serve warm or at room temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Although Pissaladiere is best eaten the day it is baked, it can be reheated the next day; place in a 200F oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until heated through. <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium bowl, sprinkle sugar and yeast over 1/4 cup warm water. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir with a fork until sugar and yeast are dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining 1/2 cup warm water, along with the oil, salt, and flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a wooden spoon, stir until a dough forms. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a lightly floured work surface; knead until smooth, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl, turning to coat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with plastic wrap; let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pissaladiere <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken breast <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> bean sprouts <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> five spice pwdr <NEXT_INPUT> egg roll skins <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> Sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 whole lg. chicken breast, skinned, halved lengthwise & boned <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp. veg. oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce.) can bean sprouts, liquid removed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. minced celery <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon five spice pwdr <NEXT_INGR> 8 egg roll skins (see recipe, or possibly 8 packaged egg roll skins) <NEXT_INGR> Veg. oil or possibly shortening for deep-fat frying <NEXT_INGR> Plum Sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For filling, chop chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat a large skillet or possibly wok over high heat; add in veg. <NEXT_INSTR> oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir fry minced chicken and chopped garlic in the 1 Tbsp. <NEXT_INSTR> warm veg. <NEXT_INSTR> oil for 2 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in the bean sprouts and the minced celery; stir fry about 2 min more. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir together soy sauce and cornstarch. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in 5 spice pwdr. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir into chicken mix; cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook and stir 2 min more. <NEXT_INSTR> Cold to room temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Place an egg roll skin with 1 point toward you. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon 1/4 c. filling diagonally across and just below center of skin. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold the bottom point of skin over the filling; tuck point under filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold side corners over, forming an envelope shape. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll up toward remaining corner; moisten point and press firmly to seal. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat with the remaining egg roll skins and filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Fry egg rolls, 2 or possibly 3 at a time, in deep warm veg. <NEXT_INSTR> oil or possibly shortening (365 degrees) for 2 to 3 min or possibly till golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain on paper toweling. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve hot with Plum Sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 8 egg rolls. <NEXT_INSTR> Plum Sauce: In a small saucepan combine 1/2 c. plum preserves, 1 Tbsp. <NEXT_INSTR> vinegar, 1 Tbsp. <NEXT_INSTR> soy sauce, 1/8 tsp. <NEXT_INSTR> garlic pwdr, 1/8 tsp. <NEXT_INSTR> grnd ginger and dash grnd red pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring mix to boiling, stirring constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat; cold. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill in covered container overnight to blend seasonings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Egg Rolls Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> browning sauce <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt, optional <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon paprika <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon browning sauce, optional <NEXT_INGR> 4 medium potatoes, cut lengthwise into 6 wedges <NEXT_INGR> Pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In an ungreased 11x7-in. microwave-safe dish, combine the first four ingredients. Microwave on high for 20-30 seconds or until the garlic is soft. Stir in browning sauce. Add potatoes and pepper; stir to coat. Cover and microwave on high for 10-12 minutes, turning and stirring twice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Micro-Roasted Potatoes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> salmon <NEXT_INPUT> saltine cracker crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> parsley flakes <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> catsup <NEXT_INPUT> hot sauce <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> Cucumber Cream Sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (15 1/2 oz.) can salmon, drained (reserve liquid) <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. saltine cracker crumbs, divided <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. butter or margarine, melted <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. green pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. onion, grated <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. dried parsley flakes <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. catsup <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. hot sauce <NEXT_INGR> 3 slices bacon <NEXT_INGR> Cucumber Cream Sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Drain salmon, reserving 1/3 cup liquid; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove skin and bones from salmon, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Flake salmon with a fork. Brown 1 1/2 cups cracker crumbs in 1/4 cup butter in a large skillet; set mixture aside. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Savory Salmon Loaf <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> white onion <NEXT_INPUT> poblano chiles <NEXT_INPUT> beer <NEXT_INPUT> asadero cheese <NEXT_INPUT> tortilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup white onion, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb poblano chiles or 1 lb anaheim chili, cut into strips <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup beer <NEXT_INGR> 6 ounces asadero cheese, shredded <NEXT_INGR> tortilla <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oil in a non-reactive skillet over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add onions. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until onions are translucent. <NEXT_INSTR> Add pepper strips, cover, and cook just until peppers are tender, about 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add beer and bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until liquid has evaporated, about 7 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in cheese and stir just until melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with tortillas. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Rajas Con Cerveza (Pepper Strips With Beer and Cheese) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bread <NEXT_INPUT> green peppers <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> fennel seeds <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Parley <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 half day-old (or more) French bread (long) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup marinated red and green peppers, sliced into long strips (I use red and green Hatch chiles canned last August - they have perfect heat. If you don't have that option, include marinated bell peppers and one chile d'arbol pinched into bits) <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves of garlic, slivered <NEXT_INGR> 1 pint cherry tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons olive oil (or bacon fat, if available) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs, double yolks if you can find them <NEXT_INGR> Parley, minced (optional) <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper, to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Run the stale bread quickly under the running kitchen faucet and place in the oven. Set the oven to 250 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> When the oven indicates 250 degrees has been reached, take the bread out and cut 4 slices roughly 2 - 2 1/2" thick each. Scoop a section of the bread out of the middle of each piece so there is about a 1"hole in the middle of each slice. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the olive oil (or bacon fat or mix of both) in a 12 inch cast iron skillet over medium-low heat. Add the garlic, fennel seed, peppers and cherry tomatoes. Add, salt and pepper to taste. Cook, stirring frequently, until cherry tomatoes collapse. Remove to a bowl for serving. <NEXT_INSTR> Add butter to the same skillet and decrease heat slightly. Once the butter is foaming, add the slices of french bread cut side down. Carefully crack each egg over the hole in each slice of the french bread so that the yolk runs into the hole. The white of the egg will spill over. No worries. After about 30 seconds to one minute, carefully flip each slice over with a broad spatula. Cook about another 1 to 2 minutes (depending how you like your eggs) and remove to individual plates for serving. Top each serving with tomato/pepper mixture and sprinkle with parsely. Serve. Some bacon wouldn't hurt. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Moonstruck Eggs In A Basket <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> dough <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> filling <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> golden raisin <NEXT_INPUT> icing <NEXT_INPUT> light cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> icing sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> for the dough <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup 1% low-fat milk, warm (if you can't put your finger in it it's too hot) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup honey or 1/4 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/4 tablespoons fast rising yeast (two of the little pkgs will do) <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups flour (including extra during kneading) <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup butter or 1/2 cup margarine <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> for the filling <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup butter (approximate, I just eyeball the filling) or 3/4 cup margarine (approximate, I just eyeball the filling) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup golden raisin (soak in booze of choice overnight if desired) <NEXT_INGR> for the icing <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup light cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup icing sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Start the dough at least 4 hours before you want to be eating these or plan to start it the night before and do the first rise overnight in the fridge. Mix warm milk with honey and yeast, set aside for 5-10 minutes until it starts bubbling suspiciously. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix 3 cups flour and salt, add margarine, eggs, and yeast mix all at once. Stir until a very soft dough forms. Knead in last cup of flour a bit at a time until you have a soft dough that's not terribly sticky. Cover with a dish towel (or plastic wrap if going in fridge overnight) and leave in a warm place until double its size. <NEXT_INSTR> In the meantime make the filling by stirring all filling ingredients together. If it's too stiff you can warm a bit, but it should not be a liquid. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll out risen dough into a rectangle about the size and shape of a cookie sheet, around 1/4-12 inch thick. Spread with filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll length-wise into a big jelly roll and cut into disks about an inch or 1 1/2 inches thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in a lasagna pan so that when they double in size again they will be touching. This keeps them soft and gooey. Let rise. <NEXT_INSTR> Either while they rise or while they bake, make the icing. Again you can warm a bit if it's too stiff, but it shouldn't be a liquid. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake buns at 350°F for 20-30 minutes or until just starting to colour. They should not be too crispy or dried out. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool, then ice in the pan. Cut apart carefully. <NEXT_INSTR> They are best warm, so attack them now or reheat in the microwave later. "Flash freezing" means freezing in a single layer, usually uncovered, until just solid, then packaging for longer term storage. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Epic Cinnamon Buns <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Oreo cookies <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate pudding <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla pudding <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 large pkg. Oreo cookies <NEXT_INGR> 1 small instant chocolate pudding <NEXT_INGR> 1 small instant vanilla pudding <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 Cool Whip <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix pudding according to directions on box. Mix cream cheese and Cool Whip. Crush 1/3 of Oreo cookies in 9 x 13 glass pan, then 1/3 pudding and Cool Whip and then layer. Refrigerate. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Oreo Cookie Dessert <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> sherry vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> shallot <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> bunches <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup sliced almonds <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tablespoons sherry vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon minced shallot <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 bunches watercress (3/4 pound), tough stems discarded <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 350. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread the almonds in a pie plate and toast for about 6 minutes, until lightly golden. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, whisk the olive oil with the vinegar and shallot and season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the watercress and almonds to the dressing, toss to coat and serve at once. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Watercress and Toasted-Almond Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanuts <NEXT_INPUT> peanut oil <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb roasted peanuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup peanut oil (to taste) <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cayenne <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> oil (for frying) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Grind or pound the nuts adding just enough oil to make a smooth paste. <NEXT_INSTR> With wet hands, squeeze the mixture to remove any excess oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute the onions, cayenne & salt in a tablespoon of oil until golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead into the nut paste. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape into 1" diameter balls adding a few drops of water if necessary to make them hold together. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop the balls into hot oil or flatten & fry in a skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until the outsides are crisp. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Kulikuli (Peanut Balls) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> oleo <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick oleo <NEXT_INGR> 2 or 3 Tbsp. peanut butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix sugar, milk and oleo; cook to soft ball stage. <NEXT_INSTR> Add peanut butter and beat. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour onto greased plate. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Peanut Butter Fudge <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> whole almonds <NEXT_INPUT> walnut pieces <NEXT_INPUT> soy nuts <NEXT_INPUT> blueberries <NEXT_INPUT> candied ginger <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup whole almonds <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup walnut pieces <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup roasted soy nuts, salted or plain <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup dried blueberries, coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 slice candied ginger, very finely chopped, optional <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350F. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread almonds and walnuts on baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 6 minutes, stir, and bake 4 minutes longer. <NEXT_INSTR> When cool enough to handle, cut almonds in half crosswise. <NEXT_INSTR> In bowl, combine roasted nuts, soy nuts, blueberries and ginger, if using. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Nutty Snack Mix <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fish <NEXT_INPUT> sage <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> swiss cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 lbs cod fish fillets <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon sage <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup grated swiss cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 - 1 cup sour cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> Wash and dry fish. Sprinkle both sides with sage, salt, and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in greased shallow baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle cheese on top and cover with sour cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Adjust sour cream, sage, salt, pepper to taste as desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Baked Cod With Cheese <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> coriander <NEXT_INPUT> coconut milk <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/4 pounds squid cleaned, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion small <NEXT_INGR> 3 garlic cloves sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 red pepper thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 5 sprigs coriander <NEXT_INGR> 1 can coconut milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon curry powder <NEXT_INGR> olive oil <NEXT_INGR> salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pour a little olive oil in a pan and add the onion and sliced garlic cloves. Simmer over low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> When the onions start to become translucent, add the pepper and cook for 2 or 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the squid, season it with salt (just a bit, because of the curry) cover the pan and cook until the squid start to get soft. <NEXT_INSTR> Then add the coconut milk and wait for it to boil <NEXT_INSTR> Once it begins to boil, add the curry and coriander. Cover and cook for another 5 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with white rice, as desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Squid Curry <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> light corn syrup <NEXT_INPUT> bittersweet <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate-chocolate chip ice cream <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate fudge brownie ice cream <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> white chocolate <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 cups finely ground or crushed chocolate wafer cookies (about 7 ounces) <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) unsalted butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup whipping cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons light corn syrup <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces bittersweet (not unsweetened) or semisweet chocolate, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 2 pints chocolate-chocolate chip ice cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 pint chocolate fudge brownie ice cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 pint cookies-and-cream ice cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 ounces good-quality white chocolate (such as Lindt or Bakers), chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 325F. <NEXT_INSTR> Butter 9-inch-diameter metal pie pan or glass pie dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix cookie crumbs and melted butter in bowl until crumbs are evenly moistened. <NEXT_INSTR> Press crumb mixture firmly onto bottom and up sides of prepared pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake until crust is set, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine cream, butter, and corn syrup in medium saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to simmer. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add bittersweet chocolate; let stand 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk until melted and smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand at room temperature until cool and slightly thickened, about 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Place alternate scoops of chocolate-chocolate chip ice cream, chocolate fudge brownie ice cream, and cookies-and-cream ice cream in single layer in cooled crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle 1/2 cup chocolate sauce over ice cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Freeze pie until sauce sets, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Top pie with scoops of remaining ice cream, alternating flavors and mounding in center. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle 1/3 cup sauce over. <NEXT_INSTR> Freeze pie until firm, at least 2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> (Can be prepared 5 days ahead. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover tightly and keep frozen. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate remaining chocolate sauce.) <NEXT_INSTR> Stir white chocolate in top of double boiler set over barely simmering water just until melted and smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Using small spoon, drizzle white chocolate in thin lines over ice cream pie. <NEXT_INSTR> Freeze until white chocolate is firm, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir bittersweet chocolate sauce over low heat just until warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve pie with warm chocolate sauce. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Decadence Ice Cream Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> pie shell <NEXT_INPUT> Meringue for <NEXT_INPUT> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 egg yolks, slightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup undiluted evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 9-inch pie shell, baked and cooled <NEXT_INGR> Meringue for Pie: <NEXT_INGR> 3 egg whites, room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch salt <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Caramelize sugar in heavy sauce pan or iron skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt brown sugar with butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to caramel mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir until well mixed. <NEXT_INSTR> In top of double boiler: Mix cornstarch, salt, and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Add beaten egg yolks and milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Add caramelized sugar mixture slowly. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook in double boiler until thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Add vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into pie shell. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with Meringue. <NEXT_INSTR> -------Meringue---------. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat egg whites and salt at high speed until frothy. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sugar gradually. <NEXT_INSTR> Continue beating at high speed until mixture stands in peaks. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread to edges of pie crust, completely sealing in filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake until light brown at 400 degrees. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Butterscotch Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> whole wheat flour <NEXT_INPUT> oats <NEXT_INPUT> apple <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> blackstrap molasses <NEXT_INPUT> water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 old fashioned oats <NEXT_INGR> 1 apple, grated <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons blackstrap molasses <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together the flour and oats. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk together the apple, egg, vegetable oil, molasses, and water. <NEXT_INSTR> Slowly incorporate the dry ingredients into the wet and mix into a firm dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll dough to 1/4 inch thick, cut into desired shapes, and bake for 30-35 minutes or until firm and crisp. <NEXT_INSTR> The treats will keep up to 2 weeks in an airtight container. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Apple Molasses Delights Treats For Dogs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fresh-pressed <NEXT_INPUT> fresh pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> rocket <NEXT_INPUT> mint leaves <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> chia seeds <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup/180 ml filtered water <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup/240 ml fresh-pressed apple juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups/255 g chopped fresh pineapple, chilled <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup/20 g firmly packed arugula/rocket, tough stems removed <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup/20 g firmly packed fresh mint leaves <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp roughly chopped raw macadamia nuts <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp chia seeds or flax seeds <NEXT_INGR> Pinch of sea salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the water, apple juice, pineapple, arugula/rocket, mint, macadamia nuts, chia seeds, and salt in a blender. Blend until smooth. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pineapple, Arugula, Macadamia Nut  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Sweet pastry <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> hazelnuts <NEXT_INPUT> kiwifruits <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla bean <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> all-purpose <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> dark rum <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Sweet pastry dough <NEXT_INGR> rice for weighting shell <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup hazelnuts (about 1/4 pound) <NEXT_INGR> 8 kiwifruits <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 vanilla bean <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon dark rum <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Reserve a quarter of dough for another use. <NEXT_INSTR> On a floured surface with a floured rolling pin roll out remaining dough into a 14-inch round (about 1/8 inch thick) and fit into an 11- by 1 1/4-inch round tart pan with a removable fluted rim. <NEXT_INSTR> Trim dough flush with rim. <NEXT_INSTR> (Don't worry if dough cracks; press dough together to patch any holes.) <NEXT_INSTR> Prick shell lightly all over with a fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill shell, covered, 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 425F. <NEXT_INSTR> Line shell with foil and fill with pie weights or raw rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake shell in middle of oven 15 minutes and remove weights or rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake shell until pale golden, about 10 minutes more, and transfer to a rack to cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce temperature to 350F. <NEXT_INSTR> Chop hazelnuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel kiwifruits and quarter lengthwise. <NEXT_INSTR> Halve vanilla bean half lengthwise and scrape seeds into a small saucepan, reserving pod for another use. <NEXT_INSTR> Add butter and melt over moderately low heat until golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool mixture to room temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Into a small bowl sift flour. <NEXT_INSTR> In a bowl with an electric mixer beat eggs with sugar and rum until thick and pale. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in flour gently but thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold butter into egg mixture gently but thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange kiwifruits evenly in one layer in tart shell and pour filling over them, spreading evenly. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle hazelnuts over filling and bake in middle of oven 35 minutes, or until top is golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool tart in pan on a rack. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Marvelous Murray's Kiwifruit Tart <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mushroom <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> cashews <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 lb mushroom, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 1/2 ounce) can crushed pineapple, and its liquid <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup uncooked rice <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup green onions or 1/4 cup white onion, minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup cashews <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine pineapple liquid with water to make 2 1/2 cups. <NEXT_INSTR> In medium sauce pan, bring to boil with salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover, simmer 20 to 25 minutes or until rice is tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, melt butter in skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute onion and mushrooms 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in soy sauce, ginger and pineapple; blend well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add mushroom mixture to rice along with nuts. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mushroom Pineapple Rice <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> onion flakes <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> tomato soup <NEXT_INPUT> saltines <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. each ground beef, pork and veal <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped celery <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. onion flakes <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. tomato soup <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. crushed saltines <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. garlic flakes <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients well and put into a large baking dish. Make sure it is tall enough so the juice will not overflow. Spread 1/2 cup tomato soup over top of loaf. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with foil and cook in oven at 375° for 1 1/2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook last 15 minutes uncovered to brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Meat Loaf <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> SALAD <NEXT_INPUT> cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> bean sprouts <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> fresh coriander leaves <NEXT_INPUT> DRESSING <NEXT_INPUT> asian fish sauce <NEXT_INPUT> rice wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> sesame seeds <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> FOR THE SALAD <NEXT_INGR> 6 cups napa cabbage, shredded (1 cabbage) <NEXT_INGR> 3 carrots, peeled and coarsely shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups bean sprouts <NEXT_INGR> 4 green onions, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup fresh coriander leaves, coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> FOR THE DRESSING <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons asian fish sauce <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> FOR THE GARNISH <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large bowl, combine the salad ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, whisk together dressing ingredients until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> (If using the optional sesame seeds, cook them for about 5 minutes in a small, dry skillet over medium heat, shaking, until they are brown and fragrant.) Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with sesame seeds, if using. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes about 6 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Asian Napa Cabbage Slaw <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> frozen peas <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> tarragon <NEXT_INPUT> bread <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> emmenthal cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chopped carrot <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chopped celery <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup frozen peas <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup flour <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups cubed or shredded cooked chicken <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons chopped fresh tarragon leaves <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups cubed sourdough bread <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons melted butter <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces shredded emmenthal cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 375°. Heat 2 tbsp. oil in a 4-qt. pot over medium heat. Add carrot, onion, and celery and cook, stirring often, until softened, about 5 minutes. Transfer mixture to a bowl and add peas; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining 1 tbsp. oil to pot. Add flour and whisk until dry and crumbly, about 30 seconds. Pour in milk 1/4 cup at a time, whisking well after each addition until smooth and creamy (mixture will be paste-like at first). Add reserved vegetables, salt, pepper, and chicken to milk mixture, stirring gently to combine. Spoon mixture into a large gratin dish (about 2 1/2 qts.) or ovenproof frying pan. Sprinkle with tarragon. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix bread and butter together in a large bowl, tossing well to coat. Top chicken mixture with bread. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake until browned and starting to bubble around the sides, 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Note: Nutritional analysis is per 1 1/2-cup serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Quick Chicken Potpie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> taro root <NEXT_INPUT> chicken thigh <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> mirin <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 taro root about a pound? <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound chicken thigh <NEXT_INGR> 2 stems green onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon mirin <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch salt & pepper <NEXT_INGR> panko <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1. peel off the skin of the taro root and slice it in thin pieces, about 1/4 inch thick and steam it until a chopstick goes through smoothly. <NEXT_INSTR> 2. soak the chicken in soy sauce and mirin mixture for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> 3. in a food processor, ground the chicken, green onion, and garlic. season with a little salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> 4. mash the taro root with a potato masher or with a fork until it looks like mash potatoes <NEXT_INSTR> 5. add the chicken and mix it into the taro well. <NEXT_INSTR> 6. finally, shape it into a croquette and do a dusting with panko. the stuff is sticky so keep a bowl of water near and moisten your hands with each shaping. <NEXT_INSTR> 7. fry with oil until it turns golden brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Taro Croquette <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> almond extract <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. water <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. almond extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut 1/2 cup butter into 1 cup flour. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons water over mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix with fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Round into ball; divide in half. <NEXT_INSTR> On ungreased baking sheet, pat each half into a strip 12 x 13-inches. <NEXT_INSTR> Strips should be about 3 inches apart. <NEXT_INSTR> In medium saucepan, heat 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water to rolling boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat; quickly stir in almond extract and 1 cup flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir vigorously over low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat in eggs all at one time, until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide in half; spread each half evenly over strips, covering completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake about 60 minutes or until topping is crisp and brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Frost with glaze and sprinkle generously with chopped almonds. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Almond Puff <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> pimento <NEXT_INPUT> crescent rolls <NEXT_INPUT> croutons <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 oz. cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. margarine <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. cooked, cubed chicken <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. pimento, chopped (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) can crescent rolls <NEXT_INGR> seasoned croutons <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend cream cheese and margarine until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken, salt, pepper, onion and pimento. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> (Add a small amount of milk if mixture is too stiff.) <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Crescent Chicken Squares <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> apricot <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup butter, at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups nuts, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 12 ounces apricot jam <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup confectioners' sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream butter and cream cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Add flour and baking powder. Mix to form a dough. Chill dough for 2 to 3 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix nuts, jam, and sugar for filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide dough into 4 equal parts, working with one-quarter of the dough at a time. Refrigerate remaining dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll dough very thin on lightly floured board. Cut into 2-inch squares and place on baking sheet. Put 1 teaspoon of nut filling in center of square and top with another square of dough. Press edges together with a floured fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool slightly and dust with confectioners' sugar. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Nutjammer Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Philadelphia cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 oz. Philadelphia cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> dash of salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/5 c. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. bananas <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. crushed pineapple <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. nuts <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. Cool Whip <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 lb.) can cranberry sauce, cubed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients together. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into mold and freeze. After salad is frozen, pour out upside down on plate and ice with Cool Whip. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cranberry Chunk Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flank steak <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 flank steak or round steak <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium onions, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 4 carrots, cut into 1 inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 6 medium to large potatoes <NEXT_INGR> melted butter <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Remove all fat from steak. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut steak into 1 1/2 inch cubes. Place in deep 3-quart casserole dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover steak with sliced onions, separated into rings. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add enough water to barely cover meat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover onions with sliced carrots. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel potatoes and cut into slices (not too thin). <NEXT_INSTR> Rinse well. Layer the potatoes on top of carrots, sprinkling the layers with a little salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush top layer with melted butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 400°, uncovered, for about 2 1/2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> If top layer of potatoes is becoming too brown, cover loosely with foil during last 1/2 hour of cooking. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> English Hot Pot <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> cottage cheese <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> kernel corn <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> white bread <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 10 ounces frozen chopped broccoli <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 cups cottage cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs (Can cut back to 1 if extra large) <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons butter, divided <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 18 cup onion, finely minced <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces whole kernel corn, drained <NEXT_INGR> 14 lb diced cheddar cheese or 14 lb swiss cheese <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 18 teaspoon black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 drops hot pepper sauce, to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 slice white bread <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup crumbled cooked bacon <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook broccoli according to package directions and drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine cottage cheese, eggs, 2 tablespoons butter and flour in blender or mixing bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend or beat until cottage cheese mixture is smooth and creamy. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in broccoli, onion, corn, cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, and a couple of drops of hot pepper sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour cottage cheese mixture into a greased, deep casserole. <NEXT_INSTR> Make soft bread crumbs by tearing 1 slice of white bread into blender container and blending on low speed until soft crumbs are formed. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Add soft bread crumbs and saute until golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle buttered bread crumbs and bacon over cottage cheese mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350F 1 hour, or until mixture is set. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dianne's Broccoli <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pancake mix <NEXT_INPUT> food coloring <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> pancake mix <NEXT_INGR> food coloring <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Make pancake mix. Separate a portion of mix and add food coloring. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat pan and drop small drops of batter into the pan in a happy face design with eyes, nose and a smile. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook for 1 minute, then pour batter over and around the face. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook as usual. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Happy Face Pancakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> white chicken meat <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> pepper cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Velveeta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 (8 ounce) cans white chicken meat, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces monterey jack pepper cheese <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup Velveeta cheese <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 -2 cup onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces sour cream <NEXT_INGR> garlic powder, to your liking <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put everything in a small crockpot to melt everything together. <NEXT_INSTR> The amount of onion and garlic powder is to your liking. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir as needed. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with Tostido Scoops. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hot Chicken Dip <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> boiling water <NEXT_INPUT> oatmeal <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/4 c. boiling water <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. oatmeal <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. firmly packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 tsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. nutmeg <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pour boiling water over oatmeal and let set 20 minutes while you mix next ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Cream butter or margarine, sugar, brown sugar, vanilla and eggs together. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg together. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to creamed mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Add oatmeal if 20 minutes is up. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour batter into a greased and floured 9-inch square pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 50 to 55 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lazy Daisy Oatmeal Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Dough <NEXT_INPUT> Shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> American Sauce <NEXT_INPUT> -Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Ravioli Dough <NEXT_INGR> Shrimp Ravioli <NEXT_INGR> American Sauce <NEXT_INGR> -Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> -ground pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1.	Put water in a large pot (3/4 of the pot) and let it boil at a high flame for 10min <NEXT_INSTR> 2.	While the water boils, put the flour and salt in a large bowl and make a hole in the middle about the size of a ping pong. <NEXT_INSTR> 3.	Crack the egg into the hole of the flour and make sure there are no shells in it <NEXT_INSTR> 4.	Combine flour and egg with a fork <NEXT_INSTR> 5.	With your hand, combine mixture together until a ball forms. <NEXT_INSTR> 6.	Knead dough for 5min <NEXT_INSTR> 7.	Put the dough in a clean wrap and make sure there are no holes for air to come in. Leave the dough aside at rest 20 -30 minutes <NEXT_INSTR> 8.	In another small bowl mix the finely chopped shrimp with no tail, oyster sauce and minced ginger. Leave it aside in the bowl for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> 9.	After the dough has rested, roll it out and knead it. Put it through the pasta roller up to level 7 so that it's very thin. <NEXT_INSTR> 10.	After it has become very thin, lay it out on a flat clean floured surface <NEXT_INSTR> 11.	Use circular shaped cookie cutter and cut out 12 circles. Try to cut the pieces close to each other so as not to waste dough. <NEXT_INSTR> 12.	Scoop about a tablespoon/teaspoon of shrimp, depending on the size of the dough circle, and put it onto the middle of the dough. <NEXT_INSTR> 13.	Spread a little water on the edge of the circle dough and then fold it in half. Then press down on the edges with a fork so it looks like a half semi-circle. <NEXT_INSTR> 14.	In a blender, mix 4 tin peeled tomatoes until it is a lumpy consistency <NEXT_INSTR> 15.	In a saucepan, add in the oil and garlic for 1 min. <NEXT_INSTR> 16.	Add blended whole peeled tomatoes, limes zest and salt into the sauce pan and stir until mixed. Leave to simmer for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> 17.	Cook ravioli in boiling water and take out when they raise to the top (4-6min) then you can take it out on to a strainer. <NEXT_INSTR> 18.	On two plates put six raviolis lined up against each other. Pour tomato sauce in a thick line over raviolis. Garnish by sprinkling cheese on top and add basil by one of the raviolis. Sprinkle salt and pepper, not too much, for flavoring. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shrimp Ravioli With Tomato Sauce  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shredded red <NEXT_INPUT> bean sprouts <NEXT_INPUT> Dressing <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> soya sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup each: shredded red and green cabbage and carrots <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup each: bean sprouts and sliced water chestnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup Kraft Classic Herb Dressing <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. honey <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. soya sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> COMBINE cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts and chestnuts. <NEXT_INSTR> COMBINE dressing with honey and soya sauce; add to vegetables and toss well. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> KRAFT Asian Coleslaw <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> 's Italian <NEXT_INPUT> Italian seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> garlic powder <NEXT_INPUT> egg noodles <NEXT_INPUT> frozen creamed spinach <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 boneless chicken breasts <NEXT_INGR> 1 can Hunt's Italian tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. Italian seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. egg noodles <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. frozen creamed spinach <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. grated Parmesan <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place chicken breasts in foiled pan; cover with seasoning, garlic powder and tomato sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes. Cook egg noodles; drain and cook packed cream spinach. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix egg noodles and spinach together; place on bottom of casserole dish. When chicken is ready, place chicken on top of noodles. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with Parmesan. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover; heat until cheese is melted. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Creame De Spinach <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> frozen prepared poundcake <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> topping <NEXT_INPUT> lemon pudding <NEXT_INPUT> blueberries <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 frozen prepared poundcake (or sugar free angel food cake) <NEXT_INGR> 1 lemon <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) container sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) whipped topping (can be sugar free) <NEXT_INGR> 2 (3 1/2 ounce) packages instant lemon pudding (can be sugar free) or (3 1/2 ounce) packages pie filling (can be sugar free) <NEXT_INGR> 1 pint blueberries <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cut pound cake into cubes and place in large colander. Sprinkle juice from 1 lemon over cake. Toss gently. <NEXT_INSTR> In separate bowl combine milk, sour cream and half of whipped topping, whisk until smooth. Add pudding and whisk until pudding begins to thicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Set 10 blueberries aside for garnish (optional). Place 1/3 of cake in bottom of bowl(glass bowl make a pretty presentation). Top with 1/3 of blueberries. Then top with 1/3 of the pudding mixture and spread evenly. Repeat layers 1-2 more times. <NEXT_INSTR> You can decorate the top with remaining whipped cream and reserved berries if you would like. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Blueberry Trifle (Sugar Free) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> pappadums <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup unsweetened shredded coconut (about 2 ounces); see Note <NEXT_INGR> 12 medium shrimpshelled, halved lengthwise and deveined <NEXT_INGR> Salt and freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons honey <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup prepared hummus (about 4 ounces) <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons Madras curry powder <NEXT_INGR> 24 miniature pappadums <NEXT_INGR> 24 fresh cilantro leaves <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 350. <NEXT_INSTR> Toast the coconut for about 5 minutes, tossing occasionally, until golden and crisp. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a plate and let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Season the shrimp with salt and pepper and brush with the honey. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss the shrimp in the coconut and arrange them on a baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for about 7 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, combine the hummus and curry powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a pastry bag fitted with a small round tip and pipe a dime-size amount of curried hummus on each pappadum. <NEXT_INSTR> Alternatively, dollop the hummus on the pappadums. <NEXT_INSTR> Top each pappadum with a coconut shrimp, garnish with a cilantro leaf and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Coconut Shrimp with Curried Hummus <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chile paste <NEXT_INPUT> ancho chiles <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> pork filling <NEXT_INPUT> four-to-five-pound bone <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> lard <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> chile paste <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> fresh masa <NEXT_INPUT> lard <NEXT_INPUT> pork stock <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> chile paste <NEXT_INPUT> tamales <NEXT_INPUT> corn husks <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> The chile paste : <NEXT_INGR> 20 to 25 ancho chiles, seeds and stems removed <NEXT_INGR> hot water for soaking <NEXT_INGR> The pork filling : <NEXT_INGR> 1 four-to-five-pound bone-in pork butt <NEXT_INGR> 1 large onion, quartered <NEXT_INGR> 8 garlic cloves, 4 whole and 4 minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 8 tablespoons lard <NEXT_INGR> 2 to 4 tablespoons ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup chile paste <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> The masa : <NEXT_INGR> 1 ten-pound bag fresh masa (available at Fiesta supermarkets) <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/4 pounds lard <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 to 1/3 cup pork stock, warm <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons salt, or to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup chile paste, or to taste <NEXT_INGR> The tamales : <NEXT_INGR> 4 to 5 bags dried corn husks (available at Mexican supermarkets) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> The chile paste : <NEXT_INSTR> Soak chiles in water until soft. In a food processor, grind chiles into a thick paste, adding the soaking water as needed. (To make tamales spicy, also prepare 10 to 12 arbol chiles in the same way.) Set aside to use in filling and masa. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> The pork filling : <NEXT_INSTR> Cover the pork with water in a deep, heavy pot and boil with onion, whole garlic cloves, salt,and pepper for 90 minutes, or until the meat's internal temperature reaches 160 degrees. Reserve at least 2 cups of pork stock. Remove the pork, allow to cool, then shred the meat, discarding bone and excess fat. Melt the lard in a large cast-iron skillet over medium heat. Add 2 tablespoons cumin, minced garlic, and 1/2 cup chile paste and saute for 3 to 4 minutes, until fragrant. Add shredded meat and enough stock to moisten the mixture. Add remaining chile paste, cumin, salt, and pepper to taste (use arbol paste here if you want heat). Set aside. Filling may be prepared a day ahead. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> The masa : <NEXT_INSTR> On a large work space, knead the lard into the fresh masa for 10 to 15 minutes, adding pork stock a little at a time until the masa is cohesive. Add salt and chile paste to taste. You can test the masa's readiness by dropping a small amount in a glass of water: if it floats, it is ready to spread. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> The tamales : <NEXT_INSTR> Soak husks in warm water overnight. When you're ready to start, dry off a handful and place within reach. Take a husk and thinly spread 2 or 3 tablespoons of the masa on its smooth side, covering the bottom two thirds of the husk. Down the middle of the masa, place about a tablespoon or so of filling. Now fold one side of the husk over the filling, followed by the other side. Then fold the bottom end of the husk toward the exposed edge. Repeat until all the tamales have been made. <NEXT_INSTR> Fill steamer pot with water to bottom of basket and bring to a boil. Fill basket with tamales, placed vertically with open end up. Secure lid and steam until masa is firm, about 90 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pork Tamales  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> spinach <NEXT_INPUT> sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> rice-wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> sesame seeds <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 3 lb. spinach <NEXT_INGR> 4 tsp. sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 tsp. rice-wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. roasted sesame seeds <NEXT_INGR> Coarse salt and freshly ground pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring the water to a boil in a large saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add spinach one bunch at a time, covering pan after each addition and adding more spinach once the prior batch has wilted. <NEXT_INSTR> When all spinach is in the pan, let steam, covered, until completely wilted, about 30 seconds. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain spinach in a colander, pressing down with a wooden spoon to extract as much liquid as possible; let cool slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer spinach to a serving bowl, and drizzle with sesame oil, vinegar, and half the toasted sesame seeds. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss well to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve warm, at room temperature, or chilled, and garnish with remaining sesame seeds. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sesame Steamed Spinach <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Chinese <NEXT_INPUT> tree ears <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> rice wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> lean pork <NEXT_INPUT> matchstick <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> ground white pepper <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> scallions <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 dried Chinese (or shiitake) mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup tree ears, optional <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups canned chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 5 tablespoons rice wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup lean pork (from a center-cut pork chop), cut into julienne strips <NEXT_INGR> 1 block firm tofu (about 4 ounces), rinsed and cut into 1/4-inch cubes (about 3/4 cup) <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup matchstick-cut canned bamboo shoots, rinsed and drained <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg, well-beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons chopped scallions <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a small bowl, soak mushrooms in 1/2 cup hot water for 15 minutes. Drain and squeeze dry; reserve soaking liquid. Cut off and discard stems; slice caps thinly. In a small bowl, soak the tree ears (if using) in 1/2 cup hot water for 30 minutes. Drain and squeeze dry. Remove any hard spots, and roughly chop the tree ears. Discard the soaking liquid. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large saucepan, combine broth, 1 cup water, vinegar, and reserved mushroom liquid; bring to a boil over high heat. Add pork, mushrooms, tree ears, tofu, and bamboo shoots. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and 3 tablespoons cold water. When soup returns to a boil, stir in cornstarch mixture, stirring constantly until soup is just thickened (about 30 seconds). Stir in egg, and remove from heat. Stir in the oil, white pepper, sugar, and scallions. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hot-And-Sour Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> whole wheat flour <NEXT_INPUT> corn meal <NEXT_INPUT> soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> molasses <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <NEXT_INPUT> water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. corn meal <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. molasses <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. raisins <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. hot water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine dry <NEXT_INSTR> ingredients <NEXT_INSTR> in a large bowl; add molasses and buttermilk, mixing well. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in raisins. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Brown Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> light molasses <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> sour milk <NEXT_INPUT> germ <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/4 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/4 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. light molasses <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. mashed bananas <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. sour milk or buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. wheat germ (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sift flour, soda, baking powder and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in wheat germ. Cream together butter or margarine, sugar and molasses. <NEXT_INSTR> Add eggs and beat well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add flour mixture alternately with bananas and milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat after each addition. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour mixture into a greased pan. Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until done. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool slightly. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dark Banana Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> wholemeal flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground cloves <NEXT_INPUT> allspice <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 50 g butter <NEXT_INGR> 450 g wholemeal flour <NEXT_INGR> 20 g baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 50 g brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 teaspoon allspice <NEXT_INGR> 150 ml skim milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vegetable oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sift the flour, baking powder and salt into a bowl. Mix-in the sugar and spiced then add the butter. Rub the butter into the mixture until it comes to resemble fine breadcrumb. <NEXT_INSTR> Form a well in the centre and add the milk and egg. Mix the ingredients together into a stiff dough and tip onto a floured board. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead the dough for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic. <NEXT_INSTR> Grease the inside of a 900g loaf tin with oil and place the dough in this. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook for 45 minutes in an oven pre-heated to 200°C Like any bread the loaf should sound hollow when tapped. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Veldt Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> plain yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> petals <NEXT_INPUT> powdered sugar <NEXT_INPUT> rosewater <NEXT_INPUT> food color <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons butter at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 2 egg whites <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup plain yogurt <NEXT_INGR> rose petals Frosted, to decorate, optional <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar sifted <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons rosewater <NEXT_INGR> food color Pink <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 375°F. Line 14 cups of a muffin pan with paper liners. Mix flour, baking powder and baking soda in a medium bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat butter and sugar in a large bowl with electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add egg and egg whites, one at a time, beating well each addition. Fold in flour mixture alternately with yogurt. Spoon into muffin cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 15-20 mins, until well risen, golden and a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool in pan 5 mins. Remove from pan; cool completely on a wire rack. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, for the rose icing, combine powdered sugar, rosewater, a few drops of food color and 1 tbsp hot water. Stir until smooth and shiny. Frost cupcakes and decorate with frosted rose petals, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> For the frosted rose petals, whisk an egg white until foamy and brush onto rose petals (make sure they are unsprayed and safe to eat). Place petals on paper towel and dust with granulated sugar. Set aside to dry in the sun, if possible. Store in an airtight container. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Rose Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> banana <NEXT_INPUT> honey <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 ripe banana <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon honey <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Dip banana into honey or mix into your favorite smoothie. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Anemic Build Your Blood With Honey And Bananas <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 Yukon Gold potatoes <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons chopped parsley <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Peel the potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch wedges. <NEXT_INSTR> Dry the potatoes with a towel. <NEXT_INSTR> To a heated skillet, add the oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the potatoes, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute the potatoes for about 3 minutes, stirring to make sure the potatoes are well covered in oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a preheated 340 degree oven for about 30 minutes until the potatoes are golden and cooked through. <NEXT_INSTR> After 15 minutes, toss the potatoes and continue roasting. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss the potatoes with the parsley just before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Roasted Potato Wedges <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orange Jell-O <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> cottage cheese <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 oz. pkg. orange Jell-O <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. grated carrots <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped celery <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. cottage cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped green pepper (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Dissolve gelatin in water (boiling). <NEXT_INSTR> Add mayonnaise. <NEXT_INSTR> When cool, add cheese and vegetables. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn into mold; chill to set. To serve, cut into squares or invert mold onto serving platter and garnish with green olives or other vegetable decorations. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 6 to 8 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Vegetable Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> curry <NEXT_INPUT> onion soup <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 250 gm cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. lowfat sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 470 gm asparagus tips, tinned <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp curry pwdr <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. French onion soup mix <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. parsley, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp mustard, French salt, pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Beat cream cheese, lowfat sour cream and mayonnaise till smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain asparagus (reserve 1/4 c. asparagus liquid). <NEXT_INSTR> Chop asparagus, add in to cream cheese mix with reserved liquid, curry pwdr, dry soup mix, lemon juice, parsley and mustard, season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill at least 1 hour before serving. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 6. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with crackers or possibly vegetable crudites at your next dinner party. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Asparagus Dip Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> cucumbers <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 kg Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 3 cucumbers (medium sized) <NEXT_INGR> 4 garlic cloves, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Wash and cut the cucumber very fine (it can be grated too). <NEXT_INSTR> Place cucumber into a clean tea towel and squeeze out all the liquid (your hands will hurt after ward). <NEXT_INSTR> Place all the ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve! <NEXT_INSTR> Flavours develop over time, so the longer you leave it in the fridge, the stronger the flavours will be. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Alfred's Iranian Yoghurt and Cucumber Dip <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Swiss cheese <NEXT_INPUT> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> stuffing <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 18 oz. Swiss cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 pkg. boneless chicken breasts <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 can evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> Pepperidge Farm stuffing <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 stick butter, melted <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place slices of Swiss cheese in an 8 x 10-inch baking pan. Add boneless chicken, salt, pepper and garlic powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine cream of chicken soup and milk over chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with a layer of stuffing. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour melted butter over stuffing and cook at 350° for one hour. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Swiss Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> frozen strawberries <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 tsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 c. oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen strawberries, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1 small can crushed pineapple <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 c. chopped pecans <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
