Combine flour, sugar, cinnamon, salt and baking soda in large bowl. Add oil and eggs; mix thoroughly. Stir in strawberries, pineapple and pecans. Pour batter into two greased and floured loaf pans. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Wrap loaves tightly in foil overnight. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Strawberry Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sweet potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> grated coconut <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallows <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 large or 1 large can sweet potatoes (yams) <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb. pineapple juice (now if needed) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 Tbsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium can pineapple slices <NEXT_INGR> 1 small can grated coconut <NEXT_INGR> 1 large bag marshmallows <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mash sweet potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add butter, salt, pineapple juice, brown sugar and cinnamon. <NEXT_INSTR> Place pineapple slices in large baking dish. Roll sweet potato mixture around a marshmallow to form a ball. Then roll sweet potato ball in coconut. <NEXT_INSTR> Place ball in the center of a pineapple slice. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 250° until marshmallow melts or for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 1 to 2 dozen. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet Potato Balls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> roll grands big <NEXT_INPUT> roll <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 roll grands big flaky biscuits <NEXT_INGR> 1 roll Jimmy dean's sausage <NEXT_INGR> 3 cup cheese <NEXT_INGR> 12 eggs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cut each biscuit into 4 ' s and layer on bottom of casserole dish <NEXT_INSTR> Cook the sausage, when done sprinkle over the biscuits. <NEXT_INSTR> You can substitute bacon also, or use them both. <NEXT_INSTR> Layer grated cheese over the sausage. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the eggs and pour over everything. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350 for about 25 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bubble Up Breakfast Bake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> broccoli slaw mixed salad greens <NEXT_INPUT> yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> rice vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (12 ounce) package broccoli slaw mixed salad greens <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons plain low-fat Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons rice vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 teaspoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 serving(s) sun maid raisins <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add the broccoli slaw and raisins to a large mixing bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine remaining ingredients in a measuring cup. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk together until the dressing is smooth and emulsified. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the dressing over the broccoli slaw. Stir well to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Let broccoli slaw rest for at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours, stirring occasionally to redistribute the dressing that will settle on the bottom of the bowl. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Weight Watchers Broccoli Slaw <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> tomato soup <NEXT_INPUT> cheese soup <NEXT_INPUT> bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> noodles <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic salt <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lbs 80% lean ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can tomato soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can cheese soup <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup bell pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 -10 ounce) package fine noodles <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chili powder <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat in cooker: beef, pepper and onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until slightly brown. <NEXT_INSTR> (drain if using beef with a higher fat) <NEXT_INSTR> Add chili powder,garlic salt and salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle dry noodle (uncooked) over top. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water, tomato and mushroom soup over meat mixture without stirring. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover. <NEXT_INSTR> When steaming hot, turn down heat and simmer 25 minutes <NEXT_INSTR> Spread cheese soup on top and cook 5 more minutes <NEXT_INSTR> This is an easy layered dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Can be made in crock pot. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mom's Mezetta <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolk <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> orange marmalade <NEXT_INPUT> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> cream of tartar <NEXT_INPUT> confectioners <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup flour <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg yolk <NEXT_INGR> 2 12 tablespoons sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup orange marmalade (or other tart preserves) <NEXT_INGR> 4 egg whites <NEXT_INGR> 18 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup confectioners' sugar <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon vanilla <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix together flour, butter, sugar, vanilla, egg yolk, sour cream and baking powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Work until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in fridge for 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll out dough and placed on a small, greased cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Pierce with a fork in several places before putting it into the oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350 for 25 - 30 minutes or until lightly golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove and cool slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Lower oven temp to 300 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread the marmalade over the top of the pastry. <NEXT_INSTR> Whip the egg whites with the cream of tartar, sugar and vanilla until stiff peaks form. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread over the pastry. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 300 degrees for 15 - 20 minutes or until meringue develops a slight "blush". <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lithuanian Semi-Crisp Meringue Pastry <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<NEXT_INPUT> gravlax <NEXT_INPUT> dill <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion powder <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> dried leaf oregano <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups coarsely chopped onion, plus 1 cup finely diced <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup coarsely chopped celery, plus 1/2 cup finely diced <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup coarsely chopped carrots, plus 1/2 cup finely diced <NEXT_INGR> 2 lovage stalks, roughly chopped, plus 2 tablespoons leaves, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 cloves garlic, smashed, plus 1 1/2 teaspoons minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 salmon carcass from a 4 to 5 pound salmon, cut into 3-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 2 bay leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> 3 quarts water <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon black peppercorns <NEXT_INGR> 5 parsley stems <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt, plus 2 teaspoons <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 pounds Idaho potatoes, peeled and cubed <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon Essence, recipe follows <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 12 slices gravlax <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped fresh dill <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 tablespoons paprika <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon onion powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon dried thyme <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large stockpot over medium-high heat, add 1 tablespoon of the olive oil to the pot as well as the chopped onion, chopped celery, chopped carrots, chopped lovage stalks and smashed garlic cloves. <NEXT_INSTR> Sweat the vegetables for 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the salmon bones and the bay leaves and continue to cook the bones and vegetables for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Deglaze with the white wine. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the water, peppercorns, parsley stems, and 1 teaspoon of salt and bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce to a simmer and cook for 45 minutes to 1 hour, until the broth is very flavorful. <NEXT_INSTR> After 45 minutes, strain the stock and reserve for the soup. <NEXT_INSTR> Discard the solids. <NEXT_INSTR> In a 6-quart stockpot set over a medium-high heat, add the remaining olive oil and cook the finely diced onion, celery and carrots for 5 minutes or until the onions are translucent. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the minced garlic and sweat for 30 seconds. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the stock over the vegetables, and add the potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring the pot to a boil and then reduce to a simmer. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook the soup for 40 to 45 minutes, or until the potatoes begin to burst. <NEXT_INSTR> Season the soup with the remaining salt, Essence and black pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Puree the soup using an immersion blender until smooth, and then add the cream and chopped lovage to the soup. <NEXT_INSTR> Adjust the seasoning, and remove from the heat. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve, ladle 1 cup of soup in a bowl and make a rosette with a slice of gravlax. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the gravlax in the center of the soup, and sprinkle the dill around the rosette. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine all ingredients thoroughly and store in an airtight jar or container. <NEXT_INSTR> Yield: about 2/3 cup <NEXT_INSTR> Recipe from "New New Orleans Cooking", by Emeril Lagasse and Jessie Tirsch. <NEXT_INSTR> Published by William and Morrow, 1993. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Potato, Salmon and Lovage Soup with Gravlax and Fresh Dill <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Cake <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> lemons <NEXT_INPUT> granulated sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Cake <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup almonds, blanched <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking powder (double-acting) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, graded large <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 ounce lemon extract <NEXT_INGR> 3 lemons, sized medium (or 2 large, use grated rind in cake, and 1/3 cup of the juice for the glaze) <NEXT_INGR> Glaze <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup granulated sugar, plus <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup lemon juice, fresh (from lemons listed above) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Spray an 8-1/2"x5" loaf pan with baking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Grind almonds very fine and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small heavy saucepan, melt butter. Transfer to a large bowl. With electric mixer, add sugar and beat a bit to mix. <NEXT_INSTR> On low speed, beat in eggs one at a time, beating only to mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add dry ingredients in three additions, alternating with milk in two additions, scraping bowl with a spatula and beating until mixed after each addition. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in lemon extract. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from mixer. Stir in grated rind, then stir in ground almonds. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn mixture into pan. (It will be thin.) Bake at 350 for 65-75 minutes. (During baking, cake will form a large crack or two on top, and crack(s) will remain light in color.). <NEXT_INSTR> A few minutes before cake is finished, prepare glaze: stir sugar and lemon juice in a small saucepan over moderate heat, only until sugar is just dissolved. (Don't boil!). <NEXT_INSTR> When cake is removed from the oven, let it stand for 2-3 minutes. Then, using brush, brush the hot glaze gradually over the hot cake. Glaze should not be applied quickly; it should take about 5 minutes to apply all the glaze. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cake stand until not quite completely cool. Then gently invert onto a rack and turn right side up. When cool, wrap in plastic wrap or foil and let stand 12-24 hours before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Maida Heatter'S Best Darn Lemon Cake Ever <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> lard <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> warm water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> yeast <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. lard (Crisco) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 6-8 c. all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. warm water <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 pkg. yeast <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Stir eggs, vanilla, sugars, milk, water, and lard. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 6-8 c. all-purpose flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Dissolve yeast pkg. in 1/2 c. warm water and 1 Tbsp. sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Add yeast mixture to flour mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead together and let rise. <NEXT_INSTR> After risen, roll out <NEXT_INSTR> and spread butter, cinnamon, and sugar (brown or white). Roll up and slice desired amount of cinnamon rolls. <NEXT_INSTR> Let rolls rise again. <NEXT_INSTR> Put 1 stick of melted butter and 1 c. sugar into a baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Place rolls into pan. Cook for 25-30 minutes at 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with glaze. <NEXT_INSTR> Dough will stay good in refrigerator up to 5 days. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cinnamon Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ouncesTomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> italian seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> fennel seeds <NEXT_INPUT> red hot chili pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 ouncesTomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons italian seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound ground turkey raw <NEXT_INGR> 1 each garlic cloves large, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon fennel seeds <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon red hot chili pepper, dried crushed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine tomato sauce, 1 teaspoon italian seasoning and 18 teaspoon salt in a small saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook over medium heat until hot; set aside and keep warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine turkey, garlic, remaining 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning, fennel seeds, pepper and 18 teaspoon salt, stir until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide mixture into 4 equal portions and shape into 1/2 inch hick patties. <NEXT_INSTR> Coat a largenonstick skillet with cooking spray; place over medium heat until hot. <NEXT_INSTR> Add patties and cook about 9 minutes or until done, turning once. <NEXT_INSTR> Place patties on a serving platter; top with sauce. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spicy Italian Patties <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> nonfat yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> ground turkey <NEXT_INPUT> yellow onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> coarse salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste <NEXT_INPUT> fresh oregano <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> eggplants <NEXT_INPUT> Olive oil cooking spray <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> egg <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups plain nonfat yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound ground turkey <NEXT_INGR> 1 yellow onion, cut into 1/4-inch dice <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon coarse salt, plus more for eggplant <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 28-ounce can whole peeled tomatoes, coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped fresh oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium eggplants (about 2 pounds) <NEXT_INGR> Olive oil cooking spray <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup (1 ounce) grated Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg plus 1 large egg white <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Drain the yogurt in a cheesecloth-lined sieve until thickened, 2 hours or overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the turkey in a medium saucepan over medium; cook until browned, about 6 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a medium bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onion, garlic, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg, and pepper to the saucepan; cook until the onion is translucent, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Return the turkey to the saucepan; add the tomatoes, tomato paste, and oregano. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil; reduce heat, and simmer until the sauce has thickened, about 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat; stir in the chopped parsley. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the broiler. <NEXT_INSTR> While the sauce cooks, cut the eggplants into 1/4-inch slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with salt on both sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in a colander over a bowl; let stand 1 hour to drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Discard the liquid; rinse each slice under cold running water to remove all salt and juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the slices on several layers of paper towels; press out water. <NEXT_INSTR> Lay the dry slices on a clean baking sheet; coat with olive oil spray; broil until browned, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn; coat with olive oil spray; broil until browned, about 2 minutes more. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat until all the eggplant slices have been broiled; set the cooked eggplant aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the drained yogurt in a small bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the Parmesan and eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk together briskly with a fork; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat the oven to 400F. <NEXT_INSTR> Assemble the moussaka: Place a layer of eggplant on the bottom of an 8 x 8-inch baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with half the turkey sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Place another eggplant layer, then the remaining turkey sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Add a final eggplant layer; cover with reserved yogurt mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake until the mixture is bubbling and the top starts to brown, about 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a heatproof surface; let sit until the moussaka cools slightly and firms, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut into squares; serve. <NEXT_INSTR> (Per serving) <NEXT_INSTR> Calories: 266 <NEXT_INSTR> Fat: 9g <NEXT_INSTR> Cholesterol: 102mg <NEXT_INSTR> Carbohydrate: 23g <NEXT_INSTR> Sodium: 510mg <NEXT_INSTR> Protein: 25g <NEXT_INSTR> Fiber: 3g <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Moussaka <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> deli ham <NEXT_INPUT> pastrami <NEXT_INPUT> thin brisket <NEXT_INPUT> sour <NEXT_INPUT> swiss <NEXT_INPUT> condiments <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb sliced deli ham <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb sliced pastrami <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb cooked and sliced thin brisket <NEXT_INGR> 8 sour dough or Kaiser rolls ( sub rolls are fine also ) <NEXT_INGR> 8 slice swiss, american, cheddar or pepper Jack cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 condiments of your choice ( mayo, mustard, lettuce, tomato etc...) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> You can use bakery style rolls of your choice or make fresh homemade ones. <NEXT_INSTR> Split the rolls in half and add mayo to both sides of bread. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat skillet or griddle to 350 and place mayo side down onto hot griddle and fry until golden brown and slightly crispy. <NEXT_INSTR> Can use butter in place of mayo. <NEXT_INSTR> Take deli meats and fry to heat and give it a little crispness but not a lot. <NEXT_INSTR> I like doing mine separate, but you can always toss them together and fry if you like. <NEXT_INSTR> I make mine the size to fit on each roll in piles but you can always just add meat after frying to suit your size. <NEXT_INSTR> Take cheeses of your choice and place on top of meats while still hot and until melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Place meat and cheese onto roll and top with condiments of your liking. <NEXT_INSTR> I use 3 different kinds of cheese because I like mine cheesy. <NEXT_INSTR> :) <NEXT_INSTR> Put tops onto sandwich and toast in toaster oven or broiler just until slightly brown and crispy. <NEXT_INSTR> This is optional. <NEXT_INSTR> I just like my tops toasted some. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve hot with chips, pickles or anything you like. <NEXT_INSTR> You can also use any meats you like. <NEXT_INSTR> I cook my brisket in crock pot, but the deli has fully cooked brisket or corned beef also. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fry Me To the Moon Sub Sandwich <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 32 large fresh mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup olive oil or 12 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, minced <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Remove stems from mushrooms, reserve caps. <NEXT_INSTR> In bowl, combine oil and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Add mushroom caps to oil mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss to coat. <NEXT_INSTR> remove mushrooms with slotted spoon and place on sheet of heavy duty foil. <NEXT_INSTR> Seal edges tightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill over medium hot coals for 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Can add these right on the grill with 10 or 15 minutes before meat is done. <NEXT_INSTR> Carefully open packet because these will be hot. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Garlic Mushrooms <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beef roast <NEXT_INPUT> Italian salad dressing <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> seasoning mix <NEXT_INPUT> barbecue sauce <NEXT_INPUT> spicy mustard <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 lbs beef roast <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup fat-free Italian salad dressing <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon onion, minced <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Mrs. Dash seasoning mix (or 2 tbsp Coco Cola) <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup barbecue sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon spicy mustard (your favorite) <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon parsley <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients together really well in crock-pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Set pot roast in crock pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Set on low for 8-10 hours or on High for 4-5 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Beef Roast Marinade- Yummy <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> limes <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> grapefruit juice <NEXT_INPUT> tequila <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 limes <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup (85g) honey or agave syrup, see notes above <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup grapefruit juice or 3 to 4 cups strawberries or blueberries, see notes above <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup (240 ml) tequila <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups (720) ice cubes <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Peel three of the limes by lopping off the tops and the bottoms of each one, cutting just deep enough to expose the fruit beneath the pith. Stand each lime on your cutting board-it should be nice and steady. Cut the remaining peel and pith off the lime in wide strips, working your way around the fruit, so that you end up with a complete, peeled piece of fruit. Discard the peels or reserve them from another use. (Julia likes to simmer them with water and brown sugar, then strain the liquid and serve it over ice. She notes that a little tequila wouldn't hurt one bit.) Cut the remaining lime into thin slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the peeled limes in a blender; add the honey or agave, juice (or 3 cups of the strawberries or blueberries), tequila, and salt; and blend until combined. Add the ice (see notes above-you likely will need to do this in batches) and let the machine run until the ice is totally blitzed and the mixture is very smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into four glasses and garnish with the lime slices. Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Red, White, And Blue Paloma Slushies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Stir and cook about 8 minutes, until the meat is no longer pink and fully cooked. <NEXT_INSTR> Add tomato sauce, tomato paste, barbecue sauce, Worcestershire, and hot sauce into the skillet. Stir. Simmer until thickened, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve on buns with extra sauce. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spenser'S Sloppy Joes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> avocados <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 ripe avocados, pitted, peeled and mashed <NEXT_INGR> 1 can RO*TEL HOT diced tomatoes &green chilies <NEXT_INGR> (DRAINED) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1TBS lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp salt <NEXT_INGR> black pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix avocados, drained tomatoes & chilies, onions, lime juice and salt in bowl until blended. Season with pepper to taste. Refrigerate before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Guacamole Caliente  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon melted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup spelt flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine milk and lemon juice in a bowl and set aside to sour, about 5 minutes. Add beaten egg and melted butter; stir to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine spelt flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl. Stir gently into milk mixture until just combined; batter will be lumpy. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a lightly oiled griddle over medium-high heat. Drop batter by large spoonfuls onto the griddle and cook until bubbles form and the edges are dry, 3 to 4 minutes. Flip and cook until browned on the other side, 1 to 2 minutes. Repeat with remaining batter. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spelt Pancakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> shallot <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> pistachios <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> canned lentils <NEXT_INPUT> sherry vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> apple <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 large shallot, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 large clove garlic, minced (about 2 tsp.) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup plus 1 Tbsp. dry-roasted, unsalted pistachios <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup canned lentils, rinsed and drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons sherry vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon unsalted butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1 tart apple <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a small nonstick skillet, warm oil over medium heat. Add shallot; saute until soft and lightly golden, about 4 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute longer. <NEXT_INSTR> In a mini food processor, combine 1/4 cup pistachios and a pinch of salt; pulse until finely chopped. Add lentils, vinegar and shallot mixture; season generously with salt and pepper. Pulse to combine. Add 2 to 3 tsp. water; pulse until smooth. Transfer to a small bowl and stir in butter, parsley and thyme. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Just before serving, core and cut apple into thin wedges (about 24 pieces). Spread 1 tsp. pate over each apple slice. Chop remaining pistachios, sprinkle over apple slices and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lentil "Pâté" With Apples <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> bourbon <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla bean <NEXT_INPUT> Vanilla ice cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lemon <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup firmly packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup bourbon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 vanilla bean, split* <NEXT_INGR> 6 ripe plums, pitted and halved <NEXT_INGR> Vanilla ice cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Using a vegetable peeler, remove thin layer of peel from lemon, leaving white pith intact. Halve lemon crosswise, and squeeze juice to equal 2 Tbsp. Place lemon juice, lemon peels, brown sugar, next 2 ingredients, and 2 Tbsp. water in a large skillet, and bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Remove skillet from heat; stir in bourbon and vanilla bean. <NEXT_INSTR> Return skillet to heat, and add plums, cut sides down. Cook, basting with pan sauce, 3 to 4 minutes or until plums are just tender and lightly caramelized. Remove skillet from heat; discard vanilla bean and lemon peels. Cool 5 minutes. Serve plums and pan sauce with ice cream. <NEXT_INSTR> *1 tsp. vanilla extract may be substituted. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bourbon-Soaked Plums <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> catsup <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> dry mustard <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> garlic powder <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 Tbsp. butter <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tbsp. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. catsup <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. dry mustard <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tbsp. cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 8 Tbsp. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 6 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 large onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tbsp. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 to 3 Tbsp. garlic powder <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large skillet, add the butter and heat on medium until melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onion and garlic and cook while stirring until lightly browned. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Store the sauce in a covered container in the refrigerator after each use. <NEXT_INSTR> Sauce goes well on beef, chicken or pork. <NEXT_INSTR> If using pork, try adding 1 to 2 tablespoons of curry powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 4 to 5 cups. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Col'S Spicy Barbecue Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> cherry pie filling <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (8 oz.) bowl Cool Whip <NEXT_INGR> 1 can Eagle Brand milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cherry pie filling <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. pecans, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. coconut <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 oz.) can crushed pineapple <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients together. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool until cool throughout. Garnish with a few more pecans on top. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pink Lady <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> green apples <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> red cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> light brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground cloves <NEXT_INPUT> ground allspice <NEXT_INPUT> red wine <NEXT_INPUT> currant jelly <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 4 green apples, peeled and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 large onion, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 lbs red cabbage, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup light brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon ground allspice <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup red wine <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons currant jelly <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt butter in a heavy large Dutch oven over medium high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add apples and onion and saute until tender, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in cabbage and stir frequently for about 8 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in sugar, vinegar, salt, cloves, and allspice. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook until cabbage is crisp-tender about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Uncover and add red wine and jelly and cook 5 minutes more. <NEXT_INSTR> Add salt and pepper to taste if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Swedish Red Cabbage <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> green tea <NEXT_INPUT> Lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Creamer <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 box Twinings pure green tea (k-cups) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp Lemon juice (no pulp) <NEXT_INGR> 10 oz Cup <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 as needed Creamer (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brew the green tea in a 10 ounce cup <NEXT_INSTR> Add lemon juice and stir <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Green Tea Detox For Keurig 2.0 <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken tenders <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> yellow pepper <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> flour tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> red chili pepper <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 pounds chicken tenders <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 ounce fajita seasoning mix <NEXT_INGR> 1 yellow pepper medium, seeded and cut into wide strips <NEXT_INGR> 1 green pepper medium, seeded and cut into wide strips <NEXT_INGR> 1 red onion large, cut into thin wedges <NEXT_INGR> 12 flour tortillas warmed <NEXT_INGR> 3 tomatoes medium ripe, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 red onion small, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 red chili pepper finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro finely <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place chicken in a large glass bowl. Add lemon juice and 1 tbsp of the oil; toss to combine. Add seasoning mix; toss to coat chicken. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 1 hour to marinate. For the tomato salsa, combine all ingredients in a medium bowl. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss peppers, onion and remaining 1 tbsp oil in a medium bowl. Preheat a grill pan to medium-high or preheat the grill on medium. Grill vegetables, in batches, for 3-5 mins or until tender. Transfer to a bowl; cover with foil to keep warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill chicken for 3-4 mins each side or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Cover with foil; let stand for 5 mins. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange chicken and vegetables on a platter. Serve with warm tortillas and salsa. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Fajitas With Fresh Tomato Salsa <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> coconut milk <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 chicken drummies <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups tomato in can <NEXT_INGR> 5/8 cup pineapple <NEXT_INGR> 3 3/8 tablespoons coconut milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 milliliter parsley <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic gloves <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 onion glove <NEXT_INGR> 2 carrots <NEXT_INGR> salt and paper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons flour <NEXT_INGR> 6 eggs <NEXT_INGR> oil for frying <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1. The drummies are placed in saucepan and frid in the olive oil for 2 -3 min <NEXT_INSTR> 2. Add chopped onion and carrots. <NEXT_INSTR> 3. Add 200 ml water after its evaporation add strain tomatoes, chopped (cubes) pineapple, coconut milk and minced garlic and parsley. <NEXT_INSTR> 4. Put salt and paper to taste and add water if needed. Leave it on the oven (middle Temperature) for about 40 min <NEXT_INSTR> 5. Hard boil 4 eggs and peel them. After it put thme in the paste made of 2 eggs and flour and fry them in hot oil till golden (yellow) <NEXT_INSTR> 6. Cut eggs on 4 and put them in the saucepan for 5 min <NEXT_INSTR> 7. Place it in dish <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken In Tomato Souse With Fried Eggs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> cranberries <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> cranberries <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ginger <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry syrup <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry bitters <NEXT_INPUT> orange bitters <NEXT_INPUT> gin <NEXT_INPUT> freshly squeezed lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> Q <NEXT_INPUT> cranberries <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups cranberries <NEXT_INGR> 1 cinnamon stick <NEXT_INGR> 16 cranberries <NEXT_INGR> 1-inch piece fresh ginger, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 ounce cranberry syrup <NEXT_INGR> Ice <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash cranberry bitters <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash orange bitters <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 ounces gin <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 ounce Averna or Ramazzotti Amaro <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 ounce freshly squeezed lime juice <NEXT_INGR> Splash Q Tonic <NEXT_INGR> Garnish: 3 whole cranberries and lime twist <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For the cranberry syrup: combine sugar, water, cranberries, and cinnamon stick in a small saucepan over medium heat, stirring frequently. Cook until sugar dissolves and cranberries soften and pop. Mash cranberries slightly. Let cool. Strain with a fine-mesh strainer and keep sealed in the refrigerator. <NEXT_INSTR> For the cocktail: Muddle cranberries, ginger, and cranberry syrup in the bottom of a cocktail shaker until cranberries have popped. Fill shaker with ice. Add bitters, gin, amaro, and lime. Shake well until chilled. Double strain into cocktail glass, top with splash of tonic, whole cranberries, and lime twist. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cranberry Crush Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon yeast <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups warm water <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups flour <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine yeast, water and sugar in a large mixing bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add all the flour at once. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead a few minutes until smooth and elastic. <NEXT_INSTR> Grease a deep pot with a lid. <NEXT_INSTR> Place dough in pot and cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Let rise for 1 hour, or until doubled in size. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 350°F. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake, covered, for 45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove lid and bake an additional 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from oven and take bread out of pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve hot with honey-citrus butter. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Maori Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Malibu rum <NEXT_INPUT> dark Creme <NEXT_INPUT> noyaux <NEXT_INPUT> scoop ice cream <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> grenadine <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 ounce Malibu rum <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 ounce dark Creme de Cacao <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 ounce creme de noyaux (or Amaretto) <NEXT_INGR> 1 scoop ice cream (vanilla, chocolate, coconut,pineapple sherbert your choice) <NEXT_INGR> 1 ounce pineapple juice <NEXT_INGR> grenadine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pour liquors into blender. <NEXT_INSTR> Add ice cream and pineapple, grenadine, 2 ice cubes and blend. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into a tall glass. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with pineapple or cherries. <NEXT_INSTR> Drink with a thick straw. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Creamy Almond Joy <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peaches <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> confectioners sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 large peeled and sliced peaches <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. plus 2 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. butter (room temperature) <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> confectioners sugar for top <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix peaches, 2 tablespoons of sugar and cinnamon in large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Cream butter and remaining sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Add eggs, one at a time until fluffy. <NEXT_INSTR> Add dry ingredients just until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour batter into greased 8 x 8-inch pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange peaches on top attractively. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake about 50 minutes or until done. Cool in pan; dust with sugar. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Summer Peach Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> turnips <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 medium turnips <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> bread crumbs, toasted <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Peel and slice turnips thin. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook in a little salted water, barely covering. <NEXT_INSTR> As soon as they are barely tender (do not overcook), drain and mash. <NEXT_INSTR> Add milk, margarine, salt and sugar. Put in greased casserole. <NEXT_INSTR> Add bread crumbs and cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Put into 375° oven, about 5 minutes or until cheese melts. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Baked Turnips <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> beans <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 large pkg. cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 can refried beans <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb. Monterey Jack cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large pie plate spread the cream cheese on the bottom. Next spread the beans over the cream cheese and then slice the cheese over the beans. Cover with wax paper. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat in microwave oven for 4 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mexican Dip <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pork <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> ginger paste <NEXT_INPUT> balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary leaf <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> cumin <NEXT_INPUT> white pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb boneless pork (cut into 2 inch by 5 inch chunks) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon minced ginger paste <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon fresh rosemary leaf <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon white pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a zip-style plastic bag, add olive oil, lemon juice, ginger, balsamic, rosemary, soy sauce, cumin, and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Close bag and thoroughly combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Reopen bag and add pork. <NEXT_INSTR> Reseal the bag and completely coat the pork. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in refrigerator for at least 1 hour to allow for marination. <NEXT_INSTR> To cook, simply place on a medium heat grill (turn occasionally) for approximately 10 - 15 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Grilled Rosemary-Ginger Pork <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> butternut squash <NEXT_INPUT> red peppers <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> stalks celery <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> black beans <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 -2 tablespoon olive oil (I used 2) <NEXT_INGR> 1 butternut squash, peeled and seeded chopped into 1" pieces <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium red peppers, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 small onions, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 stalks celery, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 (28 ounce) can crushed tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) can black beans, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) package frozen white shoepeg corn <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> shredded monterey jack cheese (, to garnish) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oil in large stockpot and add first 5 ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the rest of the ingredients (except the cheese) and bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with a little cheese sprinkled on top. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Wintertime Chili <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Cherry Tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Olive Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Dried Basil <NEXT_INPUT> Oregano <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Nuts <NEXT_INPUT> Romaine Lettuce <NEXT_INPUT> Mozzarella <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> Vinaigrette <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cups Cherry Tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Fresh Or Dried Rosemary Leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Garlic Powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Dried Basil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Dried Oregano <NEXT_INGR> Kosher Salt And Black Pepper To Taste <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Pine Nuts <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups Romaine Lettuce <NEXT_INGR> 2 ounces, weight Fresh Mozzarella, Cubed Into Small Chunks <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cups Pesto (homemade Or Store Bought) <NEXT_INGR> Balsamic Vinaigrette, For Serving <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1. To roast the tomatoes, preheat oven to 375 F. Wash and dry the tomatoes, then place in an 8x8 baking dish or on a rimmed baking sheet. Add olive oil, rosemary, garlic powder, dried basil and dried oregano and season with kosher salt and black pepper. Mix to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> 2. Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes. Take it out of the oven and let it cool for 5-10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> 3. To toast the pine nuts, place them into a small saute pan over medium heat. Toast the pine nuts for 1-2 minutes, tossing occasionally, just until the pine nuts begin to get a bit golden on the outside. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> 4. To assemble salad, place lettuce into a large bowl. Top with the chunks of mozzarella and the roasted tomatoes. Drizzle the pesto over the top of the salad. Sprinkle the toasted pine nuts. Toss with balsamic vinaigrette as desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! Makes 2 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Warm Caprese Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hamburger <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> crackers <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> onion soup <NEXT_INPUT> mushroom gravy mix <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 or 5 lb. hamburger <NEXT_INGR> 1 green pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 pkg. saltine crackers or 1 box Cheez-Its <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. dry onion soup mix <NEXT_INGR> 2 pkg. dry mushroom gravy mix <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the first 6 ingredients; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape into patties. Lay in long baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 325° for 20 minutes; drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn each pattie over. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 20 minutes more; drain again if necessary. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Quick And Easy Patties <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> rice <NEXT_INPUT> cucumbers <NEXT_INPUT> avocado <NEXT_INPUT> crab <NEXT_INPUT> Vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> rice vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 100 g sushi rice <NEXT_INGR> 1 sheet fresh seaweed <NEXT_INGR> 50 g cucumbers, julienned <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 avocado, julienned <NEXT_INGR> 80 g crab, sticks <NEXT_INGR> 15 g tobiko (flying fish roe) <NEXT_INGR> For Sushi Vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 15 ml rice vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put sushi rice on a seat seaweed (nori). <NEXT_INSTR> Spread on seaweed evenly. <NEXT_INSTR> Now turn the seaweed so that it comes up and the sushi rice comes down. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the cucumber, avocado and crabstick in the center of the seaweed. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll it up tightly. <NEXT_INSTR> This becomes easy if you use plastic wrap. <NEXT_INSTR> Put tobiko on top and cut into 6 pcs. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> California Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> jello <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. jello (cherry) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. water (boiling) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. water (cold) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Let set while cake is baking. <NEXT_INSTR> Then poke holes in cake and pour jello over. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Jello Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 whole Ears Of Corn <NEXT_INGR> Sugar, To Taste <NEXT_INGR> Salt And Pepper, to taste <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tablespoons Butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Shuck the corn and remove the silk; rinse in cold water. Cut 2 squares of tin foil just longer than the ears of corn on each side and place the corn on the foil. Sprinkle on salt, sugar, and pepper to taste. Thinly slice the butter into about 8 equal pats and place 4 on each ear of corn. Tightly roll up the foil around the corn and make sure the ends are firmly twisted shut. Cook over white hot campfire coals for about 4 minutes on each side. Remove from fire, unwrap and eat immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Campfire Corn On The Cob <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sweet <NEXT_INPUT> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> Italian plum tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> kidney beans <NEXT_INPUT> mostaccioli <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound sweet or hot Italian sausage, casings removed <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound lean ground beef (90% lean) <NEXT_INGR> 1 large onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 4 garlic cloves, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (28 ounces) Italian plum tomatoes, drained and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (15-1/2 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound mostaccioli, rigatoni or macaroni, cooked and drained <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound shredded Fontina or mozzarella cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large skillet, saute first six ingredients, crumbling with a fork, until the meat is browned and done. Drain. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, salt, pepper and kidney beans; heat through. <NEXT_INSTR> Add pasta, Parmesan cheese and parsley; toss well. Spoon into a greased shallow 4-qt. baking dish; sprinkle with Fontina or mozzarella cheese. Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 30 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Italian Pasta And Bean Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> graham crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> Cream Cheese <NEXT_INPUT> condensed milk <NEXT_INPUT> yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> lemons <NEXT_INPUT> Topping <NEXT_INPUT> blueberries <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1-1/2 cups graham crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. (250 g) Philadelphia Brick Cream Cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (300 mL) sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup plain low fat Greek-style yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. zest and 1/4 cup juice from about 2 lemons <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups thawed Cool Whip Whipped Topping <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup each blueberries and raspberries and sliced strawberries <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix graham crumbs and butter; press onto bottom and up side of 9-inch springform pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat cream cheese in large bowl with mixer until creamy. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually beat in milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Add yogurt, lemon zest and juice; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Gently stir in Cool Whip. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Freeze 3 hours or until firm. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove cheesecake from freezer 15 min. <NEXT_INSTR> before serving. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine berries; serve over individual servings of cheesecake. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Frozen Berry Cheesecake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> biscuits <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> walnut pieces <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 tubes Pillsbury biscuits <NEXT_INGR> butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> sugar <NEXT_INGR> cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> walnut pieces <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Split biscuits in four; roll in buttered hands, then roll in sugar and cinnamon. <NEXT_INSTR> Put in a well buttered tube pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle some sugar and cinnamon and nuts between biscuits. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle more sugar and cinnamon on top. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Invert immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pinch Me Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fryer <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> cornbread stuffing mix <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 fryer, cooked in unsalted water <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cornbread stuffing mix <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick margarine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt margarine and mix well with stuffing mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Place 1/3 in casserole dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Put 1/2 of cut-up chicken over stuffing. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix 1 can chicken broth and cream of chicken soup and pour over chicken. Put 1/3 stuffing over soup mix and rest of chicken pieces over stuffing. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix cream of mushroom soup and chicken broth and pour over chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Put rest of stuffing on top and bake at 375° for 45 to 50 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic salt <NEXT_INPUT> chili pwdr <NEXT_INPUT> pork roast <NEXT_INPUT> apple jelly <NEXT_INPUT> ketchup <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 teaspoon chili pwdr, divided <NEXT_INGR> 4 lbs. boneless pork roast, rolled and tied <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. apple jelly <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. ketchup <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. vinegar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 325 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> In small bowl, combine salt, garlic salt and 1/2 tsp. <NEXT_INSTR> chili pwdr. <NEXT_INSTR> Rub roast with mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Place roast, fat side up, on rack in shallow roasting pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Roast, uncovered, approximately 2 hrs. <NEXT_INSTR> While meat cooks, combine jelly, ketchup, vinegar and remaining chili pwdr in medium saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, 2 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> About 15 min before roast is done, baste meat with jelly mix. <NEXT_INSTR> When roast is done, remove from oven and let stand 10 min before carving. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix 1/2 c. of pan drippings with remaining jelly. <NEXT_INSTR> Reheat sauce if necessary and serve with roast. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 10 servings. <NEXT_INSTR> Note: If roast is very lean, there may not be as much as 1/2 c. drippings. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in whatever is in bottom of pan to jelly mix. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chili Rubbed Pork Roast Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> apricot Jello <NEXT_INPUT> cottage cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> peaches <NEXT_INPUT> red <NEXT_INPUT> cool whip <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 large box peach or apricot Jello <NEXT_INGR> 1 large carton cottage cheese <NEXT_INGR> 8 oz. cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 large cans peaches or apricots (save liquid) <NEXT_INGR> 1 jar red or green cherries (cut up) <NEXT_INGR> 6 oz. cool whip <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring liquid from fruit to boil and mix into Jello. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat cream cheese and cottage cheese into mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat in fruit. <NEXT_INSTR> Let set until fairly firm; mix in Cool Whip. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Peach Or Apricot Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Graham Cracker Crust <NEXT_INPUT> weight Cream Cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> Lemon <NEXT_INPUT> Egg <NEXT_INPUT> Cream <NEXT_INPUT> Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Vanilla-For <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Deep Dish Graham Cracker Crust <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces, weight Cream Cheese, Room Temperature <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Pure Vanilla Or Almond Extract <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Lemon Peel, Finely Shredded, If Desired <NEXT_INGR> 1 whole Egg <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces, fluid Whipping Cream, Very Cold <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Sugar-For Optional Topping <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces, weight Sour Cream-For Optional Topping <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Vanilla-For Optional Topping <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Make or buy a deep dish graham cracker crust. <NEXT_INSTR> For pie filling, in a large mixing bowl beat the cream cheese, sugar, vanilla (or almond extract), and lemon peel, if desired, with an electric mixer until combined. Add egg and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, beat very cold whipping cream until it holds a soft peak. Soft peak should fold over when the beaters are lifted. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold everything together gently until blended. Pour into the graham cracker crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 35-40 minutes until light golden brown. Cool cheese pie and chill until set. <NEXT_INSTR> Now you can mix topping ingredients together in a small bowl. Spread Topping onto Cheese Pie. Cover and chill at least 4 hours before serving. <NEXT_INSTR> OTHER OPTIONS FOR TOPPINGS: Reese's Peanut Butter Cups, Snickers, or Heath Bars chopped; Fresh Berries, Sliced Peaches, Mocha Powder <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Nancy’S Cheese Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> pepperoni <NEXT_INPUT> Mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> head lettuce <NEXT_INPUT> Italian dressing <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 bunch broccoli, cut into flowerets <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped red onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 oz.) can mushrooms, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. sliced pepperoni <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) pkg. shredded Mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 head lettuce, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) bottle Italian dressing <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix broccoli, onions, mushrooms, pepperoni and dressing. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand for 2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss in lettuce and top or toss with cheese. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pepperoni Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>
