<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> salad oil <NEXT_INPUT> beef <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salad oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> mushroom stems <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 medium onion, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon salad oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 beef cube steaks <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon salad oil <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 (2 ounce) can mushroom stems and pieces <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In 8-inch skillet, cook and stir onion in 1 tablespoon oil until tender, about 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from skillet and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Coat steaks with flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat 2 tablespoons oil in same skillet; cook steaks over medium heat, about 4 minutes on each side. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Place steaks on warm platter or dinner plates. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain fat from skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Add onion, sour cream and mushrooms (with liquid) to skillet; heat, stirring ocassionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve sauce on steaks. <NEXT_INSTR> Good on hot buttered egg (2 cups dry) noodles with a dash of parsley flakes mixed inches. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Steak Stroganoff for 2 <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> celery salt <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> cucumbers <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 c. vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. celery salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 bell pepper, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tomatoes, cut in quarters <NEXT_INGR> sliced cucumbers <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix the first 6 ingredients in a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add onion, bell pepper, tomatoes and as many cucumbers it takes to fill the bowl. Cover and refrigerate. <NEXT_INSTR> Will keep for approximately one week or more. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Marinated Cucumber Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> dates <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. self-rising flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 stick margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped pecans <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. pitted chopped dates <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. vanilla <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients well. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread into a well-greased and floured 9 x 12-inch pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 25 to 30 minutes at 375°. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with powdered sugar while still warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool completely, then cut into 1 x 4-inch sticks. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Date Sticks <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chia seeds <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> coffee <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> nectar <NEXT_INPUT> lecithin <NEXT_INPUT> almond <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup chia seeds <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup hot water <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup raw sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua(R)) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup agave nectar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lecithin <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon almond extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups spelt flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups cocoa powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chocolate chips <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup pecans <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup cocoa nibs (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. <NEXT_INSTR> Put chia seeds in a blender; add hot water. Let chia seeds soak in hot water for 5 minutes. Add sugar, olive oil, coffee-flavored liqueur, water, agave nectar, lecithin, almond extract, vanilla extract, and salt to chia seeds; blend on high speed until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine flour, cocoa powder, and baking powder in a bowl. Gradually stir the chia seed mixture into the flour mixture until dough is just mixed; fold in chocolate chips, pecans, and cocoa nibs. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide dough in half and spoon each half onto the prepared baking sheets forming two 2x12-inch logs using wet hands. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in the preheated oven until logs are lightly browned, about 40 minutes. Remove baking sheet from oven and cool logs for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce oven temperature to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). <NEXT_INSTR> Cut logs diagonally into 3/4-inch-thick slices. Lay slices on their sides on the parchment-lined baking sheets. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in the oven until biscotti are dry, about 25 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Vegan Chocolate Spelt Biscotti <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ginger <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> chicken breast halves <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil spray <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon minced peeled fresh ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons curry powder <NEXT_INGR> 4 skinless boneless chicken breast halves <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup canned low-salt chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> Nonstick vegetable oil spray <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Whisk first 5 ingredients to blend in 8 x 8 x 2-inch glass baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken and onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and let marinate at room temperature 1 hour or refrigerate up to 3 hours, turning chicken occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat) or preheat broiler. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove chicken from marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Strain marinade into medium saucepan; add broth. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil until sauce coats spoon, about 14 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, spray chicken with vegetable oil spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill or broil until just cooked through, about 4 minutes per side. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to platter. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon sauce over chicken and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Grilled Chicken with Soy-Lime Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> crust <NEXT_INPUT> ground pecans <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> pumpkin puree <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> ground cloves <NEXT_INPUT> ground mace <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground ginger <NEXT_INPUT> light cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup ground pecans <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup canned pumpkin puree <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon ground mace <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup light cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C.) In a small bowl, combine pecans, 1/3 cup brown sugar and butter. Press firmly into bottom of unbaked pie shell. Bake in oven 10 minutes. Remove crust from oven and reduce temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C.) <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, combine eggs, pumpkin, 2/3 cup brown sugar, flour, cloves, mace, cinnamon, salt and ginger. Blend in cream until mixture is smooth and creamy. Pour into partially baked shell. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes, or until filling is set. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Praline Pumpkin Pie Ii <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> unsweetened cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 tablespoons flour <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa, pwdr <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil (I used canola) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons water <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> chocolate chips, 1 small handful <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Whist together (or use a small spoon) dry ingredients in a coffee mug. Add oil, water, & vanilla and mix thoroughly, making certain to scrape bottom and sides so that all is incorporated. If desired (DUH) mix in the Chocolate Chips. <NEXT_INSTR> Microwave on high 1 - 1 1/2 minutes. The finished product will be softish and chewy. Cool for 1 minute Eat right out of the mug (its GREAT with a scoop of ice cream too!). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Brownie In A Mug <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> green tea <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> lemonade <NEXT_INPUT> bourbon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 7 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 green tea bags <NEXT_INGR> 12 oz. orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 12 oz. lemonade <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. bourbon <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix water and sugar in pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil and add tea bags. Let cool. Add orange juice and lemonade. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in bourbon. Put in ice cream pail or plastic container and put in deep freeze. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> The Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fresh cranberries <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> orange <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 c. fresh cranberries <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 to 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium orange <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Slice the unpeeled orange into eight parts. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the seeds. Place half the cranberries and half the orange slices in a food processor. <NEXT_INSTR> Process until the mixture is evenly chopped. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat with the remaining cranberries and orange slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes about 3 cups. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cranberry-Orange Relish <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg <NEXT_INPUT> shredded carrot <NEXT_INPUT> potato <NEXT_INPUT> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> oats <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> condensed cream <NEXT_INPUT> condensed cream <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> fresh parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup shredded carrot <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup shredded potato <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup shredded zucchini <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup finely chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup quick-cooking oats <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/4 cups 2% milk <NEXT_INGR> Mashed potatoes <NEXT_INGR> Minced fresh parsley, optional <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large bowl, combine the first eight ingredients. Crumble beef over mixture and mix well. Shape into 1-1/2-in. balls. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large skillet, brown meatballs in oil in small batches; drain. Transfer to a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, combine the soups and milk; pour over meatballs. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and bake at 350° for 35-40 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with mashed potatoes; garnish with parsley if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook meatballs until a thermometer reads 160°; cool completely before assembling. Cover and freeze without baking. To use, partially thaw in refrigerator overnight. Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before baking. Preheat oven to 350°. Bake as directed, increasing time as necessary until heated through and bubbly. Serve as directed. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Creamy Veggie Meatballs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> granulated sugar <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> smooth peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> quick-cooking <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> semi-sweet chocolate chips <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup smooth peanut butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups quick-cooking rolled oats <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 12 ounces semi-sweet chocolate chips <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°. In a medium bowl with a hand or stand mixer on medium speed, cream butter and sugars until smooth. Add peanut butter and mix until combined; then add eggs and vanilla, scraping down sides of bowl as needed. <NEXT_INSTR> In another medium bowl, whisk together oats, flour, and baking soda. Add to butter mixture and mix on low until well incorporated. Stir in chocolate chips with a wooden spoon. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop dough by rounded tablespoons 1 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. (I used a cookie scoop and found I needed to use a fork to press the tops of the cookies down a bit as they do not spread out much) Bake 10 to 12 minutes (In my oven 14 minutes), switching position of pans halfway through baking, or until lightly browned but still soft in the center. Transfer cookies to racks to cool. (I found it helped to leave cookies on the sheet for a minute before removing them to racks to cool). <NEXT_INSTR> The Twist: Ice Cream Sandwiches. Turn these great cookies into superb ice cream sandwiches: Soften the ice cream of your choice, 10 minutes. Spread 1/4 cup onto flat side of 1 cookie and top with another cookie, flat side down, pressing lightly. Chill sandwiches in freezer about 10 minutes, just long enough to chill ice cream but not enough to harden cookies. Eat immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Oatmeal Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> active dry yeast <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> bread flour <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> valrhona bittersweet chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> bread <NEXT_INPUT> warm milk <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa powder <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> For the Home Made Brioche <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1/4 ounce) packet active dry yeast <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons whole milk, warm <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups bread flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs, lightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 12 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> For the sauce <NEXT_INGR> 6 ounces valrhona bittersweet chocolate <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 tablespoons butter, cut into pieces and softened <NEXT_INGR> For the French Toast <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 5 slices brioche bread (homemade preferred, but store bought ok) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup warm milk <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup cocoa powder, with sugar (or sweetened cocoa powder like Ghiradelli) <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For the Home made Brioche: <NEXT_INSTR> For Brioche: Sprinkle yeast over milk in large mixing bowl; let stand 5 minutes. Combine flour, sugar and salt, beat in alternately with eggs and blend until dough is very smooth and elastic. (For best results, use standard mixer with a paddle attachment, mixing for approximately 10-15 minutes total.) Beat in butter, a tablespoon at a time, until well incorporated (dough will be very soft and sticky); continue to mix for 3 minutes more. Remove dough from bowl and shape into a ball. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a large buttered bowl, cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, approximately 2 hours. Punch down, reshape into a ball, cover and refrigerate overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> After refrigeration, preheat oven to 375 degrees. Turn dough out onto lightly floured board; quickly form into loaf shape. Place dough in buttered 8x4-inch loaf pan; let stand at room temperature 20 to 30 minutes, or until dough just begins to soften (dough will rise slightly). <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer dough to oven, lower the temperature to 350 degrees and bake until golden brown and loaf sounds hollow when tapped, about 50 minutes. Let cool for several minutes, unmold while still warm and transfer to a wire rack to cool to room temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare the chocolate sauce: <NEXT_INSTR> Break up the chocolate and place the pieces along with 1/4 cup of the water in a saucepan. Place over low heat and slowly melt the chocolate, stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> When the chocolate is melted and smooth, stir in the butter piece by piece. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the rest of the water and bring the sauce to a boil, stirring constantly. Keep over very low heat while you finish the French toast. (The sauce may be made ahead. Reheat gently in a double boiler.). <NEXT_INSTR> For the French Toast: <NEXT_INSTR> Place a cake rack over your sink. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, stir the cinnamon and sugar together. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the brioche in one layer in a baking dish or other shallow dish and pour warm milk over them. <NEXT_INSTR> After about 1 minute turn them over and soak for another minute. Remove them to the cake rack to drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat the oven to warm and place 6 plates or soup plates in the oven to warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the eggs together in a shallow dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Place a frying pan over moderate heat and melt some butter in it. Quickly dip the brioche, first one side then the other. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in the frying pan and brown on both sides. Remove, place on a cutting board and sprinkle with the cinnamon sugar and Cocoa Powder. Repeat with remaining french toast/Brioche. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut the brioche into 6 pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve: <NEXT_INSTR> Place 5 pieces of brioche on each plate and drizzle with the chocolate sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with sliced large, ripe juicy strawberries and Pistachios (optional) and sprinkle lightly with confectioners sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> INHALE! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Norma'S Chocolate Decadence French Toast  With Valrhona Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> icing sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> strawberries <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 175 g plain flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons icing sugar <NEXT_INGR> 100 g butter <NEXT_INGR> 150 g chocolate <NEXT_INGR> 300 ml double cream <NEXT_INGR> 25 g sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 drops vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 250 g strawberries <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6. Sift the flour and a pinch of salt into a bowl. Stir in the icing sugar and rub in the butter with your fingertips until it looks like breadcrumbs. Sprinkle over 2tbsp chilled water and mix with a knife until it forms clumps. Gather with your hands to make a dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the pastry on a floured surface and roll out to the thickness of a 1 coin. Use to line a 23cm flan case. Prick the base and lay some baking powder inside. Weigh the paper down with dry rice. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove the paper and rice and return to the oven for another 5 minutes. Reduce the oven to 160C/140C Fan/Gas 3. <NEXT_INSTR> Break the chocolate into squares and put in a bowl. Heat the cream until it is almost boiling and then pour over the chocolate. Stir until the chocolate melts. <NEXT_INSTR> In another bowl, whisk the caster sugar, eggs, and vanilla until creamy. Pour on the chocolate, stirring, then pour into the pastry case and cook in the oven for 25 minutes. Leave to cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice the strawberries. Serve some on the flan and the rest separately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Strawberry And Chocolate Flan <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Archer Farms® <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> egg white <NEXT_INPUT> Archers Farms&reg <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon Archer Farms(R) Garam Masala <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons paprika <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg white <NEXT_INGR> 2 (10 1/2 ounce) bags Archers Farms® Raw Unsalted Mixed Nuts (5 1/2 cups) or (10 1/2 ounce) bags Archer Farms(R) Raw Almonds <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 325°F. Line a half sheet pan with parchment paper. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, combine the sugar, garam masala, paprika, salt, and cumin. In large bowl, whisk the egg white until foamy. Add the nuts and toss to coat, then add the spice mixture and toss to coat. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread the nuts in an even layer in the pan. Bake until golden brown and dry, about 35 minutes. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack, stirring occasionally to separate the nuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Tip: The nuts will keep in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tandoori Nuts <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> milk chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> flour tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> raspberry sauce <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla ice cream <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate shavings <NEXT_INPUT> Raspberry Sauce <NEXT_INPUT> frozen raspberries <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> orange liqueur <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> For Chocolate Chimichangas <NEXT_INGR> 6 (1 5/8 ounce) milk chocolate candy bars <NEXT_INGR> 6 (10 inch) burrito-size flour tortillas <NEXT_INGR> vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> raspberry sauce <NEXT_INGR> vanilla ice cream <NEXT_INGR> Garnishes <NEXT_INGR> chocolate shavings, mint sprigs <NEXT_INGR> For Raspberry Sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 ounce) package frozen raspberries, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon orange liqueur (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cornstarch <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For Chimichangas: Place 1 candy bar just below center of 1 tortilla. Fold bottom of tortilla up and over candy bar just until partially covered. Fold left and right sides of tortilla over; roll up, and place, seam side down, on a baking sheet. Repeat procedure with remaining candy bars and tortillas. Freeze 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour oil to depth of 1 inch into a large skillet; heat to 375°F Place 2 tortillas, seam sides down, in hot oil, gently pressing with tongs for a few seconds to seal. Fry tortillas 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Repeat procedure with remaining tortillas. Drain on paper towels. Serve with Raspberry Sauce and vanilla ice cream. Garnish, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> For Raspberry Sauce: Combine first 3 ingredients and, if desired, orange liqueur, in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, and simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes or just until raspberry mixture starts to thicken. Remove from heat, and let cool completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Press raspberry mixture through a wire-mesh strainer into a small saucepan, using the back of a spoon to squeeze out juice. Discard pulp and seeds. Whisk in 1 teaspoons cornstarch. Bring to a boil, and cook 1 to 2 minutes or until thickened. Store in refrigerator up to 3 days Makes 1 cup. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Chimichangas With Raspberry Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> white bread <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> crab meat <NEXT_INPUT> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 large loaf white bread <NEXT_INGR> 4 to 6 green onions, chopped fine <NEXT_INGR> 6 hard-boiled eggs, chopped fine <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans crab meat <NEXT_INGR> 1 can shrimp <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. celery, chopped fine <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. mayonnaise <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Remove crust from bread; cut into 1/2-inch squares. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix with onions and hard-boiled eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand overnight, tightly covered, in refrigerator. <NEXT_INSTR> Four to six hours before serving, add crab, shrimp, celery and mayonnaise. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend well and chill. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Seafood Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> taco seasoning mix <NEXT_INPUT> kidney beans <NEXT_INPUT> salsa <NEXT_INPUT> green peppers <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 1/4 ounce) package taco seasoning mix (1-1/4 oz) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup salsa <NEXT_INGR> 4 medium green peppers <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium tomatoes, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup shredded cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup sour cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In lg skillet, brown beef; drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in taco seasoning, beans and salsa. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut peppers in half lenghtwise; remove seeds. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop peppers in boiling water for 3 minutes; drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon 1/2 cup meat mixture in each pepper half. <NEXT_INSTR> Place peppers in baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and bake at 350* for 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Top each with tomatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> cheese and sour cream. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Taco-Filled Bell Peppers <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Mix <NEXT_INPUT> Green Onions <NEXT_INPUT> Cranberries <NEXT_INPUT> Frozen Peas <NEXT_INPUT> Vegetable Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Natural Peanut Butter <NEXT_INPUT> Rice Vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> Red Wine Vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> Soy Sauce <NEXT_INPUT> Sesame Oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 cups Cooked Brown Rice Or Brown And Wild Rice Mix <NEXT_INGR> 6 whole Green Onions, Chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Toasted Slivered Almonds <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Dried Cranberries Or Cherries <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Frozen Peas, Thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Vegetable Oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tablespoons Natural Peanut Butter <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tablespoons Seasoned Rice Vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Red Wine Vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Soy Sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tablespoon Toasted Sesame Oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> The noted 'Cook Time' is to allow for cooking the rice. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, combine the cooked rice, green onions, almonds, cranberries and peas. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, thoroughly combine the vegetable oil, peanut butter, vinegars, soy sauce and sesame oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir the dressing into the rice mixture. Chill before serving, about 2 hours. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hearty Rice Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> frozen peas <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> scallions <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (12 oz.) package frozen peas <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp water <NEXT_INGR> 3 scallions, cut into thin rounds <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp thinly sliced fresh mint <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp kosher salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the peas, lemon juice and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer over a medium flame. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook until peas are just tender and heated through, about 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat and stir in the scallions, mint, olive oil and salt. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Peas With Mint And Lemon  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 egg whites <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. finely chopped nuts <NEXT_INGR> 6 oz. pkg. chocolate chips <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat egg whites until stiff. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add sugar and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in nuts and chocolate chips. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cookies While You Sleep <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> block of velveeta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> pico de gallo <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lbs. block of velveeta cheese cubed <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. pico de gallo <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 stick of butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt butter and cheese. Then add pico de gallo. Stir well. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fast Chile Con Queso <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound Yukon Gold potatoes, washed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound carrots, peeled and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 5 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place the whole un-peeled potatoes in a large pot and fill with water until they are covered by an inch. Cover, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss the carrots and cook for another 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain the vegetables in a colander. Carefully remove the skins of the potatoes. Toss everything back into the waterless pot. Go to town with a potato masher. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the butter, mash some more. Than whisk in the heavy cream. Season with salt and pepper to taste. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dinner Tonight: Dressing Up Mashed Potatoes Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 350 grams flour <NEXT_INGR> 70 grams cocoa <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp salt <NEXT_INGR> 10 grams baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 320 grams sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs beaten <NEXT_INGR> 180 ml oil <NEXT_INGR> 160 ml water or milk <NEXT_INGR> 212 ml whipped cream <NEXT_INGR> 200 grams dark chocolate <NEXT_INGR> 200 grams dark chocolate <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp canola oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> We start with the mousse:Whip the cream for a solid cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt the chocolate on a microwaveand fold the chocolate to the whipped cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Let it cool in the fridge <NEXT_INSTR> Sift together flour, cocoa, salt and baking powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the sugar and mixtogether. <NEXT_INSTR> Create an hole in the middle of the dry ingredients and pourin the eggs, oil and milk (or water). <NEXT_INSTR> Mix just untill well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Fill a muffin pan with the mixture- just 2/3 of the way.Heat oven to 180C and bake for 15-20 minutes or untill a toothpick iserted to the middleof the muffin comes out with a moist crumbs.Let the muffins cool and then take off their mushroom heads. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the "heads" in a bowl and crumble it. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix the crumbled "heads" with the mousse.Now comes the dirty part: shape with the mousse a Crembo like hill using your hands and place it on each bottom of a muffin. <NEXT_INSTR> Continue with all 16 muffins. <NEXT_INSTR> A fter done, let the Crembos rest in the fridge for an hour <NEXT_INSTR> Melt the chocolate and add about 2-3 spoons of canola oil.Coat each Crembo with the melted chocolate using a spoon. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy ;-) <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate indulgence <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Santa <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> cloves <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> powdered sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 c. seeded, coarsely chopped Santa Rosa plums <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 (3-inch) sticks cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 4 whole cloves <NEXT_INGR> 8 corn crepes <NEXT_INGR> powdered sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine plums, sugar, cinnamon and cloves in small saucepan and cook over medium heat until soft and thickened, about 20 to 30 minutes, depending on ripeness of plums. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat and let cool. When cool, spread about 1/4 cup plum compote over crepe, then fold crepe in quarters. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle lightly with powdered sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on baking sheet and glaze under broiler 2 to 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 4 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cornmeal Crepes With Spiced Plum Compote <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> salmon <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> gingerroot <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 24 ounces salmon fillets, cut fillets to serve 4 <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons green onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 -2 tablespoon garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 teaspoon gingerroot, grated <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes (or more, to taste) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place salmon fillets in a large zip-loc style plastic bag. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, whisk together remaining ingredients and pour over salmon. <NEXT_INSTR> Seal bag and refrigerate for at least 8 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat grill (or broiler if preparing indoors). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove salmon from marinade and place on a well-oiled grill five inches from heat source. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill for 5-10 minutes, until fish flakes easily when tested w/ a fork. <NEXT_INSTR> (Turn only once, halfway through cooking). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Asian Grilled Salmon - Low-Carb - Fabulous! <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> peanuts <NEXT_INPUT> light corn syrup <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. raw peanuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. light corn syrup <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. soda <NEXT_INGR> dash of salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a very large bowl, combine sugar, corn syrup, water and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook in microwave uncovered on High for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add nuts and cook 13 to 15 minutes or until 300° reached on candy thermometer, checking last few minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Microwave Peanut Brittle <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cauliflower florets <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> white pepper <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 1/2 cups cauliflower florets <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup onions diced <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons flour, all-purpose <NEXT_INGR> 1 packet chicken broth instant <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup milk, skim <NEXT_INGR> 1 d white pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 x nutmeg <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a 4-quart saucepan, combine cauliflower, water and salt; bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat and let simmer until cauliflower is tender; let cool slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer 2 cups cauliflower (including cooking liquid) to blender container and process until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat procedure, 2 cups at a time, until all cauliflower and cooking liquid have been processed. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In same saucepan heat margarine over medium-high heat until bubbly and hot; add onion and saute until translucent. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with flour and broth mix and stir quickly to combine; cook, stirring, for 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add milk and cook, stirring constantly, until flour mixture is completely dissolved and liquid thickens; stir in pureed cauliflower. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat and let simmer, stirring accasionally, until heated through; stir in pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Ladle into 4 soup bowls and, if desired, sprinkle each portion with dash nutmeg. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cauliflower Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> frozen broccoli cuts <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> condensed cream <NEXT_INPUT> Swiss cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. (16 oz.) frozen broccoli cuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. cheese and garlic croutons <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (10 3/4 oz.) condensed cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. shredded Swiss cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place broccoli in 2-quart casserole; cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Microwave on High for 3 to 4 minutes or until defrosted, stirring once to break apart; drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in croutons, soup, cheeses and milk; mix well. Re-cover, microwave on High for 8 to 11 minutes or until heated through, stirring twice. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand covered for 3 minutes before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Broccoli Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> condensed milk <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> orange zest <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> yellow cake <NEXT_INPUT> Chocolate <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> For the Flan <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (12 oz.) evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (14 oz.) sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 4 oz. PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> For the Cake <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. orange zest Safeway 1 lb For $0.79 thru 02/09 <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. (2-layer size) yellow cake mix <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. grated BAKER'S Semi-Sweet Chocolate <NEXT_INGR> COOL WHIP Whipped Topping, thawed (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350F. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare the caramel with sugar and 1/4 cup of water in a small saucepan, cook at medium heat for 5 minutes or until the sugar is completely dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Continue boiling until it turns golden in color and caramelizes. <NEXT_INSTR> Once it s ready pour and spread into a 12-cup fluted tube pan . <NEXT_INSTR> (Very careful not burn yourself.) <NEXT_INSTR> Mix the evaporated milk, condensed milk, the cream cheese, and 4 eggs in a blender. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour strained mixture over the caramel. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix the 3 eggs, orange zest, water and oil in with the cake mix, until well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Once it s ready place it carefully over the cream cheese mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover pan with foil sprayed with cooking spray, sprayed-side down. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in larger pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add enough water to larger pan to come halfway up side of tube pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 1 hour and 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean from the center of the cake. <NEXT_INSTR> Leave to cool completely at room temperature, and invert onto plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate for 4 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve topped with grated chocolate or whipped topping, optional. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Orange & Cheese Flancocho <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup slivered almonds <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup raisins <NEXT_INGR> 6 cups of hot cooked rice <NEXT_INGR> shredded coconut <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In skillet, melt 1/4 cup butter; cook 1/2 cup chopped onion and 1/4 cup slivered almonds till golden. Add 1/2 cup raisins; heat until plump. Add to 6 cups of hot cooked rice; mix gently. Press mixture into greased mold. Unmold at once on platter. Top with shredded coconut. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> East Indian Rice Ring  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> scallions <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> parsley flakes <NEXT_INPUT> oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 potatoes <NEXT_INGR> 6 scallions <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. parsley flakes <NEXT_INGR> oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Scrub potatoes very well and grate in food processor. <NEXT_INSTR> Some like them grated for a coarser texture and some just like them once grated for a coarser texture. <NEXT_INSTR> If you choose the finer texture, it doesn't work to just chop-you have to grate first. Finely chop the scallions. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Potato Latkas <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> low-fat mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> bread <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> country ham <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 large green onions <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 8 teaspoons low-fat mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 4 sourdough bread slices, toasted <NEXT_INGR> 4 hard-cooked eggs, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons thinly sliced or diced cooked country ham (optional) <NEXT_INGR> Freshly grated Parmesan cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 425°. Toss together green onions, olive oil, and salt in a jelly-roll pan. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until tender. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Cut onions into 2-inch-long pieces. Spread 2 tsp. mayonnaise onto each of 4 toasted sourdough bread slices. Layer each with one-fourth of green onions; 1 hard-cooked egg, sliced; and, if desired, 1 Tbsp. country ham. Top with desired amount of freshly grated Parmesan cheese. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Country-Ham-And-Egg Toasts <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <NEXT_INPUT> teriyaki sauce <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons minced ginger (more if you prefer) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup green onion, chopped fine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup teriyaki sauce <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, minced <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix ingredients together in a saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat to a mild boil. Season with garlic powder, onion powder, and pepper. Mix in the sliced venison until completely coated. Brush 1 side of each slice of squash with syrup mixture. Bake at 425° for 15 minutes. Turn squash over, and brush with remaining glaze. Bake an additional 15 minutes or until tender. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Maple-Glazed Roasted Acorn Squash <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. onion salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. chili powder <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix the flour, Parmesan cheese and all the spices thoroughly in a large Ziploc bag. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut the potatoes into 4 wedges each and shake well in mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Lay in single layer in buttered pan. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Lemon Cake <NEXT_INPUT> cake flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> lemon zest <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> Lemon Cream Cheese Filling <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla extract <NEXT_INPUT> lemon curd <NEXT_INPUT> Lemon Soaking Syrup <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Lemon Buttercream <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> lemon curd <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Lemon Cake <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups cake flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup unsalted butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 cups sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup strained fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGR> Lemon Cream Cheese Filling <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup lemon curd (Lemon Curd) <NEXT_INGR> Lemon Soaking Syrup <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> Lemon Buttercream <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup lemon curd (Lemon Curd) <NEXT_INGR> salt, a pinch <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> The cake: position oven rack in center of oven; preheat oven to 350°; grease the bottom and sides of two 9-inch round cake pans; dust pans with flour and tap out excess. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift together the cake flour, baking powder, and salt into a bowl; whisk to combine; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In the bowl of an electric mixer, using the paddle attachment, beat the butter at medium speed until cream, about 30 seconds. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add in sugar; beat at high speed until well blended and light, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Scrape down sides of bowl as needed; decrease speed to medium and add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition and mixing until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat in the lemon zest and lemon juice until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Decrease speed to low and add the flour mixture in three additions, alternating it with the milk in two additions, and mixing just until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Scraped batter into prepared pans, dividing it evenly, and smooth the tops with a rubber spatula. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake cakes for 22-25 minutes, until they are golden brown around the edges and a pick comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool cakes in pans on wire racks for 15 minutes; invert cakes onto the wire racks and let cool completely. <NEXT_INSTR> The filling: in a bowl of an electric mixer, using the whisk attachment, beat the heavy cream at high speed until firm peaks form; transfer the whipped cream to a smaller bowl, cover, and refrigerate. <NEXT_INSTR> In the same mixer bowl (no need to wash it), using the paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese at medium speed until very creamy, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> On low speed, beat in the vanilla extract. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the lemon curd and beat at medium speed until well blended and smooth, about 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the bowl from the mixer stand and, using a rubber spatula, gently fold in the whipped cream until almost completely blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover the bowl and refrigerate while you make the syrup and buttercream. <NEXT_INSTR> The syrup: In a small saucepan, combine the water, lemon juice, and sugar; bring to a boil over med-high heat, stirring occasionally to dissolve the sugar; remove the pan from the heat and set aside at room temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> The buttercream: in a bowl of an electric mixer, using the paddle attachment, beat the butter at medium speed until cream and light, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> At medium speed, gradually add the lemon curd, a large spoonful at a time, then add the salt and beat at med-high speed until creamy and light, about 1 1/2 minutes; set aside at room temperature while you assemble the cake. <NEXT_INSTR> Assemble cake: using a long serrated knife, trim off the domed tops of the cakes so that they are even; cut each cake horizontally into 2 layers; reserve one of the flat bottom layers for the top of the cake. <NEXT_INSTR> Place another layer cut side up on a cardboard cake round or flat serving plate; generously brush with some of the lemon syrup. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon a scant cup of the filling onto the cake and, using a small offset spatula, spread it into an even layer, leaving a 1/2 inch border around the edge of the cake. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with another cake layer and brush it with more syrup; top with another scant cup of filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat with another layer, more syrup, and remaining filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush the cut side of the reserved cake layer with remaining syrup; place the layer cut side down on top of the cake. <NEXT_INSTR> Frost the sides and top of the cake with the buttercream. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve the cake at room temperature; if it has to be refrigerated, let stand at room temperature for about 45 minutes before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Lust Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> basil leaf <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> pasta <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb small zucchini, cut into 1/4-inch thick slices <NEXT_INGR> 4 garlic cloves, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 14 cups heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup torn fresh basil leaf (a handful) <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb dry pasta (farfalle, penne, cavatelli) <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup freshly grated parmesan cheese, plus additional to serve <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt butter with olive oil in a skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in zucchini and garlic; cook/stir often over medium heat, until just golden, 5-10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Decrease heat to med-low; add in cream; simmer gently until just thickened, 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in basil with salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large pot of boiling, salted water until al dente; drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Add pasta with parmesan to the hot sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss well to coat; serve immediately with extra parmesan. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pasta, Zucchini, and Basil With Cream <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Worcestershire <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, slightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. catsup <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. nonfat dry milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. each: pepper, powdered mustard, celery salt, garlic salt and sage <NEXT_INGR> bread crumbs to equal 2 slices bread <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Grease or spray casserole. <NEXT_INSTR> In layers, add sliced potatoes, sliced onions, sliced celery, small can regular or chili beans, 1/4 cup rice, 1 1/2 cups tomatoes (sliced or canned), any amount of hamburg on top and 1/2 cup water. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper to taste. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Meat Loaf(Diabetic)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cracker crumbs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 chicken, boiled and deboned <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. uncooked instant rice <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick margarine, melted <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. chopped onions <NEXT_INGR> salt, garlic powder, black pepper and cheese to taste <NEXT_INGR> cracker crumbs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients together. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in casserole dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix melted butter and cracker crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on top of mixture. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 1 hour. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken And Rice <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> chile flakes <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 pounds ripe tomatoes, or two 28-ounce cans peeled whole tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 8 to 10 garlic cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 bay leaves <NEXT_INGR> Dried chile flakes <NEXT_INGR> Salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Peel, seed, and chop the fresh tomatoes, or seed and chop the canned tomatoes; reserve the juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel and chop the garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat and add the garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> When the garlic begins to sizzle and release its fragrance, add the tomatoes and juice, bay leaves, a big pinch of chile flakes, and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer the sauce for 20 minutes or so, until thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the bay leaves and taste for seasoning; add more salt and chile flakes to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> (If the tomatoes are too acidic and not as sweet as you would like, add a bit of sugar.) <NEXT_INSTR> For a smooth sauce, pass through a food mill. <NEXT_INSTR> All through the cold months, we wait for the real tomatoes of summer (bland out-of-season tomatoes dont count), until we find ourselves inundated with varieties of all kinds from late July until the fall. <NEXT_INSTR> The pleasant challenge becomes how to use them allin sauces, salads, gratins, sandwiches, soups, pastas. <NEXT_INSTR> Peeling and seeding tomatoes is a summertime ritual. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a pot of water to boiling and have ready a bowl of icy cold water. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop the tomatoes, a few at a time, into the boiling water for 15 to 30 seconds, just long enough to loosen their skins. <NEXT_INSTR> Very ripe tomatoes take less time, thick-skinned, firm tomatoes take longer. <NEXT_INSTR> Scoop the tomatoes out of the boiling water and plunge them into the ice water to prevent the outer layer of flesh from cooking and softening. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the water, and use a paring knife to cut out the cores at the stem end and slip off the skins. <NEXT_INSTR> To seed the tomatoes, cut them in half horizontally, use your fingers to loosen the seeds in their cavities, and squeeze the halves to coax the seeds out. <NEXT_INSTR> Work over a bowl with a strainer to catch the delicious juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Once peeled and seeded, the tomatoes are ready to be stuffed and baked, diced or chopped for any number of preparations, or sliced and dressed for a salad. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Simple Tomato Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> unsweetened cherries <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 stick margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 lb.) can unsweetened cherries <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt margarine in an 8 x 12-inch baking dish. Serve warm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Quick Cherry Cobbler <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Place fish in pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix wine, stock, and lemon juice in small bowl and pour over fish. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and bake at 350° F for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt margarine in small saucepan. Gradually add milk and cook over moderately low heat, stirring constantly until thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove fish from oven and pour liquid from baking dish into cream sauce, stirring until blended. Pour sauce over fish and sprinkle with grapes. <NEXT_INSTR> Broil about 4 inches from heat 5 minutes or until sauce starts to brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fish Veronique  (Low Fat, Diabetic Friendly) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> long red chili pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 500 g broccoli (about one large head, chopped into bite sized florets, chop off the biggest ends) <NEXT_INGR> 1 long red chili pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove (finely minced or pressed) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons dark soy sauce (important because it is sweeter, which you need with the less sweet Western broccoli, if you don't h) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Boil water for steamer. <NEXT_INSTR> Put broccoli in steamer for 4 minutes until slightly soften. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat oil in pan on medium heat and fry chili and garlic for a minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn up heat to high, add broccoli and stir occasionally for a minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Add soy sauce, stir, cover and cook for a minute. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chili Garlic Broccoli <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> + <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> warm water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, slightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. + 2 tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon warm water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream butter and sugars. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in egg and beat till smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in dry ingredients, then water and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in your choice of either 1 c. chocolate chips, 1 c. oatmeal, 1/2 c. coconut, 1/2 - 1 c. of walnuts or possibly pecans, 1 c. of peanut butter chips or possibly any combination of the above to create your favorite cookies. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop by spoonfuls on greased cookie sheet and bake at 375 degrees for 8-10 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 4-5 dozen. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Basic Drop Cookie Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lean ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> taco seasoning mix <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> chunky salsa <NEXT_INPUT> blend cheese <NEXT_INPUT> corn chips <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb lean ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 1/4 ounce) package taco seasoning mix <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup masa corn flour or 12 cup cornmeal <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 (1/4 ounce) envelopes fast rise yeast <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup milk (very warm - 120-130 F) <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, slightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chunky salsa <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shredded Mexican blend cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup corn chips, partially crushed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown meat in a skillet and drain off fat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add taco seasoning, stir well and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Coat an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix all the batter ingredients together and stir until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Top batter with meat mixture then pour salsa evenly over the meat; sprinkle with cheese and corn chips. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in a cold oven; set temperature to 350 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 30 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Quick Taco Bake and Rise Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lean ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> tomato soup <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 lb. lean ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. raw rice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. finely chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. finely chopped green pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 1/2 oz.) can tomato soup <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a mixing bowl, combine ground beef, rice, onion, green pepper, egg, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well to blend. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape meat mixture into 24 meatballs, about 1 1/2-inches in diameter. <NEXT_INSTR> Place meatballs in slow cooking pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour soup over meatballs. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and slow cook at setting #3 for 7 to 8 hours, or setting #4 for 4 to 5 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 4 to 6 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Porcupine Meatballs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> unsalted <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> bittersweet chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> raspberry <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolk <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> ramekins <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup unsalted, shelled raw pistachios <NEXT_INGR> Unsalted butter (for ramekins) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sugar, plus more for ramekins <NEXT_INGR> 6 ounces high-quality bittersweet chocolate, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup high-quality raspberry jam or jelly <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg yolk <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more <NEXT_INGR> 6 large egg whites, room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 4 (6-ounce) ramekins <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Position rack in center of oven; preheat to 375°F. Toast pistachios on a rimmed baking sheet, tossing once, until fragrant and slightly darkened, 5-6 minutes. Let cool slightly, then coarsely chop. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, butter ramekins, making upward strokes up the sides with a pastry brush. Sprinkle with sugar, tilting to coat completely and tapping out any excess. Arrange prepared ramekins on baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine chocolate and jam in a medium heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of barely simmering water (do not let bowl touch water); stir constantly until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth, 1-2 minutes. Remove bowl from heat. Stir in egg yolk and 1/4 tsp. salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat egg whites and a pinch of salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment on medium speed until frothy, about 2 minutes. Gradually add 1/2 cup sugar, 1 Tbsp. at a time, and beat until medium peaks form, 6-7 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a rubber spatula, fold one-quarter of the beaten egg whites into chocolate mixture to lighten. Fold in remaining egg whites in 2 batches. Divide batter among prepared ramekins, filling completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer baking sheet with ramekins to oven and bake souffles until puffed and tops feel firm to the touch, 18-20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, using an electric mixer on medium-low speed, beat cream in a large bowl until soft peaks form. Dollop souffles with cream, top with chopped pistachios, and serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate-Raspberry Soufflé  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. dry yeast <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 c. scalded milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. shortening <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. fresh hot mashed potatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 large eggs, lightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 6 1/2 c. sifted flour (about) <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. melted butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sprinkle yeast over 1/2 cup warm water. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir until dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine the milk, shortening, potatoes, sugar and salt in large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 1/2 cups flour; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover; let rise for 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in enough flour to make stiff dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead on lightly floured board. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in greased bowl, turning to grease top. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover; refrigerate. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape into balls. <NEXT_INSTR> Grease in butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Let rise for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Bake at 425° for 20 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fresh Potato Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> grated cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cracker crumbs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> cabbage <NEXT_INGR> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> grated cheese <NEXT_INGR> cracker crumbs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook cut up cabbage 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Layer cream of chicken soup, grated cheese and cabbage. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle cracker crumbs on top and bake in 350° oven for 20 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cabbage Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> filling <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> pancake <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> For the dough and filling <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup water, probably a bit less. <NEXT_INGR> 2 bunches green onions <NEXT_INGR> 1/2-3/4 cups canola oil <NEXT_INGR> canola oil, for frying <NEXT_INGR> kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> Rolling out the dough and filling the pancake <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Dump the flour into a large mixing bowl. Make a well in the center for the water. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in the water and mix. I find using one hand to steady the bowl and the other to mix the dough is sufficient. Keep adding water a little bit at a time if necessary until the dough has formed, is uniform, and slightly sticky. Don't worry about overworking. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape the dough roughly into a rounded disk and lay to "sleep" in the same mixing bowl you just used. Dampen a cloth or paper towel and drape over the dough lightly to prevent drying. <NEXT_INSTR> Let the dough "sleep" for about 20-30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> While the dough is sleeping, rinse the green onions and chop them, discarding the root ends. Set aside. It will seem like you have a lot. You should! <NEXT_INSTR> Generously flour a work surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead the dough a few times and check the consistency. It should be smooth and dry to the touch, but soft and pliable. If it is too wet and sticky, it will incorporate some of the flour from your work surface as you knead it. You may need to add more flour, but go slow. If it is too dry, it will be hard to knead, get crackly on the outside, and be slow to spring back. In that case, add a few drops of water. <NEXT_INSTR> Once the consistency feels right, shape the dough into a disk shape and begin to roll it out with a rolling pin (I think the plain old wooden broom handle types are the easiest for this). Rotate the dough as you roll. Sometimes it may seem as though you aren't getting anywhere because the dough will keep springing back, but after a certain point it will start to behave and keep its shape. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll the dough as thinly and evenly as you can. It should be a very large and thin circle. Patch the holes with torn off pieces from the edge. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the oil onto the dough's surface. Use the back of a spoon to smooth it out evenly, taking care not to tear the dough. Make sure the edges are covered too. <NEXT_INSTR> Generously sprinkle the chopped green onions all over the dough. Again, get all the way out to the edge. <NEXT_INSTR> Generously salt and season the pancake. Most often heard complaint over three generations has been, "It's not salty enough!" <NEXT_INSTR> Once the dough has been topped with the oil, green onions, and salt, start at the bottom edge of the dough and begin to roll it up all the way to the top so it looks like a long tube <NEXT_INSTR> You may need to add some more flour to your work surface at this point. Next, press down lightly on each end to seal, and coil the roll around itself so it looks like a snail, tucking the ends under and pressing down lightly <NEXT_INSTR> With the rolling pin, gently roll out the pancake a bit again, flattening it to the desired thickness. I like mine about 1/2-3/4 inch think. Remember, a thicker pancake equals longer cooking time. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a little oil in a heavy bottomed pan, just to cover it. I prefer a cast iron skillet. Cook the pancake on medium-low heat, about ten minutes each side. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut into wedges and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Green Onion Pancakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pork chops <NEXT_INPUT> Campbell's tomato soup <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> caraway seed <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 pork chops (1 lb.) <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (10 3/4 oz.) Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. caraway seed or oregano (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 6 to 8 small whole potatoes or 3 medium, quartered <NEXT_INGR> 4 small carrots, split lengthwise and cut in 2-inch pieces <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In skillet; brown chops. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour off fat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add rest of ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover; simmer 45 minutes or until tender. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> One-Pot Pork Chop Supper <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> stalks Chinese broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> oyster sauce <NEXT_INPUT> corn oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 stalks Chinese broccoli, cut into 5-inch lengths <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. oyster sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. corn oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring 1/2 pot of water to a boil. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Golden Butter <NEXT_INPUT> applesauce <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> caramels <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (18.5 oz.) box Golden Butter Recipe cake mix <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 c. unsweetened (natural) applesauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 24 individual wrapped Kraft caramels, unwrapped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Line 24 muffin cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare cake mix as directed only substitute the applesauce for the water and beat in the cinnamon. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon into lined cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Gently press a caramel in the middle of each cup (the caramel will stick to the bottom during baking). <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 20 minutes or until wood pick inserted in center comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool in pan on a wire rack 5 minutes before removing cupcakes from pan to wire rack to cool completely. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Caramel Apple Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 refrigerated rolls tube <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons butter melted <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons fresh parsley minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 375°F <NEXT_INSTR> Cut biscuits into fourths, and place in a large mixing bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the butter, garlic powder, parsley, and mozzarella, and mix with your hands, coating all of the biscuit pieces <NEXT_INSTR> Place the pieces in a muffin tin, 3 pieces per tin (you'll have 2 extra-just use them in whichever tin you want). <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 15 minutes. Best served fresh from the oven. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pull-Apart Garlic Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bean soup mix <NEXT_INPUT> beef <NEXT_INPUT> roma tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> green bell peppers <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> beef bouillon <NEXT_INPUT> flour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 12 cups 13 bean soup mix <NEXT_INGR> 2 lbs beef (frozen is fine) or 2 lbs chicken (frozen is fine) or 2 lbs pork, roughly chopped (frozen is fine) <NEXT_INGR> 4 roma tomatoes, diced <NEXT_INGR> 2 green bell peppers, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 3 garlic cloves, roughly chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon beef bouillon (better than bouillon brand) <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup flour (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place beans in a bowl and cover with water, let soak overnight in the fridge. <NEXT_INSTR> In the morning, combine all ingredients EXCEPT flour in a crockpot. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with water. <NEXT_INSTR> Set on low for 8 hours or high for 6 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix flour with water and pour into the pot about an hour before done if you'd like a thicker chili. <NEXT_INSTR> For gluten-free, please OMIT the thickening step. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bean and Meat Chili <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> pork neck <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> spice <NEXT_INPUT> ground turmeric <NEXT_INPUT> potato soup <NEXT_INPUT> chicken stock <NEXT_INPUT> apricot juice <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> steamed jasmine rice <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tbsp vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 lb pork neck, trimmed, cut into small chunks <NEXT_INGR> 1 None onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp Chinese five spice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp ground turmeric <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 cups leek and potato soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chicken stock <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup apricot juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp fresh cilantro, chopped + extra, for garnish <NEXT_INGR> None None steamed jasmine rice, to serve <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup sliced almonds, toasted, to serve <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large saucepan over high heat, cook pork for 3-4 mins, until browned. Set aside. Add remaining oil, saute onion and garlic for 2-3 mins, until tender. Add spices and cook for 1 min. Return pork to pan. Add soup, stock and apricot juice. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 40 mins. Remove lid and simmer for another 15-20 mins, until pork is tender. Add cilantro. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve over rice, sprinkled with almonds and reserved cilantro. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spiced Pork Neck Stew <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> salt-cured spicy pollack <NEXT_INPUT> Cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> Bread <NEXT_INPUT> Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> Water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 Mentaiko (salt-cured spicy pollack or cod roe) <NEXT_INGR> 50 grams Cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp Lemon juice (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 100 grams each Bread (strong) flour, and Pastry flour <NEXT_INGR> 10 grams Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 grams Salt <NEXT_INGR> 20 grams Butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 grams Instant dry yeast <NEXT_INGR> 120 grams Water (Use cold water in summer time, 35C water in winter time) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Microwave cream cheese for 10 second until soft. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix with lemon juice and mentaiko (remove the skin around the mentaiko in advance), and chill in the fridge to harden. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the bread ingredients into the bread pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Select dough-only setting that will finish after the 1st rising. <NEXT_INSTR> When you knead by hand, also that's fine to knead butter at the same time. <NEXT_INSTR> Deflate and divide the dough into 6 pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with a moist tea towel and rest for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> After that, flatten the dough and wrap the mentaiko filling securely. <NEXT_INSTR> When the dough has doubled in volume, the 2nd rising is done. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray water on the dough, hover a fork over the top, and sprinkle with flour to make the designs. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in the preheated oven at 390F/200C to 430F/220C for 18 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> My oven is an old electric oven, so please adjust the temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Cutting into the dough to let moisture escape from the filling might be a nice touch. <NEXT_INSTR> There is a space on top of the filling because of the moisture, but no leaking. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> French Bread with Mentaiko using a Bread Maker <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable shortening <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. vegetable shortening <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. very finely grated sharp Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Beat butter and shortening thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Add very finely grated cheese; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend flour, salt and cayenne pepper together. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in 3 additions. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well after each addition. <NEXT_INSTR> Make a roll of dough. Press into cookie tube firmly. <NEXT_INSTR> Hold cookie maker firmly; press. Bake at 350° approximately 12 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Yields 10 dozen. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Super Cheese Straws <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Shallot <NEXT_INPUT> Tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Pastry <NEXT_INPUT> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> Olive Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Dried Basil <NEXT_INPUT> Oregano <NEXT_INPUT> Fresh Spinach <NEXT_INPUT> Lemon <NEXT_INPUT> Mozzarella Cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Breadcrumbs <NEXT_INPUT> Fresh Basil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 pounds Mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 2 whole Garlic Cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1 whole Shallot <NEXT_INGR> 2 whole Tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 whole Sheet Of Puff Pastry, Thawed <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Dried Basil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 Tablespoons Dried Oregano <NEXT_INGR> 2 cartons Fresh Spinach (or I Used Arugula) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 whole Lemon, Juiced <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Shredded Mozzarella Cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Crumbled Feta <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Fine Breadcrumbs <NEXT_INGR> Fresh Basil, For Garnish (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 375F. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice the mushrooms and mince the shallot and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice tomatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Set these aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Unfold the sheet of puff pastry and place it on a greased baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter and brush it onto the pastry. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat any remaining melted butter and olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add mushrooms, shallot and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until softened. <NEXT_INSTR> Add basil, oregano, spinach and lemon juice to pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir and cook until spinach is wilted. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread mushroom mixture onto puff pastry. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with mozzarella and feta cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Dip the tomatoes in a bowl of bread crumbs to cover them on both sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Place tomatoes on top of cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake the pizza for 25-30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from oven, then top with sliced fresh basil if you have some on hand. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Greek Style Pizza <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>
