<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> lean beef <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> baby carrots <NEXT_INPUT> nonfat beef broth <NEXT_INPUT> light beer <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> olive oil flavored cooking spray (5 one-second sprays) <NEXT_INGR> 12 ounces lean beef round, roast, cut into cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium bell pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium garlic cloves, minced (or 1 teaspoon jarred minced garlic) <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium potatoes, peeled and diced <NEXT_INGR> 24 medium baby carrots, about 1/2 pound <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup nonfat beef broth <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces light beer <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup fat-free evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon paprika <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Coat a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add beef, onion, pepper and garlic; cook until beef is browned, stirring, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in potatoes, carrots, broth and beer; bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer until meat is tender, about 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir together evaporated milk, cornstarch and paprika in a small cup; add to beef mixture and stir to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until slightly thickened and bubbly, about 5 minutes; cook stirring occasionally for 2 minutes more. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Skillet Beef and Beer Stew <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> unsweetened applesauce <NEXT_INPUT> whole wheat flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 egg white <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. skim milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. unsweetened applesauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tbsp. raisins <NEXT_INGR> artificial sweetener (type which withstands heat) to equal 3/4 c. sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix together egg white and milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Add applesauce, mixing well. Combine flour and baking powder. Add to applesauce mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix until smooth. Fold in raisins. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour batter into muffin pans sprayed with nonstick spray or use paper bake cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 10 muffins. <NEXT_INSTR> One muffin equals 88 calories. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sugarless Fat-Free Muffins <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 14 cups unbleached all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 14 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch salt <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 23 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 14 cups brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 cups 35% cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Batter: With the rack in the middle position, preheat the oven to 190 C (375 F). <NEXT_INSTR> Butter a square 20-cm (8-inch) baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In another bowl, combine the oil and brown sugar with a whisk. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the egg and stir to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the dry ingredients alternately with the milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon the batter at the bottom of the dish and place on a baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Sauce: In a saucepan, combine the brown sugar, sugar, and cornstarch. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the cream and bring to a boil, stirring with a whisk. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the sauce over the batter and bake for about 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve warm or cold. <NEXT_INSTR> a a . <NEXT_INSTR> Tips : Freezes well. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sugar Fudge Pudding Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cans (10 count) biscuits <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 Tbsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. brown sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cut each biscuit into 4 to 6 pieces. Combine cinnamon and granulated sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll each piece of biscuit in mixture and place into greased Bundt pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter and brown sugar together and pour over biscuits. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 35 to 45 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Monkey Biscuits <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> white onion <NEXT_INPUT> serrano <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 ounces tomatoes (about 2 medium), cut into 1/4-inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium white onion (about 7 ounces), cut into 1/4-inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 2 to 8 serrano or jalapeno chiles, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> Coarse kosher salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine first 5 ingredients in medium bowl. Season to taste with coarse salt. DO AHEAD: <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Salsa Mexicana  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bread <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 slices American-style sandwich bread, crusts removed <NEXT_INGR> 8 (1/4-inch) slices mozzarella <NEXT_INGR> 5 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons fresh thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Top each of 4 slices of bread with a piece of mozzarella. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with the 4 remaining slices of bread to form sandwiches. <NEXT_INSTR> Trim the bread to within 1/4-inch of the cheese and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a wide, shallow bowl, whisk the eggs until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the milk, thyme, and salt and mix until well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Dip the sandwiches into the egg mixture one by one to coat, and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a 12 to 14-inch nonstick saute pan, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil until smoking. <NEXT_INSTR> Place 2 sandwiches in the pan and cook slowly until golden brown on the first side, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Flip each sandwich and cook on the other side for 2 more minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove sandwiches and set aside in a warm oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat process with the remaining oil and sandwiches. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mozzarella in a "Carriage": Mozzarella en Carozza <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> bourbon whiskey <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 pounds carrots, peeled, cut into equal-sized pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt, or more to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup bourbon whiskey <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste <NEXT_INGR> freshly ground black pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 2 sprigs fresh thyme leaves for garnish (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt butter in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> When butter foams up, add carrots. Season with salt and cook, stirring, until liquid from carrots evaporates and carrots begin to brown around the edges, 5 or 6 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat to medium-low. Carefully pour in bourbon. Cook and stir until bourbon is almost evaporated, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle in brown sugar. Stir until carrots are almost cooked through, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> When carrots are nearly tender, raise heat to medium-high to thicken the glaze, 15 to 30 seconds. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with cayenne pepper and ground black pepper. Transfer to serving dish and garnish with fresh thyme leaves, if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chef John'S Bourbon Glazed Carrots <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> yellow onion <NEXT_INPUT> ground coriander <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> sumac <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Greek yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> dill <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> cucumber <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> buns <NEXT_INPUT> handful arugula <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound 80/20 ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 large yellow onion, small-diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon ground coriander <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon sumac <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tablespoon cayenne <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGR> Zest and Juice of 1 small lemon <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon finely chopped garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tablespoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 bunch cilantro, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 bunch dill, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 bunch mint, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 seedless cucumber, diced <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 4 burger buns <NEXT_INGR> Harissa, for spreading <NEXT_INGR> Small handful arugula <NEXT_INGR> 4 sprigs flat-leaf parsley <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For the kofte burger: With your hands, mix together the ground beef, onion, coriander, cumin, sumac, cayenne and some salt and pepper in large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide the mixture into four 4-inch patties. <NEXT_INSTR> For the yogurt sauce: Mix the Greek yogurt, lemon zest and juice, garlic, cumin, cilantro, dill, mint and cucumber in a large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Season to taste with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook burgers on a grill or in a skillet (recommended) to the desired doneness. <NEXT_INSTR> Salt and pepper the burgers liberally and let rest for 5 minutes to ensure a juicy patty. <NEXT_INSTR> Split the burger buns and spread about 1 teaspoon harissa each of the cut-sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Layer with a burger, arugula and parsley. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with some yogurt sauce and chow down! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Kofte Burger with Harissa and Yogurt <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> powdered sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> flour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. butter or oleo, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. powdered sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. ginger <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 tsp. soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/4 c. all purpose flour <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 400°. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix thoroughly butter, sugar and vinegar. Blend in remaining ingredients.(If dough is too dry to handle easily, work in milk or cream, 1 tsp. at a time.) <NEXT_INSTR> Roll dough 1/8-inch thick on lightly floured cloth covered board. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut into desired shapes. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on ungreased baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 6-8 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool slightly before removing from sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> If desired, decorate with icing. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pennsylvania Dutch Light Ginger Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> flour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. flavoring (almond or vanilla) <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/4 c. flour <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 350°. Mix butter, sugar, egg, salt and flavoring thoroughly. Measure flour and work into mixture. Using 1/4 dough at a time, force through cookie press on ungreased <NEXT_INSTR> baking sheet in desired shapes. Bake 6 to 9 minutes or until set but not brown. Makes about 5 dozen cookies. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spritz(Press Cookie)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chestnuts washed <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> arborio rice <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable stock <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> spring onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 3/8 cups chestnuts washed and sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups arborio rice <NEXT_INGR> 5 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 1/4 cups vegetable stock <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 bay leaves <NEXT_INGR> spring onion to garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large skillet heat up oil, add garlic and onions; saute for 3 minutes then add mushrooms and continue for further 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add bay leaves. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Add vegetable or chicken stock, one ladle at a time. Simmer until liquid has been absorbed; don't forget to stir to avoid sticking. <NEXT_INSTR> Continue to add the stock in this way, until all the stock has been absorbed and the rice cooked. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with chopped spring onion. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chestnut Risotto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> marshmallows <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> maraschino cherries <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> rice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (6 oz.) mini marshmallows <NEXT_INGR> 1 (No. 2) can crushed pineapple, drained (save juice) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 Tbsp. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1 small jar maraschino cherries, drained (save juice) <NEXT_INGR> 1 carton (small) Cool Whip <NEXT_INGR> chopped pecans <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. cooked rice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook rice with juice of cherries and pineapple and enough water so you have 2 cups cooked rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine pineapple and marshmallows; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix cream cheese, sugar and mayonnaise. Chop cherries and mix all together with Cool Whip and nuts. Chill. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 6 to 8 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Rice Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lasagna noodles <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> fresh spinach <NEXT_INPUT> bread <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> pasta sauce <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 15 pieces lasagna noodles <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 6 mushrooms, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 carrots, grated <NEXT_INGR> 2 onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb fresh spinach <NEXT_INGR> 2 slices bread <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup chopped fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon dried oregano <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups pasta sauce (of your choice) <NEXT_INGR> 7 slices mozzarella cheese, halved <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook lasagna until al dente. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain off most of the water and add ice-cubes to stop the cooking process. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat oil and cook mushrooms, garlic, carrots, and onions stirring for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Chop spinach and add to pan; cook until wilted. <NEXT_INSTR> Crumble bread and stir into vegetable mixture until well combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in spices. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread a thin layer of sauce in a 13x9-inch baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain lasagna. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread each piece evenly with 1/4 cup of mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with a strip of cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll up and place rolls seam side down over sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon more sauce over rolls. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and bake at 350F until bubbly. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lasagna Roll-Ups <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. honey <NEXT_INGR> 6 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 6 c. pecans and walnuts, combined <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream butter and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Add honey and beat well. <NEXT_INSTR> Separate eggs and add well beaten yolks to mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Add salt and vanilla. Add milk and flour; beat mixture well and add pecans and walnuts. Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bradford Nut Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 8 slices streaky bacon, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 9 ounces chestnut mushrooms, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 10 ounces risotto rice <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups hot chicken stock <NEXT_INGR> grated parmesan cheese, to serve <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat the oil in a deep frying pan and cook the onion and bacon for 5 mins to soften. Add the mushrooms and cook for a further 5 mins until they start to release their juices. Stir in the rice and cook until all the juices have been absorbed. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the stock, a ladleful at a time, stirring well and waiting for most of the stock to be absorbed before adding the next ladleful - it will take about 20 mins for all the stock to be added. Once the rice is cooked, season and serve with the grated Parmesan. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bacon & Mushroom Risotto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground round <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> American cheese <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> rolls <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 lb. ground round <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 3 hard-cooked eggs, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. grated American cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 small can tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> 24 to 36 rolls or buns <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown onions and garlic in oil, then brown meat and pepper. Add tomato sauce, cheese, eggs and salt; cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Store in refrigerator. <NEXT_INSTR> When needed, fill rolls and heat in 300° oven for 20 minutes to 1/2 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 24 to 36 sandwiches, depending on size of buns. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hamburger Deluxe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> Baking Powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> cold butter <NEXT_INPUT> Shredded Triple <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan Cheese <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. CALUMET Baking Powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. ground red pepper (cayenne) <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup cold butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cups KRAFT Shredded Triple Cheddar Cheese with a TOUCH OF PHILADELPHIA <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. KRAFT Grated Parmesan Cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 400 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix first 4 ingredients in large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut in butter with pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in cheeses. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk eggs and milk until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Make well in center of flour mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Add egg mixture; stir with fork until mixture forms stiff dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Lightly knead dough just until it holds together. <NEXT_INSTR> Pat or roll out to 1/2-inch thickness; cut into 3-inch rounds with floured biscuit cutter, rerolling scraps as necessary to make 10 rounds. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on parchment-covered baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 15 to 17 min. <NEXT_INSTR> or until golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve warm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cheese Scones <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> curry <NEXT_INPUT> green chili <NEXT_INPUT> black salt <NEXT_INPUT> cumin powder <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> coriander <NEXT_INPUT> lots ice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 500 ml buttermilk or 200 ml curds <NEXT_INGR> 1 stalk curry leaf, chopped fine <NEXT_INGR> 1 -2 green chili, deseeded and chopped <NEXT_INGR> black salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cumin powder <NEXT_INGR> 8 -10 leaves mint, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon coriander leaves (chopped) <NEXT_INGR> lots ice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Take butter milk in a big vessel. <NEXT_INSTR> Whip with hand blender. <NEXT_INSTR> If using curds, add 300-350 water and blend with hand or electric whipper till smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the cumin powder and black salt and ice. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend some more so that Ice crushes a little. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into glasses and garnish with the mint, curry leaves and cilantro. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve and enjoy. <NEXT_INSTR> (YOu can put the ice into individual glasses too and then serve). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cool Buttermilk <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pie crust <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> frozen spinach <NEXT_INPUT> light sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> asiago cheese <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> heavy whipping cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pie crust, refrigerated <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup bacon, cooked, about 4 slices <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chicken, pre-cooked & chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) box frozen spinach, chopped, thawed, squeezed to drain <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup light sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups cheddar cheese, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups asiago cheese, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 375°F Unroll pie crust and press firmly against bottom and side of 9-inch regular or 9 1/2-inch deep glass pie plate; flute edge as desired. Prick bottom of crust several times with fork. Bake 10 minutes; cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, in 10-inch skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and onion; cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until onion is tender. Reduce heat. Stir in bacon, chicken and spinach; toss to combine. Remove from heat; transfer mixture to large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir sour cream, salt, garlic powder and pepper into spinach mixture until well blended. Stir in cheeses. <NEXT_INSTR> In small bowl, beat eggs and whipping cream with fork or wire whisk until well blended. Gently fold into spinach mixture until well blended. Pour filling into pie crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 15 minutes. Cover crust edge with strips of foil. Bake 20 to 25 minutes longer or until center is set and edge of crust is golden brown. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Asiago Chicken Quiche <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> black beans <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> cloves garlic <NEXT_INPUT> lettuce <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> Red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> rice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound bag black beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 med. onion, skin removed <NEXT_INGR> 1 green pepper, halved with seeds removed <NEXT_INGR> Salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 to 1/2 c. extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 med. cloves garlic, thickly sliced <NEXT_INGR> Minced lettuce <NEXT_INGR> Minced green onions <NEXT_INGR> Red wine vinegar and oil dressing <NEXT_INGR> Cooked rice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Rinse beans well in cool water. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine beans, onion, green pepper and salt in a large pot (at least 4 qt), and fill 3/4 full with water. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over medium heat, when it reaches a steady boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce to low-medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir and check at least hourly. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook slowly, adding water as needed, approximately 6-8 hrs. <NEXT_INSTR> Beans should be tender, sauce slightly thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove onion and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook extra virgin olive oil and garlic over medium heat till cloves are light brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove closes; add in oil to beans slowly. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer a short while before serving. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve, layer rice, then beans, then lettuce and green onions. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle salad dressing over all. <NEXT_INSTR> Beans may be kept approximately a week covered in refrigerator. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in water when reheating. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cuban Black Beans Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut oil <NEXT_INPUT> prawns <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> rice noodles <NEXT_INPUT> thai <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> bean sprouts <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> peanuts <NEXT_INPUT> red chilies <NEXT_INPUT> lime wedges <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons peanut oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/4 pounds prawns peeled, tails left intact and deveined <NEXT_INGR> 4 cloves garlic crushed <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound ground chicken <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs lightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 13 1/4 ounces rice noodles soaked in boiling water for 5 mins then drained <NEXT_INGR> 7 ounces sauce pad thai <NEXT_INGR> 8 spring onions sliced <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces bean sprouts <NEXT_INGR> 3 ounces cilantro leaves fresh <NEXT_INGR> 2 ounces peanuts toasted, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 2 red chilies long, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> lime wedges to serve <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a wok or large frying pan, heat 1 tbsp oil over high heat. Stir-fry prawns and crushed garlic for 2-3 mins. Remove from heat, cover and keep warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining oil and garlic over high heat. Add ground chicken and brown for 4-6 mins. Add eggs and cook, stirring, for 1-2 mins until almost set. Add noodles, pad thai sauce, spring onions, and prawns. Top with bean sprouts, cilantro, peanuts and chilies. Serve with lime wedges. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Prawn Pad Thai <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cream-style <NEXT_INPUT> Niblets corn <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> corn muffin <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (15 oz.) can cream-style corn <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 oz.) can Niblets corn (undrained) <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 box Jiffy corn muffin mix <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray baking dish with Pam or other vegetable oil spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Can bake 1/2 and freeze the other 1/2 for later use. <NEXT_INSTR> Freezes very well in Ziploc bag. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Corn Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> frozen hash brown potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lb. frozen hash brown potatoes <NEXT_INGR> 2 little green onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 to 1 c. grated Cheddar cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a 9 x 13-inch casserole dish, cook potatoes on High in microwave until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining ingredients; cook until heated all the way through and cheese is melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 12 to 16 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Quick Cheesy Potatoes(Microwave)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> warm water <NEXT_INPUT> cottage cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> fat <NEXT_INPUT> dill <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> soda <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> flour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. yeast <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. warm water <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. cottage cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. grated onion (dry) <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. fat <NEXT_INGR> 1 or 2 tsp. dill seed <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 unbeaten egg <NEXT_INGR> flour to make stiff dough <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Soften yeast in water. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine with other ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Add flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Let rise to double bulk, in warm place. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir down. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn into greased pan and let rise again. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dilly Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> brown onion <NEXT_INPUT> curry <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste <NEXT_INPUT> beef stock <NEXT_INPUT> butternut squash <NEXT_INPUT> green beans <NEXT_INPUT> frozen peas <NEXT_INPUT> basmati rice <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 14 lbs lamb leg steaks, cut into 1in pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1 brown onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 ounces curry paste, rogan josh preferably <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup beef stock <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 lbs butternut squash, peeled, deseeded, cut into 1in pieces <NEXT_INGR> 7 ounces green beans, topped, coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 5 ounces frozen peas <NEXT_INGR> 10 ounces basmati rice <NEXT_INGR> fresh cilantro leaves <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat 3 teaspoons of oil in a large heavy-based saucepan over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add half the lamb and cook, turning, for 1-2 minutes or until browned. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a heatproof bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat with the remaining lamb. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the remaining oil in the pan over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onion and cook, stirring, for 5-6 minutes or until soft. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the curry paste and cook, stirring for 2 minutes or until aromatic. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the tomato paste, stock and squash. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and bring to a simmer. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the lamb and cook, partially covered, for 15 minutes or until the squash is almost tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the beans and peas and cook, partially covered, for 5 minutes or until vegetables are just tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, cook the rice, following packet directions. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide the rice among serving bowls. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with curry and cilantro and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tomato & Lamb Curry (Oamc) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> whole wheat flour <NEXT_INPUT> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> molasses <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 7 1/2 c. whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. dry yeast (2 pkg.) <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 to 4 c. warm water <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. honey <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tbsp. molasses <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place the whole wheat flour in a large mixing bowl and set in the oven at the lowest temperature for 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> While the flour is warming, dissolve the yeast in 1 cup warm water. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the honey to the mixture and set it aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Then dissolve the molasses in 1 cup water. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside while the flour is being warmed. <NEXT_INSTR> This short time period will give the yeast mixture time to work before you combine it with flour. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> No-Knead-No-Fault Whole Wheat Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cucumbers <NEXT_INPUT> red grapes <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> bacon ranch salad dressing <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1-1/2 cups chopped peeled cucumbers <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup seedless red grapes <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (8 ounces) pineapple chunks, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup chopped pecans, toasted <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup bacon ranch salad dressing <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large bowl, combine the cucumbers, grapes, pineapple and pecans. Pour dressing over salad; toss to coat. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Anytime Cucumber Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> white kidney beans <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> Private Selection <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground black pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cans (16oz ea.) white kidney beans. <NEXT_INGR> 1 small red onion, peeled cored and sliced thin. <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup Private Selection Extra Virgin Olive Oil. <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. red wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. freshly ground black pepper. <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Drain the beans in a sieve and rinse thoroughly under cold running water. Combine with the onion in a large bowl. Stir the remaining ingredients in a small bowl until blended. Add the beans and toss until coated. Let stand or chill briefly and toss again before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> White Bean And Red Onion Salad  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. walnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg white <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. water <NEXT_INGR> pinch of salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place walnuts in bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat egg white, water and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in walnuts and coat well. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix sugar and cinnamon and stir over egg white coated nuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray cookie sheet lightly with Pam; spread walnuts and bake 1 hour in 250° oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn with spatula after 1/2 hour to loosen. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cinnamon Walnuts <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken thighs <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> dried lentils <NEXT_INPUT> progresso reduced <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> fresh basil <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, chopped (1/2 cup) <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium zucchini, chopped (2 cups) <NEXT_INGR> 4 medium carrots, sliced (2 cups) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup dried lentils, sorted and rinsed (8 oz) <NEXT_INGR> 4 1/2 cups progresso reduced-sodium chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sliced mushrooms (3 oz) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil or 1 tablespoon dried basil leaves <NEXT_INGR> shredded parmesan cheese, if desired <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Remove fat from chicken. In 3 1/2- to 6-quart slow cooker, mix remaining ingredients except mushrooms, tomatoes, basil and cheese. Add chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook on Low heat setting 5 to 6 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove chicken from cooker; place on cutting board. Use 2 forks to pull chicken into shreds. Return chicken to cooker. Stir in mushrooms and tomatoes. Cover and cook on Low heat setting about 15 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with basil. Serve with cheese. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Crockpot Italian Chicken-Lentil Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> swimmers <NEXT_INPUT> section <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> spring onions <NEXT_INPUT> white pepper <NEXT_INPUT> coriander <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 crabs (blue swimmers raw, cleaned and quartered) <NEXT_INGR> 2 lemongrass (stems pale section only, thinly sliced) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 8 cm ginger (piece fresh, peeled and cut into matchsticks) <NEXT_INGR> 2 spring onions (scallions, ends trimmed and thinly sliced) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon white pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons coriander (leaves, to garnish) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> To segment the crabs, lift the flap under the body with your thumb and pull off the top part of the shell with one hand while holding the body firmly with the other and discard the top shell. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove and discard the spongy white gills on either side of the body and rinse out the brown/yellow much and then use a sharp knife to cut each body in half and then that half in half again and crack the claws with a nutcracker. <NEXT_INSTR> Put a rack into a electric fry pan (skillet - ours are square) and put water into bottom of the frypan (in the original recipe they used a bamboo steamer in a wok and used a heat proof dish in the steamer), bring the water to the boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, place lemon grass on a heatproof plate and place crab on the lemon grass (try to do one layer) and sprinkle with sugar and drizzle with soy sauce and half of the sliced ginger. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the plate in the steamer and cook covered for 3 minutes or until crab is just cooked through (the meat will be white rather than transparent when cooked - we found the crabs in Cowell cooked quicker than we were used to in Perth). <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with spring onions and remaining ginger and cook a further minute or 2 until spring onion wilts and then remove from heat (to be honest I put all the ginger and spring onions together in the previous step and missed this one cooking the crab for 5 minutes which actually overcooked it). <NEXT_INSTR> We just put the plate (or in our case it was 2 plates) in the centre of the table with finger bowls and napkins and everyone helps themselves or put into individual serving bowls and garnish with coriander leaves. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Steamed Crab With Ginger <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> lamb <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 head of garlic, cloves peeled <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup rosemary leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 racks of lamb, frenched (2 pounds each) <NEXT_INGR> Salt and freshly ground pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1.In a mini food processor, combine the garlic, rosemary and olive oil and process until the garlic is finely chopped. Season the lamb racks with salt and pepper and rub the garlic-rosemary oil all over them. Set the racks fat side up on a large rimmed baking sheet and let stand for 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> 2.Preheat the oven to 450°. Roast the lamb in the upper third of the oven for 15 minutes. Turn the racks and roast for 10 minutes longer for medium-rare meat. Transfer the racks to a carving board, stand them upright and let rest for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> 3.Carve the racks in between the rib bones and transfer to plates. Serve right away <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Garlic-Crusted Roast Rack Of Lamb  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mashed banana <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> toffee <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. mashed banana (2 to 3 medium size bananas) <NEXT_INGR> 1 beaten egg <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. firmly packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 (7.5 oz.) pkg. toffee brickle bits, divided (1 1/2 c. total) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 400°. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, combine the eggs, banana, oil and milk; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the flour, brown sugar and baking powder, stirring just until moistened. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside 1/4 cup of the toffee bits; stir the remaining toffee bits into the batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Lightly grease 18 muffin cups or line them with paper baking cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Fill the cups 2/3 full with batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with the reserved toffee bits and bake for about 20 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool for 5 minutes in the pan on a wire rack. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove muffins and cool completely on the wire rack. <NEXT_INSTR> Yields 18 muffins. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Brickle Muffins <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> dry white wine <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> mussels <NEXT_INPUT> garlic soup <NEXT_INPUT> bread <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 3 dozen mussels, Cleaned <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 ounce) envelope savory herb with garlic soup mix <NEXT_INGR> French bread <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In Dutch oven, bring wine and water to a boil over high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add mussels; return to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat to low and simmer covered 3 minutes or until mussels open. <NEXT_INSTR> With slotted spoon, remove mussels to large bowl; discard any unopened shells. <NEXT_INSTR> Strain liquid from Dutch oven using strainer line with cheesecloth or paper towels. <NEXT_INSTR> Reserve enough liquid to equal 1 1/2 cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Rinse and wipe pot clean. <NEXT_INSTR> In same Dutch oven, bring savory herb with garlic soup mix blended with reserved 1 1/2 cups liquid to a boil over high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over mussels. Serve with bread. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Garlic Steamed Mussels <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> liquid smoke <NEXT_INPUT> garlic powder <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. Tender Quick <NEXT_INGR> 6 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 6 Tbsp. liquid smoke <NEXT_INGR> 4 tsp. garlic powder <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Open fresh loaf of bread. <NEXT_INSTR> Put one slice of bread in left hand. <NEXT_INSTR> Put another slice of bread in right hand. <NEXT_INSTR> Move left hand towards the right hand and the right hand towards the left. <NEXT_INSTR> Whaw!! the slices of bread are jammed together--Thus--a Jam Sandwich. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Jerky - Antelope Or Deer <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> springwater <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound Parmigiano-Reggiano rinds and ends <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, peeled and halved <NEXT_INGR> 1 head garlic, halved crosswise <NEXT_INGR> A few sprigs fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 gallon cold springwater <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all the ingredients in a large stockpot over high heat and bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Decrease the heat to low and simmer for 1 hour to 1 hour and 15 minutes, until the broth is richly flavored and aromatic. <NEXT_INSTR> Strain through a sieve lined with cheesecloth. <NEXT_INSTR> Use immediately, or freeze in ice-cube trays, and then transfer to a large resealable bag. <NEXT_INSTR> The broth will keep in the freezer for up to 2 months. <NEXT_INSTR> Use the same quantity (1 pound) prosciutto rinds, end, and bits. <NEXT_INSTR> If you dont use as much prosciutto as I do and want to make the broth, ask your butcher for some scraps you can buy for cheap. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill the broth and skim the fat before using or freezing. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Parmesan Brodo <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. nuts, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Over low heat cook butter, sugar, brown sugar and sour cream. Stirring until sugar dissolves. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook to soft ball stage. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat until luke warm and until it holds shape. <NEXT_INSTR> Add vanilla and nuts. Pour into pan and cool. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Butterscotch Nut Fudge <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 24 each mushrooms fresh <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup walnuts or pine nuts <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups basil snipped, fresh <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup parmesan, parmigiano-reggiano cheese, grated grated <NEXT_INGR> 4 each garlic cloves peeled <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 x black pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> In a food processor bowl or blender container, Place the oil, chopped nuts, basil, parmesan cheese, and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Process or blend until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove and discard stems from mushrooms. <NEXT_INSTR> Clean mushrooms. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon a rounded teaspoon of pesto into each mushroom cap. <NEXT_INSTR> Place a walnut half or several pine nuts atop each. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for about 10 minutes or until hot. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain on a paper towel. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve warm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mushroom Caps with Pesto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> condensed milk <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> custard apple <NEXT_INPUT> cherries <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 14 ounces sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 12 ounces evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs, separated <NEXT_INGR> 1 large ripe custard apple, de-seeded and mashed <NEXT_INGR> cherries (to garnish) or plums (to garnish) or berries (to garnish) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine milks and cook gently, stirring steadily over medium heat for about 20-30 minutes, until as thick as double cream and lightly caramelised. <NEXT_INSTR> Leave to cool in a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the yolks into the mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Place bowl over pan of simmering water. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk until thickens to a custard - about 10 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk egg-whites and fold into mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in custard apple pulp and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Manjarblanco De Cherimoya <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> salt <NEXT_INPUT> White pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Celery <NEXT_INPUT> sage <NEXT_INPUT> pork <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sausage casings <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Sea salt <NEXT_INGR> White pepper <NEXT_INGR> Celery seed <NEXT_INGR> Mace <NEXT_INGR> Minced sage <NEXT_INGR> 4 pounds pork butt and 1 pound pork jowl fat, cured overnight with kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup ice water <NEXT_INGR> Natural sausage casings, soaked in ice water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> First make the brat seasoning by combining equal parts of the sea salt, white pepper, celery seed, mace and 1 tablespoon of the sage. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a meat grinder or food mixer with a sausage grinding attachment, grind the pork butt and jowl fat twice until combined and a smooth consistency. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 2 ounces of the prepared brat seasoning to the ice water and mix until it forms an emulsion then add to the pork mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Knot one end of the casing and attach the casing to the mixer sausage making attachment, fill the casings until approximately 3 inches in length, twist and repeat to the desired sausage amount and then tie a knot to secure the last sausage. <NEXT_INSTR> Poach the sausages in 165 to 170 degree water until the internal temperature reaches 155 degrees (roughly 5 minutes). <NEXT_INSTR> Put sausages on a grill/under a broiler to finish. <NEXT_INSTR> (Alternatively, the brat can be cooked in a pre-heated 375 degree oven for twenty minutes or until they are golden brown.) <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Prime Meats Bratwurst <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> apples <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon rind <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> Brandy <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 9 lrg Eating apples <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. Fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 20 gm Butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp Grnd cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 50 gm Caster sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 x Large eggs, separated Icing sugar for dusting <NEXT_INGR> 50 gm Butter <NEXT_INGR> 50 gm Caster sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp Finely grated lemon rind <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. Fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. Brandy or possibly Calvados, (optional) Single cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 190C/375F/gas 5. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring the Large eggs to room temperature before you whisk them to give more volume. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice off the stalk end of six apples. <NEXT_INSTR> Then cut around the top edge of each apple and scoop out the flesh, leaving about 1cm border. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush all the cut edges of the apple c. with lemon juice to prevent discolouration. <NEXT_INSTR> Roughly chop the flesh and place in a pan with one Tbsp. <NEXT_INSTR> of water. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook for 5-8 min till the apples are softened. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the heat and press through a sieve into a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the butter into the apple puree, then stir in the cinnamon, sugar and egg yolks. <NEXT_INSTR> In a clean, dry, grease-free bowl whisk the egg whites till stiff and dry. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold a quarter into the apple mix, then mix in the remainder using a metal spoon, cutting through the mix till proportionately mixed. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the apple c. in an ovenproof dish, using scrunched foil to keep them stable, if necessary. <NEXT_INSTR> Carefully spoon in the souffle mix and bake for 20-25 min till well risen and golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Make the caramelised apples: Peel, core and quarter the remaining apples, then cut each quarter into four slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the butter in a shallow pan, add in the apples and cook quickly, turning once, till light golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the sugar, lemon rind and juice and simmer for a few min till syrupy. <NEXT_INSTR> Keep hot till the souffles are ready. <NEXT_INSTR> If using brandy or possibly Calvados, add in it to the caramelised apples, ignite carefully and serve when the flames have disappeared. <NEXT_INSTR> Place one apple souffle on each hot serving plate with a small pile of the warm caramelised apples and some cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Dust the souffles with icing sugar and serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Apple Souffle Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> rice <NEXT_INPUT> broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 c. rice <NEXT_INGR> 2 pkg. frozen chopped broccoli <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 small jar Cheez Whiz <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 c. Durkee onion rings <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook broccoli as directed. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute onion in butter. Mix cream of mushroom soup with Cheez Whiz. <NEXT_INSTR> Add rice, onion, broccoli (drained) and 1 cup onion rings. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover casserole and bake at 350° for 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove cover, sprinkle 1/4 cup onion rings on top and bake 5 more minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Broccoli Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> plain yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ginger <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup plain yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, peeled and minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 lemon, juiced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons curry powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 - 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (to taste) <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 4 chicken breast fillets, skinless chicken breast halves <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix the yogurt, garlic, ginger, lemon juice, curry, cayenne, and salt in a large ziplock bag until well combined. Add the chicken and turn to coat. Marinate the chicken at least 1 hour or up to 24 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the chicken from the marinade (discard the marinade) and grill over medium-high heat , about 12 minutes per side, until cooked thoroughly. Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Grilled Indian-Style Curry Yogurt Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> CAKE <NEXT_INPUT> All-purpose <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Baking Powder <NEXT_INPUT> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> Eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Milk <NEXT_INPUT> GANACHE <NEXT_INPUT> Heavy Cream <NEXT_INPUT> Espresso Powder <NEXT_INPUT> Chocolate Chips <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> FOR THE CAKE: <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups All-purpose Flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Fine Salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Baking Powder <NEXT_INGR> 16 Tablespoons Unsalted Butter, Room Temperature <NEXT_INGR> 2-1/2 cups Granulated Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Biscoff Spread (or "cookie Butter") <NEXT_INGR> 4 Large Eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Milk <NEXT_INGR> FOR THE GANACHE: <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cups Heavy Cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tablespoon Instant Espresso Powder <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cups High Quality Semisweet Chocolate Chips <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For the cake: <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 350 F and place rack in the lower middle position. Prep a standard sized bundt pan with flour/oil baking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium sized bowl whisk together the dry ingredients (flour through baking powder) and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a beater blade or paddle attachment, cream the butter, sugar, and Biscoff spread together. Add the eggs, one at a time, making sure each is incorporated before adding the next. Scrape down the sides of the bowl if necessary. Add milk; mix until incorporated. Slowly add the reserved dry ingredients and mix until combined; scraping bowl if necessary. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove pan from the oven. Cool cake in the pan for 5 minutes before removing it. Then allow it to rest on a cooling rack until completely cool. When cool, put it on a serving platter before pouring the ganache over the top. <NEXT_INSTR> For the ganache: <NEXT_INSTR> While the cake is cooling, make ganache by gently heating the heavy cream in a medium saucepan over medium heat. When cream is hot add the espresso powder and stir to dissolve. Add chocolate and continue heating slowly, stirring constantly, until the ingredients are fully combined and the mixture looks smooth and creamy. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat and pour it through a fine mesh sieve into a bowl to make sure it's nice and smooth. Allow ganache to cool until it thickens slightly, then pour over cake. Chill cake just long enough to set the ganache. Cover and store at room temperature for several days. <NEXT_INSTR> Recipe adapted from A Beautiful Bite. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Biscoff Bundt Cake With Espresso Ganache <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> cranberries <NEXT_INPUT> onion soup <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 chicken breasts (skinless) <NEXT_INGR> 1 can whole cranberries <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. Best Foods mayonnaise <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook rice and cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Add all the chopped ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Save a small amount of the marinade and mix with mayonnaise. Pour over rice mix and stir well. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill and serve. <NEXT_INSTR> Looks great served with a leaf of lettuce on a salad plate. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> San Francisco Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Minute rice <NEXT_INGR> 1 small can black olives, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 small can mushrooms, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. grated Mozzarella cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Fry hamburger, onion, salt and pepper in skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> In another pan, add remaining ingredients except cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine these two mixtures in casserole dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with grated cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 20 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pizza Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> frozen phyllo dough <NEXT_INPUT> orange-flavored liqueur <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> orange zest <NEXT_INPUT> blueberries <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> ground coriander <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound or 2 cups unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> Peel of 1 orange <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 package frozen phyllo dough, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons orange-flavored liqueur <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, divided <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons orange zest, divided <NEXT_INGR> 6 cups blueberries, divided <NEXT_INGR> 2 pounds cream cheese, at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons ground coriander <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the butter with the orange peel and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Place a sheet of phyllo dough on a parchment-covered baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush the phyllo with melted butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with another sheet of phyllo dough and brush it with butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat until all sheets are layered. <NEXT_INSTR> Be sure to keep the phyllo sheets covered with a damp kitchen towel as you use them so they dont dry out. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine the orange-flavored liqueur, 1/2 cup confectioners sugar, 1 tablespoon orange zest, and 3 cups blueberries in a large saucepan and place the pan over medium-low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the mixture to a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Strain. <NEXT_INSTR> In a stand mixer, or using a hand held mixer, make the filling by blending together the cream cheese, sour cream, remaining orange zest, remaining confectioners' sugar, and ground coriander. <NEXT_INSTR> When the filling is well-blended, gently stir in the blueberries. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut the phyllo dough into 8 (4-inch) squares. <NEXT_INSTR> Place a square of phyllo on each plate, and top with a dollop of filling; add another phyllo square, another dollop of filling, then top with blueberry sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat the process to make 4 servings. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Blueberry Napoleon with Orange-Blueberry Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream butter and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Put eggs in a cup and finish filling with milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Add this to the butter and sugar; beat well. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift flour with baking powder alternately with milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in tube pan in a slow oven. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> 5 Minute Pound Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pasta <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> handful baby spinach leaves <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> feta cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 oz farfalle pasta <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 slices thick-cut bacon, cut into 1/2-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 3 None ripe tomatoes, coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 handful baby spinach leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 3 oz crumbled feta cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook the pasta in a large saucepan of boiling salted water according to the package directions. Drain well, then return to the pan and keep hot. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large skillet on medium heat. Add the bacon and cook for 3-4 mins until crisp. Add the tomato, spinach and garlic. Cook and stir for 3-4 mins until the tomato is softened. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the tomato and bacon mixture to the pasta and toss on low heat to coat the pasta. Season to taste. Sprinkle with the feta cheese. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pasta With Bacon And Spinach <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lean ground meat <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> beans <NEXT_INPUT> minestrone soup <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lb. lean ground meat, browned and drained <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans Rotel tomatoes (mild, regular <NEXT_INGR> hot) <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans ranch-style beans <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans minestrone soup <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add ingredients and cook on low heat for about an hour. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Two-by-Four Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> garlic salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> cold butter <NEXT_INPUT> fully cooked ham <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 3 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> Dash pepper <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons cold butter, cubed <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup finely chopped fully cooked ham <NEXT_INGR> 2 green onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup 2% milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 450°. In a large bowl, whisk the first five ingredients. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in ham and green onions. Add milk; stir just until moistened. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface; knead gently 8-10 times. Pat or roll dough to 1/2-in. thickness; cut with a floured 2-1/2-in. biscuit cutter. Place 2 in. apart on an ungreased <NEXT_INSTR> . Bake 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Ham & Green Onion Biscuits <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> boiling water <NEXT_INPUT> black kale <NEXT_INPUT> shallots <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> paste <NEXT_INPUT> fresh-ground black pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 or more dried shitake mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup boiling water <NEXT_INGR> 1 bunch black kale <NEXT_INGR> 1 shallots <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1-2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon gluten-free miso paste <NEXT_INGR> fresh-ground black pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Soak the mushrooms in the boiling water. Work on other prep while waiting. <NEXT_INSTR> If desired, remove the tough part of the spine of the kale. Roughly chop the kale. Thinly slice the shallot, and mince the garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the mushrooms from the hot water, reserving the liquid. Squeeze the extra water out of the mushrooms and then slice them. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat olive oil in a skillet over a medium-low flame. Add the shallots and saute until they begin to soften, then add the garlic, kale, and mushrooms. Saute until all the kale is wilted. <NEXT_INSTR> Move everything to one side of the skillet and turn up the heat to medium-high. On the empty side, add the wine and 1/4 cup of the reserved mushroom soaking liquid, then add the miso and incorporate. Stir the liquid into the the kale mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer until most of the liquid evaporates. Remove from heat and add freshly ground black pepper to taste. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Miso Braised Kale And Mushrooms <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shallots <NEXT_INPUT> grape tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> bread <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> sherry vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> hearts <NEXT_INPUT> goat cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 small shallots, quartered <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups grape tomatoes (8 ounces) <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup pumpernickel bread cubes (1/2-inch) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon sherry vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 2 romaine hearts, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch ribbons <NEXT_INGR> 3 ounces goat cheese, crumbled <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 350. <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium baking dish, toss the shallots with the tomatoes and 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Roast for about 45 minutes, until tender and lightly browned. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, spread the pumpernickel cubes in a pie plate and toast for about 10 minutes, until crisp. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, whisk the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons of olive oil with the mayonnaise, sherry vinegar and mustard and season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, toss the shallots and tomatoes, toasted pumpernickel croutons and romaine with the dressing until coated. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the goat cheese and toss gently. <NEXT_INSTR> Mound the salad on plates and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Roasted Tomato and Shallot Salad with Goat Cheese <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> jalapeno juice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 whole chicken, rinsed and excess fat removed <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> pepper <NEXT_INGR> jalapeno juice (from a jar or beer) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Season the chicken inside and out with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Fill the can of beer with finely chopped onion and garlic and a generous amount of jalapeno juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the beer can inside the chicken's cavity and prop the chicken on the grill. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over indirect heat for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours with the grill lid closed. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Borracho Chicken ( Drunken / Beer Can Chicken ) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> shredded cheese <NEXT_INPUT> apples <NEXT_INPUT> jalapeno jelly <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 3 green onions chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chopped pecans <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shredded cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped apples <NEXT_INGR> small jar jalapeno jelly <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Stir first 4 ingredients together in a small mixing bowl <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a serving bowl and pour jalapeno jelly over top <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate until ready to serve <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Jalapeno-Pecan Cheese Dip  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 whole chicken breast with rib <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. plain bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. Parmesan cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bone chicken and season with garlic powder; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Dip chicken into egg batter; drain slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Place chicken into bread crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> In frying pan, pour moderate amount of Crisco cooking oil; fry chicken lightly, slightly browning both sides. <NEXT_INSTR> In casserole dish, bake for 1 hour at 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover dish with foil to seal in juices. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mama'S Parmesan Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken breast <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> black beans <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> green chilies <NEXT_INPUT> cumin <NEXT_INPUT> ground cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> flour tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> Campbell's Cream <NEXT_INPUT> blend cheese <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 -1 12 lb boneless skinless chicken breast <NEXT_INGR> 2 (14 1/2 ounce) canslight fat free chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon dried oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chilies, drained (I use Ro-Tel brand) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 1/2 ounce) can green chilies, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup fresh cilantro, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 8 (8 inch) flour tortillas <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 3/4 ounce) Campbell's Cream of Chicken Soup, Healthy Request <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups Mexican blend cheese, I use Kranft 2% <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup green onion, diced <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees & lightly grease a 13x9" baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Depending upon the size of your enchiladas, you might need an additional greased 9x9' pan. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large skillet (with lid) over MED-HIGH heat, bring to boil both cans of chicken broth with 1 additional can of water, oregano, bay leaf, and chopped onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Once mixture has come to a boil, add chicken breasts and cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Poach chicken for 20 minutes over MED-HIGH heat, turning once half-way thru cooking. <NEXT_INSTR> While chicken is poaching, in a medium size bowl mix together; rinsed black beans, RO*TEL, green chilis, cumin, cayenne pepper, and chopped cilantro. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Once your chicken is fully cooked, place it in a large mixing bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> When cool enough, finely shred chicken with two forks, then add black bean mixture and toss all together. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside & save your cooking liquid from the chicken! <NEXT_INSTR> In a small mixing bowl, add can of cream of chicken soup and whisk soup together with an equal amount of cooking liquid from your chicken breasts. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Pile chicken mixture into flour tortillas and roll. <NEXT_INSTR> Line greased baking dish with enchiladas, seam side down. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over cream of chicken soup and top with Mexican cheese and diced green onions. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes in a 350 degree oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove foil for last 5 minutes of baking. <NEXT_INSTR> I liked to serve these enchiladas topped with fresh Pico de Gallo and light sour cream. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Black Bean & Chicken Enchiladas <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 c. potatoes, cooked and mashed <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. butter or oleo <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix and put in baking dish. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet Potato Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> Cajun seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> green tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> center <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> avocado <NEXT_INPUT> sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups self-rising flour <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons Cajun seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 3 large green tomatoes, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 9 slices bacon <NEXT_INGR> 3 center split deli rolls <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1 ripe avocado, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups shredded iceberg lettuce <NEXT_INGR> Hot sauce (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine flour and Cajun seasoning in a shallow dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat to 360°. Dip tomato slices in buttermilk, and dredge in flour mixture. Fry tomatoes, in batches, 2 minutes on each side or until golden. Drain on a wire rack over paper towels; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat bacon according to package directions; keep warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Split rolls, and arrange, split sides up, on a baking sheet. Broil 5 inches from heat 2 minutes or until lightly toasted; remove from oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread cut sides of rolls with mayonnaise; place fried green tomatoes on bottom roll halves. Top evenly with bacon, avocado, and lettuce; sprinkle with hot sauce, if desired. Top with remaining roll halves, and serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fried Green Tomato Po'Boys <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> crescent dinner <NEXT_INPUT> hot sausage <NEXT_INPUT> grated cheese <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cans crescent dinner rolls <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. hot sausage, cooked <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. grated cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, beaten <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Roll one can of rolls to flatten in 9 x 13-inch pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 4 minutes in 350° oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread sausage over bottom, then cheese, then beaten eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Flatten other can of rolls and put on top of cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in 350° oven until brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Breakfast Dish <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> Crisco <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 c. Crisco <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. vinegar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Stir flour, sugar and salt together. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut in Crisco until crumbly. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat water, vinegar and egg in a small bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to flour mixture and stir until moistened. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide dough into 4 or 5 patties. <NEXT_INSTR> Wrap each one in plastic wrap and wax paper. Refrigerate for 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> When ready to roll, flour both sides of patty and rolling pin. <NEXT_INSTR> Dough will always be flaky even if handled more than usual. <NEXT_INSTR> May be left in refrigerator for 3 days or can be frozen. <NEXT_INSTR> Must be thawed before use. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 5 (9-inch) pie shells. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Foolproof Pie Crust <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> ground lamb <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> yellow onions <NEXT_INPUT> pine nuts <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> cucumber <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> mint leaves <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> Hearts of romaine lettuce leaves <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion powder <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> dried leaf oregano <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cups bulgur (cracked wheat) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound ground lamb <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Essence, recipe follows <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup minced yellow onions <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup pine nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup seeded and finely chopped tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup finely chopped, peeled, seeded cucumber <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup finely chopped parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped fresh mint leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup finely chopped green onions <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> Hearts of romaine lettuce leaves <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 tablespoons paprika <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon onion powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon dried thyme <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place the bulgur wheat in a large bowl and pour in enough hot water (about 3 cups) to cover generously. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand until the grains soften, about 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain well in a fine mesh strainer, pressing out excess water. <NEXT_INSTR> Return the bulgur to same large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the lamb and Essence, and cook, stirring, until no longer pink, about 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the cumin, salt, pepper, and cinnamon, and cook, stirring, for 20 seconds. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onions and cook, stirring, until soft, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the cumin and pine nuts and cook until lightly toasted. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the meat mixture with a slotted spoon to the bulgur, leaving any fat in the skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the remaining ingredients, except the lettuce leaves, and toss to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Adjust the seasoning, to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange the lettuce leaves around the rim of a platter. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon the tabbouleh in the center and use the leaves as scoops. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve cold or at room temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine all ingredients thoroughly and store in an airtight jar or container. <NEXT_INSTR> Yield: about 2/3 cup <NEXT_INSTR> Recipe from "New New Orleans Cooking", by Emeril Lagasse and Jessie Tirsch. <NEXT_INSTR> Published by William and Morrow, 1993. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tabbouleh with Lamb and Pine Nuts <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> brown potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound bacon <NEXT_INGR> 6 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) package frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon butter, or as needed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Butter a casserole dish and press mixture into the dish. Top with the remaining cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover casserole and refrigerate to let flavors mingle, 8 hours to overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
