<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> tomato puree <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> Stone's Ginger Wine <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Pepper <NEXT_INPUT> fresh tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Basil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 cups chicken broth or beef broth <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups peeled plum tomatoes, cubed <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons tomato puree <NEXT_INGR> 3 large onions, minced <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons flour <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup Stone's Ginger Wine <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups cream <NEXT_INGR> Salt to taste <NEXT_INGR> Pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> Chopped fresh tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> Basil or dill sprigs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat the stock in a saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the tomatoes, tomato puree, and onions, and simmer 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the pan from the heat and whirl the mixture in a blender. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the butter in the saucepan, stir in the flour, and cook the roux for about 1 minute, without browning. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually stir in the blended soup. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the wine and lemon juice, and heat the soup for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the soup from the heat, and stir in the cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve each bowl garnished with chopped fresh tomatoes and a sprig of fresh basil or dill. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tomato and Ginger Wine Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> red onions <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> shallots <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 pounds small red potatoes, halved <NEXT_INGR> 3 large red onions, cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch wedges (keep root ends intact) <NEXT_INGR> 6 carrots, cut diagonally into 1-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 8 large shallots, halved lengthwise <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> Salt and freshly ground black pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 450°F with racks in upper and lower thirds. Divide vegetable mixture between baking sheets. <NEXT_INSTR> Roast vegetables, stirring occasionally and switching position of sheets halfway through, until vegetables are tender and golden, about 1 hour. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Roasted Potatoes, Onions, And Carrots  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> oranges <NEXT_INPUT> lemons <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> ginger ale <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 6 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 (46 oz.) can pineapple juice <NEXT_INGR> 5 oranges, juiced <NEXT_INGR> 2 lemons <NEXT_INGR> 5 ripe bananas, mashed <NEXT_INGR> 1 bottle ginger ale (cold) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine sugar and water; heat to boiling and boil 3 minutes. Add remaining ingredients, except ginger ale. <NEXT_INSTR> Put mixture into 2 rinsed 1/2-gallon milk cartons and freeze. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove and let thaw some. <NEXT_INSTR> Put in serving bowl and pour ginger ale over. <NEXT_INSTR> Should be slushy when served. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 50 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sheila'S Punch <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fish <NEXT_INPUT> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> red aji limo chile <NEXT_INPUT> limo chile <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> potato <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cubes <NEXT_INPUT> white corn kernels <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 fish fillets (flounder or sea bass) <NEXT_INGR> 12 cooked shrimp (cooled) <NEXT_INGR> 1 red aji limo chile (red peruvian peppers can be found at south american stores, with or without veins depending on how s) <NEXT_INGR> 1 yellow aji limo chile (remove veins) <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups lime juice (do not squeeze limes fully to avoid bitterness, squeeze about halfway) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cooked sweet potato (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 bunch cilantro (leaves only) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 red onion (thinly sliced) <NEXT_INGR> sea salt <NEXT_INGR> 6 ice cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup white corn kernels (previously boiled and cooled, this better known as giant white cusco corn, also optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> The night before or a few hours before boil shrimp, sweet potato and corn on separate containers. Refrigerate. <NEXT_INSTR> If you cannot find aji limo chilies then habanero peppers will do fine. <NEXT_INSTR> You can add an assortment of cooked seafood on this recipe, this is a shrimp and fish ceviche. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut fish filets into small cubes. <NEXT_INSTR> Use the tip of the aji chili to rub the bottom of the glass or plastic bowl you wil be using. <NEXT_INSTR> Thinly dice aji chili. <NEXT_INSTR> In glass bowl, add fish, 6 ice cubes, and lime juice. Salt to taste. Stir. <NEXT_INSTR> Let fish cook in lemon juice for about 15 minutes and remove ice cubes,. <NEXT_INSTR> Add aji peppers to taste, add shrimp, stir. <NEXT_INSTR> Chop up cilantro leaves and incorporate, stir. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sliced red onions, refrigerate for about 15 more minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve accompanied with corn and sweet potato. (optional). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Peruvian Mixed Cebiche (Ceviche Mixto) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hot cooked rice <NEXT_INPUT> corn oil <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> red cooking wine <NEXT_INPUT> beef broth <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 c. hot cooked rice <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. round steak, cut into 1-inch strips <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. corn oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. sliced onions <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. carrots <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. Burgundy or red cooking wine <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 c. beef broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 oz.) can sliced mushrooms and liquid <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 tsp. seasoned salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. celery, diagonally sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. cornstarch <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Saute steak in oil until brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Add onions and cook 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in carrots, wine, broth, mushrooms with the liquid and seasonings. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat, cover and simmer ten minutes longer. <NEXT_INSTR> Dissolve cornstarch in 1/4 cup water. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir into meat mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook stirring constantly until thickened. Serve over rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes six servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Steak Burgundy <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sausage <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> pimentos <NEXT_INPUT> water chestnuts <NEXT_INPUT> rice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. sausage <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. celery, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 green pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 small jar pimentos, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 small can water chestnuts, drained and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 box Lipton chicken noodle soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. Minute rice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Break sausage apart and combine next three ingredients. Simmer until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water chestnuts and pimentos. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil 3 cups water and add whole box (2 packages) of dry chicken soup. Remove from heat and add Minute rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine sausage mixture and soup mixture together and put into casserole dish and cook for 30 minutes at 350°. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Oriental Rice <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Muscadine <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> clove <NEXT_INPUT> water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 lbs Muscadine grapes or 5 lbs scuppernong grapes <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/4 lbs sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 lemon <NEXT_INGR> 1 orange <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon clove <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 - 1 cup water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Prepare grapes by cutting partway through the skin and popping the pulp/seed capsule out of the hull. Put pulp into one pot and the hulls into another. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer the pulp, covered, on low-medium until soft enough to press through sieve or food mill ~ 10 minutes. Add just a little water if necessary to prevent sticking. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, chop hulls very finely in the food processor and return to their pot. Add just enough water to make it possible to simmer without sticking. Cook slowly, covered, 10 minutes or until hulls are softened. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel lemon and the orange. Chop peel finely. Use entire peel, including the white part, to ensure good jelling. <NEXT_INSTR> Juice the lemon and the orange. <NEXT_INSTR> Press pulp through a sieve or food mill to remove seeds. Stir sieved pulp into cooked hulls in a large pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Add citrus juice, citrus peel, and cloves. Bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in sugar and return to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer, stirring frequently until the jellying point is reached ~ 1-2 hours. Timing is approximate and will vary depending on conditions and the amount of natural pectin in the fruit. Check frequently. <NEXT_INSTR> Pack into hot, sterilized jars and process for 10 minutes in boiling water bath. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Orange Spice Muscadine Jam <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> corn syrup <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> confectioners sugar <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. corn syrup <NEXT_INGR> 1 (12 oz.) pkg. Stir until morsels melt and mixture is smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread into foil-lined 9-inch square pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> In saucepan, combine brown sugar, butter and corn syrup. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir until smooth. Bring to a boil; remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add confectioners sugar and walnuts; stir until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread over peanut butter fudge. Chill until firm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cloud Topped Peanut Butter Fudge <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken thigh fillet <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> coarse grain mustard <NEXT_INPUT> balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> beans <NEXT_INPUT> cherry tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> feta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> arugula <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb chicken thigh fillet, skinless, trimmed <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon coarse grain mustard <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INGR> olive oil flavored cooking spray <NEXT_INGR> 14 ounces cannellini beans, drained <NEXT_INGR> 9 ounces cherry tomatoes, halved <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup reduced-fat feta cheese, crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 2 ounces arugula leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1 lemon, cut into wedges, to serve <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Season chicken with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk garlic, mustard and vinegar in a dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken and turn to coat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate for at least 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat a barbecue plate on high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove chicken from marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Lightly spray chicken with oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook for 1 minute each side or until golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat to medium-low. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook chicken for 6 to 8 minutes each side or until cooked through. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and stand for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine beans, tomato, feta, arugula and chicken in a large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss gently. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon onto plates. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with lemon. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Balsamic Chicken and White Bean Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fresh strawberries <NEXT_INPUT> fresh raspberries <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> pretzels <NEXT_INPUT> apricots <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> Chocolate Sauce <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> dark rum <NEXT_INPUT> orange zest <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pint fresh strawberries, washed, dried and hulled <NEXT_INGR> 1 pint fresh raspberries <NEXT_INGR> 2 bananas, peeled, cut into 2 to 2 1/2-inch slices <NEXT_INGR> 12 ounces thick, salted pretzels <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces dried apricots <NEXT_INGR> 6 ounces roasted, salted almonds <NEXT_INGR> 4 to 6 recipes Enriched Chocolate Sauce, recipe follows <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces semisweet chocolate <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons dark rum <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon grated orange zest <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Arrange all of the fondue elements on a platter. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve Enriched Chocolate Sauce warm with the fondue elements. <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium saucepan over low heat, bring the cream, sugar, cinnamon and butter to a rolling boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the heat, add the chocolate and stir until the chocolate melts. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the rum and stir in the orange zest before serving. <NEXT_INSTR> Yield: 1/2 cup <NEXT_INSTR> Prep Time: 15 minutes <NEXT_INSTR> Cook Time: 5 minutes <NEXT_INSTR> Difficulty: Easy <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Fondue <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> basil <NEXT_INPUT> Romano cheese <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> pinenuts <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup packed spinach leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup packed basil leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup grated Parmesan or Romano cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon chopped garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons toasted pinenuts <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Rinse the spinach leaves a few times until they have no sand left on them, and put them into a colander or strainer. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the basil leaves and pour boiling water over them, making sure that they all get covered. <NEXT_INSTR> Immediately submerge the spinach and basil in cold water. <NEXT_INSTR> Once cool, squeeze the leaves to extract as much water as possible. <NEXT_INSTR> In a food processor, combine all the ingredients and process until it becomes a smooth paste. <NEXT_INSTR> Season generously with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Use immediately or store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spinach-Basil Pesto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> soda <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> rum flavoring <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 sticks butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 2 3/4 c. flour (plain) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tbsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tbsp. rum flavoring <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream butter with sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating after each one. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix soda with buttermilk. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift flour and salt three times before measuring; add to mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Add flavorings in small amounts at a time. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours in a tube pan lined with wax paper. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Buttermilk Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> bread <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> blue cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Salad <NEXT_INPUT> arugula <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Mini Cheesecakes <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons unsalted butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 slice bread, processed in a food processor to make 1/2 cup bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup one 8-ounce container whipped cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup crumbled blue cheese, like Stilton or 1/4 cup Roquefort cheese <NEXT_INGR> Salad <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups arugula, crunchy lettuce or another tender crunchy lettuce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon red wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash salt & freshly ground black pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For the mini cheesecakes: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Generously coat four small (3/4-cup) souffle molds with the butter. Divide the bread crumbs among the molds and coat the bottoms and sides heavily with the crumbs, pressing them onto the buttered dish so they stick. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the cream cheese in a medium bowl and add the eggs, sour cream, salt, pepper, and 1 tablespoon of the parsley. Mix well with a whisk and divide among the souffle molds. Sprinkle the crumbled blue cheese on top of the cream cheese mixture in the molds. Top with the remaining 1 tablespoon parsley. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange the molds on a baking sheet and bake for about 20 minutes. The cheesecakes will still be slightly wet and soft in the center. Let cool for 10 minutes before unmolding. <NEXT_INSTR> For the salad: Meanwhile, toss the lettuce leaves with the oil, vinegar, and salt and pepper. Arrange on four plates. <NEXT_INSTR> Invert each cooled mini cheesecake into one of your hands to unmold it, then turn it over so it is right side up and place it in the center of one of the plates on top of the lettuce. Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mini Savory Cheesecakes On Arugula Or Butterhead Lettuce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> button mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> ground cloves <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> beef consomme <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> sweet sherry <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 pints medium button mushrooms, stems removed, washed <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, minced <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup chopped fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dry mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 ounce) can beef consomme <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> 3 teaspoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup sweet sherry <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup sour cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat butter in large skillet, saute' garlic and parsley. <NEXT_INSTR> Add mushrooms and brown lightly, but do not overcook. <NEXT_INSTR> Add seasonongs, sherry, and cornstarch dissolved in a little water or more sherry. <NEXT_INSTR> When heated through, turn off flame and stir in sour cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve in chafing dish or heated bowl. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sherried Sour Cream Mushrooms <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> weight Lump <NEXT_INPUT> Bell Pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Celery <NEXT_INPUT> stalks Scallions <NEXT_INPUT> Sour Cream <NEXT_INPUT> Mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> Black Pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Bay Seafood Seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> Bread Crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> Vegetable Oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 ounces, weight Medium Shrimp, Deveined, No Tails (Frozen Is Fine, Thaw First) <NEXT_INGR> 6 ounces, weight Lump Crab Meat (I But Mine Fresh At The Seafood Market) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cups Finely Diced Bell Pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 stalk Celery Heart, Chopped Finely <NEXT_INGR> 2 stalks Scallions, Finely Diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Sour Cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Black Pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoons Old Bay Seafood Seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Panko Or Unseasoned Bread Crumbs <NEXT_INGR> Canola Or Vegetable Oil, As Needed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> In a pot of boiling water, add shrimp and cook 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain and set aside to cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Once cooled, cut into small pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer into a mixing bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add lump crab meat and gently stir, breaking up crab meat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add diced bell pepper, celery, scallions, sour cream, mayonnaise, black pepper, and Old Bay seasoning. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir well to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> On a clean plate, add panko or breadcrumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a scoop or large spoon (or clean hands, which is what I do), pat out the crab and shrimp mixture into patties, about 3 to 4 inches in diameter. <NEXT_INSTR> Coat both sides well with panko. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in a nonstick baking dish in a single layer. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle with oil and bake 810 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> We love these served with any type of rice and vegetable side dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Baked Crab & Shrimp Cakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tomato soup <NEXT_INPUT> beef bouillon <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (10 ounce) can tomato soup <NEXT_INGR> 2 (10 ounce) cans beef bouillon (or broth) <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup green pepper, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried basil <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> sour cream, for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all ingredients except the sour cream in a large pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir, and bring the soup to a gentle bubble over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Immediately turn down the heat and allow the soup to simmer for 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with a dollop of sour cream and fresh chopped chives if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Zesty Tomato Starter <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> leeks <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> Pecorino cheese <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> Freshly ground pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 tbsp. olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb. guanciale* (or pancetta) <NEXT_INGR> 2 large leeks (white part only) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. fresh thyme leaves <NEXT_INGR> 12 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. grated Pecorino cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. grated Grana Padano (or Parmigiano-Reggiano) <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> Freshly ground pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a 10-inch ovenproof, nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute guanciale until golden brown, about 3 to 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add leeks and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add thyme. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a plate; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Return skillet to medium-low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, whisk eggs, milk, and cheeses; season with salt and pepper; and stir in reserved leek mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into pan and cook until frittata sets around edges, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer pan to oven and cook for 15 minutes more. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Leek Frittata <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hamburger <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> pork <NEXT_INPUT> kidney beans <NEXT_INPUT> butter beans <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> catsup <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. hamburger, browned <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped onions <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 lb.) can pork and beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 lb.) can kidney beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 lb.) can butter beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. prepared mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. catsup <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. green pepper, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> This is a recipe for dried string beans. Take fresh string beans and a needle with a <NEXT_INSTR> fish line and string beans on it like a necklace. Hang them in the attic to dry. <NEXT_INSTR> When you are ready to cook them, cook them like dry shell beans. <NEXT_INSTR> Soak them overnight in water. <NEXT_INSTR> Add a few pieces of bacon pieces, onion, salt and pepper. Simmer for 2 1/2 to 3 hours. Flavor is a combination of dry beans and string beans. <NEXT_INSTR> Very good! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Crock-Pot Ranch Beans <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> boiling water <NEXT_INPUT> orange flavored gelatin <NEXT_INPUT> frozen nondairy whipped topping <NEXT_INPUT> orange segments <NEXT_INPUT> flaked coconut <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 oz. can crushed pineapple in juice (undrained) <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. boiling water <NEXT_INGR> 8 serving size pkg. or 2 (4 oz. serving size) pkg. orange flavored gelatin <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 c. frozen nondairy whipped topping, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 11 oz. mandarin orange segments, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. flaked coconut <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Drain pineapple, reserving juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water to juice to measure 1 cup. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir boiling water into gelatin in large bowl 2 minutes or until completely dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in measured liquid. Refrigerate 1 1/4 hours, until slightly thickened (consistency of egg whites). <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in topping with wire whisk until smooth. Refrigerate 10 minutes or until mixture will mound. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in pineapple, orange, marshmallows and coconut. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Ambrosia Mold <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sausage <NEXT_INPUT> hamburger <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> salsa <NEXT_INPUT> Velveeta cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb sausage <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb hamburger <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) jar salsa (your choice) <NEXT_INGR> 2 lbs Velveeta cheese (must be Velveeta) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown sausage and hamburger along with onion. Drain. <NEXT_INSTR> In a crock pot, cut cheese into cubes and combine all ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until smooth, stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Depending on your taste, you can use hot sausage or hot salsa. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with tortilla chips. <NEXT_INSTR> Scoops chips work best. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hog Heaven <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Orange Sauce <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> fresh gingerroot <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> hot chili flakes <NEXT_INPUT> Chicken <NEXT_INPUT> chicken breast <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Blood Orange Sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups orange juice (blood orange or regular) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon minced fresh gingerroot <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon hot chili flakes <NEXT_INGR> Chicken <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups hot cooked rice <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup thinly sliced green onion (including tops) <NEXT_INGR> soy sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> To make Blood Orange Sauce, mix all sauce ingredients in a 10-12" nonstick skillet over high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to boil and boil until reduced to 1 cup, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir often to prevent burning. <NEXT_INSTR> May be made up to 2 days in advance; use either hot or cold. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, rinse chicken and pat dry. Cut into 1/2 inch chunks. <NEXT_INSTR> In a 12" nonstick skillet or 5-6 qt nonstick pan, heat oil over high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken and stir-fry until lightly browned and cooked through (cut to test for pinkness), about 4-5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add Blood Orange Sauce and stir until it comes to a boil, about 1-2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon chicken and sauce over rice in bowls. Sprinkle with green onion and season to taste with soy sauce. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Szechuan Orange Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> snow peas <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons ginger, grated <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon honey <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon vegetable or canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound chicken breast, cubed, boneless, skinless <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup snow peas, halved <NEXT_INGR> 1 red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch thin strips <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix the first 5 ingredients in a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat and cook the chicken cubes for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the vegetables and cook an additional 2 minutes then transfer the chicken vegetable mixture to a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the sauce to the pan, bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes until reduced by half. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the chicken and vegetables back into the sauce and cook an additional minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Orange Chicken  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 large potatoes, peeled and sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup all-purpose flour, divided <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) package Cheddar cheese, sliced <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon paprika <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). <NEXT_INSTR> In a 2 quart casserole dish layer 1/3 of the potatoes, then 1/3 of the flour and 1/3 of the cheese. Repeat layering 2 more times, ending with cheese. Season with salt, pepper and paprika. Pour milk over top; use more or less, to reach 2/3 of height of casserole dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cheesiest Potatoes Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> green cardamom <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> arbol <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> milk chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> semi-sweet chocolate with cayenne <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 ounces milk (preferably whole) <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 1" piece of ginger, peeled, cut into 4 slices <NEXT_INGR> 4 pods green cardamom, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 chile de arbol, broken <NEXT_INGR> 4 egg yolks <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon sea or kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces milk chocolate <NEXT_INGR> 1 ounce semi-sweet chocolate with cayenne <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Set a pan containing a quart of water on the stove to heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour milk and cream into a stainless steel saucepan. Add ginger, cardamom, cinnamon, and the chile de arbol. Stir, then set over medium heat. Bring to a scald, then remove from heat and put a lid on the pot. Let spices steep for 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk egg yolks together in a mixing bowl. Add the salt to the sugar, and add them to the yolks in a slow, steady stream, whisking continuously. <NEXT_INSTR> Break milk chocolate into pieces and place in a separate mixing bowl. Set a strainer over the bowl. Strain the milk and cream mixture into this bowl and let sit for one minute for the chocolate to melt. Discard spices. Stir mixture with a spatula to completely incorporate melted chocolate. <NEXT_INSTR> Temper chocolate mixture into the eggs and sugar by pouring in a slow, steady stream, and whisking all the while. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide among 4 ramekins. Break the piece of cayenne-chocolate into 4 sections. Drop one into each of the ramekins. This is going to put a little surprise down in the middle of your custards. <NEXT_INSTR> Set the ramekins on a baking sheet with 4 sides. Set the baking sheet in the oven. Pour the hot water into a large measuring cup or pitcher. Use that to pour hot water into the baking sheet so that it comes almost to the lip. Set a second baking sheet on top of the ramekins. This will prevent the custard from forming a skin on the surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake custards for 35-40 minutes. When done, they should still be a bit jiggly. I use a canning jar lifter to remove the custards from the oven. Don't try to lift the baking sheet full of hot water out of the oven until the water has cooled. Leave the door ajar, and the water should be cool enough to safely handle within a half hour or so. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool before serving, but it need not be refrigerator-cold. The custard will have more flavor if it's closer to room temperature. Top with a splosh of whipped cream. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spice Of Life Pots De Crème <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> herbed dressing mix <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 chicken breasts, stewed until tender <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. celery <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. onions <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) pkg. herbed dressing mix <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Remove chicken from bone and chop. <NEXT_INSTR> Put in baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix broth, milk and soup. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook celery and onions in small amount of water until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Add egg and stuffing mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread over chicken mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> maple syrup <NEXT_INPUT> mint leaf <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> light rum <NEXT_INPUT> club soda <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup maple syrup (I personally like the pure maple from Coombs Family Farms) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup packed fresh mint leaf, plus <NEXT_INGR> 2 sprigs of fresh mint <NEXT_INGR> fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> light rum <NEXT_INGR> club soda <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat syrup to a simmer in small saucepan. Remove from heat. Reserve 15 of the mint leaves. Add the remaining mint leaves to the syrup and let steep until cool, then strain (If you like more of a mint taste refrigerate for up to 1 week). <NEXT_INSTR> In a cocktail shaker, muddle the 15 reserved mint leaves with 1 part lime juice and 1 part mint maple syrup. Add ice and 1 part rum. Shake well. Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour the drink into glass. Top off with Club soda. Garnish the drink with mint sprig. Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Maple Mojito <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> frozen rolls <NEXT_INPUT> butterscotch pudding <NEXT_INPUT> oleo <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 24 frozen rolls <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. butterscotch pudding (not instant) <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick oleo <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 tsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> chopped nuts <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Arrange 24 frozen rolls into a greased Bundt pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with package of butterscotch pudding. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt 1 stick oleo, brown sugar and cinnamon and pour over rolls. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with chopped nuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and let stand overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 30 minutes at 350°. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Caramel Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/3 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 6 egg yolks <NEXT_INGR> 3 heaping Tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. cooked raisins <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 tsp. salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix sugar, flour and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Add yolks and enough milk to form smooth mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in rest of milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over low heat until thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add vanilla, butter and raisins (including juice). <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into 2 baked pie shells. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with Cool Whip. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Raisin Cream Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pork loin roast <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> white cooking wine <NEXT_INPUT> preserves <NEXT_INPUT> fig juice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (4 lb.) pork loin roast <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. sliced mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 1 large chopped onions <NEXT_INGR> salt and black pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. white cooking wine <NEXT_INGR> fig preserves (about 6 to 8) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. fig juice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Wash roast and place in baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Salt and pepper the roast (some use red pepper but that is too hot for my family). Place mushrooms, onions and cooking wine around roast, placing figs on top of roast. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour fig juice over roast. <NEXT_INSTR> Marinate overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 325° for about 3 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Very good! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pork Roast <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> shallot <NEXT_INPUT> bottled green <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> green cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Gorgonzola <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 thick slices bacon, about 3 ounces <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 small shallot, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tablespoon drained bottled green peppercorns <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 small green cabbage, halved, cored, and sliced about 1/4-inch thick (about 6 cups shredded cabbage) <NEXT_INGR> Freshly grated black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 ounces Gorgonzola, crumbled (about 1/3 cup) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tablespoon finely chopped fresh parsley leaves <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain on paper towels and crumble. <NEXT_INSTR> Reserve 1 1/2 tablespoons of the fat in the skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine the wine, shallot, peppercorns, and a pinch of salt in a small saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce the heat to medium-high, and simmer until reduced to about 1 tablespoon. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in the cream and simmer until reduced by half. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the large skillet with the reserved bacon fat over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add half the cabbage and season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook, stirring often, until it begins to wilt, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the cabbage to a bowl and cook the remaining cabbage in the same manner. <NEXT_INSTR> Return all the cabbage to the skillet and pour in the cream mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook, stirring often, until the cabbage is very tender yet still crisp, 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the Gorgonzola and the parsley. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper and cook, stirring, until the cheese has melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle each portion with the crumbled bacon. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Warm Cabbage with Bacon and Gorgonzola <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> head lettuce <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> salsa <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 small onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 green pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 head lettuce, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 (10-ounce) package shredded carrots <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 (6-ounce) package radishes, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15-ounce) can no-salt-added black beans, rinsed and drained <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 (16-ounce) jar salsa <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 (8-ounce) package shredded reduced-fat Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 (8-ounce) package shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place toppings in individual serving dishes, and top tacos as desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Taco Bar Toppings <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sherbet <NEXT_INPUT> liters ginger ale <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 gal. sherbet (any flavor) <NEXT_INGR> 1 to 2 liters ginger ale <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix in large punch bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Let sherbet dissolve a little, not completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Party Punch <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Olive Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Nuts <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan Cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup Garlic Scapes <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Olive Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Pine Nuts <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cups Shredded Parmesan Cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Chop garlic scapes into green-bean size pieces and put in food processor or blender. <NEXT_INSTR> Add pine nuts and Parmesan cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> While blending, slowly add olive oil until mixture is smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Use on pasta, pizza, or mix with sour cream for a delicious dip. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Garlic Scape Pesto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mint <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> light rum <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> chilled soda water <NEXT_INPUT> mint <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 20 rinsed fresh mint leaves (each about 1 1/2 in. long) <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons superfine sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 to 5 tablespoons light rum <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 4 to 6 tablespoons chilled soda water <NEXT_INGR> 1 sprig of fresh mint <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In an 8- to 10-ounce glass, combine 20 rinsed fresh mint leaves (each about 1 1/2 in. long) and 2 teaspoons superfine sugar. With a wooden spoon, pound mint leaves with sugar to coarsely crush. Add 4 to 5 tablespoons light rum, 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice; mix well. Fill glass with ice cubes and 4 to 6 tablespoons chilled soda water. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mojito <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bread <NEXT_INPUT> sausage <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> fennel seed <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 loaf frozen bread dough <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb breakfast sausage <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 12 green pepper, diced <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon fennel seed <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup flour <NEXT_INGR> canola oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Spray canola oil into large ziploc storage bag. <NEXT_INSTR> Place loaf of bread into bag, seal and set out overnight on the kitchen counter. <NEXT_INSTR> The next morning cook your sausage until almost done and add the green pepper and fennel. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until done. <NEXT_INSTR> Let the sausage mixture cool for 10 minutes and then add the parmesan and 1 beaten egg. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat your oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile spread the flour onto a clean working surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Take the dough out of the bag and shape into a ball. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll the dough out into a rectangular shape. <NEXT_INSTR> Should be at least 10 inches wide and 16 inches long. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread mixture evenly onto dough, then add the fresh garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll from one end to the other making sure to seal both ends. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake seam side down for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sausage, Green Pepper and Garlic Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> gin <NEXT_INPUT> bitters <NEXT_INPUT> mint <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 ounces gin <NEXT_INGR> 2 dashes peach bitters <NEXT_INGR> 3 or 4 ice cubes <NEXT_INGR> 2 sprigs mint <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all ingredients, except the mint, in a cocktail shaker and shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with mint sprigs. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Derby  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> yellow cornmeal <NEXT_INPUT> crack black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 1-2/3 cups yellow cornmeal, medium grind <NEXT_INGR> freshly crack black pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> butter and sour cream (or yogurt, to feel more virtuous) for serving <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring water to boil in a medium saucepan. Add salt and butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Begin stirring the water in one direction, sprinkling about 1/3 cup of the cornmeal into the depression that forms in the center. Once the water returns to the boil, pour in the rest of the cornmeal, stirring continuously to prevent clumps from forming. Turn heat to low and continue stirring until cornmeal begins to thicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover the pot and cook on low heat, stirring occasionally, for about 10 to 15 minutes. When it is done, the mamaliga will pull away from the sides of the pot. (A tip from Nicolae Klepper, author of Taste of Romania: Wet the handle of a wooden spoon and insert it into the center of the mixture, spinning it a few times. If it comes out clean, the mamaliga is done.) <NEXT_INSTR> Invert the pan onto a wooden cutting board and carefully lift it away - the mamaliga should hold its shape, spreading out slightly. Slice into six wedges and top with butter and sour cream. (Note that as it cools, the mamaliga will harden.) <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Basic Mamaliga <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> First Group <NEXT_INPUT> Italian sausage <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> barley <NEXT_INPUT> Second Group <NEXT_INPUT> chicken stock <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> lentils <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> Group <NEXT_INPUT> salsa <NEXT_INPUT> garbanzo beans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> First Group: <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb. Italian sausage <NEXT_INGR> 1 chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 3 cloves chopped garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup barley <NEXT_INGR> Second Group: <NEXT_INGR> 3 quarts chicken stock <NEXT_INGR> 1 whole chicken breast, skinned, boned, and cut up <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup lentils <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped parsley <NEXT_INGR> Third Group: <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 oz. jar of salsa (mild or medium) <NEXT_INGR> 1 16 oz. can of garbanzo beans <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> First Group <NEXT_INSTR> -saute together until all nicely done <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Add Second Group to this. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer for about 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Add Third Group and heat through. <NEXT_INSTR> Add some chopped fresh spinach at the last minute to preserve bright green color. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lentil Soup  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beef <NEXT_INPUT> pared <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <NEXT_INPUT> water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound grnd beef <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. dry lentils rinsed <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. pared, sliced carrots <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sliced celery <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. minced onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. minced cabbage <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 2 beef bouillon cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1 (46 ounce.) can tomato or possibly V-8 juice <NEXT_INGR> 4 c. water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown beef in large pot over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in remaining ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over high heat till mix comes to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat to low. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer uncovered 1 1/2 hrs or possibly till lentils are tender, stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Soup freezes well. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Beefy Lentil Soup Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> low-fat milk <NEXT_INPUT> ground nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/3 cup flour <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups low-fat milk (1%) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup grated parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a medium, heavy saucepan, whisk flour to remove any lumps. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add 1 cup milk, whisking until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining milk and the nutmeg. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk over medium heat until thickened and comes to a boil, about 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat and stir in Parmesan and butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Season to taste. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Parmesan Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> grapefruit juice <NEXT_INPUT> orange sorbet <NEXT_INPUT> ginger ale <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. grapefruit juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. orange sorbet or lemon ice <NEXT_INGR> ginger ale or club soda <NEXT_INGR> orange twist (for garnish) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. superfine sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place fruit juices and sugar in blender container and process 10 seconds to dissolve sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sorbet and process on low speed until sorbet begins to blend into mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Increase speed to high and blend just until smooth. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sunny Citrus Fizz <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sweet potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> graham cracker <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground black pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 -5 large sweet potatoes <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup butter, divided <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup graham cracker, coarsely crushed <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup pecans, coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup brown sugar, packed <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon ground black pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Prick sweet potatoes with fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Microwave on high 18-20 minutes or until very soft. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand until cool enough to handle. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, melt 5 T. butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine melted butter, graham crackers, pecans, brown sugar and cinnamon in small bowl; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel sweet potatoes and place in large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Mash sweet potatoes with remaining 3 T. butter, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon sweet potato mixture into baking dish; top evenly with pecan mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 20-25 minutes or until topping is golden brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pecan Crumble Sweet Potato Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> grated cheese <NEXT_INPUT> crackers <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lbs sliced steamed squash <NEXT_INGR> 1 small chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup grated cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 cups crushed Ritz crackers <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1 stick butter. <NEXT_INSTR> 1 egg. <NEXT_INSTR> 1 sm. <NEXT_INSTR> chopped onion. <NEXT_INSTR> 1 cup grated cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> 1 cup crushed Ritz or saltine crackers. <NEXT_INSTR> 1/2 cup milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375 degreesr for 30 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Melinda Squash and Ritz Cracker's <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> castelvetrano olives <NEXT_INPUT> oil-cured black olives <NEXT_INPUT> roasted bell peppers <NEXT_INPUT> stalks celery <NEXT_INPUT> capers <NEXT_INPUT> flat-leaf parsley <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> capicola <NEXT_INPUT> soppressata <NEXT_INPUT> mortadella <NEXT_INPUT> provolone <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 sheet pan focaccia (see note) <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons finely chopped castelvetrano olives (or other green olives) <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons finely chopped oil-cured black olives (or other black olives) <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons finely chopped roasted bell peppers <NEXT_INGR> 3 stalks celery, roughly chopped, plus any leaves that might be attached <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons drained capers <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup flat-leaf parsley, roughly chopped <NEXT_INGR> 5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons red wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt, to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound sliced capicola <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound sliced soppressata <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound sliced mortadella <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound sliced provolone <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Make the olive spread. Combine the olives, roasted peppers, celery, capers, parsley, olive oil, vinegar, and oregano in a bowl. Season with salt to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Build the muffaletta. Cut the focaccia in half (so you have two 9 x 13 pieces). Now halve each piece horizontally-a big serrated knife and a slow, sawing motion works best here. Flip the 4 pieces over, so the fluffy interior is facing up. Spread the olive mixture evenly over each. On 1 bottom piece, layer half the meat and cheese in this order: capicola, soppressata, mortadella, provolone. Repeat with the other bottom piece. Cap both with the remaining 2 pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Wrap each sandwich tightly in plastic or foil. Place onto a sheet pan and top with another sheet pan. Load up the top sheet pan with some cans or jars. Weigh down for at least 1 hour (at room temperature) or up to 12 hours (in the fridge). <NEXT_INSTR> When ready to serve, cut each half into 8 to 16 pieces (so, 16 to 32 total) and arrange together to reflect the original, slab focaccia shape. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Slab Muffuletta <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 pkg. biscuits (10 per pkg.) <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 Tbsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 3/4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 sticks butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put cinnamon and 3/4 cup of sugar in plastic bag and shake biscuits that have been quartered in mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in Bundt or tube pan. <NEXT_INSTR> In a saucepan, bring to a boil the butter and 1 cup of sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour this mixture over biscuit pieces in pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from pan immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Monkey Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> green chilies <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 large pkg. flour tortillas <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) carton sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 small can chopped green chilies <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. grated sharp Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 3 green onions, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients in bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Process well. Let tortillas get soft at room temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread mixture on tortillas. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll tortillas up tightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Line up in 9 x 13-inch casserole, cover tightly and refrigerate overnight or a minimum of 3 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from refrigerator, slice tortillas in 1/2 inch rounds. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with Pace's medium Mexican sauce. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mexican Cream Cheese Roll-Ups <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> semi-sweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallow cream <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. margarine <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 c. evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 oz. package semi-sweet chocolate chips <NEXT_INGR> 1 7 oz. jar marshmallow cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine sugar, margarine and milk in a saucepan, bring to rolling boil stirring constantly. Boil 5 minutes, over medium heat. Stir in chocolate until melted, add marshmallow cream, nuts and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Pour into greased pan. Makes 3 lbs. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fantasy Fudge <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Marsala <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 egg yolks <NEXT_INGR> 3 to 4 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. Marsala (sweet or dry) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In the top of a double boiler, beat together the yolks, the wine and 3 tablespoons of the sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the double boiler over simmering water. <NEXT_INSTR> Whip mixture constantly with a wire whisk until it is thick enough to retain a slight peak when the whisk is withdrawn (about 5 minutes cooking time). <NEXT_INSTR> Taste for sweetness. <NEXT_INSTR> If it is not sweet enough, add the remaining sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into stemmed glasses and serve at once. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Zabaglione <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion (chopped) <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb ground beef <NEXT_INGR> salt & fresh ground pepper (to taste) <NEXT_INGR> 12 medium cabbage (shredded) <NEXT_INGR> 3 carrots (peeled, grated) <NEXT_INGR> 2 bay leaves (ground) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oil in a wok. <NEXT_INSTR> Add onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add beef. <NEXT_INSTR> Brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Season. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the cabbage, carrots and bay leaves. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute until crisp tender. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Beef and Cabbage <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> beans <NEXT_INPUT> red kidney beans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> coarse salt and pepper, to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 ounce) package frozen lima beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 (9 ounce) package frozen cut green beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 ounce) can red kidney beans, drained and rinsed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook lima and green beans until al dente, (dont know how else to say it! HA). <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium bowl, whisk together vinegar, and oil; season generously with salt and pepper. Add all beans; toss to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Let marinate at room temperature or in the refrigerator, tossing occasionally, at least 30 minutes and up to a day. <NEXT_INSTR> The longer you let marinate, the better! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Three Bean Salad Ala Martha Stewart <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon Jell-O <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry sauce <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. lemon Jell-O <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 oz.) can cranberry sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) can crushed pineapple <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped celery <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. pecans <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix Jell-O by directions on box. <NEXT_INSTR> Crush cranberry sauce with fork and add Jell-O. <NEXT_INSTR> Add other ingredients and let congeal. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cranberry Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> apple juice <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2/3 c. unsweetened apple juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. cornstarch <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook all ingredients in one quart saucepan over medium heat just until mixture thickens slightly and boils. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir constantly. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Apple Orange Syrup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onions <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable stock <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> medium onions 6 <NEXT_INGR> butter a thick slice <NEXT_INGR> all-purpose flour a heaping tablespoon <NEXT_INGR> vegetable stock (see above) 1 cup (250ml), hot <NEXT_INGR> milk 1 cup (250ml), hot <NEXT_INGR> bay leaves 3 <NEXT_INGR> nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> whole-grain mustard 2 teaspoons <NEXT_INGR> parsley leaves a small handful <NEXT_INGR> a little oil <NEXT_INGR> ham steaks 2, about 5 to 6 ounces (150 to 175g) each <NEXT_INGR> dried oregano <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 350F (180C). <NEXT_INSTR> Bring a deep pan of water to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel the onions, add them to the pan, then decrease the heat and let them simmer until they are tender when pierced with the tip of a knife. <NEXT_INSTR> This will only be a matter of twenty to twenty-five minutes or so. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain them and discard the water (dont try using it in the sauce, the flavor can be too strong). <NEXT_INSTR> Put the pan back on the stove, melt the butter in it, and stir in the flour, keeping the heat low to medium. <NEXT_INSTR> Let the flour and butter cook for a couple of minutes, stirring often so the mixture doesnt burn, then increase the heat, pour in the stock and milk, and whisk together for a minute until there are no lumps. <NEXT_INSTR> Season the sauce with salt and black pepper, the bay leaves, a gentle grating of nutmeg, and the mustard. <NEXT_INSTR> I cannot emphasize enough the importance of these seasonings: they add depth and savor to the sauce and make the whole dish work. <NEXT_INSTR> Let the sauce simmer gently for a good ten minutes or more, stirring regularly so that it does not catch on the bottom. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut the onions in half from stem to tiptake care, they are slipperyand place them, flat side down, in a shallow baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> I use an oval enameled gratin dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Chop the parsley, but not too finely, and stir it into the sauce, then scoop the lot over the onions. <NEXT_INSTR> Their caps will probably be poking out, but no matter, just bake for forty to forty-five minutes until the sauce is bubbling. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn off the heat, but leave the onions in the oven while you cook the ham. <NEXT_INSTR> If your broiler is, like mine, in the oven, then move the onions to the bottom and put the broiler pan two-thirds of the way up, so that it blocks the onions from the broiler (if you prefer, you can cook the ham on a stovetop grill). <NEXT_INSTR> Oil the steaks lightly and season them with pepper, a very little salt, and a light sprinkling of oregano. <NEXT_INSTR> Now broil them for three or four minutes on each side, until golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve the broiled ham with the baked onions and heir sauce. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Grilled Ham, Baked Onions <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fresh cranberries <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> Marsala wine <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolk <NEXT_INPUT> cartons <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry juice <NEXT_INPUT> orange liqueur <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cookies <NEXT_INPUT> baking cocoa <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups fresh cranberries <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup Marsala wine <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg yolk <NEXT_INGR> 2 cartons (8 ounces each) mascarpone cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/4 cups cranberry juice <NEXT_INGR> 4 teaspoons orange liqueur <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/4 teaspoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 package (7 ounces) crisp ladyfinger cookies <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking cocoa <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a small saucepan, combine cranberries, sugar and orange juice. Cook, uncovered, over medium heat until berries pop and mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes. Cool completely. <NEXT_INSTR> For custard, heat wine and sugar in a small heavy saucepan over medium heat until bubbles form around sides of pan. Whisk a small amount of hot mixture into egg yolk. Return all to pan, whisking constantly. Cook and stir over low heat until a thermometer reads at least 160° and mixture coats the back of a spoon. Quickly transfer to a small bowl; place bowl in a pan of ice water. Stir 1 minute. In a large bowl, beat cheese until smooth. Gradually beat in custard; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> For fruit dip, combine cranberry juice, liqueur and sugar in a shallow bowl. Quickly dip ladyfingers into mixture, allowing excess to drip off. Arrange in a single layer in an 8-in. square dish. Layer with 1 cup custard mixture and cranberry mixture. Top with remaining ladyfingers and remaining custard mixture. Refrigerate, covered, at least 4 hours or overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Just before serving, dust with cocoa. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cranberry-Orange Tiramisu <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cucumbers <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> alum <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> coloring <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon sticks <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 gallons cucumbers <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon alum <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 ounce) bottle red food coloring <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 4 cinnamon sticks <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1 (12 ounce) package red-hot candies <NEXT_INGR> 10 cups sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Peel and slice cucumbers into 1/4 inch rounds. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove seeds. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover cucumbers and lime juice with water and soak for 24 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain and rinse 4 times. <NEXT_INSTR> Soak in cooled water for 3 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine alum, 1 cup vinegar and red food coloring. <NEXT_INSTR> Put over cucumbers and add enough water to cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil, then simmer for 2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain and throw away the solution. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine 2 cups vinegar, cinnamon, water, red hots and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to boil and pour over rings. <NEXT_INSTR> Let set 24 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain and boil liquid again. <NEXT_INSTR> Place rings in jars and pour hot liquid over rings and seal. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cinnamon Cucumber Rings <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beets <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 lb. beets <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. minced onion <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook beets until tender; cool slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel and dice. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend sugar, salt and cornstarch in another pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add vinegar; stir until mixed. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until thick and smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Add butter and onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir; pour over beets (heat if desired). <NEXT_INSTR> Makes about 6 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Harvard Beets <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bing cherry <NEXT_INPUT> fresh lime <NEXT_INPUT> powdered sugar <NEXT_INPUT> lime wheel <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 fluid ounces bing cherry infused Cruzan Light Rum <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 fresh lime, juiced <NEXT_INGR> 2 heaping bar spoons powdered sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 lime wheel <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Shake all ingredients until well chilled, strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with a lime wheel. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bing Cherry Daiquiri <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> rapid-rise <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolk <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 4 to 4 1/2 cups flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt if desired <NEXT_INGR> 3 packages rapid-rise yeast <NEXT_INGR> 8 tablespoons butter plus butter for greasing a bowl and pans <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup egg yolks (from about 12 eggs) <NEXT_INGR> Plus 1 egg yolk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cold water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put milk in a small saucepan and heat to 130 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Put 4 1/4 cups flour, the sugar, salt, yeast, 8 tablespoons butter and 1 cup egg yolks into the container of a food processor. <NEXT_INSTR> Start blending while gradually adding the milk to produce very stiff dough. <NEXT_INSTR> If blending slows, stop the machine and turn the dough out onto a lightly floured board. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead by hand about 5 minutes, adding up to 1/4 cup more flour to produce a spongy dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Add as little flour as possible. <NEXT_INSTR> When ready, the dough may be a trifle sticky. <NEXT_INSTR> Lightly butter inside of a mixing bowl and add ball of dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with clean cloth and let stand 1 hour and 10 minutes or until double in bulk. <NEXT_INSTR> Butter two 8-cup loaf pans. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide dough in half and shape into 2 oval shapes. <NEXT_INSTR> Put one oval in each buttered pan and press the dough, making it rounded on top. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in warm, draft-free place and cover with clean cloth. <NEXT_INSTR> Let rise about 35 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, preheat oven to 375 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Using scissors, clip the top lightly and uniformly in several spots up and down the center of each loaf. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the one egg yolk with the water and brush the top of each brioche with a little of the mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in the oven and bake 35 minutes to an internal temperature of about 200 degrees. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Brioche <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> rhubarb <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> blueberry pie filling <NEXT_INPUT> raspberry jello <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 c. rhubarb, cooked (fresh or frozen) <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 5 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 can blueberry pie filling <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 oz.) pkg. raspberry jello <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook rhubarb in 1 cup water until tender (sauce). <NEXT_INSTR> Add sugar, stirring constantly, until dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Add pie filling and cook 8 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat and add jello. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir until dissolved. Put into jars, seal and keep in freezer or refrigerator. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Blueberry Jam <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> rice cakes <NEXT_INPUT> cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> gochujang <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> ketchup <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 16 ounces rice cakes, for tteokbokki (defrosted if using frozen) <NEXT_INGR> 2 sheets korean rectangular fish cakes (Shagahk Oden, cut into squares) (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups cabbage (cut into 1 in squares) <NEXT_INGR> 1 carrot (sliced) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 onion (sliced) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped garlic (or 1 tsp garlic powder) <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups water (anchovy stock would be preferred if available) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons gochujang (spicy red bean paste) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ketchup <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Using a non-stick saute pan, add the water or anchovy stock and cabbage, carrot and onion and bring to a boil. Add gochujang, garlic, soy sauce, salt and sugar to this mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> When it reaches a full boil, add rice cake and fish cake and stir. Simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally to make sure rice cakes don't stick to the bottom of the pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Taste after the simmer time and adjust seasoning if necessary. Add ketchup, stir in, and sprinkle with black pepper before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tteokbokki - Korean Spicy Rice Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> bacon bits <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound red potatoes, cut into chunks <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 (3 ounce) can bacon bits <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon grated Parmesan cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with lightly salted water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and allow to steam dry for a minute or two. <NEXT_INSTR> Mash the potatoes until smooth, then add the cream cheese, Cheddar cheese, bacon, cayenne pepper, and garlic powder. Mash until the ingredients are well blended, then transfer to a serving dish, and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese to garnish. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Loaded Baby Reds <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> beef brisket <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> lemons <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> oranges <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> tomato ketchup <NEXT_INPUT> maple syrup <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> oyster sauce <NEXT_INPUT> tamarind paste <NEXT_INPUT> cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> beef <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> anise <NEXT_INPUT> cloves <NEXT_INPUT> tomato puree <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> shallots <NEXT_INPUT> red cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> lime <NEXT_INPUT> coriander seeds <NEXT_INPUT> cumin seeds <NEXT_INPUT> anise <NEXT_INPUT> handful rocket leaves <NEXT_INPUT> flour tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> sweetcorn salsa <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 l (3.5pints) water <NEXT_INGR> 160 g (5.6oz) salt <NEXT_INGR> 10 g (0.4oz) fresh thyme <NEXT_INGR> 15 g (0.5oz) fresh rosemary <NEXT_INGR> 2 bay leaves <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic <NEXT_INGR> 5 g (0.2oz) black peppercorn <NEXT_INGR> 2.25 kg (5lbs) beef brisket <NEXT_INGR> 0.5 lemon, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 lemons, juice only <NEXT_INGR> 0.5 orange, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 3 oranges, juice only <NEXT_INGR> 20 g (0.7oz) ginger, peeled and finely sliced <NEXT_INGR> 250 g (8.8oz) tomato ketchup <NEXT_INGR> 115 g (4.1oz) maple syrup <NEXT_INGR> 15 ml (0.5fl oz) Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 100 ml (3.5fl oz) soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 45 ml (1.6fl oz) oyster sauce <NEXT_INGR> 15 g (0.5oz) tamarind paste <NEXT_INGR> 45 g (1.6oz) cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 200 g (7.1oz) jus for beef <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp smoked paprika <NEXT_INGR> 4 g (0.1oz) star anise <NEXT_INGR> 3 g (0.1oz) coriander seed <NEXT_INGR> 2 g (0.1oz) cloves <NEXT_INGR> 100 g (3.5oz) tomato puree <NEXT_INGR> 100 g (3.5oz) golden caster sugar <NEXT_INGR> 200 g (7.1oz) shallots, peeled and finely sliced <NEXT_INGR> 325 g (11.5oz) red cabbage, finely sliced <NEXT_INGR> 0.5 orange, zest and juice <NEXT_INGR> 0.5 lime, juice only <NEXT_INGR> 0.5 tsp coriander seeds <NEXT_INGR> 0.5 tsp cumin seeds <NEXT_INGR> 0.5 star anise <NEXT_INGR> 1 handful rocket leaves <NEXT_INGR> 8 soft flour tortillas <NEXT_INGR> 1 dollop sweetcorn salsa per wrap (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> To brine the meat: place all the ingredients except the brisket in a pan and bring to the boil, mix well and leave to cool down completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the brisket in and leave for 24 hours or preferably 2 days (in the fridge). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the brine and wash in cold water for 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> For the marinade: place all the ingredients in a large sauce pan over medium heat and bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce the heat and allow to simmer for 20 minutes before straining the liquid through a fine sieve. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat the oven to 110C/gas mark 1/4. <NEXT_INSTR> Sear the brisket in a hot pan with little oil, until all the sides are caramelized. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in a deep sided roasting tray and add the marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook in a preheated oven for 5 hours, covering with foil halfway through. <NEXT_INSTR> After the time has elapsed, allow the brisket to cool in the liquid. <NEXT_INSTR> Then strain the liquid through a fine sieve and place in a pan over medium heat and allow to reduce to sauce consistency. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the brisket and brush some of the sauce on while turning it on all sides until heated through. <NEXT_INSTR> For the slaw: in a bowl, mix the cabbage with the orange zest and juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the lime juice and a pinch of salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with clingfilm and place in the fridge for 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, toast the coriander seeds, cumin seeds and star anise in a pan over medium heat for a couple of minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a pestle and mortar, grind the seeds to a coarse powder then mix the spices with the slaw and season with salt. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve, place rocket leaves in the lower half of a warm tortilla and add slices of the brisket. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with some slaw and finish with some sweetcorn salsa. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold the 2 ends in and roll the tortilla into a tight roll. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat for remaining tortillas and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Heston Blumenthal's brisket wrap recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> cherry pie filling <NEXT_INPUT> yellow cake mix <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple <NEXT_INGR> 1 (21 oz.) can cherry pie filling <NEXT_INGR> 1 box yellow cake mix <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick butter or margarine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Dump pineapple into 9 x 13 x 2-inch ungreased pan (don't drain). <NEXT_INSTR> Spread cherry pie filling over pineapple, then spread cake mix over pie filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle chopped nuts over cake mix. Add butter in thin pats or melt and pour over. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 1 hour at 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 12 to 16 people. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dump Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ricotta <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> salmon gravlax <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 7 oz ricotta <NEXT_INGR> 1 None large egg, lightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup self-rising flour, plus 2 tbsp <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tbsp butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> None None salmon gravlax, to serve (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Whisk together ricotta, egg, sugar and milk. Stir in flour and mix until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a nonstick frying pan over medium heat and brush with melted butter. Cook heaped tablespoons of batter for 1-2 mins, until bubbles appear. Flip over and cook for another 1-2 mins, or until golden brown and cooked through. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil. Repeat with remaining butter and batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with salmon gravlax, if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Ricotta Mini Pancakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>
