<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups flour <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup skim milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 3 12 tablespoons melted butter <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup chocolate chips <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400F. <NEXT_INSTR> Place wax paper on a large baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine dry ingredients (except chocolate) in a large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine other ingredients in a second bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chocolate chips. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop by large spoonfuls onto the baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 15 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Quick Chocolate Chip Scones <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> cooking spray <NEXT_INPUT> lime <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup low sodium soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon curry powder <NEXT_INGR> 3 garlic cloves, minced <NEXT_INGR> 8 (6 ounce) chicken thighs or (6 ounce) chicken breasts, skinned <NEXT_INGR> cooking spray <NEXT_INGR> lime wedge (optional) <NEXT_INGR> green onion top (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine first 6 ingredients in a large ziploc plastic bag, add chicken. Seal and marinate in refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight, turning ocacsionnally. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare grill. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove chicken from bag, reserving marinade. Place marinade in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, cook 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Place chicken on grill rack coated with cooking spray; grill 20 minutes or until done, turning and basting frequently with cooked marinade. Garnish with lime wedges and green onion tops, if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Asian Barbecue Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> White Cake Mix <NEXT_INPUT> Orange Juice <NEXT_INPUT> Brown Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Orange Juice <NEXT_INPUT> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> Baking Pan <NEXT_INPUT> Confectioners Sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 box White Cake Mix <NEXT_INGR> Orange Juice (instead Of Water On Box Instructions) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cups Dark Brown Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cups Orange Juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Butter <NEXT_INGR> 9 X 12- Inch Baking Pan <NEXT_INGR> Confectioners Sugar, For Dusting <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare the white cake mix according to package instructions, with the exception of substituting orange juice for water. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into a 9 x 12- inch greased baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 30 minutes or until the cake springs back when lightly touched. <NEXT_INSTR> Let the cake rest in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a serving dish. <NEXT_INSTR> While the cake cools, in a saucepan over medium heat, cook the dark brown sugar, butter and orange juice. Let the mixture just come to a boil. Remove from the heat and let it cool slightly. Meanwhile, poke several holes through the top of the cake, at least halfway down through the thickness of the cake. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon over or very slowly pour the orange juice mixture over the top of the cake. <NEXT_INSTR> Dust the cake with confectioners' sugar. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Brown Sugar ‘N Orange Juice Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> fresh spinach leaves <NEXT_INPUT> feta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> dill weed <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> phyllo <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 tablespoons thinly sliced green onions <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 teaspoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cups torn fresh spinach leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 to 2 teaspoons dill weed <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> 7 sheets phyllo dough (14 inches x 9 inches) <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a small skillet, cook onions in oil until tender. Stir in spinach; cook and stir for 2 minutes longer. Cool and squeeze dry. In a large bowl, combine the cheese, dill and parsley. Stir in spinach mixture; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Place one sheet of phyllo dough on a lightly floured surface. Lightly brush with butter. Top with another sheet of phyllo dough; brush with butter. Repeat with remaining dough. (Keep remaining phyllo covered with plastic wrap and a damp towel to prevent it from drying out.) Place a 6-oz. custard cup upside down on dough. Cut around custard cup with a small pizza cutter. <NEXT_INSTR> Place about 4 teaspoons of cheese mixture in the center of each circle. Bring edges of circle up and around cheese, forming a tart. Brush dough with butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on an ungreased <NEXT_INSTR> . Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown and spinach mixture is hot. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spanakopita Tarts <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> nonstick cooking spray <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> egg whites <NEXT_INPUT> light margarine <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> boiling water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> nonstick cooking spray <NEXT_INGR> 1 34 cups flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 34 cups packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup cocoa powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 14 cups reduced-fat buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 3 large egg whites <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons light margarine, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup boiling water <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350F Lightly coat a 9-by-12-inch baking pan with cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, combine next 6 ingredients (flour through salt). <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well with a fork to break up brown sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large mixing bowl, combine buttermilk, egg whites, melted margarine and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix on low speed until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually beat in boiling water. <NEXT_INSTR> Then slowly add flour mixture and, again, mix on low speed until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour batter into prepared pan and bake 25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool cake in pan on a wire rack. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift confectioners' sugar over top just before slicing. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> No-Regrets Chocolate Snacking Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> yellow raisins <NEXT_INPUT> cherries <NEXT_INPUT> Kentucky bourbon + <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cream of tartar <NEXT_INPUT> pecan <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup (4 ounces, 112 grams) yellow raisins <NEXT_INGR> 1 2/3 cups (8 ounces, 224 grams) dried cherries <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Kentucky bourbon + 1/4 cup for soaking the wrapping cloth <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 sticks (12 tablespoons, 6 ounces) butter <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs, separated + 1 egg yolk <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/4 cups (8 1/4 ounces, 231 grams) sifted flour (measured after sifting) <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup (192 grams) sugar <NEXT_INGR> Scant 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound pecan pieces <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> The night before: Soak the raisins and cherries in 1 cup of bourbon. <NEXT_INSTR> When you're ready to bake, heat the oven to 300° F. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut the butter into 12 pieces as soon as you take it from the fridge, and put them in your mixing bowl. (Do this no more than 30 minutes before you plan to start mixing the batter.) <NEXT_INSTR> Using a fork, beat the 4 egg yolks together with the vanilla extract in a glass liquid measure (its pouring spout is handy here) or a small bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> If using decorative paper mini-loaf pans, line them completely with foil. Otherwise, use parchment to line the long sides and bottoms of your pans, to create a sling. Generously butter the ends and corners of the loaf pans. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift the flour with the nutmeg and baking powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the butter in the mixing bowl on medium high for 3 minutes, scraping down once, halfway through. It should be light in color and starting to look a bit fluffy. Gradually add the sugar while beating on medium, scraping down the sides after you've added about half. Once all of the sugar is incorporated, beat on medium high for 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Very slowly add the beaten yolks in a stream while beating at medium speed. Continue to beat for another 2 minutes, scraping down after 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the egg whites with the cream of tartar just until firm peaks hold their shape when the beaters are lifted out. (Do not let the beaten whites get too stiff, as they will be dry and that will make the cake drier as a consequence.) <NEXT_INSTR> Stir the fruit and their soaking liquid into the batter. Fold the dry ingredients, a third at a time, into the batter, adding the pecans with the final third. <NEXT_INSTR> Take a big dollop (no more than 1/5th by volume) of the egg whites and stir them into the batter. Gently fold the remaining egg whites into the batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the batter into the prepared mini-loaves. Bake for 45 minutes, or until a toothpick stuck in the center is clean when removed. <NEXT_INSTR> Let the loaves cool for about five minutes in the pans. Gently remove them from the foil and let them cool on a wire rack for at least an hour. <NEXT_INSTR> To wrap for storage, measure and cut four rectangles of cheesecloth large enough to wrap each loaf as if it were a gift to be wrapped with paper. Cut four somewhat larger rectangles of foil. In a wide, shallow bowl, put two pieces of cloth. Moisten them thoroughly with 2 tablespoons of whiskey. Center one of the soaked pieces of cloth onto one of the pieces of cut foil. Place one loaf on the cloth and wrap it, tucking the ends under to secure. Wrap tightly with the foil. Do the same thing for each of the four loaves. Wrap each loaf tightly with plastic wrap / cling film. Put the four loaves into a larger plastic bag and store in a cool place until ready to give. The cakes will continue to taste great, if these steps are followed, for at least two months. <NEXT_INSTR> Also, please note that this slices best when cool. The original recipe recommends storing it in the fridge for a few hours before serving. The slices will soon warm up. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! ;o) <NEXT_INSTR> You can double this to bake in a large tube pan for 3 hours, or two large loaves, baked for an hour and a half to two hours, or until a toothpick tests clean. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Kentucky Whiskey Cake -- An Updated Version For Making Mini-Loaves <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Country style beef spare ribs <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Country style beef spare ribs <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. red wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. extra virgin olive oil or possibly salad oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In small bowl combine mustard and vinegar. <NEXT_INSTR> Beating constantly with a wire whisk, add in oil, a few drops at a time. <NEXT_INSTR> Then beat in garlic, thyme, Worcestershire sauce and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over country style beef ribs in a shallow pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand for about 2 hrs. <NEXT_INSTR> Lift ribs from marinade and grill 4 to 6 inches above warm coals, 20 to 25 min. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bar B Que Ribs With Mustard Marinade Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> green peppers <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> pepperoni <NEXT_INPUT> olives <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> tomato juice <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> dried basil <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> croutons <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 10 plum tomatoes, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 medium green peppers, cut into 1 inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces shredded mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 (3 1/2 ounce) package pepperoni <NEXT_INGR> 1 (2 1/4 ounce) can sliced ripe olives, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup tomato juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup red wine vinegar or 1/4 cup cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon dried basil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup seasoned croutons <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, green pepper, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, olives, and onion; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, combine tomato juice, vinegar, oil, garlic, basil and pepper; whisk together well. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the dressing over the tomato mixture; toss to coat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate several hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle croutons just before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pepperoni Pizza Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon zest <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> anchovy paste <NEXT_INPUT> sherry vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> fresh basil <NEXT_INPUT> olives <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 teaspoons finely grated fresh lemon zest <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon honey <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon anchovy paste <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon sherry vinegar <NEXT_INGR> Salt and freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 3 small zucchini, trimmed and thinly sliced into half moons <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups loosely packed frisee (French curly endive), trimmed and torn into small pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup loosely packed fresh flat-leaf parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup loosely packed fresh mint leaves, torn in 1/2 lengthwise if large <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup loosely packed fresh basil leaves, torn into small pieces <NEXT_INGR> 12 kalamata olives, pitted and thinly sliced lengthwise <NEXT_INGR> 1 small red onion, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced crosswise <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Whisk together zest, juice, mustard, honey, anchovy paste, sherry vinegar, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Slowly whisk in the olive oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Add zucchini, frisee, herbs, olives, and onion and toss to coat. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Zucchini Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> chili sauce <NEXT_INPUT> cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> cornflour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup good quality pineapple juice (Not from concentrate) <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons blue dragon sweet chili sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons low sodium soy sauce (I use Kikkoman) <NEXT_INGR> 2 teapoons cornflour <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix cornflour with a little of the pineapple juice, and add all ingredients to a saucepan and slowly bring to the boil stirring continuously. <NEXT_INSTR> Add small amount of red food colouring (optional). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fantastic Sweet and Sour Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butternut squash <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cardamom pods <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> ghee <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lbs butternut squash <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup almonds <NEXT_INGR> 5 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGR> 8 whole cardamom pods <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons rose water <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons ghee <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Soak almonds in warm water for about 2 hours. Remove the skins and pulse in a food processor until almonds grind to powder but not into a paste. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel the skin from butternut squash and cut into half lengthwise. Remove the pulp and finely grate using a mandoline or other grater. You should have 3 cups tightly packed shredded squash. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile prepare milk-sugar syrup: place milk and sugar in a large heavy pot or Dutch oven. Cook the mixture until is gets thick and is reduced to about one fourth of the original quantity (30-45 minutes). <NEXT_INSTR> Take the cardamom pods, remove the skins and grind the seeds into a fine powder with your mortar and pestle. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large, wide bottomed pot, heat ghee on medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the grated butternut squash to the melted ghee. With a big slotted spoon, gently mix and cook the squash for about 20 minutes, stirring frequently, until the raw smell of squash disappears and color changes from yellow to orange-yellow. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the ground almonds and condensed milk-sugar syrup, cardamom powder and rose water. Gently mix and stir constantly until the mixture comes together in a solid mass (10-15 minutes). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the halwa from heat and spread the mixture into a baking dish, allowing it to cool. Place dish, covered, into freezer for another hour to allow additional firming. Remove pan from freezer and cut halwa into small squares. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve chilled, or store up to one week, refrigerated. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Butternut Pumpkin Squash Halwa <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> sharp cheese <NEXT_INPUT> flour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 lb. margarine, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb. sharp cheese, grated <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. self-rising flour <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix margarine and cheese thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend in flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape into roll, about the diameter of a quarter. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill overnight. Slice wafers 1/4-inch thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes, or until lightly browned. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cheese Wafers <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 -6 cubed red potatoes (enough to fill the pan completely-will vary) <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) containerof hiland French onion dip <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup shredded mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup shredded cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 5 pieces bacon, pieces (already cooked soft and chewy with a little crunch) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cube potatoes into 1 inches pieces and place in a 11X8 glass pan or baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the 1/2 cup water and 1 TBSP of Butter to prevent them from drying. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook on 325 degrees until they come apart with a fork. <NEXT_INSTR> About 20-30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> You want the potatoes to be a little brown and toasty. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain any excess liquid off you can leave some if you wish for sauce to be thinner. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the 8oz tub of French Onion Dip and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add Bacon, Mozzarella, and Cheddar Cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Put it back in the oven for 5-10 minutes until cheese is melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve Warm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cheesy Loaded Baked Potatoes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shallots <NEXT_INPUT> rice vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup chopped shallots <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons seasoned rice vinegar* <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> *Also known as sushi vinegar; available at Asian markets and in the Asian foods section of some supermarkets. <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Whisk shallots, rice vinegar and Dijon mustard in small bowl to blend. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually whisk in oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Season dressing to taste with salt and pepper. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shallot Vinaigrette <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic powder <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> nonstick spray coating <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 c. skim milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> nonstick spray coating <NEXT_INGR> 4 medium potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese (approximately 2 oz.) <NEXT_INGR> snipped fresh parsley <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sauce: <NEXT_INSTR> In saucepan, stir together milk, flour, salt, pepper and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook; stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in onion. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cheesy Scalloped Potatoes(Low-Fat)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> collard greens <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> apple cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black-eyed peas <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 pounds collard greens or kale, mustard greens, stemmed, washed in 2 or 3 changes of clean water, and coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 slices bacon cut crosswise into thin strips, about 2 ounces <NEXT_INGR> 1 x vegetable oil if any <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 medium onions finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 cloves garlic minced, or as needed <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup chicken broth, low salt or chicken stock, vegetable stock <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 x salt to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound black-eyed peas dried, or large white beans, soaked until rehydrated, overnight at least 4 hours <NEXT_INGR> 1 each bay leaves <NEXT_INGR> 5 each garlic cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 teaspoons salt or as needed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Prepare the dried black eyed peas. <NEXT_INSTR> You can use canned if you wish but cooking your beans from scratch costs next to nothing and end up with better texture and flavor. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring a large pot of water to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the bay leaf, garlic cloves, beans and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring back to the boil, reduce heat cover and simmer gently for about 30 minutes until the beans are done. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain, reserve cooking liquid, and discard bay leaf and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> (Beans in liquid can be made in advance, cooled, covered, and refrigerated up to 5 days) <NEXT_INSTR> Blanch the collards. <NEXT_INSTR> In a saucepan bring 2 quarts of water to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the salt and greens, cover and cook for 6 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain in a colander, rinse with cold water to stop the cooking and allow to drain thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large non-stick skillet cook the bacon until crisp. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove to drain on paper towels. <NEXT_INSTR> Discard all but two tablespoons of the bacon fat. <NEXT_INSTR> If there's not enough bacon fat left add enough vegetable oil to make about two tablespoons. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat the skillet over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onions and garlic and cook until the onion is becoming translucent. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the greens and toss to coat with the bacon fat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the stock, cover and simmer for 4 or 5 minutes until the liquid has been absorbed. <NEXT_INSTR> Add some of the cooking liquid from the beans if the green dry out too quickly. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the black eyed peas (or other beans) and toss until heated through. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the vinegar and toss. <NEXT_INSTR> Taste and adjust seasonings if needed. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve warm topped with the crispy bacon. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Southern Living Braised Collards with Bacon and Black-Eyed Peas <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground cardamom <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <NEXT_INPUT> orange rind <NEXT_INPUT> lemon peel <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> powdered sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 14 teaspoons dry yeast <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup milk, scalded <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon ground cardamom <NEXT_INGR> 5 cups all-purpose flour, sifted <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup raisins <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons orange rind, grated <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lemon peel, grated <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup chopped almonds <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup hot water <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Proof the yeast in warm water about 105-115 degrees for about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter in hot milk; add sugar, salt, and cardamom. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool to luke warm; stir in 2 cups flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Add eggs; beat well. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in yeast, fruit peels, and nuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining flour to make soft dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn out on lightly floured surface; cover and let rise 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead 5 minutes until smooth and satiny. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in lightly greased bowl; cover and let rise until doubled, about 1 1/2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Punch down; divide in 3 equal parts. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and let rise about 30 mins more. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine the glaze ingredients and drizzle over the bread. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> German Stallen Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lamb meat <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> ground chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> bread buns <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound ground lamb meat <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons ground chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> Southwest seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 4 slices Jalapeno Monterey Jack cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup roasted garlic aioli <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup roasted corn and roasted pepper salsa <NEXT_INGR> 4 beer bread buns <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups shoestring potatoes <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the fryer. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat the grill. <NEXT_INSTR> In a mixing bowl, combine the ground lamb with the cumin, chili powder, and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix until thoroughly incorporated. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with Southwest seasoning. <NEXT_INSTR> Form into 4-ounce patties. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on the grill and cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side for medium-rare. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the cheese on the burgers about a minute before removing from the grill, so the cheese will melt. <NEXT_INSTR> Fry the shoestring potatoes for 3 minutes or until golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the fryer and drain on a paper-lined plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread the aioli in-between the bun. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the burger in-between the bun and top with the salsa. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with the fried shoestrings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cumin and Chili Lamb Burgers <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> corn kernels <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> shallots <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> light chicken <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> mascarpone <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 1/2 cups corn kernels from 6 to 8 ears corn <NEXT_INGR> 8 to 10 ounces Yukon Gold potatoes <NEXT_INGR> Salt to taste <NEXT_INGR> 2 small shallots, coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup light chicken stock or vegetable stock <NEXT_INGR> Bouquet garni of thyme, bayleaf and tarragon <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons mascarpone, sour cream or light sour cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cut corn from cobs, being careful not to get too close to the cob. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel potatoes, and slice about 1 inch thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in pot with corn cobs, and cover with enough water to come an inch above the potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt, and bring to a simmer. <NEXT_INSTR> Gently cook potatoes until they are tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile sweat shallots in butter for about 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Do not let them color. <NEXT_INSTR> Add corn kernels, and cook slowly for 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add wine, stock and bouquet garni, and cook kernels until they are tender enough to puree, a matter of a few minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> When potatoes are cooked, drain them thoroughly, and discard corncobs. <NEXT_INSTR> Put potatoes through a ricer, and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> When corn is tender, remove bouquet garni, and puree corn in a blender. <NEXT_INSTR> Measure out 1 cup of riced potatoes (do not mash down), and fold in 2 cups corn puree with mascarpone. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve with fish, make a mound in center of plate, and top with fish. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Corn And Potato Puree <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Water <NEXT_INPUT> Olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> Honey <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Bread Machine <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> Vital <NEXT_INPUT> Active dry yeast <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Water 10 oz <NEXT_INGR> Olive oil. 1 1/2 Tablespoon <NEXT_INGR> Honey 1 1/2 Tablespoon <NEXT_INGR> Salt. 1 1/4 teaspoon <NEXT_INGR> Bread Machine Flour 1 1/2 cups <NEXT_INGR> Whole wheat flour 1 1/2 cups <NEXT_INGR> 7 grain cereal 1/4 cup <NEXT_INGR> Vital wheat gluten 3 teaspoons <NEXT_INGR> Active dry yeast 2 teaspoons <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add ingredients to mixer bowl and mix until blended into a lump/ball. <NEXT_INSTR> Let rise for about an hour in a warm place. Form into a loaf, place on a cooking stone and let rise again for about an hour. Bake for 30 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Multigrain Bread  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. pecans <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg white <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Beat egg white and water until stiff peak forms. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in a small bowl, sugar, cinnamon and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix pecans in egg whites, then in sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread on a cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 1/2 hour at 325°. After 15 minutes, stir around. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool, then break. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sugar Pecans <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Wagon-wheel pasta <NEXT_INPUT> Extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> Onion <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> green peas <NEXT_INPUT> Light cream <NEXT_INPUT> fresh basil <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Black pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 ounce Wagon-wheel pasta <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. Extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. Unsalted butter or possibly: margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 sm Onion, minced, up to <NEXT_INGR> 4 x Plum tomatoes, stemmed, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 x Clove garlic, finely minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkt (10 ounces) frzn baby green peas <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. Light cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. Minced fresh basil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp Salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp Black pepper Grated parmesan, (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook wagon wheels in large pot <NEXT_INSTR> 2. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, heat oil and butter in medium-size skillet over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in onion; cook till softened, about 2 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in tomatoes and garlic; cook 2 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in peas; cook 2 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in cream; cook 4 min, till thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in basil, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> 3. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain pasta; toss together with sauce in serving bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with grated Parmesan cheese if you like. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Baby Peas, Tomato And Cream Sauce Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> graham cracker crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> flaked coconut <NEXT_INPUT> semi-sweet chocolate morsels <NEXT_INPUT> butterscotch <NEXT_INPUT> condensed milk <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/3 c. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. graham cracker crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1 (7 oz.) can flaked coconut <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. (6 oz.) semi-sweet chocolate morsels <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. (6 oz.) butterscotch morsels <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 oz.) can sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped pecans <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place butter in a 13 x 9-inch pan. Bake at 325° for 3 minutes or until melted. Add graham cracker crumbs and remaining ingredients, layering in the order listed. (Do not stir.) Bake at 325° for 30 minutes. Cool completely in pan. Cut into bars. Yield: 3 dozen. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Seven Layer Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> dry mustard <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 c. olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. each: salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. dry mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. paprika <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. oregano <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Prepare at least 1 hour before using. <NEXT_INSTR> Shake all ingredients together in a covered jar until blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Shake several times during the hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 1 cup dressing. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Italian Salad Dressing <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate syrup <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> white chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup butter or 1 cup margarine, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups miniature semisweet chocolate chips, divided <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces sweet baking chocolate, melted and cooled <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup chocolate syrup <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces white chocolate, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 8 teaspoons shortening, divided <NEXT_INGR> chocolate and white chocolate leaves (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream butter in a large mixing bowl; gradually add sugar, beating well at medium speed of an electric mixer. <NEXT_INSTR> Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition. <NEXT_INSTR> Dissolve soda in buttermilk, stirring well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to creamed mixture alternately with flour, beginning and ending with flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 cup mini-morsels, melted chocolate, chocolate syrup, and vanilla, stirring just until blended (do not overbeat). <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon batter into a heavily greased and floured 10 inch Bundt pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 300 F for 1 hour and 25 to 35 minutes or until cake springs back when touched. <NEXT_INSTR> Invert cake immediately onto a serving plate, and let cool completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine 4 oz chopped white chocolate and 2 Tbls shortening in top of a double boiler; bring water to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat to low; cook until mixture is melted and smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle melted white chocolate mixture over cooled cake. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt remaining 1/2 cup mini-morsels and 2 tsp shortening in a small saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat, and let cool; drizzle over white chocolate. <NEXT_INSTR> If desired, garnish with chocolate and white chocolate leaves. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Decadent Fudge Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> penne pasta <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> anchovy <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> olive <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> capers <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> fennel seeds <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> fresh basil <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (16 ounce) package penne pasta <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium carrot, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 anchovy fillets <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup pitted black Greek olive, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup sun-dried tomato packed in oil, drained <NEXT_INGR> 5 garlic cloves, minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons capers, drained <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons dried oregano <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons dried thyme <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons fennel seeds, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 1 - 1 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes <NEXT_INGR> 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 6 fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook pasta according to package directions. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, in a Dutch oven, saute carrot and anchovy fillets in oil until carrot is tender. Stir in the olives, sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, capers, oregano, thyme, fennel and pepper flakes; cook 1 minute longer. Stir in the diced tomatoes, tomato paste and sugar. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 10-15 minutes or until thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain pasta. Add pasta and basil to sauce mixture; toss to coat. Sprinkle with cheese. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pasta Puttanesca <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> peanuts <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup creamy peanut butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup butter or margarine, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons whipping cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped unsalted peanuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 (13-ounce) package miniature peanut butter cup candies (we tested with Reese's) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Beat first 3 ingredients at medium speed with an electric mixer 2 minutes. Add egg, whipping cream, and vanilla; beat well. Combine flour, soda, and salt. Add to peanut butter mixture; stir well. Stir in peanuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll dough into 3/4" balls. Press dough into miniature (1 3/4") muffin pans lined with paper cups. Bake at 350° for 12 minutes. Remove from oven; press a peanut butter cup into center of each cookie. Bake 2 more minutes. Remove from oven. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Peanut Butter Cup Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken patty <NEXT_INPUT> pizza sauce <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 breaded chicken patty <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons pizza sauce or 2 tablespoons spaghetti sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 ounce of shredded mozzarella cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat Chicken patty as directed on the box. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 2 tablespoons of pizza/spaghetti sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 ounce of shredded mozzarella cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat in microwave on high for 30 to 45 seconds or until cheese melts. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Microwave Chicken Parmesan <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup butter softened <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup brown sugar packed <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups flour, all-purpose <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 300F (150C). <NEXT_INSTR> Cream the butter; gradually add the sugar, beating with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift together the flour and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to the creamed mixture and stir with a wooden spoon to thoroughly combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll out the dough on a lightly floured board to 1/4 inch thickness. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut out with heart-shaped cookie cutters. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on an ungreased or parchment-lined cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with red sugar crystals, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until lightly browned. <NEXT_INSTR> Decorate with icing if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Store in airtight containers with waxed paper between the layers of cookies. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shortbread Heart Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable <NEXT_INPUT> baby Portobello mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> red peppers <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> baby spinach <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tbsp vegetable or olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 7 oz baby Portobello mushrooms, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 None medium onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 7 oz Arborio rice <NEXT_INGR> 5.25 oz roasted red peppers, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 oz Parmesan cheese, shaved <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups hot vegetable stock <NEXT_INGR> 3 oz baby spinach <NEXT_INGR> 4 None Portobello mushrooms <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Saute sliced mushrooms until tender. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Add butter and saute onion and garlic for 5 mins, or until softened. Add rice and cook for 1 min. Reduce heat. Add peppers and 1 oz Parmesan. Season. Add hot stock, 1 ladleful at a time, stirring constantly, until all liquid is absorbed. Add spinach and sauteed mushrooms. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, preheat oven to 400°F. Place Portobello mushrooms, stem-side up, on a baking tray. Drizzle with remaining oil. Season and bake for 15 mins, or until tender. Transfer to serving plates. Top with risotto and remaining Parmesan. Season. Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Portobello Mushrooms Stuffed With Risotto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beets <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> horseradish <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 medium beets <NEXT_INGR> 5 tablespoons unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons prepared horseradish <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Trim, wash, peel and dice the beets. Place in a medium saucepan with enough water to cover. Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer until beets are tender. Drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Place beets in a blender or food processor. Add the butter, cream, sugar, lemon juice, horseradish and salt and pepper. Puree until smooth and strain puree through a sieve into saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Gently reheat over very low heat, stirring frequently to prevent it from sticking to the bottom of the pan. Spoon the puree onto serving plates and garnish with a sprig of dill and a few pink peppercorns. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Puree Of Fresh Beets With Horseradish <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> meal <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cream-style <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> salad oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> grated cheese <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 c. self-rising meal <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 small can cream-style corn <NEXT_INGR> 1 large onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium bell pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. salad oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 scant tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. grated cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix well and bake at 375°. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mexican Corn Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cherry pie filling <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <NEXT_INPUT> almond extract <NEXT_INPUT> instant vanilla pudding <NEXT_INPUT> cake <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cans cherry pie filling <NEXT_INGR> 1 can Eagle Brand milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. cold water <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. almond extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 oz.) pkg. instant vanilla pudding <NEXT_INGR> 1 angel food cake <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. Cool Whip <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix Eagle Brand, water, almond extract and instant vanilla pudding. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool in refrigerator while cutting cake into small pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove pudding mixture from refrigerator and add 2 cups Cool Whip. <NEXT_INSTR> Layer in 2 layers the cut up cake, cream mixture and cherry filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cynthia'S Cherry Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> head green cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> ground veal <NEXT_INPUT> ground pork <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> ground sage <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 large head green cabbage <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. ground veal <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb. ground pork <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. ground sage <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. margarine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix ground veal and pork with other ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll stuffing in blanched cabbage leaves. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook in salted water until tender, about 25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Brown cracker crumbs in butter and sprinkle over top of cabbage rolls after they have been placed on the platter for serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Danish Stuffed Cabbage <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chickens <NEXT_INPUT> yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> coriander powder <NEXT_INPUT> cumin seeds powder <NEXT_INPUT> turmeric <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> red chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 large chickens <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup full Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp ginger and garlic paste <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp coriander powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp cumin seeds powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp turmeric powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp black pepper powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp red chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp salt <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 335f oven. <NEXT_INSTR> add it in a bowl yogurt, lemon juice , ginger and garlic paste , red chili powder , coriander powder, cumin seeds powder, turmeric powder , black pepper powder , oil, salt, all mixed. <NEXT_INSTR> put the chicken in a big bowl and mark the legs and chicken brest with a nife dip the chicken in the spices. <NEXT_INSTR> and over night put the chicken in the refrigerator. <NEXT_INSTR> than cook the chicken in the oven with the temp of 335F <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> spicy tandore chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Olive Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> Water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound Mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 5 cups Water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> You can use whatever mushrooms you like. <NEXT_INSTR> Use all buttons, or an assortment of wild mushrooms. <NEXT_INSTR> The options are limitless! <NEXT_INSTR> 1. <NEXT_INSTR> Roughly chop the mushrooms in medium pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> 2. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat oil in a pot and saute mushrooms to a deep golden brown, the darker the better (but not burned). <NEXT_INSTR> 3. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water and boil until reduced by half. <NEXT_INSTR> 4. <NEXT_INSTR> Strain out mushrooms and save for something else. <NEXT_INSTR> 5. <NEXT_INSTR> Return broth to pot and reduce to 1/2 cup. <NEXT_INSTR> It should be thick and syrup-y looking. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mushroom Syrup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate bits <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> oatmeal <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 c. shortening <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) pkg. chocolate bits <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped nuts <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. oatmeal <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream shortening and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Add eggs; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift flour with salt and soda; add to above. <NEXT_INSTR> Add vanilla, nuts, oats and chocolate bits; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop scant teaspoons. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Oatmeal Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Italian sausage <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> pie crusts <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup Italian sausage (cooked and crumbled) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup asparagus (cut in bite size pieces) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup onion (diced) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon garlic (minced) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup red bell pepper (diced) <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups monterey jack cheese (shredded) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon butter <NEXT_INGR> 6 eggs (divided into 2 bowls and beat) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup milk (divided in half and put in each bowl of eggs) <NEXT_INGR> 2 pie crusts (I use Marie Callendar's deep dish) <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat your oven on 350°F; prick your pie shells on the bottom and place them on a baking sheet. Put the pies in the oven for 10 minutes. Take them out of the oven and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Next, melt butter in a small saucepan on medium high heat. Add the onion and bell pepper and saute for 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Next, add the asparagus and saute until the asparagus is a bright green color and the onion is translucent, about 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Take the mixture off of the heat and mix in the garlic and salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide the sausage between the two pie shells, add 1/4 cup of cheese over the sausage. Divide the asparagus mixture in two and place over the cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour each bowl of egg and milk mixture over the pies and top each with remaining cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake on 350°F for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sausage And Asparagus Quiche <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> feta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> fresh dill <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> dill <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 ounces potatoes, cooked and mashed <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces feta cheese, crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 3 green onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons fresh dill, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> lemon, zest of 1/2 <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> flour, for dredging <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> extra dill and lemon (to garnish) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a medium bowl, place the potato, feta, egg, green onions, dill lemon juice, zest, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix until well combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate for 1-2 hours until firm. <NEXT_INSTR> Using hands, roll the mixture into golf-ball-size fritters, and flatten slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Dredge lightly in flour, using a small sieve. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat olive oil in a large frying pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook fritters in batches for about 3-5 minutes until golden brown on both sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain on paper towel and serve immediately. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with extra dill and lemon. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Potato Feta Fritters <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> broccoli spears <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> buttered bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> American cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 whole boned, cooked chicken breasts <NEXT_INGR> 2 frozen pkg. broccoli spears, cooked and drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 can evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. curry powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. buttered bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 c. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. grated American cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place cooked broccoli in casserole dish and top with chicken slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine other ingredients and heat on low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over top of broccoli and chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with bread crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> (Or prepare and freeze; return to room temperature before baking.) <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Curried Chicken And Broccoli <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> frozen spinach <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> red peppers <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> fresh basil <NEXT_INPUT> penne cooked al <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tbsp olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 large garlic cloves finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 c chopped drained oil sun dried tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 c heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 pck frozen spinach <NEXT_INGR> 1 c white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1 7.25 oz jar roasted red peppers drained and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp dried red pepper crushed <NEXT_INGR> 1 c chopped fresh basil <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb penne cooked al dente <NEXT_INGR> parmesan cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Saute garlic one minute in oil. Add all other ingredients and simmer till blended. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pasta With Spicy Sun-Dried Tomato Sauce  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hamburger <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> tomato juice <NEXT_INPUT> cream of celery soup <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. hamburger or ground round or 1/2 turkey (brown with 4 Tbsp. onion, minced) <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. carrots, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. celery, diced <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. water (plus 1 or 2 bouillon cubes) <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. tomato juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans cream of celery soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. margarine <NEXT_INGR> pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook 1 1/2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 14 cups or 10 large servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Church Women United Vegetable Soup(Recipes From Hunger Slide Show)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> corned beef <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> tomato juice <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable mix <NEXT_INPUT> beans <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cans corned beef <NEXT_INGR> 6 diced potatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 big onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 qt. tomato juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 can corn <NEXT_INGR> 1 bag vegetable mix <NEXT_INGR> 1 can lima beans <NEXT_INGR> sugar to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 qt. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> cayenne pepper (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Boil potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Put all ingredients in a big stew pot with 1 quart of water. <NEXT_INSTR> Slow cook about 2 to 3 hours. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Ruby Wolfe Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> barley <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> chicken bouillon cube <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> poultry seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> sage <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 -2 lb chicken, cut up <NEXT_INGR> 2 quarts water <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 cups carrots, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup celery, diced <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup barley <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 chicken bouillon cube (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon poultry seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon dried sage <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In large kettle, cook chicken in water until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool broth and skim off fat. <NEXT_INSTR> Bone chicken and cut into bite-size pieces; return to kettle along with remaining ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer, covered, for at least 1 hour or until vegetables and barley are tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove bayleaf. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Barley Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> okra <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> okra <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> hot pepper or dill <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Stuff okra in jars. <NEXT_INSTR> Add hot pepper or dill. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring all other ingredients to boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour liquid over okra in jars and seal. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand for 2 weeks. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pickled Okra <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. peanut butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix together. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll into balls the size of walnuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on ungreased cookie sheet 2 inches apart. <NEXT_INSTR> Press with fork to make crisscross on top of each cookie. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand on cookie sheet for about 1 minute before removing to rack to cool. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Peanut Butter Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Banana <NEXT_INPUT> Apple <NEXT_INPUT> Carrot <NEXT_INPUT> Coconut Flakes <NEXT_INPUT> Coconut Milk <NEXT_INPUT> Raisins <NEXT_INPUT> Golden <NEXT_INPUT> Cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> Ginger <NEXT_INPUT> Nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> handful Pecans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 Banana, mashed <NEXT_INGR> 1 Apple, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 Carrot, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup Coconut Flakes, unsweetened <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup Coconut Milk, full-fat <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons Raisins, no sugar added <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon Golden Flax, ground <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon Cinnamon, ground <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon Ginger, ground <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash Nutmeg, Cloves, Cardamom <NEXT_INGR> 1 handful Pecans, toasted and roughly chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a medium bowl, smash the banana with a fork, or, if you're feeling fancy, go ahead and whip that baby till fluffy with a hand mixer or whisk. Make sure to dice your apple sans peel for a consistent texture, then add and stir. <NEXT_INSTR> After shredding the carrot with a cheese grate, add also and give it a whirl with a spatula. Add the remaining ingredients and be sure to mix properly so that you don't experience this creation with your first mouthful being a huge clump of ginger. <NEXT_INSTR> This is best eaten after it has sat overnight (think: overnight oats, Whole30 style), however, if you're dying for a treat, splash a bit of coconut milk over the top and dig in. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Carrot Cake Breakfast Smash <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> warm water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 1/4 cups unbleached flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons fast rising yeast <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, plus a little for brushing <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups warm water (more or less) <NEXT_INGR> sea salt (but I wouldn't leave it out) (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large bowl combine the flour, yeast and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a wooden spoon, stir to mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the 3 tbs olive oil. <NEXT_INSTR> While stirring, add the warm water until all of the flour absorbs and a dough forms. <NEXT_INSTR> You may need more or less of the water. <NEXT_INSTR> No biggie. <NEXT_INSTR> Gather dough into a ball and transfer to a floured work surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead until soft and elastic, not sticky. <NEXT_INSTR> Probably 10 min or so. <NEXT_INSTR> Place dough in a lightly oiled and warmed bowl, turning several times to coat it with oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place till doubles, around 45-75 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Position rack on lower part of oven and preheat to 400 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush a 10x15 baking pan with olive oil and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Punch down dough and transfer to foured surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead a few times and let rise for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> With palms form into a rectangle about 4x8 inches. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer into pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Stretch and pat the dought to fit pan completely end evenly. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with plastic wrap and let rise about 1 inch (30 min or so). <NEXT_INSTR> Using fingertips, make'dimple' indentations in the dough about 2 inches apart. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush surface with olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake til golden brown, about 30-40 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool for a few minutes, cut into squares and serve warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Before baking, you can also add roasted red peppers. <NEXT_INSTR> It's absolutely delicious. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Focaccia <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground cloves <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> lime <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> avocado <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium green pepper, seeded, diced medium (about 1/2 lb, 1 1/2 cups) <NEXT_INGR> 1 small red onion, peeled and chopped (about 1/4 lb, 3/4 cup) <NEXT_INGR> 1 large garlic clove, peeled and finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon sea salt <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon oregano leaves, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 18 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch ground cloves <NEXT_INGR> 3 medium plum tomatoes, peeled, seeded, diced medium (about 1 lb total) <NEXT_INGR> 4 (14 ounce) cans reduced-sodium chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 lime, sliced, plus <NEXT_INGR> 2 limes, juice of (2-4 Tbsp) <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup fresh cilantro, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups shredded cooked chicken or 3 cups shredded cooked turkey <NEXT_INGR> 1 avocado, peeled, diced medium <NEXT_INGR> cilantro (to garnish) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oil in large stockpot over medium-high, until oil faintly smokes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add pepper and onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook, stirring occasionally until soft but not brown, 3-4 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Add garlic, cook, stirring 1 minute Add salt, cumin, oregano, cinnamon and cloves; cook, stirring 1 minute Add tomatoes, stock, sliced lime and cilantro; simmer 10 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Add juice of 2 limes to soup. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Season to taste with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring back to simmer. <NEXT_INSTR> Ladle into warmed bowls. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with avocado and cilantro. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lime Soup With Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> macaroni <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 (19 ounce) can tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 teaspoons oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) package macaroni <NEXT_INGR> 12 lb mozzarella cheese, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup grated parmesan cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown the beef, the garlic, and the onion in olive oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in tomato sauce, tomatoes, and seasonings. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and allow to simmer for 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> While meat is simmering, cook macaroni and drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Layer the macaroni, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, and meat sauce in a casserole dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Galumpous <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> lard <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups self-rising flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup lard <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup buttermilk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F and lightly spray a baking sheet with non-stick cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Measure the flour into a large bowl and cut the lard into the flour with a pastry blender or two forks. The crumbs should be about pea-size. <NEXT_INSTR> Slowly incorporate the buttermilk until everything is just combined. Don't overwork the mixture. The dough will be wet and sticky. <NEXT_INSTR> Working with well-floured hands scoop up about ? to 1/4 cup of the dough and form the dough into a ball. <NEXT_INSTR> You may have to dust some additional flour over the ball to make it easier to roll. Gently flatten the dough until it is about 3/4 inch thick and place it one the baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Continue with the remaining dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 10 to 12 minute or until golden brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hand-Shaped Buttermilk Biscuits <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> oil <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> ground beef <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (6 oz.) pkg. Martha White Mexican cornbread mix with jalapeno <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 large can creamed corn <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. ground beef <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown ground beef; drain well. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix all other ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Put 1/2 ground beef in bottom of 8-inch square baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Put 1/2 above mixture over it. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with shredded Cheddar cheese. Repeat with second layer. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with shredded Cheddar cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° until cornbread mixture is done. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mexican Cornbread Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/3 cup mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons lemon juice or rice wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 large garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> Salt and freshly ground black pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients until well-blended. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Creamy Buttermilk Dressing <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> corn tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. corn tortillas (15 per pkg.) <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. cooked, shredded pot roast (salted) <NEXT_INGR> oil for deep frying <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat on high a cup or two of oil in skillet for deep frying, or use a deep fryer. <NEXT_INSTR> When hot, lower it and keep it on medium for later use. <NEXT_INSTR> Next, soften tortillas slightly by putting them in the microwave for 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> (Spread them on a paper towel; do not stack them on top of each other.) <NEXT_INSTR> Fill each tortilla with 2 tablespoons of the shredded meat; roll it up. <NEXT_INSTR> If necessary, use a toothpick to hold it together. <NEXT_INSTR> Slowly drop a tortilla roll in the skillet; fry for 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> (If oil does not cover entire tortilla roll, flip it and fry the other side for an additional 2 minutes.) <NEXT_INSTR> Tortilla roll should be crispy. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the tortilla rolls (Flautas, pronounced flou-tas) in the oven to keep them warm while you prepare the dip. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Flautas With Avocado Dip <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> cookie cutters <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/8 cups milk (use more for thinner batter) <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg, lightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 to 4 (4 1/2- to 5-inch) heavy metal cookie cutters <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine flour and next 3 ingredients in a bowl; whisk in 1 1/8 cups milk and egg, whisking until mixture is blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Grease heavy metal cookie cutters lightly, and place on hot (375°), lightly greased griddle. Pour pancake batter (approximately 2 tablespoons) into each cutter. Using tongs, remove cutters after 1 minute (cutters will be hot); cook pancakes 2 more minutes. Turn pancakes over, and cook 2 to 3 more minutes or until done. <NEXT_INSTR> Pecan Pancakes: Stir 1/2 cup chopped toasted pecans into batter. Proceed as directed. <NEXT_INSTR> Banana Pancakes: Stir 1 cup chopped banana (2 bananas) into batter. Proceed as directed. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Christmas Tree Hotcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> ground turmeric <NEXT_INPUT> beer <NEXT_INPUT> cauliflower <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> HERB RAITA <NEXT_INPUT> plain yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> None None Vegetable oil, for deep-frying <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups self-rising flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1/2-1 tsp cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp ground turmeric <NEXT_INGR> 1 bottle 12 oz) beer, chilled <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb cauliflower, cut into small florets, blanched <NEXT_INGR> 2 None onions, cut into wedges, blanched <NEXT_INGR> None None Fried mint, and parsley or cilantro leaves, to serve <NEXT_INGR> None None FOR THE HERB RAITA <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup plain yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp chopped mint <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp ground cumin <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oil in large heavy-bottomed saucepan on high heat, until a cube of bread sizzles as soon as it is added. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, sift flour and spices into a large bowl. Season to taste. Whisk in beer to form a thick batter (there will be some lumps). <NEXT_INSTR> Working in batches, coat cauliflower and onion in batter, allow excess to drain off. Carefully lower into oil and cook for 3-4 mins, until golden. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. <NEXT_INSTR> Deep-fry mint and parsley or cilantro leaves for 30 seconds, until crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and use as a garnish. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, for the herb raita, combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Season to taste. Serve with fritters. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spiced Cauliflower And Onion Fritters <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste + <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce + <NEXT_INPUT> oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 to 3 lb. ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 large onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 medium green pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 bay leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. prepared mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 large can tomato paste + 1 can water <NEXT_INGR> 1 large can tomato sauce + 1 can water <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place oil in heavy pan over heat; add chopped onion and pepper and saute until 1/2 cooked without browning. <NEXT_INSTR> Add ground beef and cook until it starts to brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Add paste and sauce; stir and let cook until grease has turned red. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water and seasoning. <NEXT_INSTR> When mixture starts to boil, lower heat to simmer and cook for not less than 5 hours. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chris' Spaghetti Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sage <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> peppercorn <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> red potatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 fresh sage leaves <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons dried rosemary <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon sea salt <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon lemon, zest of <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon fresh peppercorn <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon olive oil (or grapeseed and touch of sesame) <NEXT_INGR> 2 lbs red potatoes, best to use smallest ones <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> chop fine the sage leaves, I prefer slivers for effect. <NEXT_INSTR> powder the rosemary in pestle. <NEXT_INSTR> medium grind the peppercorns. <NEXT_INSTR> mix dry ingredients and set aside in ramakin. <NEXT_INSTR> set aside juice and zest in ramakin. <NEXT_INSTR> steam potatoes, do not boil as it weakens the skins, untill tender. <NEXT_INSTR> heat medium skillet med. <NEXT_INSTR> high. <NEXT_INSTR> let the oil come up to temperature and toss potatoes in. <NEXT_INSTR> add dry mixture and saute for about 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> add lemon zest mixture; toss briefly and remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> works well served family style set off with sage or mint sprigs or simply arrange 2-4 potatoes individually per serving plate. <NEXT_INSTR> thought I'd add a recipe to start with that I could remember at work. <NEXT_INSTR> this one is quite easy, and fast, but gets consistent remarks. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Simple Herbed Potatoes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orzo <NEXT_INPUT> cucumber <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> feta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> fresh chives <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups cooked orzo (about 1 cup uncooked rice-shaped pasta) <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups diced cucumber <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chopped fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup (2 ounces) crumbled feta cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup diced red onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped fresh chives <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 4 large tomatoes <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine first 11 ingredients in a large bowl. Remove cores from tomatoes. Cut each tomato into 8 wedges, cutting to, but not through, the other end.
