<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> golden brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> semisweet chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> white chocolate <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons (packed) golden brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 ounce unsweetened chocolate, chopped <NEXT_INGR> Pinch of salt <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) chilled unsalted butter, cut into pieces <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 3 ounces unsweetened chocolate, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 ounces semisweet chocolate, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup all purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped pecans, toasted <NEXT_INGR> 2 ounces semisweet chocolate, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup (1/2 stick) unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 ounces good-quality white chocolate, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend first 4 ingredients in processor until finely chopped. <NEXT_INSTR> Add butter; cut in using on/off turns until mixture resembles coarse meal. <NEXT_INSTR> Add milk and vanilla; process until moist clumps form. <NEXT_INSTR> Using plastic wrap as aid, press dough over bottom and up sides of 11-inch-diameter tart pan with removable bottom. <NEXT_INSTR> Freeze 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 350F. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake crust until just set and beginning to brown around edges, about 8 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer pan to rack and cool crust completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Maintain oven temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir butter and chocolates in medium saucepan over low heat until melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat sugar, eggs, vanilla and salt in medium bowl until fluffy, about 4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk in chocolate mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in flour and nuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour batter into crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake until filling puffs around edges and tester inserted into center comes out with moist crumbs attached, about 40 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to rack and cool completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir semisweet chocolate, butter and oil in small saucepan over low heat until melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread over tart. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill until set, about 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir white chocolate in top of double boiler over simmering water until melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle atop tart. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill until set, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> (Can be made 1 day ahead. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and chill.) <NEXT_INSTR> Serve at room temperature. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Brownie Tart <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> venison sirloin <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> wine <NEXT_INPUT> cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> liquid smoke <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> white pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> onion juice <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> green peppers <NEXT_INPUT> rice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lbs boneless venison sirloin, cut into 1 1/2 inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup dry Burgundy wine <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tablespoons liquid smoke <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon white pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon onion juice <NEXT_INGR> 16 cherry tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 24 small fresh mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 4 small onions, peeled and quartered <NEXT_INGR> 2 -3 large green peppers, cut into 24 1 inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> hot cooked long grain and wild rice blend <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put meat cubes into a shallow marinating container (I use my tupperware marinating container with lid so I can turn the container over during the marinating time); set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine the next 8 ingredients in a mixing bowl or large glass measuring cup; pour over meat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate 48 hours, stirring occasionally (or turn container over). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove meat from marinade; reserve marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Alternately thread meat and vegetables on skewers; brush with marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill over medium-hot heat for 15 minutes; turn and baste frequently with marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with rice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Venison Kabobs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> prawns <NEXT_INPUT> oyster sauce <NEXT_INPUT> chilies <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 whole garlic, peeled and minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 big red onion, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 green onion, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 red bell pepper, minced <NEXT_INGR> 2 lbs prawns, cleaned, back slit open <NEXT_INGR> 5 tablespoons oyster sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 chilies <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat wok add in olive oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute garlic in olive oil till fragrant. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in onions, cook till soft. <NEXT_INSTR> Dump in the green onions, 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in the minced red bell pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in the oyster sauce, keep stirring. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in the prawns and keep mixing to blend well. <NEXT_INSTR> Let prawns ooze out its own oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in chili last minute of cooking. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with piping hot rice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shygirl's Exquisite Prawns <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cream styled corn <NEXT_INPUT> whole kernel corn <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cornmeal <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (15 ounce) can cream styled corn <NEXT_INGR> 2 (15 ounce) cans whole kernel corn or (15 ounce) cans Mexican-style corn, drained <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup cheddar cheese or 1/2 cup swiss cheese, grated <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup cornmeal <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup of chopped parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 - 1 cup onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> parmesan cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix the whole kernel corn with the creamed corn. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the remaining ingredients; blend. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into buttered 9 x 12-inch casserole. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 325°F and bake until firm, about 40 to 45 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Too Good Corn Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hamburger <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 lb. hamburger <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> chopped green onions <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix hamburger with green onions; mix well and shape into patties. <NEXT_INSTR> Fry in medium saucepan until almost done. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour tomato sauce over meat and finish cooking 5 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 3 to 4. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Onion Sauce Hamburger Steaks <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fish fillet <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> turmeric <NEXT_INPUT> cumin powder <NEXT_INPUT> fresh black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb fish fillet, your choice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon turmeric <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon fresh black pepper, Ground <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons lemon juice, fresh squeezed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place fish fillets into a medium sized bowl and sprinkle with salt, turmeric, cumin, black pepper and garlic, tossing to coat well. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and marinate for 50 - 60 minutes in the refrigerator. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> Coat the bottom of an 8 x 8 inch baking dish with the vegetable oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the fish in a single layer inside the baking dish, and pour the marinade on top. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake uncovered for 20-25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> The fish should be firm to the touch. <NEXT_INSTR> Fish is done when it easily flakes with a fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with lemon juice 5 minutes before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Baked Fish With Lemon & Black Pepper <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Green Pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Onion <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Cooking Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Kidney Beans <NEXT_INPUT> Pinto Beans <NEXT_INPUT> Vegetable Juice <NEXT_INPUT> Green Chilies <NEXT_INPUT> Chili Powder <NEXT_INPUT> Mix <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar Cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Freshly Snipped Cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> Salsa <NEXT_INPUT> Sour Cream <NEXT_INPUT> Tabasco Sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup Green Pepper, Chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Onion, Chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves Garlic, Minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tablespoon Cooking Oil <NEXT_INGR> 15 ounces, weight Canned Kidney Beans, Rinsed, Drained And Slightly Mashed <NEXT_INGR> 15 ounces, weight Canned Pinto Beans, Rinsed, Drained And Slightly Mashed <NEXT_INGR> 6 ounces, fluid Vegetable Juice (i.e. V8) <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces, weight Canned Diced Green Chilies, Undrained <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Chili Powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 package (about 8 Oz. Package) Corn Muffin Mix <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Cheddar Cheese, Shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cups Freshly Snipped Cilantro <NEXT_INGR> Salsa, To Serve <NEXT_INGR> Sour Cream, To Serve <NEXT_INGR> Tabasco Sauce, To Serve (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven 400 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Grease a 2-quart square baking dish or 10-inch quiche dish; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium skillet, cook sweet pepper, onion and garlic in hot oil until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in kidney beans, pinto beans, vegetable juice, chili peppers, and chili powder; heat through. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon bean mixture into prepared dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare corn muffin mix according to package directions; add cheese and cilantro, stirring just until combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon cornbread mixture evenly over the top of the bean mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake, uncovered, for about 25 minutes or until golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with salsa, sour cream, or if you are me, Tabasco sauce to give it that kick! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Oh Me! Sure-Jell <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine strawberries and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine water and pectin. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil 1 minute, stirring constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Add pectin mixture to fruit and stir 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into jars or freezer containers, leaving 1-inch headspace. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with lids. <NEXT_INSTR> Let stand at room temperature for 24 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Freeze. <NEXT_INSTR> Yield: <NEXT_INSTR> 6 cups. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Freezer Strawberry Jam <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Barilla <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> broccoli florets <NEXT_INPUT> cherry tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> pesto <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (13.25 ounce) box Barilla Whole Grain Spaghetti <NEXT_INGR> 1 chicken breast, cut in half lengthwise and pounded thin <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided <NEXT_INGR> 4 garlic cloves, chopped, divided <NEXT_INGR> salt and black pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 4 sprigs fresh thyme, divided <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups small broccoli florets <NEXT_INGR> 1 pint cherry tomatoes, halved <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 ounce) jar pesto <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Marinate chicken breast with 2 garlic cloves, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, black pepper and 2 sprigs thyme for about two hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring a large pot of water to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> In a skillet saute remaining garlic in olive oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Just before garlic turns yellow add broccoli and saute three minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add cherry tomatoes and saute for 2 minutes, season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, grill the chicken on both sides until cooked thoroughly, season with salt and cut into strips. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook pasta according to package directions; drain and toss with veggies and pesto. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with grilled chicken and remaining thyme leaves before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Whole Grain Spaghetti with Cherry Tomatoes, Marinated Chicken Breast and Pesto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fresh pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> mandarin orange <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> yogurt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups fresh pineapple or 2 cups drained canned pineapple chunks <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup mandarin orange, drained <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup plain fat-free yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup fat-free whipped topping <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a food processor or blender process pineapple, oranges, and vanilla until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add yogurt, process briefly, just enough to mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Scrape down sides of bowl with a spatula. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in freezer for 30 minutes <NEXT_INSTR> Place bowl back on processor and pulse once to mix slightly; add whipped topping. <NEXT_INSTR> Pulse once or twice to incorporate. <NEXT_INSTR> scrape the bowl sides again and pulse once or twice again. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon evenly into 6 oz. <NEXT_INSTR> custard bowls or fluted glasses. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and freeze 1 to 2 hours or until firm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pineapple and Orange Yogurt Freeze <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> corn syrup <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> corn <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. or 2 sticks butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. firmly packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. corn syrup (light or dark) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 6 qt. popped corn <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in syrup and brown sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil without stirring 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in soda, vanilla and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually pour over popped corn, mixing well. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn into a large greased roaster or baking pans. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 250° for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes. Cool completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Break apart. <NEXT_INSTR> Store in tightly covered container. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 5 quarts. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Baked Caramel Popcorn <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> whorstishire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> tumeric <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 whole chicken cut up <NEXT_INGR> 1 seasoning salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 course black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 whorstishire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tumeric <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Rinse chicken then ,pat dry set oven temp on 350 <NEXT_INSTR> Season chicken, then let sit at room temperature for at least 30 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Add whorstishire sauce <NEXT_INSTR> In a 13"9 baking dish add a little water, then chicken bake for 20 to 30 min till juices run clear. <NEXT_INSTR> Use a meat thermometer if not sure if it's not done ,should read 145 to 150. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> My No Sauce Baked chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> arborio rice <NEXT_INPUT> peas <NEXT_INPUT> feta <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> zest of one lemon <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable broth <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup arborio rice <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup peas (fresh is better, frozen's fine) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup crumbled feta <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> zest of one lemon <NEXT_INGR> black pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 6 mint leaves, chiffonade <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups vegetable broth <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Saute uncooked rice in olive oil over medium heat until absorbed. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 cup of warm stock to the rice. Stir as needed to prevent the rice from sticking - you'll have time to prepare your chiffonade of mint and/or zest the lemon while you're letting the rice cook down. Stir more frequently as the liquid cooks off. <NEXT_INSTR> When the rice is nearly dry, repeat step two. Continue until a taste test yields rice that is chewable, but sticks to your teeth. Keep in mind that you will probably only need three cups of broth - but far better to have too much than too little on hand. <NEXT_INSTR> Add your peas and cook for one or two minutes more (longer if using frozen). Season to taste - salt if necessary, and be generous with the black pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> When both peas and rice are done and seem to be bathed in a creamy sauce, remove from heat and stir in the lemon zest. Follow with the feta cheese. Add the mint chiffonade just before serving. <NEXT_INSTR> Are you a thrifty person who's worried about what to do with the lemon and the fact that you picked too much mint? Muddle the mint and lemon juice with some sugar and add some vodka and a little seltzer. Sip quietly in the kitchen and don't tell your guests. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Mint Risotto With Peas And Feta <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> red peppers <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> feta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> nonfat milk <NEXT_INPUT> feta <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces roasted red peppers <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can diced tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried basil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons fat free feta cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup nonfat milk <NEXT_INGR> feta, for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a saucepan over medium heat, soften 1/4 cup chopped onion and 1 tsp chopped garlic in 1 tsp olive oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 4 oz roasted red peppers in 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes; simmer 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 cup chicken broth and 1 tsp dried basil; simmer for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into a blender and combine with 2 Tbsp fat-free feta. <NEXT_INSTR> Return to pan, add 1/2 cup nonfat milk, and heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with more feta when serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Savory Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Port wine or fruit juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped pecans <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sour cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Dissolve Jell-O in water. <NEXT_INSTR> Add next 3 ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill until slightly thickened and fold in pecans. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill until firm. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> apple juice <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> maple syrup <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> black peppercorns <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> apple cider vinegar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 quart water <NEXT_INGR> 1 quart apple juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup maple syrup <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons black peppercorns <NEXT_INGR> 3 bay leaves <NEXT_INGR> 3 cloves garlic, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 1 jalapeno pepper, sliced in half and seeded <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Dump all the ingredients into a large saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Strain the brine into a bowl, cool to room temperature, and then chill completely in the refrigerator before using. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chops to the brine and let them marinate in the refrigerator for 8 to 12 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Pull them out and dry them off before using in a recipe. <NEXT_INSTR> The new leaner style pork is missing somethingfat. <NEXT_INSTR> That great old conveyor of flavor and succulence has been bred right out of the loin meat of my favorite critter. <NEXT_INSTR> Lean meat may be healthier, but I found that eating a pork chop was just not worth tiring my jaws out. <NEXT_INSTR> That changed when I got turned on to brining. <NEXT_INSTR> During the process the protein strands in the meat unwind and then get tangled up with other unwound strands, allowing them to trap moisture inside these new little webs. <NEXT_INSTR> This results in juicier meat with better texture after cooking. <NEXT_INSTR> Things get even better if you add some sugar to the brine, which boosts the caramelized flavorof the grilled surface of the meat. <NEXT_INSTR> Give it a try and see for yourself how adding a brining step to your pork prep will have you lickin your chops again. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Apple-Brine <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pork chops <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> long grain rice <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 boneless pork chops, 1/2 inch thick <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/3 cup long grain rice, uncooked <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of chicken soup <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown pork chops in a large skillet in olive oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Place rice in ungreased shallow 3 quart baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour orange juice over rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with pork chops. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour soup over all. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover tightly with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 40 - 45 minutes until pork chops are done and rice is tender. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pork Chop Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pizza dough <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> turkey <NEXT_INPUT> sweet red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> hearts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (10 ounce) can pizza dough, refrigerated <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 cups basil leaves, fresh and firmly packed into measuring cup <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup parmesan cheese, freshly grated and divided <NEXT_INGR> 23 cup walnuts, chopped, toasted, and divided <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, cut in half <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 cups mozzarella cheese, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces smoked turkey, cubed <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sweet red pepper, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 ounce) jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained and chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Unroll pizza dough, and press into the bottom of a greased 9x13 pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Position knife blade in food processor bowl; add basil, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, 1/3 cup toasted walnuts, and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Process 1 minute or until smooth, stopping once to scrape down sides. <NEXT_INSTR> With processor running, pour olive oil through food chute in a slow steady stream until combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread basil mixture over pizza dough, leaving 1/2 inch border on all sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese, turkey, red pepper, artichokes, remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan, and remaining 1/3 cup walnuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake, uncovered, at 425^ for 30 minutes or until crust is golden and mozzareella cheese melts. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut into rectangles. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Provencal Pizza Bites <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> beef roast <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable soup <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. butter <NEXT_INGR> 4 lb. beef roast <NEXT_INGR> 1 envelope Knorr vegetable soup mix <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 12 small onions, cut in half <NEXT_INGR> 1 box frozen baby carrots <NEXT_INGR> 8 peeled potatoes, cut into bite-size pieces <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 375°. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover roast with flour mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> In large skillet, add 3 tablespoons butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Brown roast on all sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove roast and place in large roasting pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange onions, potatoes and carrots around roast. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle on soup mix over roast and vegetables. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook for 2 hours, covered. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water if needed. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook for 25 minutes or longer, uncovered, until veggies and roast are brown and tender. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pot Roast <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> macaroni <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> condensed celery soup <NEXT_INPUT> salmon <NEXT_INPUT> American cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. macaroni (raw) <NEXT_INGR> 1 can evaporated milk (small) <NEXT_INGR> 1 can condensed celery soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 can salmon <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. American cheese, grated <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook macaroni; drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine celery, soup and evaporated milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Add macaroni, salmon and 1/2 cup of cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn into greased casserole and sprinkle with remaining cheese around edge. Bake in moderate oven at 350° for 25 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Salmon Macaroni Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> light brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup unsalted butter, and softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup light brown sugar, firmly packed <NEXT_INGR> 4 large eggs, at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 6 ounces unsweetened chocolate, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Line 12 cupcake tins with cupcake paper. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, sift together flour and baking soda. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, on the medium speed of an electric mixer, cream the butter until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the sugars and beat until fluffy, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the chocolate, mixing until well incorporated. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the dry ingredients in three parts, alternating with the buttermilk and vanilla. With each addition, beat until the ingredients are incorporated, but do not overbeat. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a rubber spatula, scrape down the batter in the bowl to make sure the ingredients are well blended and the batter is smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Carefully spoon the batter into the cupcake liners, filling them about three-quarters full. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a cake tester inserted in the center of the cupcake comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool the cupcakes in the tins for 15 minutes. Remove from the tins and cool completely on a wire rack before icing. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Magnolia Bakery'S Chocolate Cupcakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> white wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> red chile peppers <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> fresh rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> lemon slices <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound unpeeled, medium-size fresh shrimp <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 large garlic bulb <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 3 dried red chile peppers <NEXT_INGR> 3 bay leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper <NEXT_INGR> Garnishes: lemon slices, red chile peppers, fresh rosemary sprigs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Peel shrimp, leaving tails on; devein, if desired, and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter with oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cut garlic bulb in half crosswise; separate and peel cloves. Add to butter mixture; saute 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in wine and next 8 ingredients; cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute or until thoroughly heated. <NEXT_INSTR> Add shrimp; cook 5 to 6 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink. Garnish, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Note: If serving over pasta, remove bay leaves. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Garlic-And-Rosemary Shrimp <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> instant chocolate pudding <NEXT_INPUT> cold milk <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallows <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (4 oz.) pkg. instant chocolate pudding <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. cold milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. miniature marshmallows <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. nuts, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. chocolate chips <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine pudding mix and milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat until well blended, 1 to 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in remaining ingredients. Spoon into dessert cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 6. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Rocky Road Pudding <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> focaccia <NEXT_INPUT> Mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> very <NEXT_INPUT> peperoncini <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (8x8") piece of focaccia <NEXT_INGR> Mayonnaise (for spreading) <NEXT_INGR> 2 lb. very thinly sliced mortadella <NEXT_INGR> 16 peperoncini, halved or quartered if very large <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Holding a bread knife parallel to a cutting board, slice focaccia in half. Spread cut sides with mayonnaise and cut each half into 2" squares. Working one at a time, drape mortadella onto squares, top with peperoncini, and secure with skewers. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mortadella Moments  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Spinach <NEXT_INPUT> Banana <NEXT_INPUT> Frozen Blueberries <NEXT_INPUT> Milk <NEXT_INPUT> Pomegranate Juice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 oz.
