Ground Flax Seeds <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend all the ingredients. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Eat Your Greens Smoothie  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> rabbit <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> wine <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cloves <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cut up rabbit <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. wine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 whole cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place rabbit in baking dish; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover with mixture of onions, wine, water and vinegar. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in refrigerator for 2 days. <NEXT_INSTR> Pat rabbit dry. <NEXT_INSTR> Flour and fry in butter until brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1/2 cup of marinade liquid and bring to boil. Cover and simmer until rabbit is tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the meat; add flour to liquid. <NEXT_INSTR> After liquid is thickened to a gravy, stir in sour cream and pour over rabbit. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fancy Rabbit(This Is Good, But Takes A While To Prepare.)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bread <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> S&P <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 slices bread, cubed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb cheddar, cubed <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb bacon, crisp fried and crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 4 oz cooked mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 2 c milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp dried mustard <NEXT_INGR> S&P <NEXT_INGR> dash paprika <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Start the day before and leave in fridge <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> In a casserole, layer bread, cheese mushrooms and bacon. Mix eggs with milk, and spices. Pour over bread. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350 for 50 minutes <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Brunch Eggs  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> Dutch <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> light corn syrup <NEXT_INPUT> white chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> cutter <NEXT_INPUT> decorative sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup unsweetened Dutch-process cocoa powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 sticks (1/2 pound) unsalted butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg yolk <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tablespoons light corn syrup <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 pound fine-quality white chocolate, melted <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> Equipment: a 1 3/4-inch fluted round cookie cutter <NEXT_INGR> Garnish: decorative sugar (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Whisk together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat butter and sugar with an electric mixer until pale and fluffy, then beat in yolk and vanilla. At low speed, mix in flour mixture in 3 batches just until a dough forms. Divide dough in half and form each piece into a 6-inch square, then chill, wrapped in plastic wrap, until firm, 2 to 3 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring cream and corn syrup just to a simmer in a small heavy saucepan, then stir into melted chocolate. Stir in butter and vanilla until smooth. Cover surface with parchment paper and chill, stirring occasionally, until very thick, about 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 350°F with rack in middle. Butter 2 large baking sheets. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll out 1 piece of dough between sheets of parchment paper into a 14- by 10-inch rectangle (1/8 inch thick). Slide dough in parchment onto a tray and freeze until dough is firm, about 10 minutes. Repeat with remaining dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut out as many rounds as possible from first chilled square with cutter, reserving and chilling scraps, then quickly transfer cookies to a buttered baking sheet, arranging them 1/2 inch apart. (If dough becomes too soft, return to freezer until firm.) <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle half of cookies with decorative sugar (if using), then bake cookies until baked through and slightly puffed, 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on sheet on rack 5 minutes, then transfer to rack to cool completely (cookies will crisp as they cool). <NEXT_INSTR> Make more cookies with remaining dough and scraps (reroll only once). <NEXT_INSTR> Beat ganache with an electric mixer at high speed just until light and fluffy. Transfer to a sealable plastic bag (snip off 1/8 to 1/4 inch from 1 corner with scissors). Pipe ganache onto flat sides of plain cookies, then top with sugared cookies to make sandwiches. Chill, layered between sheets of parchment, in an airtight container until filling is set, at least 1 hour. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Double-Chocolate Sandwich Cookies  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> stalks celery <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> red onions <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> penne pasta <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 chicken breast halves, with skin & bones <NEXT_INGR> 2 stalks celery <NEXT_INGR> 2 (32 ounce) bags baby carrots <NEXT_INGR> 2 red onions <NEXT_INGR> 2 large tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> penne pasta (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Fill up a really large pot with water and leave about 4 inches from the top high to boil. <NEXT_INSTR> While water heats up, salt it with some kosher salt or table salt doesn't matter. <NEXT_INSTR> Clean off the split chicken and remove any bones that are attached loosely. <NEXT_INSTR> Place chicken in boiling water. <NEXT_INSTR> Chop up the celery add to water. <NEXT_INSTR> chop up the onions & tomateos into quarters add to water. <NEXT_INSTR> Put in 3 bags of baby carrots into water. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and turn down heat to medium temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cook for 3 hours stirring occasionally and adding salt to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove chicken before serving and remove the bones & skin & chop up before adding back to the soup. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pork loin <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> ketchup <NEXT_INPUT> meat broth <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> warm sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (3-4 lb.) pork loin or possibly Boston butt roast <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4-1/2 c. ketchup <NEXT_INGR> 6-8 tbsp. meat broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> Texas Pete warm sauce to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown meat on all sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Put meat, sugar, salt and vinegar in crock pot and cook 10 to 12 hrs or possibly till done. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove meat from crock pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove bones and chop into small pcs. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix remaining ingredients for sauce and toss with meat. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Crock Pot Barbecue Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> lemons <NEXT_INPUT> mint <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 9 whole lemons <NEXT_INGR> sprigs of mint <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine sugar and water in a small saucepan; bring to a boil and boil for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat; cool slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Reserve one lemon to slice for garnish. <NEXT_INSTR> Grate zest of two lemons; juice eight lemons. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine juice and zest with warm syrup. <NEXT_INSTR> Steep one hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Strain. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemonade Concentrate(Servings: 24.  Preparation Time: 1 Hour And 15 Minutes.)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Bread <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> zest of half <NEXT_INPUT> egg <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Jiffy Corn Bread Mix <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup orange juice <NEXT_INGR> zest of half an orange <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Stir all ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into a greased 8"X8" baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 400o for 20-25 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Orange Corn Bread Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> corn tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> jalapeno chiles <NEXT_INPUT> no-salt <NEXT_INPUT> low-fat <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 corn tortillas <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. pickled sliced jalapeno chiles <NEXT_INGR> 1 can no-salt-added black beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. low-fat (1-percent) milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp. cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp. water <NEXT_INGR> 4 oz. reduced-fat (50-percent) extra-sharp Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 plum tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 green onion <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sprinkle 1 side of tortillas with 1/4 teaspoon salt. <NEXT_INSTR> In 4 batches, place tortillas between 2 paper towels on microwave-safe plate in single layer, spacing 1/2 inch apart. <NEXT_INSTR> Microwave on High 2 minutes or until crisp. <NEXT_INSTR> Finely chop half of jalapenos; reserve remaining for serving. <NEXT_INSTR> Reserve 1/4 cup beans; place remaining in medium bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> In 1 1/2- to 2-quart saucepan, heat milk on medium until just bubbling around edges. <NEXT_INSTR> In small bowl, stir cornstarch and water until cornstarch dissolves. <NEXT_INSTR> With wire whisk, stir cornstarch mixture into hot milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat to simmering, whisking constantly; simmer 2 minutes or until thickened, whisking constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add cheese and whisk until melted and smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in chopped jalapenos. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour 1/4 cup sauce over beans in bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> With potato masher or fork, mash beans until almost smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Place tortilla chips on serving plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon mashed beans over, then top with remaining sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with tomatoes, green onion, reserved beans, and reserved jalapenos. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Healthier Nachos Supreme <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> boiling water <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> onion juice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 Tbsp. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. boiling water <NEXT_INGR> 2 egg yolks, beaten <NEXT_INGR> juice of 1/2 lemon <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. chopped parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. onion juice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix butter and flour over low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Carefully add the boiling water. <NEXT_INSTR> When thickened, remove from heat and gradually add the eggs and other ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Reheat gently and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hollandaise Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> veal <NEXT_INPUT> sweet Italian sausage <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> bell peppers <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> boiling potato <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste <NEXT_INPUT> green beans <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> marjoram <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 lbs veal or 1 1/2 lbs pork sausage <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 lb sweet Italian sausage <NEXT_INGR> 4 onions, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 bell peppers, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 6 garlic cloves, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb boiling potato, peeled and cubed <NEXT_INGR> 16 ounces stewed tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 14 1/2 ounces chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 10 ounces green beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried oregano, crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried basil, crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried marjoram, crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup mozzarella cheese, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup cheddar cheese, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup parmesan cheese, grated <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat heavy 4 quart saucepan over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sausages and cook until brown, turning occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer sausages to plate and cool slightly. Cut into 1" pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove all but 2 tablespoons of fat from saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add onions to saucepan and saute over medium heat until tender, about 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add bell peppers and garlic and continue cooking until bell peppers soften, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in wine and boil 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Add potatoes, tomatoes, broth, and tomato paste. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in green beans, sausages, and herbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add all cheeses and stir. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sausage Stew <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> apples <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> apple cider <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <NEXT_INPUT> currants <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> molasses <NEXT_INPUT> lemon rind <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> ground cloves <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> lean ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/2 cups peeled, chopped apples <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 cups firmly packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup apple cider <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup raisins <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup currants <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped pecans <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup molasses <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons grated lemon rind <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cloves <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 pounds lean ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons whipping cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine first 15 ingredients in a large Dutch oven; stir well. Cook over medium heat 15 minutes. Add beef; cook an additional 15 minutes. Cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide pastry into 4 equal portions. Roll one portion of pastry to 1/8-inch thickness, and fit into a 9-inch pie plate. Repeat procedure with a second portion of pastry. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon half of mincemeat mixture into each pastry shell. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll third portion of pastry to 1/8-inch thickness; cut into 3/4- inch wide strips, and arrange in lattice design over filling. Seal and flute edges. Brush pastry with 1 tablespoon whipping cream; sprinkle with 1 tablespoon sugar. Repeat procedure with remaining portion of pastry. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake pies at 350° for 55 minutes or until golden brown. Cool before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Homemade Mincemeat Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> orange rind <NEXT_INPUT> lemon rind <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons fresh grated orange rind <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon fresh grated fresh lemon rind <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon orange extract <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup finely chopped pecans <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups all-purpose flour, divided <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Using an electric mixer, beat the butter in a mixing bowl on medium speed for about 2 minutes or until soft and creamy. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add in the sugar; beat at medium speed 5-7 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in eggs, one at a time, beating just until the yellow disappears. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in rinds and orange extract, stir to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, add nuts and 1/4 cup flour; stir to combine; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining flour, baking powder, and salt to a bowl; stir to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Add flour mixture to butter mixture alternately with milk; begin and end with flour mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix on low speed just until blended after each addition. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in pecans; stir to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour batter into a greased and floured 9x5 inch loaf pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 325° for 1 hour and 5 minutes or until pick comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10-15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn out of pan and let cool completely on wire rack. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Orange-Pecan Pound Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 small can evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. coconut, separate <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. nuts, separate <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix and boil 10 minutes, then add coconut and nuts. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over cake. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cake Topping <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> condensed milk <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla instant pudding <NEXT_INPUT> crackers <NEXT_INPUT> bananas super <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 condensed milk a can of <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups cold water <NEXT_INGR> vanilla instant pudding jell-o, if you want a stronger banana taste, use the banana pudding <NEXT_INGR> 600 milliliters heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> wafer you can use graham crackers too - coarsely grinded, you can manually break it with your hands inside a ziploc - not too smooth <NEXT_INGR> bananas super ripe, sliced <NEXT_INGR> cocoa powder / grated chocolate for garnish <NEXT_INGR> nuts hazelnut or peanut for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix condensed milk with cold water until it dissolves. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in the instant vanilla pudding into the milk until it thickens. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill in the fridge for at least 4 hours. (Don't forget to cover). <NEXT_INSTR> After four hours, whip the heavy cream to peak. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in the pudding into the cream, fold and mix evenly. Texture should be smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill in the fridge for another 4 hours (or not, if you can't wait :P) <NEXT_INSTR> Use individual crystal cup or ramekin - and spread a little of the pudding in the bottom. <NEXT_INSTR> Alternately layer banana slices and wafers - with pudding in between each. <NEXT_INSTR> Repeat and end with pudding on top. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with a sprinkle of wafers, nuts, and grated chocolate. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Pudding <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> mixed tender <NEXT_INPUT> red-wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 pound mixed tender or baby greens such as young chard, kale, mustard greens, spinach, beet greens, dandelion, and arugula, coarse stems discarded and leaves coarsely chopped (20 cups) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons red-wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook greens in a 6- to 8-quart pot of , uncovered, until wilted and tender, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain greens in a colander, then immediately plunge into a large bowl of very cold water to stop cooking. <NEXT_INSTR> Once cooled, drain in colander, tossing occasionally, 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Just before serving, whisk together vinegar, salt, and oil in a bowl until combined well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add greens and toss to coat. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Wilted Mixed Greens <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> baking apples <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 -8 medium baking apples (tart) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 34 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup butter (a little additional for baking dish) <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking powder <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel core and chop apples. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in buttered 9 inch baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine remaining ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Pack closely over apples. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a fork poke holes all over the crisp to break it apart (or it will be a crunchy layer like peanut brittle) Place on cookie sheet and bake for 1 hour or until bubbly. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Apple Crisp <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> Brown Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> All-purpose <NEXT_INPUT> Oats <NEXT_INPUT> Baking Soda <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Chocolate Chips <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup Butter Or Butter-flavored Shortening <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cup Brown Sugar, Packed <NEXT_INGR> 2 whole Eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cup All-purpose Flour <NEXT_INGR> 2-1/3 cups Old Fashioned Rolled Oats <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons Baking Soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 bag (12 Oz) Semi-sweet Chocolate Chips. <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees (F). <NEXT_INSTR> Lightly grease a cookie sheet or line with parchment. Cream butter and sugar til fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Beat or stir in flour, oats, baking soda, and salt; mix well! Stir in chocolate chips with a wooden spoon. Drop 1 tablespoon scoops of dough onto a greased cookie sheet, keeping a 1-inch space between cookies. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> **Very Important: allow the cookies to cool on the cookie sheet for five minutes so they can "set up," then transfer to cooling rack or parchment paper. If placed in an airtight container, they'll stay fresh for about a week. <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy thoroughly with a glass of milk! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> The Best Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies. Bar None. <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. butter or margarine, divided <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. evaporated milk <NEXT_INGR> 3 egg yolks <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt 2 tablespoons butter over low heat (or in top of a double boiler over hot water); stir in flour until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add evaporated milk slowly, stirring constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until smooth. Add egg yolks, one at a time and stir well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add remaining butter, then lemon juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 1 1/2 cups. <NEXT_INSTR> May be reheated. <NEXT_INSTR> If too thick, add a tablespoon water or lemon juice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mock Hollandaise <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> frozen peas <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> boil- <NEXT_INPUT> water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 skinless chicken breasts <NEXT_INGR> 2 (10 3/4 ounce) cans cream of mushroom soup (i use cambels) <NEXT_INGR> 10 ounces frozen peas <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon paprika <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups boil-in-the-bag rice (I use success rice) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cut chicken into 1 inch pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> place in bottom of glass (pyrex) bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> season chicken w salt n pap. <NEXT_INSTR> Place peas on top of chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> put cream of mushroom on top of peas. <NEXT_INSTR> cover 3/4 of bowl with tin foil. <NEXT_INSTR> place in 350 degrees oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook for 90 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Michael Ledsome's Creamy Chicken Dish <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cocktail franks <NEXT_INPUT> meatballs <NEXT_INPUT> barbecue sauce <NEXT_INPUT> maple-flavor syrup <NEXT_INPUT> brown mustard <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (16 ounce) package cocktail franks <NEXT_INGR> 1 (18 ounce) packagefrozen cooked meatballs <NEXT_INGR> 1 (18 ounce) bottle barbecue sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup maple-flavor syrup <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons spicy brown mustard <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients in a 3 to 4 quart crock pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook on high for 3 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir after 2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve, set on low heat. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Maple-Mustard Barbecued Meatballs and Sausages <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> carrot sticks <NEXT_INPUT> bouillon cubes <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> catsup <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> rice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. (8 oz.) pineapple chunks <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. shortening or Pam <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. carrot sticks <NEXT_INGR> 3 bouillon cubes or instant broth packets <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. firmly packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. catsup and 1 Tbsp. soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. diced cooked chicken and/or can stir-fry <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. green pepper strips (you can substitute green beans) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/4 c. Minute rice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Drain pineapple, reserving juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Add water to juice to make 2 1/4 cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute onion in shortening in large skillet until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 1/4 cups water, carrots and bouillon. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and simmer 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine sugar, cornstarch and ginger. <NEXT_INSTR> Add catsup, vinegar and soy sauce and stir into vegetable mixture. Cook until clear and thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chicken, green peppers and pineapple. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and simmer 5 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet And Sour Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> strawberry halves <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> fruit <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 c. strawberry halves <NEXT_INGR> 1 small pineapple, pared and cubed <NEXT_INGR> 2 kiwi fruit, sliced <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix strawberries, pineapple cubes and kiwi fruit; toss with Honey Sesame Dressing. Chill. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mixed Fruit With Honey Sesame Dressing <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. butter, at room temperature <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 Large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. mashed very ripe bananas <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. lowfat sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. minced walnuts or possibly pecans (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Cream butter, sugar, and Large eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift the dry ingredients and combine with butter mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in bananas, lowfat sour cream and vanilla; stir well. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in nuts and pour into a well-buttered 9x5x3 inch loaf pan or possibly several smaller ones. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn out onto a rack to cold. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Best Banana Muffins Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ham <NEXT_INPUT> Swiss cheese <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> Bisquick baking mix <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 c. cut-up fully cooked smoked ham <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. shredded natural Swiss cheese (about 4 oz.) <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. chopped green onions or chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. Bisquick baking mix <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt (if desired) <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> The pie that does the impossible by making its own crust. Makes 6 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Impossible Ham 'N Swiss Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> confectioners sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary sprigs <NEXT_INPUT> parchment paper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) unsalted butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons mild honey <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup confectioners sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> Garnish: small rosemary sprigs <NEXT_INGR> Special equipment: parchment paper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 300F. <NEXT_INSTR> Whisk together flour, salt, baking powder, and rosemary in a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together butter, honey, and confectioners sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer at low speed, then add flour mixture and mix until dough resembles coarse meal with some small (roughly pea-size) butter lumps. <NEXT_INSTR> Gather dough into a ball and transfer to a lightly floured surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead dough until it just comes together, about 8 times. <NEXT_INSTR> Halve dough and form each half into a 5-inch disk. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll out 1 disk (keep remaining dough at room temperature) between 2 sheets of parchment into a 9-inch round (trim as necessary). <NEXT_INSTR> Remove top sheet of parchment and transfer dough on bottom sheet of parchment to a baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Score dough into 8 wedges by pricking dotted lines with a fork, then mark edges decoratively. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange rosemary sprigs (if using) decoratively on top of dough, pressing lightly to help adhere, and sprinkle dough with 1/2 tablespoon granulated sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake shortbread in middle of oven until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Slide shortbread on parchment to a rack and cool 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer with a metal spatula to a cutting board and cut along score marks with a large heavy knife. <NEXT_INSTR> Make another shortbread with remaining dough. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Rosemary Shortbread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> sweet potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> chives <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 slices bacon crosswise thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 123 cups sweet potatoes, or yams peeled and dice into 1/4-inch <NEXT_INGR> 1 x kosher salt to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 x black pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons chives thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 each belgian endive medium size <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup sour cream, light optional <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook bacon in large nonstick skillet over medium heat until it has rendered some fat, 3 to 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add diced sweet potato and 1/4 teaspoon each kosher salt and pepper or to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook and stir often, until sweet potato is tender and bacon starts crispy, 6 to 9 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in 2 tablespoons of chives and season with more salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool for bout 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice the bottom 1/2 inch off endives, so some of outer leaves break free. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut another 1/2 inch off and break some more leaves free. <NEXT_INSTR> Keep doing until all larger leaves are free. <NEXT_INSTR> (You should have about 20.) <NEXT_INSTR> If you desire, trim leaves so they're all the same length. <NEXT_INSTR> Save remaining endive for salad. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange endive leaves on a large platter. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon sweet potato mixture near the bottom of the leaves. <NEXT_INSTR> Top each with a dollop of sour cream and then sprinkle with the remaining chives. <NEXT_INSTR> Let sit for up to 20 minutes before serving or serve right away. <NEXT_INSTR> If you're aiming for a Paleo diet, omit the sour cream and you are in compliance! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bacon Sweet Potato Bites <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> wasabi powder <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> tuna <NEXT_INPUT> egg white <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> sesame seeds <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> rolls <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 teaspoons water <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons wasabi powder (look for this in the Asian section of most supermarkets) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 tuna steaks, about 1 1/2 pounds total <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg white, lightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons sesame seeds, toasted in a dry skillet over medium heat until light brown <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt-free Greek seasoning, like Cavenders <NEXT_INGR> 6 brioche rolls or hamburger buns <NEXT_INGR> Pickled ginger <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a small bowl, mix the water and wasabi powder together to form a paste. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the sour cream, mustard, and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Light a charcoal fire or preheat your gas grill on high. <NEXT_INSTR> Oil the grills cooking surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Let the coals bum down to a medium-hot fire or adjust the gas grill burners to medium-high. <NEXT_INSTR> 3, Meanwhile, cut the tuna into large chunks, place in a food processor, and pulse just until coarsely ground. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a large bowl and stir in the egg white, soy sauce, and sesame seeds. <NEXT_INSTR> With moistened hands, form the mixture into 6 patties, about 1 inch thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush both sides of each burger with the oil and sprinkle the Greek seasoning equally over the burgers. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the burgers on the grill and cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side or to your desired degree of doneness. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve on brioche rolls or buns with the wasabi sauce and pickled ginger. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tuna Burgers with a Wasabi Kick <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> navy beans <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> ham bone <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb navy beans <NEXT_INGR> 2 quarts water <NEXT_INGR> chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> chopped carrot <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> ham bone <NEXT_INGR> ham <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Soak navy beans according to pkg directions. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute onion and carrots in butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine all ingredients in large soup kettle; bring to a boil and let simmer until beans are soft- about 1 to 2 hours. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Navy Bean & Ham Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> oil <NEXT_INPUT> condensed cream <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 to 2 1/2 lb. round steak <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. oil or shortening <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 1/2 oz.) can condensed cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. instant minced onion or 1 small onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown meat on both sides in hot oil in large fry pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine remaining ingredients and pour over meat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover simmer 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 4 to 6. <NEXT_INSTR> I like to cut meat into serving size pieces. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Melba'S Steak In Mushroom Gravy <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> chives <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 to 10 medium potatoes, peeled <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) carton sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. butter or oleo <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. chopped chives or green onion tops <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Boil, drain and mash potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add cheese and remaining ingredients except paprika. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon into buttered 2-quart casserole. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with paprika. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from refrigerator, wait 15 minutes and bake at 350° for 35 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 8 to 10. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Irish Potato Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cuban rum <NEXT_INPUT> banana liqueur <NEXT_INPUT> coffee liqueur <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> banana <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 ounce cuban rum (aged) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 ounce banana liqueur <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 ounce coffee liqueur <NEXT_INGR> 1 ounce cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 ounce milk <NEXT_INGR> banana <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Fill a sling glass to the rim with crushed ice. <NEXT_INSTR> Put a small amount of crushed ice in the blender container. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour aged rum of cuban type, banana liqueur, coffee liqueur, cream and milk over the crushed ice. <NEXT_INSTR> Close the lid on the blender and run until the drink is smooth. Add some more liquid if it's too hard, and more ice if it's too runny. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the drink into the sling glass. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with a banana (slice). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dirty Banana <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> enchilada sauce <NEXT_INPUT> corn tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> olives <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 3 (10 oz.) cans Las Palmas enchilada sauce <NEXT_INGR> 8 corn tortillas <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. Cheddar cheese (optional) <NEXT_INGR> ripe olives for garnish (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Saute beef and onion in a skillet pan until cooked. Drain grease. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in 1/3 cup Las Palmas enchilada sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> In a skillet, heat 1 can (10 ounce) sauce. Dip each tortilla in sauce until well coated. <NEXT_INSTR> Lay tortilla in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Fill with 3 tablespoons of meat and roll. <NEXT_INSTR> Place seam side down, side by side, in same dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover rolled enchiladas with remaining sauce. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Makes 8 tortillas, 4 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Enchiladas Las Palmas <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 10 each chicken thighs, boneless, skinless <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons soy sauce, tamari reduced sodium <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Soak the chicken pieces in salted water for 20 minutes (or just rinse if you are in a hurry). <NEXT_INSTR> Drain and pat the pieces dry and arrange them in a baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> They should be a bit crowded, touching each other. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix up the rest of the ingredients and pour over the chicken, then let stand for 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile pre-heat the oven to 400F (200C). <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 45 minutes or until done, juices should run clear or use a thermometer in the thickest part of the thigh. <NEXT_INSTR> It should read at least 165 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> If desired you can use the juices (skim the fat after removing the chicken from the baking dish) with some flour to make a bit of a gravy for any accompanying vegetables. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Garlic Chicken Thighs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> jalapeno chile <NEXT_INPUT> freshly popped <NEXT_INPUT> lime zest <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbs. thinly sliced jalapeno chile <NEXT_INGR> 8 cups freshly popped hot popcorn <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbs. grated lime zest <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup loosely packed cilantro leaves, coarsely chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oil and jalapeno in small skillet over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook 1 minute, or until jalapeno sizzles. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt, if desired, and continue cooking 2 minutes more. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat, and cool slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle popcorn with oil-jalapeno mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with lime zest and cilantro. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Jalapeno-Lime Popcorn <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> rice cereal <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup Land O Lakes Butter, very soft <NEXT_INGR> 4 ounces (1 cup) shredded Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup toasted rice cereal <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 400F. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine flour, butter and cheese in large bowl; mix until dough forms. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in cereal until combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape dough into 1-inch balls. <NEXT_INSTR> Place 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 10-15 minutes or until golden brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Crunchy Cheddar Bites <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla extract <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 eggs, separated <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 quart milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash cinnamon (optional) or 1 dash nutmeg (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> in large bowl beat yolks with 3 T of the sugar until very fluffy. <NEXT_INSTR> with clean beaters beat the egg whites until frothy gradually beat in remaining sugar and continue to beat until stiff peaks just form. <NEXT_INSTR> heat milk over medium heat in a deep 10 in skillet or 6 quart pot just heat for about 3-4 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> drop beaten egg whites by spoon fulls into hot milk. cook until the egg whites spoon drops (called kisses) are set and firm to the touch about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> remove the kisses with slotted spoon onto wax paper. <NEXT_INSTR> stirring constantly gradually add hot milk into the egg yolks. <NEXT_INSTR> strain mixture into the sauce pan add extract and salt cook over medium low heat about 3 minutes until thickened and will coat a soup spoon. <NEXT_INSTR> serve soup with 2 or 3 kisses atop each serving sprinkle with cinnamon or nutmeg if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> can be served hot or cold. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Polish Nothing Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> Ginger <NEXT_INPUT> Cooking Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Soy Sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 leaves Cabbage <NEXT_INGR> 13 cups Ginger, Julienned <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tablespoon Cooking Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound Thinly Sliced Pork Loin <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cups Soy Sauce, Mild <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Wash and shake dry cabbage leaves. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut out the spine and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Stack 2 or 3 leaves, roll them up and thinly slice. <NEXT_INSTR> Also thinly slice the spine portion that you previously removed if you like the crunchy part! <NEXT_INSTR> Place all of this in a large serving platter to serve as a bed for the pork. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Julienne the ginger. <NEXT_INSTR> Really pack it in there! <NEXT_INSTR> You can add more if you love ginger. <NEXT_INSTR> My kids will even eat this, so dont be afraid! <NEXT_INSTR> Remove about 1 tablespoon of the ginger and finely chop it to be used at the beginning of stir frying. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large frying pan or wok, add the cooking oil and the finely chopped ginger. <NEXT_INSTR> On a low flame, slowly warm the ginger until it begins to sizzle. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the pork and stir fry until it is almost completely done (all the pink has disappeared). <NEXT_INSTR> Add in the ginger and stir fry until the sticks of ginger become tender and bendy! <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in the soy sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir fry one more minute, until soy sauce is mixed in well and bubbly. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over a bed of rice and serve immediately! <NEXT_INSTR> Check my blog post for all the details with pictures. <NEXT_INSTR> This is also yummy served on top of a bowl of rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Place rice in the bowl, put on a layer of cabbage, pour on the pork with some of the juices to flavor the rice! <NEXT_INSTR> Yum! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Ginger Pork <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. flour, sifted <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. bananas, mashed <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. nuts, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix the first 3 ingredients; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In another bowl, mix flour, baking soda and baking powder together. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add flour mixture until it is well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Add your bananas, nuts and milk; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Your batter will be thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Use loaf pans. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for about 45 minutes, or until golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn out onto a rack to cool. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Nut Loaf <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> cloves <NEXT_INPUT> unflavored gelatine <NEXT_INPUT> apples <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 Tbsp. cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar or more <NEXT_INGR> cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> cloves <NEXT_INGR> Knox unflavored gelatine <NEXT_INGR> 4 to 5 apples, chopped <NEXT_INGR> nutmeg <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix with cold water. <NEXT_INSTR> Put this into a pie shell (top and bottom). <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° until done. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Apple Pie (Mom'S) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> frozen broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen broccoli, cooked and drained <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. cooked chicken, sliced or chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. curry powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. grated Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. soft bread crumbs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place broccoli in shallow 9 x 13-inch dish. Cover with chicken. Combine soup, mayonnaise, lemon juice and curry powder. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in a 325° oven for 30 minutes. Serves 6 to 8. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Divan <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> turkey broth <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> potato <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> turkey <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 c. turkey broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 stalk celery, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 carrot, peeled and sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. peeled, cubed potato <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. diced onion <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. cooked turkey, cut in chunks <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. thyme <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In medium saucepan, combine broth, celery, carrot and potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add onion, turkey and thyme. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer 10 to 15 minutes more or until potatoes are fork-tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Adjust seasoning to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 4 cups. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Turkey Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> crunchy peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> yellow cake <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 1 (18 ounce) jar crunchy peanut butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 (18.25 ounce) package yellow cake mix <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the butter and sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth. Add the egg and beat until incorporated; then beat in the peanut butter until evenly mixed. Stir in the cake mix until just incorporated. Shape the dough into 1 inch balls, place onto ungreased baking sheets, and flatten with a fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in the preheated oven until the edges are golden, about 10 minutes. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 1 minute before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Cake Mix Peanut Butter Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> almond extract <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 large eggs (room temperature) <NEXT_INGR> 2 sticks (1 c.) butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. almond extract <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 4 oz. (1 c.) sliced almonds <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. ground cinnamon <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large mixing bowl with electric mixer, beat eggs for 30 seconds on medium speed. <NEXT_INSTR> With mixer on low, gradually add melted butter and almond extract. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat in sugar, flour and salt until blended, about one minute on medium speed. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray a jelly roll pan, 15 x 10-inches with one-inch sides with vegetable spray. Pour batter evenly into pan, smoothing out evenly to edges. Sprinkle almonds evenly over top of batter. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Swedish Almond Bars <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> granulated sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/4 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. butter/margarine, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. packed light brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. Jell-O vanilla instant pudding <NEXT_INGR> 1 (12 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. nuts <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix flour with baking soda. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine sugar (white and brown), butter, vanilla and pudding mix in large mixer bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat until smooth and creamy. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat in eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add flour mixture, then stir in chips and nuts. <NEXT_INSTR> (Batter will be stiff.) <NEXT_INSTR> Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375° for 8 to 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes about 7 dozen. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Chip Jello Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> white bread <NEXT_INPUT> processed cheese <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 slices white bread <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb. processed cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. Grey Poupon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs, well beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. whole milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> (You can add Shoe Peg corn to this. <NEXT_INSTR> Make sure kernels are dry.) <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cheese Pudding <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> gingerroot <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> vegetables <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> red lentils <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable stock <NEXT_INPUT> coconut milk <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 large onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 1 inch fresh gingerroot, peeled and very finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 tablespoons curry powder, to taste <NEXT_INGR> 2 lbs vegetables, peeled, trimmed and chopped into small chunks <NEXT_INGR> 14 ounces chopped tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 3 12 ounces split red lentils <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup vegetable stock <NEXT_INGR> 1 23 cups coconut milk <NEXT_INGR> fresh cilantro leaves, chopped (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat the oil in a large frying pan and fry the onion until soft and pale golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the curry powder and cook for another 2 minutes, stirring all the time. <NEXT_INSTR> Add all the vegetables to the pan and stir well so everything is completely coated in the spice mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the chopped tomatoes, lentils, vegetable stock and coconut milk and stir together gently. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat, cover and leave to simmer gently for about 20 to 25 minutes, until the vegetables are tender. <NEXT_INSTR> If you are adding the fresh cilantro leaves, stir them into the curry just before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Speedy Spicy Vegetable Curry <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chutney <NEXT_INPUT> peaches <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> turkey breast <NEXT_INPUT> egg white <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Cooking spray <NEXT_INPUT> buns <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/3 cup prepared cranberry chutney <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup finely chopped peeled peaches <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon finely chopped green onions <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound ground turkey breast <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg white <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> Cooking spray <NEXT_INGR> 4 lettuce leaves <NEXT_INGR> 4 (2.8-ounce) gluten-free hamburger buns, toasted <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine first 3 ingredients in a small bowl, stirring well to blend. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine turkey and next 3 ingredients. Divide turkey mixture into 4 equal portions, shaping each into a 1/2-inch-thick patty. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add patties; cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until a thermometer registers 165°. <NEXT_INSTR> Place 1 lettuce leaf on bottom half of each bun; top each with 1 patty and 2 tablespoons cranberry mixture. Top each with 1 bun top. <NEXT_INSTR> For this recipe, select ground turkey breast over ground turkey, which contains both the dark and white meat. The breast meat is much lower in calories and fat. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Turkey Burgers With Cranberry-Peach Chutney <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> leaf basil <NEXT_INPUT> leaf oregano <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 firm large tomatoes, unpeeled <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. dry bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. grated Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. finely diced ham <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. leaf basil, crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. leaf oregano, crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. minced parsley <NEXT_INGR> pinch of salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut tomatoes in halves. <NEXT_INSTR> In small bowl, mix remaining ingredients thoroughly and press on top of tomato halves. <NEXT_INSTR> In shallow baking dish, bake tomatoes until softened, about 15 to 25 minutes (time will depend on firmness of tomatoes). <NEXT_INSTR> Topping should be lightly browned. <NEXT_INSTR> If not, tomatoes may be placed under broiler. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 4 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Stuffed Tomatoes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> American cheese slices <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (8 oz.) pkg. American cheese slices <NEXT_INGR> 4 Tbsp. melted butter <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. fine bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 4 c. sliced zucchini <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 3 tomatoes, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. finely chopped green pepper <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pour melted butter over bread crumbs. Mix thoroughly. Grease a 1 1/2-quart casserole. Cut cheese slices into triangles. Alternately place layers of zucchini, onion, tomatoes, green pepper, cheese and bread crumbs in casserole. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and top with bread crumbs. Cover and bake in 350° oven for an hour or until vegetables are tender. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Zucchini Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> tuna <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> pesto <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/3 lb potatoes, peeled and cut into wedges <NEXT_INGR> 1 None fresh tuna steak (about 5 oz) <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 None small onion, peeled and thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp fresh chopped rosemary, plus extra sprigs to garnish <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp pesto <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped <NEXT_INGR> None None tomato and lettuce salad, to serve <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Boil the potato wedges in a pan of lightly salted water for 15-20 mins until tender. Meanwhile, sprinkle the tuna steak with 2 tbsp of the lemon juice and season with freshly ground black pepper. Heat the butter in a small frying pan and fry the tuna steak for 3-4 mins, on each side or until seared and cooked to your liking. Remove and keep warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onion and rosemary to the pan and fry until tender and golden. Set aside with the tuna. Add 2 tbsp water and the rest of the lemon juice to the pan and heat gently stirring any sediment from the base of the pan. Stir in the pesto and parsley and heat through gently. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain the potatoes and serve with the tuna steak, onion and pesto sauce. Garnish with the rosemary sprigs and serve with tomato and lettuce salad. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pan-Fried Tuna Steak With Pesto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sweet Italian sausage <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> green peppers <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> Italian seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> garlic powder <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. sweet Italian sausage <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. chopped celery <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. cut up zucchini <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 2 green peppers, diced <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. basil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. Italian seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. garlic powder <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown Italian sausage and drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Add celery and cook for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add rest of ingredients and cook 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Zucchini Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> freshly squeezed orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> saffron <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> Orange marinade <NEXT_INPUT> orange <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> chicken stock <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted cold butter <NEXT_INPUT> chives <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> shallots <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> polenta <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 cups freshly squeezed orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 6 cloves garlic, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> Pinch saffron <NEXT_INGR> 1 chicken (4 to 5 pounds) <NEXT_INGR> Orange marinade <NEXT_INGR> 1 orange, quartered <NEXT_INGR> 4 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, peeled and quartered <NEXT_INGR> Salt and coarsely ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups chicken stock <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons unsalted cold butter <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons finely chopped chives <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 shallots, finely diced <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 pound assorted wild mushrooms (shiitake, oyster, cremini) chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> Salt and freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup polenta <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring ingredients to a boil in a medium saucepan and reduce to 2 cups and let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Place chicken in a large baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush 1 cup of the marinade over the chicken and inside the cavity. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or up to 8 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Remove the chicken from the marinade and place the oranges, garlic and onions in the cavity and truss. <NEXT_INSTR> Season well with salt and coarsely ground black pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush with more of the marinade. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the chicken in a medium roasting pan and roast in the oven for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn the heat down to 375 degrees and continue roasting for 1 to 1 1/4 hours, basting with the marinade every 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the chicken to a cutting board and let rest 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Degrease the pan and place the roasting dish with the drippings on top of 2 burners over high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the wine and orange juice and reduce by half. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the chicken stock and reduce by half. <NEXT_INSTR> Swirl in the butter and add the chives. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat oil and butter in a large saute pan over high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the shallots and cook until soft. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the mushrooms and cook until golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the wine and cook until completely reduced. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper and fold in the thyme and parsley, set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a small saute pan over high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the polenta and toast until lightly golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan and add 1 tablespoon of salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Slowly whisk in the toasted polenta, and reduce the heat to low. <NEXT_INSTR> Switch to a wooden spoon and continue cooking until the mixture begins to pull away from the pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the mushrooms, cheese and season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> If the mixture is too thick, add more water. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Roast Chicken Marinated in Saffron, Orange and Garlic with Toasted Wild Mushroom Polenta <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> soda <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 c. margarine or butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 to 6 mashed bananas (ripe) <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. buttermilk or sour milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. nuts (if desired) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream margarine or butter and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Cream well. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend in bananas and eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift flour, flour and soda together. <NEXT_INSTR> Add alternately with buttermilk or sour milk, blending until well combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in nuts, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake at 350° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes one 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Delicious Banana Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> baguettes <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> marinara sauce <NEXT_INPUT> soy pepperoni <NEXT_INPUT> red peppers <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 mini baguettes (5 oz. each) <NEXT_INGR> 3 tsp. olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 8 Tbs. marinara sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 4-oz. pkg. soy pepperoni slices <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup (about 13 oz.) chopped roasted red peppers <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups shredded low-fat mozzarella cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat broiler to 450F. <NEXT_INSTR> Split baguettes in half lengthwise, and place 4 halves side by side on baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine oil and garlic in mixing bowl, and brush on split baguette halves, dividing equally among each. <NEXT_INSTR> Place in oven and heat 5 minutes, or until loaves slightly browned and aromatic. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from oven, and set on work surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread 2 tablespoons marinara sauce on each half of baguette. <NEXT_INSTR> Carefully arrange pepperoni slices on each half, dividing them into four equal servings. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle each half with chopped red peppers, and top with cheese, being sure to cover each half completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Increase oven temperature to 475F, and bake loaves about 5 minutes, or until cheese bubbles and browns slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat, and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Italian-Style Pepperoni Hero <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pistachio nuts <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> prawns <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> generous handful <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> lemon rind <NEXT_INPUT> liters water <NEXT_INPUT> wild fennel <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 100 g pistachio nuts <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil (EVOO) <NEXT_INGR> 300 g cooked prawns, without the tail <NEXT_INGR> garlic clove (finely chopped) <NEXT_INGR> generous handful of chopped parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 large piece of glazed lemon rind <NEXT_INGR> 5 liters water <NEXT_INGR> 500 g tagliatelle pasta noodles <NEXT_INGR> wild fennel (if available) or fennel leaves (if available) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> METHOD: <NEXT_INSTR> 1.	Add 4 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil to a food processor along with 100g pistachio and mix until it becomes a pesto-like creamy texture. <NEXT_INSTR> pistachio. <NEXT_INSTR> 2.	Slice lemon rind into thin strips and then smaller pieces and put to the side. <NEXT_INSTR> 3.	Boil 5L of water in a large pot. <NEXT_INSTR> 4.	Put the saucepan on the stove at a medium heat and add EVOO and finely chopped garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> 5.	Cook garlic until it begins to golden then add the prawns. <NEXT_INSTR> 6.	Cook the prawns until they slightly change in colour (which only takes a few minutes), then add parsley and a sprinkle of salt. <NEXT_INSTR> 7.	Keep this simmering until the prawns turn a much stronger shade of orange. <NEXT_INSTR> 8.	Once the prawns are cooked, add the pistachio pesto and stir it through really well. <NEXT_INSTR> 9.	Let the prawns simmer in the pistachio pesto at a low heat for approximately 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> prawns. <NEXT_INSTR> 10.	Your water should be boiling by now, so add the pasta and cook it to your desired preference (I love it al-dente, but follow the instructions on the packet so you don't overcook it!). <NEXT_INSTR> 11.	Once the pasta is ready and the pesto is smothering the prawns, strain the pasta and add it to the pan before tossing it through the mix really well. <NEXT_INSTR> HOW TO SERVE: <NEXT_INSTR> 1.	Once the pasta is smothered in the pesto, it is ready to serve! <NEXT_INSTR> 2.	Get a large serving spoon and use this to serve the pasta onto a plate trying to keep it in the centre. <NEXT_INSTR> 3.	Then, if you have some fennel leaves, add them to the top for added presentation. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tagliatelle With Prawns And Pistacchio Pesto <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pork tenderloin <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sage <NEXT_INPUT> rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> all-purpose <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> One 1 1/2-pound boneless pork tenderloin, cut on the extreme diagonal into 12 slices <NEXT_INGR> Salt and freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons finely chopped sage <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon finely chopped rosemary <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup dry white wine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> On a work surface, lightly pound the tenderloin slices a scant 1/4 inch thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> In a bowl, combine the Pecorino, sage, rosemary and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of the herb mixture over each pork slice and roll into a cylinder; secure with toothpicks. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread the flour in a pie plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Coat the involtini with flour, tapping off the excess. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large skillet, heat the oil until shimmering. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the involtini and cook over moderately high heat until browned all over, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the wine, cover and simmer until the involtini are cooked through, 3 minutes longer. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the involtini to a plate and cover loosely with foil. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil the cooking liquid until reduced to a thick sauce, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Return the involtini to the skillet and shake the pan to coat them with sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the involtini to plates and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Herbed Pork Involtini <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> chops <NEXT_INPUT> Blend <NEXT_INPUT> condensed cream <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 bone-in pork chops <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 ounce) bag Birds Eye(R) Recipe Ready Chopped Seasoning Blend <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom or celery soup <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Season pork chops, if desired, with salt and black pepper. Reduce heat to low and add back pork chops. Simmer 5 minutes or until pork is cooked through.* Serve over hot cooked noodles or mashed potatoes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Smothered Pork Chops From Birds Eye® <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cooking spray <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> canyams <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> apple cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> dark brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> brown mustard <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> non-stick cooking spray <NEXT_INGR> 4 lbs chicken parts, skin removed <NEXT_INGR> salt & fresh ground pepper, to taste (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) canyams in syrup, not drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can crushed tomatoes, preferably fire-roasted <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup apple cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon spicy brown mustard <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400F. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray rimmed sheet pan with oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Season chicken with salt and pepper, if desired, and arrange on pan with as much space between the pieces as possible. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray with oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, make the Yummy Yammy BBQ sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Puree yams, tomatoes, vinegar, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce and mustard in a blender until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside about 1 1/4 cups of the sauce for dipping later; leaving about 2 1/2 cups of sauce for basting the chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush approximately 1 1/4 cups of the sauce over the chicken and bake for 20 more minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Then turn the chicken pieces and baste with about 1 1/4 cups of the sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 20 minutes more until chicken pieces are brown on the edges and cooked through to an internal temperature of 165F. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve the original Yummy Yammy BBQ Chicken, dish up the remaining sauce for dipping. <NEXT_INSTR> **. <NEXT_INSTR> Nutritional Information Per Serving: <NEXT_INSTR> Calories 380; Total fat 7g; Saturated fat 2g; Cholesterol 160mg; Sodium 430mg; Carbohydrate 28g; Fiber 3g; Protein 50g; Vitamin A 25%DV*; Vitamin C 20%DV; Calcium 6%DV; Iron 20%DV. <NEXT_INSTR> *Daily Value. <NEXT_INSTR> **For a variation, prepare one of the following flavor-enhancing combos, then stir it into the Yummy Yammy BBQ sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> For each tasty twist on the original recipe, youll reserve a portion of the flavored sauce for dipping and use the remaining sauce to brush onto the uncooked chicken. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Yummy Yammy BBQ Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. shortening <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking powder <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix sugar, shortening and eggs together. <NEXT_INSTR> Add vanilla, flour and baking powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate for 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Take out, roll and cut into shapes. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook at 350° until done. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sugar Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> bourbon <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> Bacon <NEXT_INPUT> Bacon <NEXT_INPUT> light brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> bourbon <NEXT_INPUT> maple syrup <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 ounces butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup packed dark brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon coarse sea salt <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 5 cups whole milk <NEXT_INGR> 4 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons bourbon <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> Candied Bacon: <NEXT_INGR> 6 slices Farmland(R) Bacon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup light brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon bourbon <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup maple syrup <NEXT_INGR> Whipped cream for garnish <NEXT_INGR> Candied pecans for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt butter in medium-sized saucepan. Add dark brown sugar and salt, and stir until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> In small bowl, whisk together cornstarch with about 1/4 cup milk until smooth; then whisk in eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually pour remaining milk into melted brown sugar, whisking constantly; then whisk in cornstarch mixture as well. <NEXT_INSTR> Return pan to heat, and bring mixture to boil, whisking frequently. Once it begins to bubble, reduce heat to low simmer and continue to cook for 1 minute, whisking nonstop, until pudding thickens. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat and stir in bourbon and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into individual dishes and chill thoroughly before serving. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. <NEXT_INSTR> Line baking sheet with parchment and place wire rack on top. <NEXT_INSTR> In small saucepot over medium heat, add brown sugar, bourbon and maple syrup. Cook, stirring often, until mixture is thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Place bacon slices on rack and brush half of glaze on both sides of bacon. Sprinkle with additional brown sugar if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in preheated oven for 8 minutes, flip and brush bacon with remaining glaze. Cook until crispy and browned. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve: Top butterscotch puddings with bacon, whipped cream and candied pecans. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Butterscotch Pudding With Candied Bacon <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Crisco or lard <NEXT_INGR> 6 Tbsp. ice water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend ingredients with electric mixer. <NEXT_INSTR> Add ice water, 3 tablespoons at a time. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend in until all water is added. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend to smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Take out on a floured pastry board or sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll out in 7-inch pie crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 2. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Southern Pie Crust <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 plum tomatoes ripe <NEXT_INGR> 4 cloves garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion medium <NEXT_INGR> 2 sprigs basil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon oregano if you don't have basil <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 hot pepper small dried red, optional <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup dry white wine or red <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cut the tomatoes in quarters and put them in a large baking dish (do not remove the seeds or the skins). Roughly chop the garlic and onions and add them to the tomatoes. Put in the basil or the oregano, salt and pepper and toss the ingredients. Add the wine and toss again to be sure that all the ingredients are covered with the herbs. All the ingredients can be roughly chopped because they will be put through a food mill at the end. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the baking dish in the oven at 400°F and cook for 45 minutes or until the tomatoes are thoroughly cooked. Move the sauce to a food mill and grind out all the juices removing the skins and seeds. If there is too much liquid in the sauce, place it in a pan and reduce it. <NEXT_INSTR> The sauce will have a warm smoky flavor and can be served over any type of pasta. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Roasted Tomato Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>
