<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> powdered sugar <NEXT_INPUT> all-purpose flour <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 -2 tablespoon milk <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups powdered sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups shredded carrots <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup raisins <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Prepare an 8x8 pan by lining it with aluminum foil and spraying the foil with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> 2. In a large microwave-safe bowl, place the butter, flour, sugar, 1 tablespoon of milk, carrots, cinnamon, salt, and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Microwave on high power for two minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the mixture to a mixer and beat it with a paddle attachment and beat until well-mixed. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> all-purpose <NEXT_INPUT> sesame seeds <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> dill pickle <NEXT_INPUT> dill weed <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons sesame seeds <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, lightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup water <NEXT_INGR> Oil for frying <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons dill pickle relish <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dill weed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large shallow bowl, combine the flour, sesame seeds and salt. Whole lowfat milk or possibly half & half Salt and Freshly grnd Pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Directions; 1. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the peeled potatoes in large pot, cover with water. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to boil cook 20 -25 min till potatoes are tender and done. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain potatoes in colander. <NEXT_INSTR> Return the potatoes to pot and cook over low heat 30 seconds to evaporate any water remaining. <NEXT_INSTR> 2. <NEXT_INSTR> With hand held mixer mash, potatoes till smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in the two pkgs. <NEXT_INSTR> of Boursin cheese and continue beating till thoroughly incorporated. <NEXT_INSTR> Thin mashed potatoes with lowfat milk or possibly half & half, beat 1 minute more. <NEXT_INSTR> 3. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> 4. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the mashed potatoes to ovenproof casserole and rewarm by baking in 350 F. or possibly microwaving till piping warm. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve at once. <NEXT_INSTR> Note: Boursin is a soft and rich French cheese laced with garlic and herbs. <NEXT_INSTR> It is widely available in America and just happens to make one of the easiest and most sensational tasting mashed potato recipes in the world. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Boursin Mashed Potatoes Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

sliced <NEXT_INGR> 12 lb parsnip, peeled and thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb potato, peeled and thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 4 garlic cloves, peeled <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 34 teaspoon black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 12 cups low-fat milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups mushrooms, quartered <NEXT_INGR> 1 12 cups frozen pearl onions, cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large pot, combine the potatoes, rutabaga, parsnips, and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Add enough water to cover by 1 inch and bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce to a simmer and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain well and transfer to a large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the oil, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and mash the mixture until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 425 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the flour in a large skillet over medium heat, and whisk in the milk until no lumps remain. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the mushrooms, pearl onions, carrots, and green beans and cook, stirring frequently, until the mixture is slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the sage, remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon the mushroom mixture into a 9-inch deep-dish pie pan and spoon the mashed potato mixture on top, leaving a 1/2 inch border. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and bake for 15 minutes, or until the topping is lightly browned and the filling is bubbly. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Root Vegetable Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> yellow onion <NEXT_INPUT> green <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> Ro <NEXT_INPUT> low-sodium <NEXT_INPUT> + <NEXT_INPUT> corn <NEXT_INPUT> black beans <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder like McCormick <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> + <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> tortilla chips <NEXT_INPUT> avocado <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 large yellow onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 small green or red bell pepper, diced <NEXT_INGR> 3 cloves garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> coarse salt and fresh black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (11 ounce) Ro-tel diced tomatoes & green chiles <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups low-sodium chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 + 1/4 pounds boneless chicken breasts <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups corn <NEXT_INGR> 1 can black beans, optional <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chili powder like McCormick <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon oregano (preferably Mexican), crushed between fingertips <NEXT_INGR> 1 + 1/2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese or monterey jack, plus more for serving <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sour cream, plus more for serving <NEXT_INGR> tortilla chips, for serving <NEXT_INGR> sliced avocado, for serving, optional <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a medium skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onions, peppers and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until softened, stirring often, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile to your crock-pot add the Ro-tel, chicken broth, chicken, corn, black beans (if using), chile powder, cumin, oregano and 1 teaspoon coarse salt or 1/2 teaspoon fine and about 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Mix in the cooked onions, peppers and garlic. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook on high 3 - 4 hour or low 5 - 6. Remove the chicken breasts to a cutting board. Stir the cheese into the soup. Add the sour cream to a medium bowl and temper it so it doesn't curdle by mixing in a few ladles of the soup broth then mixing it into the soup. <NEXT_INSTR> Shred the chicken or cut into bite-sized pieces and add back to the pot. Taste and season as needed. Cook 1/2 to 1 more hour on low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve garnished with more cheese, sour cream, tortilla chips and avocado. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Slow Cooker Chicken Enchilada Soup  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> n <NEXT_INPUT> crackers <NEXT_INPUT> rasberry lemonade <NEXT_INPUT> condensed milk <NEXT_INPUT> cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 tablespoons melted i can't believe its not butter <NEXT_INGR> 6 packages Sweet 'n Low <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups crushed cinnamon graham crackers <NEXT_INGR> 6 ounces frozen rasberry lemonade, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 14 ounces sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces lite whipped cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> In a bowl, mix together butter, sugar, and grahm cracker crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Put mixture into a pie pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Mash down with bottom of a cup to settle the crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 10 minutes, let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> In a bowl, mix lemonade, milk, and whip cream till smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into cooled pie crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Freeze for 6 hours & serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Frozen Lemonade Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> shallots <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> clam broth <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> linguine <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (15 ounce) can clams, reserve the juice <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 small shallots or 1 small onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons chopped garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup clam broth or 1/2 cup bottled clam juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup dry white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 1/2 lb spinach linguine or 1/2 lb plain linguine <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons soft butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tablespoon parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 - 1/2 teaspoon black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon basil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lemon juice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a heavy skillet, heat the olive oil.Stir in the garlic and cook over moderate heat, stirring constantly, for about 30 seconds. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in the clam broth,wine,garlic,parsley,oregano,basil,pepper,salt and lemon juice and boil briskly over medium high heat for about 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large kettle or soup pot bring the water to a bubbling boil over high heat adding1/2 teaspoon salt.Add the linguine or spaghetti and (if you desire add a 1 teaspoon oil),this will keep the pasta from sticking together.Stir it gently with a wooden spoon for a few moments to prevent from sticking together or to the bottom of the pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil over medium high heat, for 6 minutes or until the pasta is to your liking.I like mine a little harder than most when taken from the pot as it's still cooking.Dump into a large colander, draining the water and stirring as you go, this will separate the linguine.Let drain and cover until ready to plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the soft butter to the pasta before serving. Bring the sauce in the skillet to a boil add the clams. <NEXT_INSTR> Stirring constantly, for 1 or 2 minutes. Then pour the clams and sauce over the spaghetti, sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Taste and season with salt and pepper if needed. Serve at once. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spinach Linguni With White Clam Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fresh peaches <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> mace <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable shortening <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 cups fresh peaches or 6 cups frozen peaches, peeled and sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch mace <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 tablespoons flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter, cut into pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup heavy cream <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup vegetable shortening <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup buttermilk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Butter a 13x9 inch casserole or baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Put peaches in a large bowl, sprinkle with lemon juice; toss to coat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the sugar, spices and 3 1/2 T flour; toss to coat. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour mixture into the prepared pan, spreading evenly. <NEXT_INSTR> Dot with the butter pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle with cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Seat aside. <NEXT_INSTR> NOTE-Last five ingredients listed are for the dough. <NEXT_INSTR> To make the dough, mix the 2 c flour with the baking powder and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut in the shortening. <NEXT_INSTR> Make a well, pour in the buttermilk and mix until well incorporated. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll dough out on a floured surface then place on top of peach mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut four steam vents into the dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 40 minutes at 350 degrees, until bubbly. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon into bowls and serve with ice cream. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Alexander Small'S Peach Cobbler <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beans <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> onion soup <NEXT_INPUT> catsup <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. can beans in barbecue sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. can tomatoes, undrained <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 lb. ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 1 packet onion soup mix <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. catsup <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine beans and tomatoes in 13 x 9-inch baking dish; spread evenly. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine remaining ingredients; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape into about 21 (1 1/2-inch) meat balls. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange in 3 rows down center of filling. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 400° for 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop biscuits by tablespoon into 2 rows between meat balls. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 20 to 25 minutes longer. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Rancho Beef Bake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Avocado <NEXT_INPUT> Lime Juice <NEXT_INPUT> Cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> Avocado Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Radish <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 Avocado <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons Lime Juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon Chopped Cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon Avocado Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tablespoon Garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch Salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 Finely Diced or Grated Radish <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch Ground Harissa Powder <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cut the avocado in half lengthwise and remove the pit. Slice it as thinly as possible and spread the slices on a plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine the lime, oil, garlic, salt, radish, cilantro, and harissa powder together. Whisk to emulsify. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the vinaigrette over the avocado. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cider <NEXT_INPUT> frozen lemonade <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> ginger ale <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 gal. cider <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 oz.) can frozen lemonade <NEXT_INGR> 2 (6 oz.) cans frozen orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 4 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 large can pineapple juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 large ginger ale <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Makes 2 gallons. <NEXT_INSTR> It is good hot. <NEXT_INSTR> I omit the ginger ale. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cider Punch <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shell <NEXT_INPUT> pecans <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> corn syrup <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 unbaked pie shell <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. finely chopped pecans <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. dark corn syrup <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup or 1/2 stick melted butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 325°. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle nuts into bowl with already beaten eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sugar and stir slightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sugar and melted butter and stir just enough until well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into pie shell and bake until firm, approximately 50 to 60 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Georgia'S Pecan Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> Nesquik <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> couple drops <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate chips <INPUT_END> <INGR_START>  4 tbsp flour <NEXT_INGR>  4 tbsp Nesquik <NEXT_INGR>  1 tbsp sugar <NEXT_INGR>  A dash of salt <NEXT_INGR>  1/8 tsp baking powder <NEXT_INGR>  3 tbsp oil - flavorless, preferably canola oil <NEXT_INGR>  3 tbsp milk* <NEXT_INGR>  A couple drops of vanilla <NEXT_INGR>  Optional: chocolate chips, nuts, etc; amount of your choice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1.) Combine all the dry ingredients in a microwave-safe mug until thoroughly mixed. <NEXT_INSTR> 2.) Pour in wet ingredients on the dry ingredients and stir until there are no clumps. <NEXT_INSTR> 3.) Microwave for 1 minute and 20 seconds in a 1000 watt microwave.** <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Footnotes: <NEXT_INSTR> * Since I don't drink regular milk, I used soymilk. I prefer it to regular milk since I was lactose intolerant until I was a teenager. Since soymilk has protein, I think it adds body to the brownie since this recipe doesn't use eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> ** Microwave times may vary according to your own microwave. Microwave your brownie in increments at first try to make sure you don't overcook/undercook your brownie. <NEXT_INSTR> --- <NEXT_INSTR> The less you microwave it, the gooier the brownie. You can even eat the batter itself! Don't worry; the batter has no eggs! <NEXT_INSTR> If you add more baking powder, the fluffier the brownie is. The less baking powder, it will rise less. I haven't tried this, but some mug brownie recipes opt out the baking powder to make their brownie gooier. You can try experimenting to your preferences especially if you don't have/want to buy baking powder. (Personally, I keep the baking powder and just microwave my brownie for less time if I want a gooey brownie.) <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Microwave Mug Brownie (With Nesquik!)  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> water <NEXT_INPUT> Parkay margarine <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> pecan halves <NEXT_INPUT> pastry shell <NEXT_INPUT> caramels <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. Parkay margarine <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. pecan halves <NEXT_INGR> 9-inch unbaked pastry shell <NEXT_INGR> 36 Kraft caramels <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt caramels with water and margarine in covered double boiler or in a saucepan over low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir occasionally until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine sugar, salt, vanilla and eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add caramel sauce; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in pecan halves. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into pastry shell; bake at 350° for 45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pie filling will appear to be very soft, but becomes firm as it cools. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Caramel Pecan Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Egg Beaters <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flax seed <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup Egg Beaters egg substitute <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar-free syrup <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups flax seed meal <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking soda <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Spray 12 muffin cups with Pam. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake @ 350 for ~40 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> 90 cals/muffin. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Flax Muffins <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> white bread <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> dry mustard <NEXT_INPUT> sausage <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 6 slices white bread, cubed (do not cut off crusts <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. shredded Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. dry mustard (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. mild sausage <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown crumbled sausage. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain and cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix other ingredients in large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sausage and pour into a 9 x 13-inch buttered baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle some of the cheese on top. Refrigerate overnight and bake in oven at 350° for 45 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sausage And Egg Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> loaf <NEXT_INPUT> beer <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> bread flour <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> aged sharp <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> bread machine yeast <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 pound loaf <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups beer <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/4 cups bread flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup buttermilk, powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup shredded aged sharp cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 teaspoons bread machine yeast or 1 1/4 teaspoons rapid rise yeast <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add ingredients into baking pan in the order recommended by the manufacturer. <NEXT_INSTR> Insert pan into the oven chamber. <NEXT_INSTR> Select Sweet Cycle. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove bread from oven when baking cycle complete; cool on wire rack. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve the day it is made. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cheddar Beer Bread (Bread Machine) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Sausage <NEXT_INPUT> Mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> Walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> Chicken Broth <NEXT_INPUT> Red Pepper <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> One med bag of stuffing of choice. <NEXT_INGR> One pkg of Jimmy Jones Hot Sausage. <NEXT_INGR> One large Vidalia or Yellow Onion. Chopped Fine <NEXT_INGR> Two Small Boxes of Rasins. <NEXT_INGR> One small Pack of Portebello Mushrooms, Whole or Sliced. <NEXT_INGR> One Small Bag of Thinly Sliced Almonds or Walnuts. <NEXT_INGR> One Can of Chicken Broth. <NEXT_INGR> 1 Teaspoon of Crushed Red Pepper. <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a frying pan brown sausage and drain fat. In a large mixing bowl, thourghly mix all ingredients. Hint, if you plan to bake then garnish top with almonds. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> dry mustard <NEXT_INPUT> bread <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sausage <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 eggs, beaten well <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. dry mustard <NEXT_INGR> 6 slices day old bread, crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. sharp Cheddar cheese, grated <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 lb. sausage, drained well <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix and pour into well-greased 9 x 13-inch pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate 12 hours or overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 40 minutes at 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve hot. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Breakfast Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> quartered cherry tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> cucumbers <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> serrano chile peppers <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 cup quartered cherry tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 finely chopped cucumbers <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped red onion <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp chopped fresh cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 to 3 teaspoons finely chopped serrano chile peppers <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a medium bowl combine all ingredients; toss to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Season to taste with additional lime juice and salt, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes about 4 cups. <NEXT_INSTR> *This recipe brought to you courtesy of Better Homes And Gardens Magazine. <NEXT_INSTR> * <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cherry Tomato And Cucumber Pico De Gallo <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cider vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup cider vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups sugar, divided <NEXT_INGR> 4 teaspoons cinnamon, divided <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups all-purpose flour, sifted <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup shortening <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons butter or 4 tablespoons margarine, divided <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine vinegar, water, 1 cup sugar and 2 teaspoons cinnamon. Stir over low heat until sugar disolves. Cook over medium heat for 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, mix and sift flour, baking powder and salt. Cut in shortening; stir in milk with fork until soft dough forms. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll out into a rectangle about 1/4-inch thick. Combine remaining sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over surface of rectangle. Dot with 2 tablespoons butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll up, starting at longer side. Cut crosswise into slices 1 1/4 inches thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Place slices, cut side up, close togather in deep baking dish. Dot with remaining butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour hot vinegar mixture over all. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve hot with heavy cream. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Old-Fashioned Vinegar Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla flavoring <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla wafers <NEXT_INPUT> bananas <NEXT_INPUT> egg whites <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. vanilla flavoring <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> vanilla wafers <NEXT_INGR> sliced bananas <NEXT_INGR> 3 egg whites, beaten <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix milk, sugar, eggs, vanilla flavoring and flour together. Cook in top of double boiler on low heat, stirring to keep from sticking, until it gets thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Put layer of vanilla wafers in bottom of 2-quart Pyrex dish and then a layer of sliced bananas. Pour half of pudding over this. <NEXT_INSTR> Make another layer of wafers and bananas, then pudding. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat egg whites and put meringue on top. Bake at 350° until brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Pudding <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> whole wheat flour <NEXT_INPUT> flax seed <NEXT_INPUT> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> very warm water <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> nonstick cooking spray <NEXT_INPUT> cornmeal <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons flax seed meal <NEXT_INGR> quick-rising yeast <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup very warm water <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons honey <NEXT_INGR> nonstick cooking spray <NEXT_INGR> cornmeal <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a medium bowl, combine flours, flax meal, yeast and salt. Mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Measure warm water in a measuring cup, stir in olive oil and honey. Pour mixture over dry ingredients and mix using a wooden spoon to form a ball. Turn dough onto lightly floured surface, knead for 2 minutes. Spray another bowl with nonstick spray and place dough inside. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until double in size, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, spray a 12-inch cookie sheet with nonstick spray and dust with cornmeal. <NEXT_INSTR> When dough has risen, turn out onto a lightly floured surface and, using a rolling pin, roll dough into a 12 inch circle. Transfer dough to prepared pizza pan. Top with pizza toppings and bake for 15 minutes in a 425* oven. Or, prick crust with a fork and baked untopped for 6 minutes. Remove crust from oven, top with pizza toppings and bake for an additional 8-10 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Whole-Wheat, Flax And Honey Pizza Dough <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> toasted white bread <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 (28 ounce) canscrushed tomatoes with juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup brown sugar, packed <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons dry mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups toasted white bread cubes <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> fresh parsley sprig (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Grease a 3-quart baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> In a bowl, combine tomatoes, sugar, paste, mustard, soda, and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Place bread cubes in the baking dish; drizzle with melted butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour tomato mixture over bread. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate up to 4 hours, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375 for 35 to 40 minutes, or until hot and bubbly. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with fresh parsley sprigs, if desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 8 to 10. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tomato Pudding <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lime <NEXT_INPUT> mint <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> white rum <NEXT_INPUT> Seltzer <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lime, cut into 16 pieces, plus more for garnish <NEXT_INGR> 16 fresh mint leaves, plus sprigs for garnish <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons superfine sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup white rum <NEXT_INGR> Seltzer water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Divide the lime pieces, mint leaves, and sugar evenly among 2 (12-ounce) glasses. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a muddler, mash the lime pieces and bruise the mint leaves while dissolving the sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Add enough chipped ice to each glass to fill. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 4 ounces of rum to each glass, then use a cocktail shaker to combine and thoroughly chill each drink separately. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the contents of the shaker back into the glasses and top each drink with a splash of the seltzer water. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish the glasses with lime and mint sprigs. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Traditional Mojito <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cabbage chinese <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> onions green <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> ginger root <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 cups cabbage chinese, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 8 1/4 ounces pineapple crushed, drained <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces water chestnuts sliced, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup parsley leaves fresh, snipped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup onions green, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup mayonnaise reduced calorie <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon prepared mustard prepared <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ginger root grated <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine cabbage, pineapple, water chestnuts, parsley, and onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and chill. <NEXT_INSTR> For dressing, combine mayonnaise, mustard, and gingerroot. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and chill. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon dressing over the cabbage mixture; toss to coat. <NEXT_INSTR> PER SERVING: 57 cal., 1g pro., 9g carbo., 2g fat, 0mg chol., 80mg sodium. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Crunchy Chinese Coleslaw <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> hoisin sauce <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ginger <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> pork tenderloin <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> Ginger Sauce <NEXT_INPUT> hoisin sauce <NEXT_INPUT> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ginger <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> Fresh ground pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 slices (each 1/2 inch thick) fresh pineapple <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons dark hoisin sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons grated peeled fresh ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 pounds pork tenderloin, trimmed <NEXT_INGR> Coarse salt and fresh ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> Quick Ginger Sauce (recipe below), for serving <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons dark hoisin sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons pineapple juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons grated peeled fresh ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> Fresh ground pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat the broiler. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the pineapple slices on a foil-lined baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, combine the hoisin sauce, ginger, garlic, and mustard. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the pork on a broiler pan fitted with a rack. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush with the hoisin mixture; season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the pork in the broiler, about 4 inches from the heat; place the pineapple in the oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Broil the pork until it registers 155F on an instant-read thermometer, 15 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from the broiler (let rest at least 10 minutes before slicing; the temperature will rise to 160F as the pork sits). <NEXT_INSTR> Turn the pineapple slices; cook until browned in spots, about 10 minutes more. <NEXT_INSTR> Halve the pineapple slices; arrange on a platter with the sliced pork. <NEXT_INSTR> Drizzle the pork with the pan juices; season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with the quick ginger sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, stir together the hoisin sauce, pineapple juice, ginger, and soy sauce; season with pepper. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Glazed Pork Tenderloin with Pineapple <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cauliflower <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> romano cheese <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> baking mix <NEXT_INPUT> oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 head cauliflower <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup romano cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch salt <NEXT_INGR> pepper, to taste <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup baking mix <NEXT_INGR> oil (for frying) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Clean and chop 1 head cauliflower. <NEXT_INSTR> About 1/4 inch pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Steam 8-10 miuntes. <NEXT_INSTR> or until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix together egg, cheese, salt, pepper, milk and enough baking mix to make a dough (simular to a soft cookie dough). <NEXT_INSTR> Add cauliflower and let the mixture sit for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> The batter will thincken while it sits. <NEXT_INSTR> You will want it to holds it shape on a spoon. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop batter by tablespoon fuls into hot oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Deep fry until brown (the color of fried chicken) <NEXT_INSTR> These can be fried and then frozen. <NEXT_INSTR> I heat them up in the oven for about 5 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cauliflower Fritters <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallows <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> fruit cocktail <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. coconut <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. miniature marshmallows <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. fruit cocktail <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sour cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend together well and chill. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> 5-Cup Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cranberry juice cocktail <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice from <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> orange soda <NEXT_INPUT> orange-flavored liqueur <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 - (32 oz) bottles cranberry juice cocktail, chilled <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c Real lemon juice from concentrate <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 c sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 - (12 oz) cans orange soda, chilled <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c orange-flavored liqueur, optional <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In large punch bowl, cranberry juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Real lemon and sugar; stir until sugar dissolves. <NEXT_INSTR> Just before serving, add orange soda, liqueurs if desired and ice. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish as desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes about 3 1/2 quarts. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cranberry Orange Punch <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tuna <NEXT_INPUT> Soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> Gochujang <NEXT_INPUT> Sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> sesame seeds <NEXT_INPUT> much <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> Rice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 200 grams Sashimi-grade tuna (saku or sashimi) <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp Soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp Gochujang <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp Sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp Roasted sesame seeds <NEXT_INGR> 1 as much as you want Chopped scallions <NEXT_INGR> 1 one for each serving Soft-poached egg or fresh egg yolk <NEXT_INGR> 3 bowls Rice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put in a bowl and mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut tuna into 5 mm-1 cm blocks. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the tuna into the [1] bowl and mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover the tuna from Step [3] with plastic wrap for 15-30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> When rice is cooked, put the tuna on bowlful of rice, with some chopped scallion. <NEXT_INSTR> Make a shallow well in the center to position the egg. <NEXT_INSTR> Done! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tuna Yukhoe Rice Bowl <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> frozen peas <NEXT_INPUT> turkey tails <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (16 ounce) bag frozen peas <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons turkey tails, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Toss the turkey tail into a cast iron skillet on medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Let the turkey tail cook down, longer if you want it crunchy like bacon bites or less if you want your bits a bit chewy. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chopped onion. <NEXT_INSTR> Add bag of frozen peas and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Green Peas With (Fake) Bacon and Onions <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, separated <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. chocolate <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring to a boil the milk and butter. <NEXT_INSTR> In separate bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, salt, chocolate, egg yolks and enough milk to make moist. <NEXT_INSTR> When milk mixture boils, add dry ingredients and stir. <NEXT_INSTR> When thick, pour in vanilla and pour into baked pie shell. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with meringue. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> aged Gouda <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> currants <NEXT_INPUT> whole-milk <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> walnut oil <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> green cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> fresh parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup walnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, finely grated <NEXT_INGR> 2 ounces aged Gouda, finely grated <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon za'atar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup dried currants <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup whole-milk plain Greek yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon walnut oil or olive oil <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt, freshly ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 small green cabbage, outer leaves removed, very thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound young carrots, shaved lengthwise <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup coarsely chopped fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> Za'atar (for serving) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°F. Toast walnuts on a rimmed baking sheet, tossing once, until golden brown, 8-10 minutes. Let cool. Process walnuts, garlic, cheese, and za'atar in a food processor until nuts are coarsely chopped. With motor running, stream in oil; process until coarsely ground. Season with salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Pesto can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill. <NEXT_INSTR> Place currants in a small bowl and cover with very hot water. Let sit until soft and plump, 5-10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, whisk yogurt, lemon juice, and oil in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper. Thin with water until dressing is consistency of heavy cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain currants and add to dressing along with cabbage, carrots, and parsley; toss to coat. Season with salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Swipe walnut pesto on a platter and arrange slaw over; sprinkle with za'atar. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cabbage And Carrot Slaw With Walnut-Za'Atar Pesto  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar snap peas <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Dressing <NEXT_INPUT> boneless beef sirloin steak <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> Peanuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/4 lb. spaghetti, broken in half, uncooked <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cups sugar snap peas <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup red pepper strips <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup KRAFT Sweet Honey CATALINA Dressing <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb. boneless beef sirloin steak, well trimmed, cut into thin strips Whole Foods 1 lb For $7.99 thru 02/09 <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. creamy peanut butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. lite soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 green onions, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped PLANTERS Dry Roasted Peanuts Rite Aid Buy 1 Get 1 Free thru 02/06 <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook spaghetti in large saucepan as directed on package, adding peas and peppers to the boiling water for the last 2 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, heat dressing in large skillet on medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add meat; stir-fry 3 to 4 min. <NEXT_INSTR> or until done. <NEXT_INSTR> Add peanut butter and soy sauce; stir-fry 1 min. <NEXT_INSTR> or until sauce is thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain spaghetti mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to meat mixture along with the onions; mix lightly. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with nuts. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> 30-Minute Asian Beef & Noodles for Two <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> active dry yeast <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> warm water <NEXT_INPUT> bread flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> Italian sausage <NEXT_INPUT> yellow onion <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> fresh oregano <NEXT_INPUT> ricotta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> dusting <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tsp. active dry yeast <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup warm water (110°F) <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups bread flour, plus more as needed <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 6 Tbs. olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 7 oz. mild Italian sausage <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 yellow onion, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 large red bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. minced fresh oregano <NEXT_INGR> 3 oz. ricotta cheese <NEXT_INGR> 12 oz. mozzarella cheese, grated <NEXT_INGR> 6 Tbs. tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> Semolina flour for dusting <NEXT_INGR> 6 Tbs. grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a small bowl, stir together the yeast, sugar and warm water. Let stand for 5 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine in food processor, 2 C bread flour, salt and yeast mixture. Slowly drizzle in 1 T. of olive oil and process for about 3 min. The dough should come together into a large ball and pull away from the sides of the bowl; <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the dough to a bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let stand at room temp until the dough is doubled in size, about 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Place a pizza stone on middle rack of an oven and preheat to 500°F. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> In a 10" fry pan over med heat, warm 1 T olive oil. Add sausage, and cook until browned, about 8 min. Drain on paper towels. <NEXT_INSTR> Wipe out the pan, set over med heat and warm 1 T olive oil. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 min, then add bell pepper and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the veggies are tender and beginning to brown, about 15 min. Transfer veggies to large bowl, add sausage, oregano, ricotta, mozzarella and tomato sauce, stir to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> Punch down the dough, divide it into 6 equal pieces. Roll each into a ball. Using extra bread flour if the dough is too sticky, roll out 1 ball of dough into an 8" round; use the open calzone mold as a guide (the dough round should be about 1/2" wider than mold). Place dough on the mold. Place 1/3 C filling on one side of the dough, then close the mold, pressing the dough down firmly. Gently remove the calzone from the mold, place on a baking sheet dusted with semolina flour and refrigerate. Repeat to make 5 more calzones. Brush the top of each calzone with 1/2 T olive oil, then dust each with 1 T Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer 3 calzones to a pizza peel dusted with semolina flour,bake for 10 to 12 min @ 500F. Remove the calzones from the oven and let cool for 5 min before serving. Repeat with the remaining calzones. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sausage And Red Pepper Calzones  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> aubergine <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> walla walla <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste/tomato puree <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> kosher <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> ground coriander <NEXT_INPUT> turmeric <NEXT_INPUT> coriander leaves <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> I <NEXT_INPUT> cauliflower <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 eggplant/aubergine (about 1 1/4 Ib/570 g), halved lengthwise <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup (135 g) finely minced walla walla or other sweet onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp minced ginger <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup (145 g) finely chopped plum tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp tomato paste/tomato puree <NEXT_INGR> 2 to 3 tsp chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp kosher or sea salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp ground coriander <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp turmeric <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp finely minced cilantro/fresh coriander leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup/60 ml water <NEXT_INGR> I tbsp low-fat plain yogurt <NEXT_INGR> Roasted cauliflower, crudites, baked pita chips, crostini, bruschetta, baked potato chips <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 500F/260C/gas Arrange the eggplant/aubergine halves, flesh-side down, on a rimmed baking sheet/tray. <NEXT_INSTR> Roast until very soft and tender when the flesh is pierced with a fork, 15 to 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside to cool for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a paring knife, peel back the skin and discard. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the cooked flesh to a cutting board and finely chop. <NEXT_INSTR> In a 10-in (25-cm) frying pan, preferably nonstick, heat the oil over medium heat and swirl to coat the pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onion and saute until soft but not brown, 5 to 7 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the garlic and ginger and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the tomatoes and tomato paste/tomato puree. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute, stirring frequently, until the tomatoes soften, about 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the chili powder, salt, cumin, coriander, and turmeric. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute to incorporate the spices, 1 minute longer. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the roasted eggplant/aubergine and saute, stirring constantly, until the mixture is well combined, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Adjust the heat to medium-low and gently stir in 1 tbsp of the cilantro/fresh coriander and the water and yogurt. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over low heat until slightly thickened and a good dipping consistency, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a serving bowl, garnish with the remaining 1 tbsp cilantro/fresh coriander, and serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Indian Tomato-Eggplant Dip <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Peg corn <NEXT_INPUT> green beans <NEXT_INPUT> peas <NEXT_INPUT> bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> distilled vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 can Shoe Peg corn <NEXT_INGR> 1 can French-style green beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 can small English peas <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped bell pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped celery <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 slice chopped onion (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. distilled vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Marinate vegetables. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat sugar, vinegar and oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat and pour over vegetables (not boiling). <NEXT_INSTR> Salt and pepper to taste. Let set overnight in refrigerator before eating. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Marinade Vegetables <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Olive Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Allspice <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Maple Syrup <NEXT_INPUT> Ground Black Pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 whole Sweet Potatoes - Med <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Ice Cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Olive Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 whole Granny Smith Apple (abt. 1 C), Peeled & Cut Into 1/2" Chunks <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoons Allspice <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoons Sea Salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Real Maple Syrup <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoons Ground Black Pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Scrub and boil whole sweet potatoes for about 20-25 minutes. Drain water and add ice cubes and 2 cups cold water. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool potatoes for 5 minutes or so. Drain and peel potatoes. Slice into chunks (about 3/4"). <NEXT_INSTR> Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add apple, sprinkle with allspice and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Saute for 3 minutes, stirring frequently, and then cover with a lid to steam for 2 more minutes. Add potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir together maple syrup and 1 T water-pour over apples and potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Lower heat, cover and cook on low for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove lid, stir briefly and top with pepper. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet Potato-Apple Stir Fry <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> crust <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 baked crust (9-inch) <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. cooked and mashed sweet potatoes <NEXT_INGR> 3 egg yolks, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb. butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. evaporated milk or cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all together and cook over medium heat until thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir at all times. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with meringue. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sweet Potato Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> head broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> mushroom <NEXT_INPUT> egg substitute <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> low-fat swiss cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 large head broccoli <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup mushroom, canned <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup egg substitute <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup fat-free half-and-half <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup skim milk <NEXT_INGR> 3 ounces low-fat swiss cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400*F. <NEXT_INSTR> Steam and chop broccoli. <NEXT_INSTR> Add broccoli and mushrooms to cake pan sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix egg substitute with half and half and skim milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour egg mixture over broccoli. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in 400*F oven approximately 40 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Broccoli Quiche <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> sandwich rolls <NEXT_INPUT> red peppers <NEXT_INPUT> arugula <NEXT_INPUT> salami <NEXT_INPUT> provolone cheese <NEXT_INPUT> pepperoncini peppers <NEXT_INPUT> black olives <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (14 ounce) can marinated artichoke hearts, drained <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, peeled <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 (6 inch) French sandwich rolls <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup sliced roasted red peppers <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups arugula leaves or spring mix <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces thinly sliced hard salami <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces thinly sliced provolone cheese <NEXT_INGR> 4 pepperoncini peppers, drained and chopped (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup sliced black olives (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a food processor or blender, combine the artichoke hearts, garlic and olive oil. Process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice the sandwich rolls in half lengthwise, and pull out most of the soft bread from the top and bottom. Spread the artichoke paste onto each side of each roll. Place layers of red peppers, arugula, salami, provolone cheese, pepperoncini, olives and onion into the rolls. Press sandwiches together, and wrap tightly in aluminum foil. <NEXT_INSTR> Place sandwiches in the refrigerator, and place something heavy on top. It helps to place a plate on top, then place cans or any weighted containers on top. I used cottage cheese. Chill for up to 3 hours. Unwrap, cut in half and enjoy. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Italian Heroes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> whole wheat flour <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> banana <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> sunflower seeds <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 c. whole wheat flour <NEXT_INGR> 5 Tbsp. dry powdered milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg or egg substitute <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. honey <NEXT_INGR> 1 large soft banana <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. peanut butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sunflower seeds <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients together except sunflower seeds. <NEXT_INSTR> Add seeds after everything is mixed well. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop on cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 10 minutes at 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Don't overcook. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Banana Peanut Butter Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> portabella mushroom <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> pasta shell <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb portabella mushroom, stems removed, caps halved and then cut into 1/4-inch slices <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup white wine <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon minced garlic (from a jar works) <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups chicken broth (preferably low-sodium) <NEXT_INGR> 5 1/2 ounces pepper boursin cheese (garlic and herb also works if pepper is unavailable) <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb asparagus (broccoli or sugar snap peas are also good choices) <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 lb medium pasta shell <NEXT_INGR> grated parmesan cheese, to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Snap the tough ends off the asparagus and discard them. Cut the spears into 1/2 inch pieces. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter with the oil over medium heat in a large frying pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally until the mushrooms are tender and well browned, about 6 minutes. Add salt, pepper and garlic. Stir and reduce heat to medium/medium low. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat chicken broth. Once lightly boiling, add in Boursin cheese and white wine, stirring with a fork to help melt cheese. Lower heat and simmer to thicken. If not using pepper Boursin, add 1/4 tsp black pepper. Once the cheese is fully incorporated to the liquids, add sauce to mushrooms, stir and simmer. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook the pasta until almost done, about 6 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the asparagus and cook until it and the pasta are just done, about 3-4 minutes longer. (If using broccoli add with 2 minutes left to go, snap peas about 1 1/2 min). <NEXT_INSTR> Drain the pasta. Toss with the mushrooms and sauce. Season to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with Parmesan cheese on side. Enjoy! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pasta Shells With Portabella Mushrooms And Boursin Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg shells Marsala <NEXT_INPUT> strawberries <NEXT_INPUT> egg <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 egg yolks <NEXT_INGR> 6 half eggshells superfine (caster) sugar <NEXT_INGR> 6 half egg shells Marsala <NEXT_INGR> 10 oz. small strawberries <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg white <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In the top of a double boiler, whisk the egg yolks with the sugar until frothy. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the Marsala. <NEXT_INSTR> Place over gently simmering water and whisk until mixture is very thick and double in volume. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat and while beating, let cool completely. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the egg white until stiff and fold into the zabaglione. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Zabaione Con Le Fragale(Zabaglione With Strawberries)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg white <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> Chinese rice <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> cod <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable <NEXT_INPUT> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable <NEXT_INPUT> yellow squash <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> white rice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon egg white, lightly beaten (see note) <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons Chinese rice wine or sake <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound cod or other firm white-fleshed fish such as halibut, sliced 1/4 inch thick <NEXT_INGR> 6 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon vegetable, canola, or peanut oil <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons homemade chicken stock or store-bought low-sodium broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium clove garlic, finely minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon vegetable, canola, or peanut oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 pound yellow squash, sliced 1/8 inch thick <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 pound asparagus, ends trimmed and cut into 1/2-inch lengths <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> Cooked white rice, for serving <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a small bowl, thoroughly combine egg white, cornstarch, rice wine, and salt. Place cod in a bowl and pour cornstarch mixture on top, tossing gently to coat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Fill a wok with the water, bring to a boil, and add oil. Add cod and cook, stirring with chopsticks or a strainer, until opaque outside and still raw within, about 30 seconds. Gently drain cod in a colander and gently shake to remove excess water. Wipe wok clean and dry. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, combine chicken stock, garlic, sesame oil, and cornstarch and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat vegetable oil in wok over high heat until smoking. Add squash and asparagus and stir-fry for 30 seconds. <NEXT_INSTR> Add cod and continue to cook, turning gently to avoid breaking up the fish, for 1 minute. Add sauce, season with salt, and cook, stirring gently, until the sauce thickens and coats fish and vegetables. Transfer to a platter and serve with white rice. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Stir-Fried Cod With Yellow Squash And Asparagus Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> back ribs <NEXT_INPUT> applewood seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> bourbon <NEXT_INPUT> bbq sauce <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 slab baby back ribs <NEXT_INGR> 3 tbsp applewood seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup bourbon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup bbq sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp vegetable oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cut ribs in half. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool ribs down. <NEXT_INSTR> Put 1 tablespoon of oil on ribs. <NEXT_INSTR> Season. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill for a few minutes to mark the ribs. <NEXT_INSTR> Tear two sheets of foil about 10 inches long. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold sides of foil to create a pocket. <NEXT_INSTR> Add half the bourbon to each pocket. <NEXT_INSTR> Put ribs on top. <NEXT_INSTR> Close pockets. <NEXT_INSTR> Roast at 300 for approximately 3 hours or until ribs are nearly falling off the bone. <NEXT_INSTR> Variations; Citrus zest, wine, mustard, vinegar <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bourbon Braised Baby Back Ribs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> head <NEXT_INPUT> Chicken <NEXT_INPUT> Black Beans <NEXT_INPUT> Kernels <NEXT_INPUT> Red Pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Tomato <NEXT_INPUT> Red Onion <NEXT_INPUT> Avocado <NEXT_INPUT> Cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> Dressing <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 head (Small Head) Romaine Lettuce, Torn Into Pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 heads Iceberg Lettuce, Torn Into Pieces <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups Cooked Chicken, Cubed <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Canned Black Beans, Drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Corn Kernels <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Diced Red Pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Tomato, Diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Red Onion, Small Sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Avocado, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Cilantro, Torn <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Taco Seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Light Ranch Dressing <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Divide lettuce between four plates. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground round <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> sprouts <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lb ground round <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cup uncooked rice (instant) <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion (chopped) <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 packages frozen brussels sprouts <NEXT_INGR> 2 can tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp dried thyme <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large bowl, combine the first 6 ingredients and well. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape a scant 1/4 cupful around each frozen brussels sprout to form a meatball <NEXT_INSTR> Place in an ungreased 15 in. <NEXT_INSTR> x 10 in. <NEXT_INSTR> x 1in. <NEXT_INSTR> baking dish <NEXT_INSTR> Combine tomato sauce,water and thyme <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over meatballs <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and bake at 350 for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until no pink remains. <NEXT_INSTR> Voila.. enjoy <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Inside-Out Brussels Sprouts <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> creme fraiche <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> fresh parsley <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 426 g mackerel in brine, drained (15 oz) <NEXT_INGR> 25 g butter, softened (1 oz) <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons creme fraiche <NEXT_INGR> 1 lemon, zest and juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> salt & freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 150 g sliced mushrooms, drained (6 oz) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Remove the skin and bones from the mackerel. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the mackerel, butter and creme fraiche into a food processor, process until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the lemon zest and juice, parsley, Worcestershire sauce and salt and pepper to taste. Mix well. Stir in the mushrooms and place mixture into a serving dish. Chill well. <NEXT_INSTR> Alternatively serve in ramekins and top with melted butter. Garnish with lemon and parsley. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mackerel And Mushroom Paté <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Topping <NEXT_INPUT> white sandwich bread <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> Beans <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> green beans <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> white button mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> heavy cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Topping <NEXT_INGR> 4 slices white sandwich bread, each slice torn into quarters <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbs unsalted butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp table salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups canned fried onions (about 6 oz) <NEXT_INGR> Beans and Sauce <NEXT_INGR> Table salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 lbs green beans, ends trimmed and halved <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbs unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb white button mushrooms, stems trimmed, wiped clean and broken into 1/2-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 3 medium garlic cloves, minced or pressed through garlic press <NEXT_INGR> Ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbs unbleached all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups low sodium chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups heavy cream <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1. For the Topping: Pulse bread, butter, salt and pepper in a food processor until mixture resembles coarse crumbs, about ten 1-second pulses. Transfer to a large bowl and toss with onions; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> 2. For the Beans and Sauce: Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 425°. Fill large bowl with ice water. Bring 4 quarts water to boil in a large Dutch oven. Add 2 Tbs salt and beans. Cook beans until bright green and crisp-tender, about 6 minutes. Drain beans into colander and plunge immediately into ice water to stop cooking. Spread beans on paper-towel-lined baking sheet to drain. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> 3. Add butter to now-empty Dutch oven and melt over medium-high heat until foaming subsides. Add mushrooms, garlic, 3/4 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp pepper; cook until mushrooms release moisture and liquid evaporates, about 6 minutes. Add flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in broth and bring to simmer, stirring constantly. Add cream, reduce heat to medium, and simmer until sauce is thickened and reduced to 3 1/2 cups, about 12 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> 4. Add green beans to sauce and stir until evenly coated. Arrange in even layer in 3-quart (or 13 by 9-inch) baking dish. Sprinkle with topping and bake until top is golden brown and sauce is bubbling around edge, about 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Classic Green Bean Casserole  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> coriander fresh <NEXT_INPUT> ginger grated <NEXT_INPUT> rum <NEXT_INPUT> molasses <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 pounds shrimp peeled, deveined <NEXT_INGR> 1 x sugar from cane <NEXT_INGR> 3 each mangos seeded and diced <NEXT_INGR> 6 each limes zest julienned <NEXT_INGR> 1 bunch coriander fresh <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ginger grated <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon rum <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon molasses <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Rub shrimp with Caribbean seasoning and skewer. <NEXT_INSTR> Let sit for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel sugar cane and slice on the bias razor thin. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare a wood or charcoal fire and let it burn down to embers. <NEXT_INSTR> In a mixing bowl combine lime zest, mango, coriander and ginger. <NEXT_INSTR> Add half of the reserved lime juice and the molasses and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the sugar cane and let rest for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove sugar cane from marinade and grill 1 minute on both sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill shrimp 2 minutes on each side. <NEXT_INSTR> Place shrimp on sugar cane and drizzle with marinade. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Skewered Shrimp <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pork chops <NEXT_INPUT> Marinade <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> white vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> swiss cheese <NEXT_INPUT> dill pickle <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 boneless pork chops <NEXT_INGR> Marinade <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons white vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons oregano <NEXT_INGR> 5 garlic cloves (minced) <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> thinly sliced ham (can use spicy italian ham too) <NEXT_INGR> swiss cheese (thinly sliced) <NEXT_INGR> dill pickle <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Butterfly the pork pieces and pound to 1/4 inch thin. (Do this between plastic wrap to keep splatter down). <NEXT_INSTR> Mix Marinade (oil, vinegar, oregano, garlic and salt). The longer you can marinade the meat the better! <NEXT_INSTR> Take pork out and open it wide. Layer Ham, Swiss Cheese and pickles. Close the pork 'sandwich'. <NEXT_INSTR> Now you can either grill this or pan fry. I suggest grilled over charcoal! <NEXT_INSTR> Enjoy! Serve with green chili refried beans for a delish meal! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pork -Cuban Sandwich- Without The Bread!! <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> pickle relish <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> dash of pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. mustard <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. pickle relish <NEXT_INGR> dash paprika <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Boil eggs quickly covered. <NEXT_INSTR> Let eggs stand in hot water off stove for 15 minutes, <NEXT_INSTR> Then run cold water over the eggs to cool them down. <NEXT_INSTR> Peel the eggs and cut lengthwise in half. <NEXT_INSTR> Scoop out yolk into a small bowl and mash with fork adding mayonnaise, salt, mustard, pepper, relish. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Put some mixture into the center of each egg half and sprinkle with paprika. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Deviled Eggs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vanilla wafers <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> apricot preserves <NEXT_INPUT> ricotta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> apricots <NEXT_INPUT> whipping cream <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1-1/2 cups (350 ml) crushed vanilla wafers (about 45 cookies) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup (60 ml) butter or margarine, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup (80 ml) apricot preserves <NEXT_INGR> 1 carton (15 oz (420 grm).) ricotta cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup (125 ml) sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp (5 ml) vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 3 squares (1 oz (28 grm). each) semisweet baking chocolate, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup (125 ml) finely chopped toasted almonds <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup (60 ml) chopped dried apricots <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup (225 ml) whipping cream, whipped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup (60 ml) slivered almonds, toasted <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the wafer crumbs and butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Press onto the bottom and up the sides of an ungreased 9 inch pie plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375 degrees (200 C.) for 6-8 minutes or until the crust is lightly browned; cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread preserves over crust. <NEXT_INSTR> In a mixing bowl, beat ricotta, sugar and vanilla until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in chocolate, chopped almonds and apricots. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold in whipped cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon into the crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with slivered almonds. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate overnight. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Ricotta Nut Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> beef stew meat <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> nonalcoholic <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> noodles <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 bacon strips, diced <NEXT_INGR> 2 pounds beef stew meat, cut into 1-inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, cut into wedges <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (12 ounces) beer or nonalcoholic beer <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dried thyme <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup water <NEXT_INGR> Hot cooked noodles <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove to paper towels; drain, discarding drippings. Sprinkle beef with pepper and salt. In the same skillet, brown beef in oil in batches; drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a 5-qt. slow cooker. Add the bacon, onion, garlic and bay leaf. In a small bowl, combine the beer, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce and thyme. Pour over beef mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook on low for 5-1/2 to 6 hours or until meat is tender. <NEXT_INSTR> In a small bowl, combine flour and water until smooth. Gradually stir into slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for 30 minutes or until thickened. Discard bay leaf. Serve beef with noodles. Freeze option: After discarding bay leaf, freeze cooled stew in freezer containers. To use, partially thaw in refrigerator overnight. Heat through in a saucepan, stirring occasionally and adding a little broth or water if necessary. Serve with noodles. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Beer-Braised Beef <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Cucumber <NEXT_INPUT> Bell Peppers <NEXT_INPUT> Cherry <NEXT_INPUT> Water <NEXT_INPUT> Avocado Oil <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Quinoa <NEXT_INPUT> Chicken <NEXT_INPUT> Lemon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 whole Cucumber, Chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 whole Bell Peppers, Chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups Cherry Or Grape Tomatoes, Halved <NEXT_INGR> 10 whole Artichoke Hearts In Water, Squeezed And Chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 ounce, weight Feta <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Avocado Oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash Garlic Salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash Pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Cooked Quinoa <NEXT_INGR> 12 ounces, weight Grilled Chicken, Chopped (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tablespoon Lemon <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Chop all veggies and combine with the rest of the ingredients in a large bowl. Store in the refrigerator up to 5 days. <NEXT_INSTR> Notes: <NEXT_INSTR> 1. You can substitute another meat or fish for the chicken. <NEXT_INSTR> 2. To make vegetarian, replace chicken with firm tofu. For vegans, replace the quinoa with firm tofu, replace feta with walnuts, and add 1 tablespoon vegan Parmesan cheese or nutritional yeast. If grain-free, omit the quinoa. For paleo, omit quinoa and substitute walnuts for feta. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chop Chop Mediterranean Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pastry <NEXT_INPUT> sweet potato <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> condensed milk <NEXT_INPUT> orange-flavored liqueur <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 9 inches unbaked pastry shells <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb sweet potato, peeled and cooked <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup margarine or 1/2 cup butter, soften <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 ounce) can eagle sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup orange-flavored liqueur or 2 teaspoons grated orange rind <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 F <NEXT_INSTR> peal and cook sweet potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large mixing bowl, mash sweet potatoes with butter. <NEXT_INSTR> add remaining ingredients except pastry shell and eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat until mixture is smooth and well blended. <NEXT_INSTR> stir in eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> pour into prepared pastry shell. <NEXT_INSTR> bake at 350 F for 50-55 minutes or until knife comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> allow to cool before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Luscious Sweet Potato Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> turkey carcass <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> turkey meat <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> light and <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 turkey carcass <NEXT_INGR> 4 qt. water <NEXT_INGR> 1 to 3 c. turkey meat, removed from carcass <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. finely chopped onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. finely chopped celery <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 4 oz. light and fluffy curly egg noodles, uncooked <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Remove 1 to 3 cups meat from turkey carcass. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. Place turkey carcass and water in large Dutch oven; bring it to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove carcass from broth and discard. <NEXT_INSTR> Measure 8 cups broth and return it to Dutch oven. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate or freeze the remainder for other uses. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Homemade Noodle Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> soup bone <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> rice <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> soup bone <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. each diced celery, carrots, turnips and potatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 small can tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. each shredded cabbage and onions <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. rice or barley <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> pinch of sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. parsley <NEXT_INGR> 2 qt. cold water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all the vegetables, seasonings, tomatoes and water together in a soup kettle. <NEXT_INSTR> Wash rice and sprinkle over top of liquid. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the soup bone in the kettle. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover kettle. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to steaming point, turn to low heat and cook slowly for about 3 hours or longer, if that fits in better with your plans. <NEXT_INSTR> When ready to serve the soup, remove the soup bone and add to soup the little particles of meat that might be clinging to it. <NEXT_INSTR> The bits of meat make a richer soup. <NEXT_INSTR> The soup is then ready for serving. Serves 8. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Vegetable Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> taco seasoning mix <NEXT_INPUT> tomato juice <NEXT_INPUT> chili beans <NEXT_INPUT> mixed vegetables <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste <NEXT_INPUT> corn chips <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1.25 oz. pkg. taco seasoning mix <NEXT_INGR> 46 oz. can tomato juice (6 c.) <NEXT_INGR> 15 oz. can chili beans <NEXT_INGR> 16 oz. pkg. frozen mixed vegetables <NEXT_INGR> 12 oz. tomato paste or crushed tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. crushed corn chips <NEXT_INGR> 8 oz. (2 c.) shredded Cheddar cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a 5-quart Dutch oven, brown ground beef; drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Add taco seasoning mix, juice, beans, vegetables and tomato paste. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring just to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 20 to 25 minutes until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Top each serving with crushed corn chips and Cheddar cheese. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mexican Vegetable Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>
