tablespoons vegetable or canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 4 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 5 yellow or red onions, quartered <NEXT_INGR> 2 large leeks, trimmed, cut lengthwise in half, and then into 2-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 3 cloves garlic, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 8 carrots, cut in half lengthwise and then into 2-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 6 celery stalks, cut into 2-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 6 medium parsnips, cut in half lengthwise and then into 2-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup finely chopped fresh parsley <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup dry red wine <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup beef broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place the flour, salt, and pepper in a large bowl and season the brisket on both sides, shaking off any excess. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large casserole, heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of the vegetable oil over medium-high heat until hot, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the meat and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> If the pan dries out, add the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the meat and clean out the pot. <NEXT_INSTR> In the same pot, heat the olive oil over low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onions, leeks, and garlic and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the carrots, celery, parsnips, and half the parsley and cook another 5 minutes, making sure to stir the vegetables around thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the meat back to the pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread the tomato paste on top of the meat. <NEXT_INSTR> Raise the heat to high and add the wine and broth and bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce the heat to low, add the bay leaf, and cook, covered, for about 2 hours, spooning the sauce on top of the meat every go minutes or so. <NEXT_INSTR> The meat is ready when it feels tender when gently prodded with a small, sharp knife. <NEXT_INSTR> Taste the sauce for seasoning. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cool 10 minutes off the heat before serving. <NEXT_INSTR> If making the brisket a day ahead of time, cover and refrigerate overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon off any excess fat that has risen to the surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Reheat in a 350 degree F oven for about 20 minutes, or until hot and bubbling throughout. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer the meat to a carving board and cut into 1/2 inch slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve the meat topped with the vegetables and juices from the pot. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with the remaining parsley. <NEXT_INSTR> Season to taste. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Brisket with Winter Vegetables <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Pepperidge Farm dressing (herbal) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Brown hamburger and drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain vegetables and mix together with soup in same skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Add just enough water to keep moist. Simmer about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour dressing on the top. <NEXT_INSTR> Put lid on and simmer for 5 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hamburger Delight <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> squash <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 medium buttercup squash <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon curry powder <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°F. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut squash in half and scrape out the seeds & pulp. <NEXT_INSTR> Place squash cut side down on an aluminum foil lined rimmed baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 30 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove squash from oven and turn over. <NEXT_INSTR> Put half of the butter and spices in each squash half. <NEXT_INSTR> Return to the oven and bake another 20 minutes or until the squash is tender and can be easily pricked with a toothpick. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve. <NEXT_INSTR> (I usually "mash" the inside of my half to mix the spices throughout the flesh once it is on my plate). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Curried Baked Buttercup Squash <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> corn muffin <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> cottage cheese <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 box Jiffy corn muffin mix <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. cottage cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 10 oz. broccoli, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick melted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix cottage cheese and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Add eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix broccoli, onion and butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Then add cornmeal mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or until golden brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Broccoli Cornbread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tbsp olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 30 grams butter <NEXT_INGR> 120 grams unsmoked pancetta or unsmoked bacon, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, coarsely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 4 diced <NEXT_INGR> 120 grams green beans, cut into 2 cm pieces <NEXT_INGR> 225 grams courgettes, diced <NEXT_INGR> 150 grams Italian rice <NEXT_INGR> 400 grams canned borlotti beans, drained with the oil and butter in a large saucepan and saute fof few minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onions, sage and parsley and fry gently for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix in the garlic, carrots, celery and potatoes and cook for 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the green beans and courgettes and saute for another couple of minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with 2.5 liters of hot water, add the tomatoes, salt and uncovered at a steady simmer until the rice is al dente. <NEXT_INSTR> Put directly parmesan cheese in the cooking pan or we can serve with a bowl of parmesan on the side. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve hot, share (4 oz.) unsweetened chocolate <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. + 2 Tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 4 eggs, slightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. chopped nuts <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Melt together the chocolate and margarine over very low heat; cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add sugar to eggs in separate bowl, mixing thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Add vanilla and cooled chocolate. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix, blending well. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in dry ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend in chopped nuts. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fudge Brownies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> fresh red <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> lime <NEXT_INPUT> ginger <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> fish sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 cups chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 2 fresh red or green jalapeno chilies (2 oz. total), stemmed, seeded, and thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 6 fresh or dried kaffir lime leaves (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 5 slices fresh ginger (each about the size of a quarter) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup thinly sliced green onions <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves <NEXT_INGR> Asian fish sauce (nuoc mam or nam pla) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a 2- to 3-quart pan, combine broth, chilies, chopped cilantro, lime leaves, and ginger. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour broth through a fine strainer into a bowl. Add lime juice, onions, cilantro leaves, and fish sauce to taste. Ladle into soup bowls. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chili-Lime Broth <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> dinner rolls <NEXT_INPUT> pecan <NEXT_INPUT> butterscotch pudding <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 24 frozen dinner rolls <NEXT_INGR> pecan pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1 (3 oz.) butterscotch pudding mix <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 tsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. melted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. brown sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Grease Bundt pan (I use spray Pam). <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle nuts on bottom. Place frozen rolls evenly in pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle dry pudding mix over rolls. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix melted butter, brown sugar and cinnamon together and pour over rolls. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with towel and let stand overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat oven to 350° and bake 25 to 30 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Monkey Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Italian tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> Kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> Freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> bucatini <NEXT_INPUT> Extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 ounces pancetta or guanciale, sliced 1/2 inch thick and cut into 1/2-inch dice <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium red onion, finely diced <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper <NEXT_INGR> One 28-ounce can whole peeled Italian tomatoes, drained, then tomatoes crushed by hand <NEXT_INGR> Kosher salt <NEXT_INGR> Freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound bucatini <NEXT_INGR> Extra-virgin olive oil, for drizzling <NEXT_INGR> Freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, for serving <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large skillet, cook the pancetta over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and the fat is rendered, about 12 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the onion and cook until softened, about 8 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the crushed red pepper and tomatoes, season with salt and black pepper and bring to a boil, then simmer over moderately low heat until the tomato sauce is slightly reduced, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, in a large pot of salted boiling water, cook the bucatini until al dente. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain the bucatini and add it to the skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss over low heat until coated in the sauce, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to bowls, drizzle with olive oil and serve with grated cheese. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Bucatini all'Amatriciana with Parmigiano <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> cold milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. Jell-O cheesecake <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. margarine, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. cold milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix cheesecake crumbs, sugar and margarine. <NEXT_INSTR> Press onto bottoms of each of 12 paper or foil lined muffin cups with spoon or bottom of glass. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat on medium for 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Filling will be thick. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon over crumb mixture in muffin cups. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> No Bake Mini Cheesecake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> light cream <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. 10x sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. shredded coconut <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. light cream or half and half <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix together and then roll into 1/2-inch balls. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes about 16. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Irish Potatoes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> cardamom pods <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> pistachios <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons butter or ghee <NEXT_INGR> 4 cardamom pods, cracked <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups carrots, shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup whole milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons honey <NEXT_INGR> chopped pistachios for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Warm the butter or ghee and cardamom pods over medium heat until melted. <NEXT_INSTR> Add carrots and cook gently, stirring, until they soften (they will already be pretty soft and "juicy" in the first place after being shredded). <NEXT_INSTR> Add milk and cook, stirring, until the mixture is moist but not soupy. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in honey and remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve garnished with pistachios. You can also use chopped almonds or cashews, but I love how the green nuts look against the sunny carrots. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Carrot Halwa <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> yellow onion <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup zucchini, grated <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 yellow onion, diced <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup cheese (cheddar or Parmesan work the best) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> Salt and Pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> 1. Preheat oven to 400F. Spray a mini-muffin tin with non-stick spray, set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> 2. Grate the zucchini and then place in a dish towel to squeeze out the excess water; if you skip this part, the middle of the zucchini tots will be really soggy while the outside gets crispy. <NEXT_INSTR> 3. In a bowl combine, the egg, onion, cheese, bread crumbs, zucchini, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> 4. Using a spoon or a cookie scoop, fill the muffin cups to the top. <NEXT_INSTR> 5. Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until the top is browned and set. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Zucchini Tots  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> noodles <NEXT_INPUT> frozen spinach <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> garlic powder <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 15 oz mushroom Alfredo sauce <NEXT_INGR> 12 oz shrimp deveined tailoff <NEXT_INGR> 3 oz Korean flat noodles <NEXT_INGR> 9 oz frozen spinach <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp granulated garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp olive oil, extra virgin <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat pan add oil add water <NEXT_INSTR> Add noodles and spinach <NEXT_INSTR> Add Salt garlicbreak up spinach leave juices from spinach in the pan <NEXT_INSTR> Add shrimp and sauce rinse jar out getting everything out of jar <NEXT_INSTR> Heat till everything is hot <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spinach shrimp alfredo with noodles <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> buttermilk <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 1/2 cups all purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs beaten <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup buttermilk <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped nuts or, pecans, almonds, hezelnuts <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 350°F. <NEXT_INSTR> Grease the bottom of a 13x9x2-inch baking pan; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl combine flour, sugar and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs; set aside 1/2 cup. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg into remaining crumb mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium bowl combine eggs and buttermilk. <NEXT_INSTR> Add egg mixture to flour mixture, stirring just until moistened. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon batter into prepared pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir together reserved crumb mixture and nuts and sprinkle over batter. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 40-45 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool slightly and serve warm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Buttermilk Coffee Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> salmon <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> corn flake crumbs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (1 lb.) can salmon <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium green pepper, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. mashed potatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. milk <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. corn flake crumbs <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Drain salmon and reserve liquid. <NEXT_INSTR> Flake the salmon and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter in saucepan, then add onion and green pepper and saute for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat and stir in the reserved salmon liquid. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over low heat until mixture leaves sides of pan, stirring constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat in the potatoes, salt, pepper and Worcestershire sauce, then stir in the salmon. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool, then chill thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape into croquettes. Beat the egg with the milk, then dip the croquettes in the egg mixture and coat thoroughly with the crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Fry in deep fat at 365° for about 5 minutes or until golden brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain on absorbent paper. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Family-Style Salmon Croquettes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> chorizo sausages <NEXT_INPUT> red onion <NEXT_INPUT> red capsicums <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 500 g uncooked medium king prawns, shelled <NEXT_INGR> 2 chorizo sausages, sliced thinly (300g in weight) <NEXT_INGR> 1 large red onion, sliced finely (about 300g in weight) <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium red capsicums, sliced finely (about 400g in weight) <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons paprika <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lemon, juice of <NEXT_INGR> 250 g asparagus, thin stemmed, trimmed <NEXT_INGR> 1 green onion, sliced thinly <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons parsley, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons honey <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons red wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 -2 teaspoon sugar, depending on taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the 3 tablespoons olive oil, red wine vinegar, honey and lemon juice in a screw top jar, shake well to combine. <NEXT_INSTR> In a wok or large fry pan heat a small amount of oil, cook chorizo until paprika oil starts to release from the sausage. Add onion to pan and cook for a couple of Min's. <NEXT_INSTR> Add prawns, half the dressing, tomato paste, lemon juice and paprika cook until prawns are pink. <NEXT_INSTR> Add asparagus, green onion, sugar and parsley, cook until asparagus is just tender and it is heated through. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes for a light meal for 4 or to make it more substantial serve with green salad and crusty bread. <NEXT_INSTR> It is a very versatile dish in the sense you can use up what ever veg you have in your fridge add as much or as little as you like. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Portuguese Prawn And Chorizo <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Delicious apples <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallows <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 Delicious apples, unpeeled <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. chopped walnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. chopped celery <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. miniature marshmallows (optional) <NEXT_INGR> lettuce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Core apples and slice or dice. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss with lemon juice. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well with remaining ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve in <NEXT_INSTR> large lettuce-lined bowl or in individual lettuce-lined plate. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tossed Waldorf Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/3 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 3 None medium potatoes, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 None medium onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 8 None eggs, lightly beaten <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°F. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat oil in an 8 inch ovenproof frying pan over medium heat. Cook potatoes and onion, covered, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender. Carefully invert onto a large serving plate and cut into wedges. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tortilla De Patatas <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bolognese sauce <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 8 pita breads <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup bolognese sauce (leftover) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup cheese, grated <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put grill on at hottest temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat up leftover sauce in microwave for approximately 3 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Spread sauce over pita. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill approximately 4 or 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Adapt recipe using anything from sliced vegetables on top of sauce before adding cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> We used a mix of Cheddar and Mozzarella cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Go ahead; give the kids their choice; really does make a quick,easy snack. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> 5 Minute Pita Pizza <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> fava beans <NEXT_INPUT> frozen peas <NEXT_INPUT> frozen asparagus <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 medium onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 (19 ounce) can fava beans or 1 (19 ounce) can butter beans (also great) <NEXT_INGR> 12 lb frozen peas <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb frozen asparagus <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons olive oil <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oil in pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Sautee onion until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Add beans, peas and asparagus and cook over medium heat until beans begin to wrinkle. <NEXT_INSTR> Add salt and pepper to taste. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sauteed Beans and Veggies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fresh spinach leaves <NEXT_INPUT> chick-peas <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> fresh chives <NEXT_INPUT> lemons <NEXT_INPUT> extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 10 ounces fresh spinach leaves, rinsed, or 1 (10-ounce) package frozen leaf spinach <NEXT_INGR> 19 -ounce can (2 cups) chick-peas, drained and rinsed <NEXT_INGR> 1 red bell pepper, finely diced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon snipped fresh chives <NEXT_INGR> 1 to 2 lemons, juiced or to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 to 1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> If using fresh spinach: Cook the spinach in a saucepan with the water clinging to its leaves, stirring, until wilted. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain, squeeze dry, and finely chop. <NEXT_INSTR> If using frozen spinach, follow package directions, drain, squeeze dry, and finely chop. <NEXT_INSTR> In a bowl combine the spinach with the chick peas, pepper, chives, lemon juice, oil, salt, and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve as is or chilled with toasted bread or as a filling for pita pockets. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chick-Peas and Spinach Tapas <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> rice wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cucumbers <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 14 cup rice wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 cucumbers, peeled and seeded <NEXT_INGR> 1 red bell pepper, julienned <NEXT_INGR> 2 carrots, pared and julienned <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat the rice wine vinegar and sugar in a saucepan until the sugar dissolves. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut the peeled and seeded cucumbers into rounds or dice. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine cucumbers, peppers, and carrots in a large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour the vinegar mixture over the vegetables and toss. <NEXT_INSTR> Add salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Marinate in the refrigerator for several hours. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Marinated Vegetable Salad II <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> soda <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> mace <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> light brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 c. sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. soda <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. mace <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb. light brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 lb. butter <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. raisins <NEXT_INGR> sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Dissolve soda in sour cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Sift flour, mace and salt together. <NEXT_INSTR> Cream brown sugar and butter; add eggs and beat well. Add sour cream and flour alternately to the creamed mixture and beat until well mixed. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the vanilla and raisins. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop by teaspoonful onto a greased cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 350° approximately 15 minutes, until puffy ahd brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cymballs(Cookies)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> yellow onions <NEXT_INPUT> stalks celery <NEXT_INPUT> fresh green beans <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ginger <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> sherry <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> instant chicken <NEXT_INPUT> quarters <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> corn ears <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tbsp. vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 yellow onions, cut into wedges and separated <NEXT_INGR> 3 stalks celery, diagonally cut into 1/2 inch pcs <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounce. fresh green beans, trimmed and diagonally cut into 1-inch pcs <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoon chopped fresh ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 tbsp. dry sherry <NEXT_INGR> 4 teaspoon Kikkoman lite soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 4 teaspoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoon instant chicken bouillon granules <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound fresh sea scallops, cut into quarters <NEXT_INGR> 8 green onions, diagonally cut into thin slices <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 ounce.) can baby corn ears, liquid removed <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 ounce.) can mushrooms <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oil in wok or possibly large skillet over high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in yellow onions, celery, green beans, ginger and garlic; stir-fry for 3 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine water, sherry, soy sauce, cornstarch and bouillon granules in small bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in to wok. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook and stir till sauce boils. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in scallops, mushrooms, green onions and baby corn. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook and stir till scallops turn opaque, about 4 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve over rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 4 to 6. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chinese Scallops With Vegetables Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> broccoli <NEXT_INPUT> red potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> fresh corn <NEXT_INPUT> green beans <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> broccoli <NEXT_INGR> red potatoes <NEXT_INGR> fresh corn <NEXT_INGR> green beans <NEXT_INGR> carrots <NEXT_INGR> mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> squash <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> A variety of steamed fresh vegetables served with cole slaw makes a wonderful fat free meal. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with hot brown rice or bulgur (cracked wheat). <NEXT_INSTR> Cole slaw is made with nonfat dressing. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Steamed Vegetable Night <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> frozen spinach <NEXT_INPUT> pine nuts <NEXT_INPUT> ricotta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 6 chicken breasts, boneless skinless <NEXT_INGR> 6 slices prosciutto, about 1/3 pound <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 ounce) box frozen spinach, defrosted <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons pine nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup ricotta cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup parmesan cheese, grated <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons olive oil, extra virgin <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Wring out defrosted spinach in clean kitchen towel to remove water. <NEXT_INSTR> Toast pine nuts <NEXT_INSTR> Combine nuts with spinach in a bowl; mix in cheeses, garlic, salt, pepper and nutmeg. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut into and across but not all the way through the chicken breasts, opening them up like a book with a sharp knife. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Fill each with a small mound of stuffing. <NEXT_INSTR> Flap chicken breasts back over stuffing and wrap each breast with prosciutto to seal them, carefully covering the whole breast. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush chicken all over with olive oil and roast 18 to 20 minutes until cooked through. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Florentine Prosciutto Wrapped Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> COOL WHIP LITE <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/3 cup MAXWELL HOUSE INTERNATIONAL Sugar Free Suisse Mocha <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup COOL WHIP LITE Whipped Topping <NEXT_INGR> 4 <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place 1/4 of GENERAL FOODS INTERNATIONAL COFFEE into each of 4 mugs. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 cup boiling water gradually to each mug and stir until coffee is completely dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Top each mug with 1 Tbsp. <NEXT_INSTR> COOL WHIP. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve 1 SNACKWELL'S cookie with each cup of coffee. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Suisse Mocha Swirl with Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shrimp <NEXT_INPUT> wasabi paste <NEXT_INPUT> pickled ginger <NEXT_INPUT> rice vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <NEXT_INPUT> endive <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound shelled cooked tiny shrimp, rinsed and drained <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 teaspoon wasabi paste or prepared horseradish <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped pickled ginger <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup seasoned rice vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped green onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound Belgian endive <NEXT_INGR> Coarse-ground pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a bowl, mix shrimp with wasabi paste, pickled ginger, and rice vinegar. Spoon shrimp onto leaves to eat. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Gingered Shrimp With Belgian Endive <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> + <NEXT_INPUT> Apple Chutney <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> celery stalk <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> firm tofu <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> fresh kale <NEXT_INPUT> flour tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> brown rice <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon peanut butter <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup + 3 tablespoons water, divided <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons Apple Chutney <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 carrot, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 celery stalk, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups sliced mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 pound firm tofu, cut into 1/2-inch cubes (about 1 cup) <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons curry powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups finely chopped fresh kale <NEXT_INGR> 8 large flour tortillas <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups cooked brown rice <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix peanut butter with 3 tablespoons of water. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Heat 1/2 cup water and soy sauce in a large non-stick skillet. Add onion, carrot, celery, and mushrooms. Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in tofu and cook over medium-high heat, stirring often, until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in curry powder, red bell pepper, cilantro, if using, kale, and peanut butter mixture. Cover and cook until kale is tender, about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR>  <NEXT_INSTR> Heat tortillas in a dry skillet until soft, then top with about 1/2 cup of the vegetable mixture, 1/4 cup of brown rice, and 2 teaspoons of Apple Chutney. Roll tortilla around filling. Repeat with remaining tortillas. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Thai Wraps  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> chicken stock <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> noodles <NEXT_INPUT> frozen green peas <NEXT_INPUT> pimento <NEXT_INPUT> shredded cheese <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 chicken, boiled and deboned <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. chicken stock <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) pkg. noodles <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. frozen green peas <NEXT_INGR> 1 small jar pimento <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. shredded cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. half and half or 1 c. canned milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Boil 1 whole chicken with onions and celery; cool and debone. Chop meat in chunks. <NEXT_INSTR> Thicken 2 cups chicken stock with 2 tablespoons flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook 1 (8 ounce) package noodles; drain and add to chicken and thickened stock. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 cup frozen peas and 1 small jar pimento. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into baking dish; top with shredded cheese and pour 1 cup half and half milk or 1 cup canned milk over all. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in 350° oven for 45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with hot rolls and a Jell-O or green salad. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Honeycomb Chicken <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> doughnut <NEXT_INPUT> cheese <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 glazed doughnut <NEXT_INGR> 2 slice cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 slice ham or lunch meat of your desire <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cut donuts in half to make two pieces of bread for your sandwich. <NEXT_INSTR> Then on the side that you could open spread butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat up frying pan and place buttered side down into. <NEXT_INSTR> Put slice of cheese on both sides of the donut <NEXT_INSTR> Then put ham on one side and turn the other side on top of that <NEXT_INSTR> What and told you get the desired Brown Ness on each side . <NEXT_INSTR> And plate! <NEXT_INSTR> Bon Appetit <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Ham & cheese grilled dSnuta <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> turkey thighs <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> dried basil <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> cold water <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 2 turkey thighs, boned <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon dried basil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon thyme <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup water <NEXT_INGR> 5 medium potatoes, peeled and quartered <NEXT_INGR> 4 medium carrots, peeled and sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup cold water <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oil in a pot. Add thighs which have been sprinkled with salt and pepper. Fry until skin is crisp on both sides. <NEXT_INSTR> Add onion and garlic. Fry until softened a bit. Stir in basil, thyme, and water. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add carrots. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add potatoes. Cover and simmer 20 minutes, or until done. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine cornstarch and 1/4 cup cold water. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove chicken and vegetables to a platter. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir cornstarch mixture into the liquid in the pot. Bring to a boil. Cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Pour over turkey and vegetables and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Vegetable And Turkey Pot Roast <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon rind <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> hot sauce <NEXT_INPUT> mustard <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup red wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons grated lemon rind <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons hot sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, pressed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Whisk together oil and remaining ingredients in a bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Note: To prepare ahead, store in an airtight container in the refrigerator up to 1 week. Bring to room temperature, and whisk before using. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon-Basil Marinade <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> lemon large <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolks <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> butter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lemon large <NEXT_INGR> 2 egg yolks <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups water <NEXT_INGR> 4 teaspoons butter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Using a zester, a potato peeler or a sharp paring knife, remove the yellow peel (this is called the "zest") from a lemon and mince. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat over medium-high heat, stirring until mixture boils to a clear consistency and sauce thickens. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. Whisk a small amount of the hot mixture into the egg yolks. Return yolk mixture to saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook, stirring constantly for about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. Add lemon zest, juice, and butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Or, using a fine grater, remove the yellow portion, leaving behind the white "pith" which is bitter). <NEXT_INSTR> Once the peel is grated or minced, measure out 1 1/2 teaspoons. <NEXT_INSTR> Squeeze the lemon and measure out 3 tablespoons of juice. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Separate egg yolks from whites. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat egg yolks lightly and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a separate bowl, blend together the sugar, cornstarch, and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Measure water into a saucepan. Gradually stir the sugar mixture into the water. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Swiss steak <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> stalks celery <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 lb. Swiss steak <NEXT_INGR> 1 (1 qt.) jar tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 3 or 4 carrots (unpeeled) <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion <NEXT_INGR> 2 stalks celery, chopped <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place steak in shallow roasting pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour tomatoes over top of steak. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice carrots, onion and celery; sprinkle over steak. Cover with tinfoil. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 375° for 60 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 6 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fast Fixin' Swiss Steak <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> pearl barley <NEXT_INPUT> chicken stock <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaf <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> red bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 tablespoon butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup pearl barley <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups chicken stock <NEXT_INGR> 1 bay leaf <NEXT_INGR> 1 carrot, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 red bell pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon lemon, zest of <NEXT_INGR> salt, pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> add onion, salt, pepper, saute about 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> add barley and stir until well coated. <NEXT_INSTR> add chicken stock and bay leaf, bring to boil, cover, lower heat to simmer. <NEXT_INSTR> cook about 25 minutes until barley is tender. <NEXT_INSTR> add carrot and pepper, cover and cook about 6 minutes more. <NEXT_INSTR> remove from heat, stir, cover and let it stand for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> stir in lemon zest, salt, pepper to taste. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Lemon Barley Pilaf <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> ketchup <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> white vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> pork <NEXT_INPUT> butter beans <NEXT_INPUT> red kidney beans <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb ground beef <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lb bacon, cut into small pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups ketchup <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon white vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) can pork and beans <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) can butter beans (partially drained,) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (16 ounce) can red kidney beans (partially drained,) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Saute ground beef, bacon, and onion in a large skillet or saucepan until meat is cooked throughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Add ketchup, brown sugar and vinegar and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Then add pork and beans, butter beans and red kidney beans and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat throughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to large baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 45 minutes to 1 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Add tender loving care. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Crazy Beans <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> tortellini <NEXT_INPUT> tuna <NEXT_INPUT> frozen peas <NEXT_INPUT> dressing <NEXT_INPUT> black olives <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 package (8-9 ounces) tortellini, cooked and cooled <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (12-ounces) albacore tuna, drained and chunked <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup frozen peas, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup Ranch dressing <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup black olives (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Prepare tortellini according to directions; drain and cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in drained tuna, peas, Ranch dressing and olives. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Albacore Tuna Tortellini Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> graham cracker crumb crust <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) container Cool Whip Topping, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1 prepared graham cracker crumb crust (9-inch) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix cream cheese and sugar in large bowl with electric mixer until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Gently stir in whipped topping. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon into crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate 3 hours or until set. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with fresh fruit. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Quick 2-Step Cheesecake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> egg noodles <NEXT_INPUT> cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> bagsshredded cheese <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> chachere's <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb egg noodles <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup (use the Campbell's kind with the Roasted Garlic if you can find it, otherwise generic brands are fin) <NEXT_INGR> 1.5 (3 cup) bagsshredded cheese (I like the Kraft 4-cheese Mexican blend, but any kind that melts well will work) <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, diced (dried onions will work) <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> black pepper <NEXT_INGR> tony chachere's creole seasoning <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Boil the noodles, drain. <NEXT_INSTR> In one of those 10" round glass Pyrex dishes with the lid (the kind your mother probably uses to make green bean casserole and which they sell for six bucks at Family Dollar), mix the soup, 1 bag of the cheese, onion, a pinch or so of salt, and however much pepper you would put on an equivalent amount of scrambled eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Just eyeball it. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir it up real good, then top with the remaining cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle a generous amount of Tony's over the top, cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to let all the seasonings blend, preferably chill overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake covered at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for 45 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 6-8 people. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Leeandra's Infamous Macaroni and Cheese <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> soda <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> almond extract <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 c. sifted all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. firmly packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 unbeaten eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. almond extract <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sift together flour, soda and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Cream butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add sugar and brown sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Cream well. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend in unbeaten eggs, vanilla and almond extract. <NEXT_INSTR> Add dry ingredients gradually. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill about 2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Prepare filling. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Date Or Fig Filled Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> wild rice <NEXT_INPUT> white wine <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INPUT> shrimp <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 boxes wild rice mix <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. dry white wine or sherry <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 oz.) can mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 (10 3/4 oz.) can cream of mushroom soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. cooked shrimp <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook rice as directed. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in soup and wine. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat through. Stir in mushrooms and shrimp. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn into greased 2-quart casserole dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with Parmesan. <NEXT_INSTR> Broil until lightly browned. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Wild Rice Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> broccoli florets <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> thyme <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 lb fresh broccoli florets <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 34 teaspoon lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 18 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 18 teaspoon dried thyme <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place the broccoli and 1-inch of water in a saucepan; bring to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 5-8 minutes or until crisp-tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the oil, lemon juice, salt and thyme. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain broccoli; toss with oil mixture. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Thyme Broccoli <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bell peppers <NEXT_INPUT> bell peppers <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> ground chuck <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> red bell peppers <NEXT_INPUT> bottles beer <NEXT_INPUT> red wine <NEXT_INPUT> Italian tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> ground pepper <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne <NEXT_INPUT> red chili pepper <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> jalapeno peppers <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> scallion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 10 dried bell peppers (*Aji Panca) <NEXT_INGR> 10 dried bell peppers (*Cascabel) <NEXT_INGR> 1 dried pepper (*Habanero) <NEXT_INGR> 5 lbs ground chuck <NEXT_INGR> 2 onions, diced <NEXT_INGR> 4 dried red bell peppers, diced <NEXT_INGR> 3 dried jalapenos, seeds removed diced <NEXT_INGR> 2 (16 ounce) bottles beer (a strong American ale or porter) <NEXT_INGR> 3 cups red wine <NEXT_INGR> 2 (28 ounce) cans peeled Italian tomatoes, crushed by hand <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon ground pepper (*Aleppo) <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cayenne (more if you would like it spicier) <NEXT_INGR> 3 teaspoons red chili pepper flakes <NEXT_INGR> 1 head garlic, roasted <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) can pickled jalapeno peppers, diced <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper, to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 bunch scallion, thinly sliced (garnish) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> For the chili powder: Toast the Aji Panca, cascabel, and habanero chilies in a 350 degree F oven until they are fragrant and crunchy. Let them cool, then break them open and remove the seeds. Grind them in a spice grinder and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> For the chili: Brown beef in a large stockpot over medium high heat. Drain off fat and remove beef from pot. Add the onion, red bell pepper, raw jalapenos, and 1/4 cup of the chili powder to the pot. Cook until the vegetables are softened and the chili powder is toasted. <NEXT_INSTR> Deglaze with beer and red wine. Reduce by half and then add the tomatoes, the ground Aleppo pepper, cinnamon, cumin, cayenne and red chili flake. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer for at least an hour. Add beef back to the mix. Add roasted garlic, pickled jalapenos, and salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> For spicier chili, add more ground Aleppo pepper and cayenne pepper. Garnish with scallions. <NEXT_INSTR> *These peppers can be found at Kalustyan's or at most specialty/gourmet grocery stores. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Texas Style Beer Braised Chili <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> salmon <NEXT_INPUT> crème fraiche <NEXT_INPUT> ginger powder <NEXT_INPUT> curry <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 pieces salmon 150g each <NEXT_INGR> creme fraiche 4 big spoons <NEXT_INGR> ginger powder 2 spoons <NEXT_INGR> curry powder 2 spoons <NEXT_INGR> honey 4 big spoons <NEXT_INGR> butter 15 g <NEXT_INGR> onions 150 g <NEXT_INGR> salt <NEXT_INGR> pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a pan with a little oil, saute the onions and let them caramelize with some honey. <NEXT_INSTR> In a plate using aluminium foil, form 4 papillotes (twits). <NEXT_INSTR> Put a salmon steak within each <NEXT_INSTR> Add to each pack, half a teaspoon of curry, ginger, a quarter of onions, a tablespoon of cream, a tablespoon of honey, a little bit of butter, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Close the papillotes and cook them in the oven thermostat 7 (210 ° C) for about 20 minutes (depending mostly on your oven). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Salmon Papillotes With Honey, Curry And Ginger <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> dough <NEXT_INPUT> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> granulated sugar <NEXT_INPUT> grape jelly <NEXT_INPUT> peanut butter <NEXT_INPUT> honey <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pound cold fresh prepared pizza dough, cut into 1-in. pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup grape jelly, plus more for serving, warmed in microwave until melted <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup creamy peanut butter, warmed in microwave until melted <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped honey roasted peanuts <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Drizzle dough with melted jelly and melted peanut butter. Bake in preheated oven until top is golden and the inside is cooked through, 18 to 20 minutes. Drizzle with more jelly, if desired, and sprinkle with peanuts. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Skillet Pb&J Monkey Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> light cream <NEXT_INPUT> condensed lowfat milk <NEXT_INPUT> instant coffee <NEXT_INPUT> egg yolk <NEXT_INPUT> Irish whiskey <NEXT_INPUT> rum <NEXT_INPUT> chocolate syrup <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 c. light cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 ounce.) can sweetened condensed lowfat milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoon instant coffee <NEXT_INGR> 1 beaten egg yolk <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. Irish whiskey <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. rum <NEXT_INGR> 2 tbsp. chocolate syrup <NEXT_INGR> 1 tbsp. vanilla <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a saucepan combine cream lowfat milk and coffee. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook and stir over medium heat till coffee is dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually stir about half the lowfat milk mix into beaten egg yolk; return to saucepan. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring mix to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook and stir for 2 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in whiskey, rum, chocolate syrup and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir till well combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Let cold to room temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to a container with a tight fitting lid. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerateat least 4 hrs before serving. <NEXT_INSTR> Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 months. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chocolate Cream Liqueur Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> potato chips <NEXT_INPUT> confectioners <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 lb butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 12 lb margarine, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 3 12 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup crushed potato chips <NEXT_INGR> confectioners' sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Cream butter and margarine well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sugar and vanilla and beat until light and fluffy. <NEXT_INSTR> Gradually add flour and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the crushed potato chips. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop by teaspoonful onto ungreased cookie sheets about 2" apart. <NEXT_INSTR> Flatten with a fork dipped in confectioner's sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> When warm, dust with confectioner's sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> When completely cool, dust again. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Potato Chip Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken Rice <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> hearts <NEXT_INPUT> curry powder <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> pimiento <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. chicken Rice-A-Roni, cooked and cooled <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 green pepper, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 (6 oz.) jars marinated artichoke hearts, drained (save marinade for dressing) <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. curry powder <NEXT_INGR> 4 green onions, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 12 pimiento-stuffed olives, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. mayonnaise <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Add green onions, green peppers and sliced olives to cooled rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut up drained artichokes and add to rice. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine marinade with curry powder and mayonnaise. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to rice and toss. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sausage <NEXT_INPUT> chili bean <NEXT_INPUT> brown rice <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Tabasco sauce <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb sausage (I used turkey sausage) <NEXT_INGR> 1 can chili bean (With Sauce) <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup brown rice <NEXT_INGR> minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 14-12 yellow onions or 14-12 yellow onion <NEXT_INGR> jalapeno pepper (depending on the degree of spiciness you prefer, i used 4) <NEXT_INGR> Tabasco sauce or hot sauce (to taste) <NEXT_INGR> pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook brown rice according to package and let cool. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook sausage according to package let cool and cut into thin slices, quarter them if you prefer smaller bits. <NEXT_INSTR> Spray large pot with cooking spray and saute minced garlic with jalepenos and onion for 1-2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add sliced sausages to pot and stir to mix. <NEXT_INSTR> Add chili beans with sauce and cooled rice to pot and stir. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with pepper and tabasco sauce (which I use very liberally). <NEXT_INSTR> Serve warm with lots of liquids for ya wimps out there. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and heat through until beans are warm. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sausage and Bean Fried Rice <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> yeast <NEXT_INPUT> warm water <NEXT_INPUT> warm milk <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. dry yeast <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. warm water <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. warm milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. flour <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix dry yeast in water and dissolve. <NEXT_INSTR> Add milk, butter, salt and sugar.	Stir <NEXT_INSTR> well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add flour in small amounts (save 1/2 cup) <NEXT_INSTR> and <NEXT_INSTR> mix <NEXT_INSTR> thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> The <NEXT_INSTR> dough <NEXT_INSTR> will <NEXT_INSTR> be <NEXT_INSTR> stiff. Sprinkle some flour on a dry surface. <NEXT_INSTR> Knead dough until it is smooth. Place dough <NEXT_INSTR> in <NEXT_INSTR> a	greased bowl, cover and set aside for 1 hour. Punch <NEXT_INSTR> dough <NEXT_INSTR> down	and <NEXT_INSTR> shape <NEXT_INSTR> into a small oval roll. <NEXT_INSTR> Place <NEXT_INSTR> in a greased loaf pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and set aside for 35 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in	loaf <NEXT_INSTR> pan <NEXT_INSTR> in <NEXT_INSTR> the <NEXT_INSTR> Dutch <NEXT_INSTR> oven <NEXT_INSTR> for 35 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Set <NEXT_INSTR> aside to cool for five minutes and then invert loaf pan and remove. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Loaf Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Bread <NEXT_INPUT> Nutella <NEXT_INPUT> Mascarpone <NEXT_INPUT> Bananas <NEXT_INPUT> Eggs <NEXT_INPUT> Icing sugar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 Bread <NEXT_INGR> 1 Nutella <NEXT_INGR> 1 Mascarpone <NEXT_INGR> 1 Bananas <NEXT_INGR> 3 Eggs (depending on how many sandwiches you wish to make) <NEXT_INGR> 1 Icing sugar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Slice bananas into thin slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Grab two slices of bread and spread Nutella over one slice and Mascarpone over the other slice. <NEXT_INSTR> Place banana slices over one of the slices and put both the slices together in a sandwich. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the eggs and add some sugar to it (make sure you don't add too much sugar, Nutella and bananas already add sweetness to the sandwiches). <NEXT_INSTR> Cut the sandwiches into triangles and dip the triangles in the beaten eggs and fry the them in some oil or butter in a fry pan just like you would fry a regular French Toast. <NEXT_INSTR> Eat hot or cold. <NEXT_INSTR> You could also sprinkle some icing sugar over the sandwich triangles or decorate them with banana slices or other fruits. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> T's Nutella Mascarpone Banana Sandwiches <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> white cake mix <NEXT_INPUT> pistachio pudding <NEXT_INPUT> Crisco oil <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> club soda <NEXT_INPUT> couple drops <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 box white cake mix <NEXT_INGR> 1 box pistachio pudding (instant) <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. Crisco oil <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. club soda <NEXT_INGR> couple drops green food coloring <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all ingredients together; grease and flour a tube pan or 13 x 9-inch pan. <NEXT_INSTR> (Tube pan is best.) <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pistachio Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> bell pepper <NEXT_INPUT> oil <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> water chestnuts <NEXT_INPUT> egg roll wraps <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3 cups chicken (cooked, boned, shredded) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup diced green onion <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup diced celery <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup diced bell pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 can diced water chestnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 package egg roll wraps <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pour oil in wok, set on high. <NEXT_INSTR> Add celery, onions, and peppers and cook stirring constantly till slightly soft, (about 3 minutes). <NEXT_INSTR> Add water chestnuts, chicken, soy sauce and broth. Cook on medium high until most of the liquid is absorbed. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir often. Turn mixture on low and begin making egg rolls. <NEXT_INSTR> Look on back of egg roll package on how to roll them up. <NEXT_INSTR> Fry the egg rolls in hot oil in a fry cooker or skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on paper towel to drain oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately. <NEXT_INSTR> Should make 15 egg rolls. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Egg Rolls <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beef top sirloin <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> dark sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice concentrate <NEXT_INPUT> rice vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> dark sesame oil <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> peanut oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> fresh ginger root <NEXT_INPUT> orange zest <NEXT_INPUT> red pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/2 pounds beef top sirloin, thinly sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon low-sodium soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dark sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon low-sodium soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon rice vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon dark sesame oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon peanut oil <NEXT_INGR> 3 cloves garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon finely shredded orange zest <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the beef, 1 tablespoon of soy sauce, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, and baking soda in a bowl and mix thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate 1 to 3 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat peanut oil in a wok or large, nonstick skillet over high heat. Stir in garlic, ginger, orange zest, and red pepper flakes, and cook until the garlic begins to brown, 20 to 30 seconds. Add the beef; cook and stir until the beef begins to brown and crisp, about 5 minutes. Whisk together 1 tablespoon soy sauce, orange juice concentrate, rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, brown sugar, and 1 teaspoon cornstarch in a small bowl. Stir into the beef, and cook until the sauce has thickened and turned clear, about 30 seconds. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Orange Peel Beef <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> chicken breasts <NEXT_INPUT> lemons <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 c. fine dry bread crumbs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. grated Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. minced parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. melted butter <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 clove garlic, crushed <NEXT_INGR> 3 chicken breasts, skinless and boneless <NEXT_INGR> juice of 1 1/2 lemons <NEXT_INGR> dash of paprika <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend crumbs, cheese, parsley, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine garlic and butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Dip chicken in butter mixture; then roll into crumbs, coating thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll each piece into firm roll; skewer with a toothpick. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange in a baking pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Squeeze lemon juice over chicken; drizzle remaining butter over top. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with paprika. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for one hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 6 servings. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Imperial <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>
