<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onion <NEXT_INPUT> zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> grated cheese <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 medium onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 lb. of zucchini <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup fresh or canned tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> salt to taste <NEXT_INGR> dash of pepper <NEXT_INGR> grated cheese - needed if baking <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick margarine <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Saut 1 sliced onion in margarine until yellow. <NEXT_INSTR> Add one pound of zucchini, sliced, and cook and stir 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 cup of fresh or canned tomatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and cook for 5 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat and cook until tender (25 minutes) or put in a casserole dish and sprinkle grated cheese and bake at 375 degrees until brown. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 4. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Zucchini Italian Style <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cranberries <NEXT_INPUT> broccoli flowerets <NEXT_INPUT> shredded red cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vinegar <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/3 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 c. chopped fresh cranberries <NEXT_INGR> 1 bunch broccoli flowerets <NEXT_INGR> 4 c. shredded red cabbage <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. chopped walnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. raisins <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, minced <NEXT_INGR> 8 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. vinegar <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put cranberries in a small bowl with 1/3 cup sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix broccoli, cabbage, walnuts, raisins, onion and bacon. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the cranberries. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar. Spread dressing over the salad. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> When ready to serve, mix the dressing into the salad. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Vegetable Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> phyllo <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> turkey <NEXT_INPUT> green onions <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry sauce <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 15 individual miniature phyllo cups, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 3 ounces cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup chopped cooked turkey <NEXT_INGR> 2 green onions, minced <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup whole berry cranberry sauce <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix cream cheese, turkey, and onions. <NEXT_INSTR> Fill thawed phyllo shells with 1 tsp of cream cheese mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with a small bit of cranberry sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> To serve hot, place filled shells on baking sheet and warm 5-8 minutes at 350F; serve immediately. <NEXT_INSTR> (You may wish to add cranberry after warming the shells/filling, so it doesn't 'melt'). <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mini Phyllo Cranberry Shells <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> frozen hash browns <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INPUT> green pepper <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> corn flakes <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> paprika <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 pkg. frozen hash browns, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> dash of pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 can cream of chicken soup <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. chopped green pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. celery (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. crushed corn flakes <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. melted butter <NEXT_INGR> paprika <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all together except corn flakes and 1/4 cup butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Put in 9 x 13-inch pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with corn flakes and butter. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle with the paprika. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 350° for 1 hour. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Dairy Potato Bake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cook roaster <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> lemons <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> potatoes <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (2 1/2 to 3 lb.) ready to cook roaster, quarter chicken <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. butter <NEXT_INGR> Juice of 1 1/2 med. lemons <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 to 1 c. warm water <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 8 to 10 cut up potatoes <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Saute/fry chicken in frying pan in warm butter till golden brown on all sides, remove to 3 qt casserole. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over the strained lemon juice and water. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in potatoes, sprinkle with salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake covered for 1 1/2 to 2 hrs, till chicken and potatoes are tender, basting every 20 min. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove chicken to heated platter; and add in potatoes; pour sauce over chicken and potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 4. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken With Lemon Recipe <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> white rice <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 stick margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. white rice, uncooked <NEXT_INGR> 2 cans beef consomme soup <NEXT_INGR> 1 can sliced mushrooms (do not drain, optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Saute onion in margarine. <NEXT_INSTR> Add rice, soup and mushrooms. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in a 2-quart casserole dish, uncovered, at 350° for 1 hour. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Brown Rice <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red salmon <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> lemon <NEXT_INPUT> capers <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> crackers <NEXT_INPUT> bread crumbs <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (14.75 ounce) can red salmon, skin and bone removed, drained and flaked <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 lemon, juiced <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped capers <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 12 saltine crackers <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon bread crumbs, or as needed <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Stir salmon, eggs, lemon juice, capers, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl until well-combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Crush saltine crackers with your hands into the salmon mixture and mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Wrap the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate, 30 minutes to overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Dust a plate with half the bread crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide salmon mixture into 4 portions and shape into patties; place onto prepared plate and sprinkle remaining bread crumbs atop the salmon patties. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter and oil in a large skillet over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook patties in hot oil until cooked and heated through, about 5 minutes per side. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chef John's Salmon Cakes <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Spanish onions <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> kosher salt <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> lump crabmeat <NEXT_INPUT> creme fraiche <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <NEXT_INPUT> croutons <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> peas <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup medium chopped Spanish onions <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup good olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1 kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 8 cups chicken broth or stock <NEXT_INGR> 12 ounces jumbo lump crabmeat, picked through for shells <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup creme fraiche <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup croutons <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups medium diced carrots <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound green split peas, rinsed <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a 4 quart stock pot on medium heat, saute the onions with olive oil and pepper until the onions are translucent, 10 to 15 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the carrots, half the split peas and the chicken stock. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring to a boil, then simmer uncovered for 40 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Skim off the foam while cooking. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the remaining split peas and continue to simmer for another 40 minutes or until all the peas are soft. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir frequently to keep the solids from burning on the bottom. <NEXT_INSTR> At the end, check for salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Add all the crabmeat to the soup, after it is finished. <NEXT_INSTR> Let sit 5 minutes to warm the crabmeat, but do not boil again or crabmeat will break up. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Grand Central Oyster Bar Chef Has 'Green Thumb' For St. Patrick'S Day Green Split Pea Soup With Lump Crabmeat  <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> red potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> ground chicken <NEXT_INPUT> carrots <NEXT_INPUT> onions <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> tomato paste <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> fresh thyme <NEXT_INPUT> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 lbs medium size red potatoes, quartered <NEXT_INGR> 3 lbs ground chicken <NEXT_INGR> 4 medium carrots, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium onions, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons tomato paste <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons salt <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon fresh thyme, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 cups chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 6 tablespoons butter, cubed <NEXT_INGR> 7 ounces cheddar cheese, shredded <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place potatoes in a dutch oven and cover with water bringing to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15 - 20 minutes (or until tender). <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile, in a Dutch oven, cook the chicken, carrots and onions over medium heat until no longer pink; drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in the flour, tomato paste, salt, pepper and thyme - adding the chicken broth and bringing to a boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 6-8 minutes or until thickened. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide mixture between two greased 13 x 9 inch baking dishes. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain potatoes placing in a large bowl then add milk and butter; mash until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in cheese and spread over chicken mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover and freeze one casserole for up to 3 months (heating instructions for frozen casserole to follow). <NEXT_INSTR> Bake the remaining casserole, uncovered, at 400 degrees for 15 - 20 minutes or until bubbly; ENJOY! <NEXT_INSTR> TO USE FROZEN CASSEROLE:. <NEXT_INSTR> Thaw in the refrigerator overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before baking; Bake uncovered for 50 - 55 minutes at 400 degrees or until bubbly. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Potato-Topped Chicken Casserole <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> cutter <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 tbsp unsalted butter, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup plus 1 tbsp superfine sugar, plus extra for sprinkling <NEXT_INGR> 1 2/3 cups all purpose flour, plus extra for rolling out the dough <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp salt <NEXT_INGR> 3 in (7.5cm) fluted cookie cutter <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat the oven to 350F (180C). <NEXT_INSTR> Beat the butter and sugar together in a medium bowl with an electric mixer set on high speed, about 2 minutes, or until light in color. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the flour and salt and stir together with a wooden spoon to make a firm dough. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll the dough out to 1/4 in (5mm) thickness. <NEXT_INSTR> Using a 3in (5cm) fluted cookie cutter, cut out 10 rounds, re-rolling as necessary. <NEXT_INSTR> Arrange the cookies spaced about 1/2 in (1cm) apart on a large baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Prick the tops with a fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake about 20 minutes, or until lightly golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle the hot cookies with sugar and cool on the baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Variation: Chocolate Chip Shortbread <NEXT_INSTR> Mix 1/2 cup semisweet or milk chocolate chips into the dough in Step 1 and proceed as Shortbread. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Shortbread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> jalapeno pasteurized process cheese spread <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 oz.) jar jalapeno pasteurized process cheese spread <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. milk <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Blend all ingredients well. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 1 1/2 cups. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Zippy Jalapeno Dip <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> loaves unbaked bread <NEXT_INPUT> ham <NEXT_INPUT> Provolone cheese <NEXT_INPUT> pepperoni <NEXT_INPUT> Mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> salami <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Wesson oil <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 loaves unbaked bread (frozen section) <NEXT_INGR> 20 slices (thin) ham <NEXT_INGR> 30 slices (thin) round Provolone cheese <NEXT_INGR> 40 slices (thin) pepperoni <NEXT_INGR> 20 slices (thin) Mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INGR> 40 slices (thin) salami <NEXT_INGR> olive oil <NEXT_INGR> garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> black pepper <NEXT_INGR> Wesson oil <NEXT_INGR> oregano <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sprinkle flour on bread board and roll out bread as thin as possible. Brush flattened bread with olive oil. Sprinkle with garlic salt, oregano and black pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Alternate 4 slices ham, 5 slices Provolone cheese, 8 slices pepperoni, 4 slices Mozzarella cheese and 10 slices salami. Roll up as tight as possible. <NEXT_INSTR> Tuck ends under. <NEXT_INSTR> You may have to cut rolls in half. <NEXT_INSTR> Make sure the ends are tucked in. Brush roll with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush pan with Wesson oil. <NEXT_INSTR> Place rolls in preheated oven and bake for 40 to 45 minutes at 350°. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Pizza Roll <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> shredded cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cayenne pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 Tbsp. shortening <NEXT_INGR> 1 small onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. canned tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. shredded cheese <NEXT_INGR> dash of cayenne pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook onions, tomatoes and chili powder. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer until thick. Add cheese and cayenne pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve over toast. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chili Con Queso <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Butter <NEXT_INPUT> White Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Light Brown Sugar <NEXT_INPUT> Vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> Flour <NEXT_INPUT> Baking Soda <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> ¼ <NEXT_INPUT> White <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 cup Butter, Softened <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups White Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cups Light Brown Sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash Vanilla Extract <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon Baking Soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 dash Salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups Oatmeal <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cups Chocolate Chips <NEXT_INGR> White, Purple Raisins And Cranberries <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix the ingredients together. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Outrageous Oatmeal Cookie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> flour <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> maple syrup <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 8 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled <NEXT_INGR> 3 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup milk <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup maple syrup <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large bowl, combine flour, bacon, baking powder and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> In another bowl, whisk the remaining ingredients together. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. <NEXT_INSTR> Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake at 400F for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. <NEXT_INSTR> Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Maple Bacon Muffins <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> fresh corn kernels <NEXT_INPUT> green onion <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> oil <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 c. fresh corn kernels <NEXT_INGR> 3 Tbsp. each: minced green onion and green pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. unbleached flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 c. grated Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. each: baking powder and salt <NEXT_INGR> dash of pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs, lightly beaten <NEXT_INGR> oil <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Toss together corn, onion, green pepper, flour, cheese, baking powder, salt and a dash of pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat enough oil to cover the bottom of a frying pan to about 1/8-inch, then drop in 2 to 3 tablespoons fritter batter and cook 3 minutes on each side. <NEXT_INSTR> Serves 4. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Corn Fritters <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> cucumber <NEXT_INPUT> gelatine <NEXT_INPUT> yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> handful of mint <NEXT_INPUT> chives <NEXT_INPUT> dill <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 cucumber <NEXT_INGR> 5 leaves gelatine <NEXT_INGR> 14 ounces Greek yogurt, full fat or 2% <NEXT_INGR> handful of mint leaves, very finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon chives, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon dill, finely chopped, plus a few fronds to garnish <NEXT_INGR> zest of 1 lemon <NEXT_INGR> squeeze of lemon juice or a splash of white wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> sea salt and black pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Grate the cucumber and leave it for half an hour, lightly salted, in a sieve over a bowl, pressing down occasionally with the back of a wooden spoon to remove the juices. <NEXT_INSTR> Squeeze out any remaining water before using. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the gelatine in a glass with water to soften (follow pack instructions). <NEXT_INSTR> When soft, heat in a small saucepan with a little water until dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Put the yogurt with all the remaining ingredients in a separate bowl, season to taste and fork it through to mix thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Add in the gelatine and mix further; pour this into a small tin, dariole or jelly mold - I use a miniature loaf tin - and refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> When ready to serve, carefully immerse the tin or mold in hot water, taking care that it does not seep over the rim, and after a few seconds it should loosen so that you can turn it out onto a plate. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with fronds of dill. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fresh Cucumber, Mint And Dill Mousse <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sirloin steak <NEXT_INPUT> avocado cream <NEXT_INPUT> corn tortillas <NEXT_INPUT> lime <NEXT_INPUT> sweet corn <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <NEXT_INPUT> jalapeno pepper <NEXT_INPUT> fresh cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> ground cumin <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> ground red pepper <NEXT_INPUT> avocado <NEXT_INPUT> cilantro <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb top sirloin steak, steak boneless cut 3/4-inch thick <NEXT_INGR> avocado cream (recipe follows) <NEXT_INGR> 8 small corn tortillas, warmed (6 to 7-inch diameter) <NEXT_INGR> lime wedge (optional) <NEXT_INGR> 2 medium ears fresh sweet corn, in husks <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup seeded and chopped tomato <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium jalapeno pepper, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 14 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons ground cumin <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, minced <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 18 teaspoon ground red pepper <NEXT_INGR> 13 cup coarsely mashed avocado <NEXT_INGR> 1 table spoon fresh cilantro <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 12 teaspoon salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pull back husks from corn, leaving husks attached. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove and discard corn silk. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring husks back up around corn; tie in place with kitchen string or strips of corn husk. <NEXT_INSTR> Soak corn in cold water 30 minutes or up to several hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Meanwhile prepare Avocado Cream: Combine coarsely mashed avocado, cilantro, sour cream, lime juice and salt in small bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine rub ingredients; press evenly onto beef steaks; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Step 6 suggests seasoning with salt after grilling. <NEXT_INSTR> I like to season prior, so if you do also, add salt to rub. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove corn from water. <NEXT_INSTR> Place over medium, ash-covered coals; grill, uncovered, 20 to 30 minutes (over medium heat on preheated gas grill, covered, 15 to 25 minutes) or until tender, turning occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Place steaks over medium, ash-covered coals. <NEXT_INSTR> Grill, uncovered, 13 to 16 minutes (over medium heat on preheated gas grill, covered, 8 to 13 minutes) for medium rare (145 degrees on an instant-read thermometer) to medium (160 degrees) doneness, turning occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> To prepare Spicy Grilled Corn Salsa, remove and discard husks when cool enough to handle. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut corn kernels from cobs; place in medium bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add tomatoes and jalapeno. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in cilantro, lime juice and salt; set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Carve steaks into thin slices. <NEXT_INSTR> Season with salt, as desired. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve beef in tortillas; top with Spicy Grilled Corn Salsa and Avocado Cream. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with lime wedges, if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Cumin-Seasoned Steaks W/Spicy Grilled Corn Salsa <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pineapple juice <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry juice cocktail <NEXT_INPUT> water <NEXT_INPUT> whole cloves <NEXT_INPUT> light brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (48 oz.) can pineapple juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 (48 oz.) can cranberry juice cocktail <NEXT_INGR> 4 1/2 c. water <NEXT_INGR> 4 1/2 tsp. whole cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. light brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 4 sticks cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Using a 32-cup coffee pot, place sugar, salt, cloves and cinnamon in the basket. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour juices and water into pot and perk until hot. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hot Cranberry Punch <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Layer <NEXT_INPUT> Spinach <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> Ricotta Layer <NEXT_INPUT> ricotta cheese <NEXT_INPUT> lemon rind <NEXT_INPUT> olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> Pepper Layer <NEXT_INPUT> yellow peppers <NEXT_INPUT> Tomato Layer <NEXT_INPUT> tomato pesto <NEXT_INPUT> black olives <NEXT_INPUT> breadstick <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Spinach Layer <NEXT_INGR> 7 cups Baby Spinach <NEXT_INGR> 2 garlic cloves, finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup olive oil <NEXT_INGR> salt, to taste <NEXT_INGR> Ricotta Layer <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups ricotta cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon grated lemon rind <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 pinch nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> salt, to taste <NEXT_INGR> Roasted Pepper Layer <NEXT_INGR> 2 yellow peppers <NEXT_INGR> Sun-Dried Tomato Layer <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup store bought sun-dried tomato pesto <NEXT_INGR> Garnish <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped black olives or 1/4 cup fresh basil (to garnish) <NEXT_INGR> breadstick (the skinny ones work well) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a blender, puree spinach, garlic, oil and salt until smooth. Place in a bowl and set aside. (Make sure your spinach is completely dry to avoid having the puree become too liquidy). <NEXT_INSTR> In a bowl, stir together ricotta, lemon rind, oil, nutmeg and salt. Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Char the 2 whole peppers on the barbecue or under broiler until black on all sides. (I put them on top of the stove burners). When cooled, peel off skin, take out the seeds and stem and discard. Rinse the roasted pepper then puree in blender until smooth. Salt to taste and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Shooter glasses work best to layer the dips. Begin layering by starting with the spinach puree, followed by the ricotta mix, sun-dried tomato, ricotta mix, pepper puree and finish off with the ricotta mix on top. <NEXT_INSTR> You can use plastic baggies to hold each of the ingredients. Just cut a hole in one of the bottom corners and use it to pour the mixtures into the glass, like you would use a piping bag. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish each glass with either chopped olives or fresh basil and serve with breadsticks. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> No Double Dippin' Here Dip <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> banana <NEXT_INPUT> germ <NEXT_INPUT> nonfat yogurt <NEXT_INPUT> honey <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 large banana, broken into 3 pieces <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. wheat germ <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. plain nonfat yogurt <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. honey <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Place all ingredients in blender. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix at high speed for about 30 seconds. <NEXT_INSTR> Makes 1 shake. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately to avoid separation. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Yogurt Shake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> baguette <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> quartered grape tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> fresh basil <NEXT_INPUT> clove garlic <NEXT_INPUT> extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INPUT> balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> goat cheese <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> whole-milk ricotta cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 12 3/4-inch-thick slices baguette, cut on a bias <NEXT_INGR> 2 cloves garlic, halved <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 cup quartered grape tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil, or to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1 clove garlic, minced <NEXT_INGR> 4 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar <NEXT_INGR> salt and ground black pepper to taste <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup goat cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup garlic and herb cheese spread (such as Boursin(R)) <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup whole-milk ricotta cheese <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). <NEXT_INSTR> Rub 1 side of each baguette slice with the cut-side of halved garlic and drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil. Arrange baguettes slices, oil-side up, on a baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Place baking sheet on the middle rack of preheated oven and bake until baguette slices are golden, about 7 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool, leaving oven on. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss tomatoes, basil, and minced garlic together with 4 teaspoons olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper in a bowl until coated. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix goat cheese, garlic and herb cheese spread, and ricotta cheese together in a separate bowl. Spread cheese mixture onto cooled baguette slices; top with tomato mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in the preheated oven until cheese melts, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tomato Tartine <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> onions <NEXT_INPUT> beef stock <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> pearl barley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 12 cups onions <NEXT_INGR> 2 (14 1/2 ounce) cans beef stock <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces sliced mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 (6 ounce) package dried wild mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon McCormick's Montreal Brand steak seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 12 cup pearl barley <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Pour broth into crockpot and add dried mushrooms. <NEXT_INSTR> In a skillet sweat the onions in the butter ofer medium low heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Once translucent, add the sliced mushrooms and seasoning to the skillet and sautee to desired texture. <NEXT_INSTR> Put th onion mixture into the crockpot and stir in the barley. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook on High for 3 to 4 hours until barley is the prefurred texture. <NEXT_INSTR> Nice lunch servings are 1 cup. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mushroom Barley Soup <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> canola oil <NEXT_INPUT> stew meat <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> beef broth <NEXT_INPUT> red wine vinegar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> cabbage <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> beets <NEXT_INPUT> bay leaves <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INPUT> sour cream <NEXT_INPUT> dill <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 tablespoons canola oil <NEXT_INGR> 1 pound lamb stew meat, cut into 1/2-inch cubes <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, peeled and finely chopped <NEXT_INGR> 3 1/2 quarts beef broth <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup red wine vinegar <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/4 pounds cabbage, cored and shredded <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 pounds ripe tomatoes, diced <NEXT_INGR> 2 pounds beets, peeled and diced (tops reserved) <NEXT_INGR> 2 bay leaves <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 pint sour cream <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup chopped dill <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat canola oil over medium-high heat in a large stockpot until very hot. Add the cubed lamb, and sear until well browned. Stir in the onion, and cook until tender and translucent, about 2 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour in the beef broth, vinegar, and lemon juice; add the cabbage, tomatoes, diced beets, bay leaves, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the lamb and beets are tender, about 2 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Chop the beet tops, stir into the borscht, and simmer an additional 15 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish the soup bowls with a dollop of sour cream, and a sprinkling of dill after ladling in the soup. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Helga'S Russian Borscht <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> citron-flavored vodka <NEXT_INPUT> cranberry juice <NEXT_INPUT> orange liqueur <NEXT_INPUT> lime juice <NEXT_INPUT> thin twists lime <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 4 ounces citron-flavored vodka <NEXT_INGR> 2 ounces cranberry juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 ounce orange liqueur <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons fresh lime juice <NEXT_INGR> 2 thin twists lime, for garnish <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine the vodka, cranberry juice, orange liqueur, and lime juice with ice in a cocktail shaker. <NEXT_INSTR> Shake to combine and chill. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour into 2 glasses filled with ice, and garnish each with 1 twist of lime. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve immediately. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Emeril's New York City Cosmopolitan <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> regular rolled oats <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> almonds <NEXT_INPUT> apricots <NEXT_INPUT> pear <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vegetable oil <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups regular rolled oats <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup chopped almonds <NEXT_INGR> 1/3 cup chopped dried apricots <NEXT_INGR> 1 firm-ripe pear (8 oz.), rinsed, stemmed, cored, and chopped into 1/4-inch pieces <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 large eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 3 tablespoons vegetable oil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 325°. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large bowl, mix oats, baking powder, and salt. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> germ <NEXT_INPUT> oats <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground cloves <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. wheat germ <NEXT_INGR> 3 c. oats, uncooked <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. coconut <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. coarsely chopped nuts <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. honey <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. ground cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2/3 c. raisins <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine all ingredients, except raisins, in an ungreased 13 x 9-inch pan or 3-quart microwave casserole dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in a conventional oven at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. <NEXT_INSTR> Or microwave on High for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring every 2 minutes. <RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> shortening <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> soda <NEXT_INPUT> coconut <NEXT_INPUT> oatmeal <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. shortening <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. soda <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. coconut <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. uncooked oatmeal <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream shortening and sugars; add eggs. <NEXT_INSTR> Add baking powder, soda and flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Add coconut and oatmeal. <NEXT_INSTR> Drop by teaspoon on Pam-sprayed cookie sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 8 to 10 minutes at 350°. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Ranger Cookies <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> white sauce <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> cooked meat <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 c. thick white sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. each: minced onion and parsley <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. chopped cooked meat (roast beef, pork, veal, lamb, chicken, etc.) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix together. <NEXT_INSTR> Chill. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape into pyramids or cylinders. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll in fine dry bread crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside 2 to 3 hours in refrigerator. Dip in mixture of 1 egg (slightly beaten) and 2 tablespoons water. Again, roll in fine dry bread crumbs. <NEXT_INSTR> Let dry again 1 1/2 hours (refrigerate). <NEXT_INSTR> Fry in deep fat (400°) until delicately browned (1 1/2 to 2 minutes). <NEXT_INSTR> Drain on absorbent paper in warm place. <NEXT_INSTR> Keep hot in oven until time to serve. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve hot with hot mushroom or tomato sauce or any desired sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Yield: <NEXT_INSTR> 8 pyramid croquettes, 3 inches high. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Meat Croquettes(Leftover Meat)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Simply Organic Cinnamon Powder <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups fresh cranberries, rinsed and drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup Bob's Red Mill Walnut Baker's Pieces <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Bring sherry, sugar, and cinnamon to a simmer in saucepan over medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Simmer 1 minute, or until sugar has dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Add cranberries and walnuts, and cook 8 minutes, or until cranberries have popped, stirring constantly. <NEXT_INSTR> Transfer to bowl, and chill well before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Heritage Lane Cranberry Sauce <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> wieners <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> yellow cornmeal <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> wieners (desired number) <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. yellow cornmeal <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. milk (or less) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat wieners in hot water; thoroughly drain. <NEXT_INSTR> Have ready deep fat for frying. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine all ingredients. <NEXT_INSTR> Dip hot wieners in mixture and fry in deep fat. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Aunt Emma'S Corny Dogs <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Cooking spray <NEXT_INPUT> turkey breast tenderloins <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> hoisin sauce <NEXT_INPUT> pearl onions <NEXT_INPUT> black olive <NEXT_INPUT> pick <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Cooking spray <NEXT_INGR> 2 turkey breast tenderloins <NEXT_INGR> Salt and ground black pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup hoisin sauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 frozen pearl onions, thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1 large black olive, halved crosswise <NEXT_INGR> Wooden pick <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a shallow roasting pan with cooking spray. <NEXT_INSTR> Place tenderloins in pan and season all over with salt and black pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> On 1 of the tenderloins, spread hoisin sauce all over. <NEXT_INSTR> On the other, drizzle vegetable oil over the top. <NEXT_INSTR> Using wooden picks, attach black olives to pearl onions and then the hoisin- coated turkey tenderloin, making a set of eyes in the meat. <NEXT_INSTR> Roast 30 minutes, until an instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the tenderloin registers at least 160 degrees F. Reserve plain tenderloin for another meal. <NEXT_INSTR> Let hoisin-coated turkey stand 10 minutes before slicing crosswise into 1/2-inch thick slices. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> "Eye-studded" Turkey Tenderloin (Pearl Onions and Black Olives) <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> hamburger <NEXT_INPUT> margarine <NEXT_INPUT> long grain rice <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> tomato puree <NEXT_INPUT> salt <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. hamburger <NEXT_INGR> 1 stick margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. long grain rice <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 can tomato puree or sauce <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper to taste <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix thoroughly all ingredients; salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut core out of head of cabbage. <NEXT_INSTR> Scald head of cabbage and remove leaves. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut thick seam off cabbage leaves. <NEXT_INSTR> Split large leaves in half. <NEXT_INSTR> Put 1 tablespoon of filling in each cabbage leaf. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll and place in pan with seam down. <NEXT_INSTR> Blend 1 large can of tomatoes; add 1 tablespoon sugar, 1 tablespoon wine vinegar and remaining half of puree or sauce. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour over cabbage rolls; add enough tomatoes or water to cover rolls. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut up unused cabbage and place in pan. Bake at 325°. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Halupkies(Cabbage Rolls)   <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground round steak <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> soy sauce <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <NEXT_INPUT> dill pickles <NEXT_INPUT> Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> onion <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 lb. ground round steak <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. soy sauce <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. chopped parsley <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. chopped dill pickles <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. grated Cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. chopped onion <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Combine ground round steak with all the ingredients; blend thoroughly. <NEXT_INSTR> Shape into 6 patties. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on broiler pan about 3 inches from broiler and cook for 4 minutes on each side. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Broiled Steakburgers <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> phyllo dough <NEXT_INPUT> Cooking spray <NEXT_INPUT> powdered sugar <NEXT_INPUT> tawny port <NEXT_INPUT> honey <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> green grapes <NEXT_INPUT> red grapes <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> lemon juice <NEXT_INPUT> goat cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cream cheese <NEXT_INPUT> walnuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 9 (14 x 9-inch) sheets frozen phyllo dough, thawed <NEXT_INGR> Cooking spray <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons powdered sugar, divided <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup tawny port <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon honey <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt, divided <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons butter <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups seedless green grapes <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup seedless red grapes <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons granulated sugar <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 ounce goat cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 1 (3-ounce) package 1/3-less-fat cream cheese, softened <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons chopped walnuts, toasted <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 350°. <NEXT_INSTR> Place 1 phyllo sheet on a large cutting board or work surface (cover remaining dough to keep from drying). Lightly coat dough with cooking spray. Place 2 tablespoons powdered sugar in a small sieve; dust phyllo lightly with powdered sugar. Repeat procedure with 2 phyllo sheets, cooking spray, and powdered sugar, ending with powdered sugar; press layers gently to adhere. Cut phyllo stack lengthwise into 3 (3 x 14-inch) rectangles. Cut each rectangle crosswise into 4 (3 x 3 1/2-inch) rectangles to form 12 rectangles. Carefully stack 1 rectangle on top of another to form 6 stacks; press layers gently. Place stacks on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Repeat procedure with the remaining phyllo, cooking spray, and powdered sugar to form 18 stacks. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover the phyllo stacks with parchment paper; place another baking sheet on parchment. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until stacks are golden and crisp. Carefully remove top baking sheet and parchment. Cool phyllo stacks completely on baking sheet. <NEXT_INSTR> Bring port to a boil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook 10 minutes or until reduced to 1 1/2 tablespoons. Remove from heat; stir in honey and 1/8 teaspoon salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add remaining 1/8 teaspoon salt, grapes, granulated sugar, and juice. Saute 10 minutes or until grapes are tender, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat, and cool to room temperature. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine cheeses in a small bowl, stirring well. <NEXT_INSTR> Place 1 phyllo stack on each of 6 plates, and top with 1 teaspoon cheese mixture and 1 tablespoon grape mixture. Repeat the layers once, ending with phyllo stack. Drizzle 1 teaspoon port mixture onto each plate. Sprinkle each serving with 1 teaspoon walnuts, and dust evenly with the remaining 2 teaspoons powdered sugar. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Sautéed Grape Napoleons With Port Reduction <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> bread <NEXT_INPUT> hamburger <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> salsa <NEXT_INPUT> green chilies <NEXT_INPUT> tomato sauce <NEXT_INPUT> mozzarella cheese <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 loaf French bread <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 lb hamburger <NEXT_INGR> 1 onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> salt & pepper <NEXT_INGR> 8 ounces salsa (or more to taste) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 ounce) can diced green chilies <NEXT_INGR> 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce <NEXT_INGR> grated mozzarella cheese (to taste) <NEXT_INGR> grated cheddar cheese (to taste) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat oven to 350 degrees. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut French bread in half lengthwise. <NEXT_INSTR> Hollow out both halves of loaf, leaving about a 1-inch shell. <NEXT_INSTR> Brown hamburger and onion in skillet. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain off fat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add salt, pepper, salsa, green chilies and tomato sauce to burger/onion mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat through until bubbly. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon evenly into both loaf halves. <NEXT_INSTR> Top with both grated cheeses. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on cookie sheet and heat in oven until cheese melts (a few minutes). <NEXT_INSTR> Slice loaf halves cross-wise into 2-inch wide sections. <NEXT_INSTR> Note: Depending on the size of the French bread, number of servings will vary. <NEXT_INSTR> Also, I'm guessing at the prep/cook times as I have not fixed this recipe yet. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Mexican Bread <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> White Rice <NEXT_INPUT> Onion <NEXT_INPUT> Red Bell Pepper <NEXT_INPUT> Zucchini <NEXT_INPUT> Fresh Basil <NEXT_INPUT> Ground Jimmy <NEXT_INPUT> Tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> White Cheese <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> Mozzarella Cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups White Rice <NEXT_INGR> 1 whole Onion <NEXT_INGR> 1 whole Red Bell Pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 whole Zucchini <NEXT_INGR> 1 bunch (a Handful) Of Fresh Basil <NEXT_INGR> 1 package Ground Jimmy Dean Breakfast Sausage (1 Pound) <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (14 Oz. Size) Diced Tomatoes <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tablespoons Soft White Cheese (goat, Cream Or Neufchatel) <NEXT_INGR> 3 dashes Salt and Pepper (Just To Taste) <NEXT_INGR> 1- 1/2 cup Mozzarella Cheese, Shredded <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cook 2 Cups of white rice (you will add all of it to the casserole later) according to package instructions. <NEXT_INSTR> When done, set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Dice onion and red bell pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut zucchini into quarters (long ways) and then chop into small chunks. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Chiffonade your handful of washed fresh basil and set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> In a large non-stick skillet begin browning your ground breakfast sausage over medium-high heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook until almost, but not completely cooked. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain some grease if necessary. <NEXT_INSTR> Now add your diced onions and peppers and saute for a few minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Next, add your chopped zucchini and continue cooking. <NEXT_INSTR> When the zucchini begins to soften up go ahead and add your can of diced tomatoes and turn the burner down to medium-low. <NEXT_INSTR> NOTE: You may want to drain just a bit of the juice off of the tomatoes depending on how you like your casserole (more or less moist). <NEXT_INSTR> Stir until combined. <NEXT_INSTR> Lastly, add 2 Tablespoons of white soft cheese (either goat, cream cheese or neufchatel will work whatever you have on hand). <NEXT_INSTR> Stir until cheese is melted and incorporated. <NEXT_INSTR> Salt and pepper to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour all of this into a large 13x9 inch baking dish. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the cooked rice and stir together until all of the rice is mixed evenly into the sausage & tomato mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Lastly, sprinkle shredded mozzarella over top and bake in a 350 degrees oven until the cheese is melted. <NEXT_INSTR> My kids really liked this. <NEXT_INSTR> I think breakfast sausage is the key when it comes to the kids! <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Breakfast Sausage and Rice Casserole for Dinner <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chicken broth <NEXT_INPUT> tomato juice <NEXT_INPUT> basil <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> oregano <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> carrot <NEXT_INPUT> celery <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> pasta shells <NEXT_INPUT> parmesan cheese <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups low sodium chicken broth <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups tomato juice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tablespoon basil <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon oregano <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 teaspoon pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium carrot, sliced <NEXT_INGR> 1 stalk celery, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 medium onion, chopped <NEXT_INGR> 1 garlic clove, pressed <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can diced tomatoes, un-drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup pasta shells, your choice <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup parmesan cheese, grated <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large freezer bag combine all ingredients except pasta shells and grated cheese. Seal the bag, squeeze out as much air as possible. <NEXT_INSTR> In a 1 quart freezer bag add the parmesan cheese, seal the bag. <NEXT_INSTR> I choose to also add the pasta shells into a quart size baggie so I have everything in one place. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the 3 filled bags and the printed recipe into a large freezer bag, seal. <NEXT_INSTR> To cook; thaw. <NEXT_INSTR> Pour veggie mixture into the crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours, or until veggies are tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Add pasta to the mix during the last hour of cooking. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with grated parm cheese. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Vegetable Soup Crock Pot Oamc <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> pineapple <NEXT_INPUT> mandarin oranges <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla pudding <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 can pineapple chunks (reserve juice) <NEXT_INGR> 1 can mandarin oranges (reserve juice) <NEXT_INGR> 1 box instant vanilla pudding <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Note: <NEXT_INSTR> Use any fresh, canned or frozen fruit. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Out Of This World Fruit Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> applesauce <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> cocoa <NEXT_INPUT> cloves <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> raisins <NEXT_INPUT> hot water <NEXT_INPUT> soda <NEXT_INPUT> nuts <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1/2 c. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, well beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 c. applesauce <NEXT_INGR> 2 c. flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 2 Tbsp. cocoa <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. cloves <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 tsp. salt <NEXT_INGR> 1 tsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. raisins <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 c. hot water <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. soda <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 c. nuts <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Cream butter and sugar. <NEXT_INSTR> Add well beaten egg and applesauce. Sift flour, cinnamon, cocoa, cloves and salt. <NEXT_INSTR> Add raisins and nuts to this mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Add to applesauce mixture with the hot water in which the soda has been dissolved. <NEXT_INSTR> Be sure some of the flour mixture is the last addition. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 45 minutes at 375° in greased and floured pan. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Applesauce Cake <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> milk <NEXT_INPUT> Rosemary <NEXT_INPUT> garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Hickory smoking chips <NEXT_INPUT> Salt <NEXT_INPUT> pork chops <NEXT_INPUT> Garlic <NEXT_INPUT> Onion <NEXT_INPUT> Mushroom <NEXT_INPUT> Red Pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 2 cups milk <NEXT_INGR> Rosemary sprigs <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon minced garlic <NEXT_INGR> Hickory smoking chips <NEXT_INGR> Salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 3 medium pork chops <NEXT_INGR> Garlic and Bleu Cheese Mashed Potatoes, recipe follows <NEXT_INGR> Caramelized Pears, recipe follows <NEXT_INGR> Onion Straws, recipe follows <NEXT_INGR> Smoked Baby Portobello Mushroom, recipe follows <NEXT_INGR> Roasted Red Pepper, recipe follows <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a medium sized bowl, combine milk, rosemary, garlic and salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Place each pork chop in the bowl and allow the meat to marinate for approximately 1/2 hour. <NEXT_INSTR> Over an open-flame grill, sear each side of the pork chops until black grill marks form. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the meat from the grill. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat a large saute pan over medium-high heat and place hickory smoking chips in the bottom of the pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover the chips with a lid, which is slightly smaller than the pan, and then place each pork chop on top of the lid. <NEXT_INSTR> This will allow the meat to smoke and become infused with the hickory flavor. <NEXT_INSTR> Smoke the meat until it is fork tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with potatoes, pears and onion straws. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with red pepper and mushroom strips. <NEXT_INSTR> A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. <NEXT_INSTR> The FN chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results. <NEXT_INSTR> Yukon gold potatoes, approximately 2 pounds, cubed <NEXT_INSTR> 1 tablespoon chopped garlic <NEXT_INSTR> 1 cup milk <NEXT_INSTR> 1 cup chicken stock <NEXT_INSTR> Bleu cheese, to taste <NEXT_INSTR> Salt and pepper <NEXT_INSTR> In a large pot, add the potatoes. <NEXT_INSTR> Cover with water and bring to a rolling boil. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil the potatoes until they are soft. <NEXT_INSTR> Drain the water from the pot and place the potatoes in a medium sized bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add all of the remaining ingredients to the bowl and mash together until you reach the desired creaminess. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> 2 pears, sliced <NEXT_INSTR> 1 cup apple juice concentrate <NEXT_INSTR> 4 tablespoons butter <NEXT_INSTR> 4 tablespoons all-purpose flour <NEXT_INSTR> 1 clove garlic, chopped <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium sized saute pan, combine all of the ingredients over medium heat and saute until the pears soften and the sauce thickens. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> 1/4 cup milk <NEXT_INSTR> Olive oil, 2 tablespoons <NEXT_INSTR> Salt and pepper <NEXT_INSTR> 1 Vidalia onion, sliced <NEXT_INSTR> All-purpose flour, for dredging <NEXT_INSTR> Vegetable oil, for frying <NEXT_INSTR> In a medium sized bowl, combine milk, oil, salt and pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Slice an onion into long strips and place them into the milk mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Shake off any excess liquid, and then dredge the onion strips in flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Heat oil over medium-high heat in a medium sized saute pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the dredged onions into the saute pan and cook until they are brown and slightly crispy. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> 1 red pepper, whole <NEXT_INSTR> Olive oil, for rubbing <NEXT_INSTR> Thoroughly clean the skin of the red bell pepper. <NEXT_INSTR> Rub olive oil lightly over the entire surface of the skin. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the whole pepper on an open flame and roast it until the skin is blackened. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the pepper from the flame and rub the charred skin with a towel. <NEXT_INSTR> Once the skin is removed, slice the pepper into thin strips and serve with the pork chops. <NEXT_INSTR> 1 baby portobello mushroom, whole <NEXT_INSTR> 1 garlic clove, chopped <NEXT_INSTR> Olive oil, for rubbing <NEXT_INSTR> Salt and pepper <NEXT_INSTR> Thoroughly clean the skin of the baby mushroom. <NEXT_INSTR> Rub the entire surface generously with garlic, olive oil and salt and pepper, to taste. <NEXT_INSTR> Place the whole mushroom into a steamer and allow it to steam for approximately 20 minutes, or until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove the mushroom from the steamer and slice into strips. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve with the pork chops. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Hickory-smoked Pork Chops with Bleu Cheese Mashed Potatoes and Caramelized Pears and Onion Straws <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> sweet potatoes <NEXT_INPUT> condensed milk <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> butter <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> white sugar <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> cornstarch <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> baking powder <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> marshmallows <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (29 ounce) can cut sweet potatoes, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 cup butter, melted <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons vanilla extract <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup flour <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup white sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon cornstarch <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 (9 inch) unbaked pastry pie shells <NEXT_INGR> 1 1/2 cups miniature marshmallows, divided <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Set rack to center of the oven and place a cookie sheet on baking rack. <NEXT_INSTR> Whip sweet potatoes in a mixing bowl with an electric hand mixer until soft. Add sweetened condensed milk, eggs, butter, and vanilla extract; continue blending until incorporated. Blend flour, white sugar, brown sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, nutmeg, baking powder, and salt into the sweet potato mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Divide sweet potato mixture between the pie shells. Cover pies with aluminum foil. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Reduce heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Continue baking pies uncovered until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 40 more minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove aluminum foil and pile marshmallows into the center of each pie. Return to oven and continue baking until marshmallows are golden brown, about 10 minutes. Allow pies to cool before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Creamy Sweet Potato Pie <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> ground beef <NEXT_INPUT> mustard seeds <NEXT_INPUT> garlic salt <NEXT_INPUT> course ground pepper <NEXT_INPUT> curing salt <NEXT_INPUT> liquid smoke <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 5 lbs ground beef, 93/7 <NEXT_INGR> 2 12 tablespoons mustard seeds <NEXT_INGR> 2 12 tablespoons garlic salt <NEXT_INGR> 2 12 tablespoons course ground pepper <NEXT_INGR> 2 -3 tablespoons curing salt (morton tender quick) <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons liquid smoke <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Mix all the ingredients well, place in a ziploc bag. <NEXT_INSTR> Refrigerate for 3 days. <NEXT_INSTR> Mix well each day. <NEXT_INSTR> On 3rd day shape into 4 rolls (about the diameter of a cracker). <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 175 degrees for 8-10 hours. <NEXT_INSTR> Wrap and refrigerate. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Salami <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> liqueur <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> orange <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 1/4 c. Peach Schnapps liqueur <NEXT_INGR> 2 qt. orange juice, chilled <NEXT_INGR> ice <NEXT_INGR> 16 oz. pkg. frozen unsweetened peach slices <NEXT_INGR> 1 orange, thinly sliced <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In large punch bowl, combine Peach Schnapps liqueur and orange juice; blend well. <NEXT_INSTR> Add ice. <NEXT_INSTR> Garnish with peach slices and orange slices. <NEXT_INSTR> If desired, make an ice ring using the peach slices and orange slices. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Fuzzy Navel Punch <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> unsalted butter <NEXT_INPUT> brown sugar <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> molasses <NEXT_INPUT> molasses <NEXT_INPUT> orange juice <NEXT_INPUT> orange zest <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> baking soda <NEXT_INPUT> ground cloves <NEXT_INPUT> ground cinnamon <NEXT_INPUT> ground ginger <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 3/4 cup unsalted butter <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup brown sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 large egg <NEXT_INGR> 2 tablespoons molasses <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon molasses <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon orange juice <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon orange zest, finely grated <NEXT_INGR> 2 3/4 - 3 cups flour <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon baking soda <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 teaspoon ground cloves <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon <NEXT_INGR> 2 teaspoons ground ginger <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large mixing bowl or using a standing mixer cream the butter and sugar until light and well combined, beat in one egg. <NEXT_INSTR> Add the molasses, orange juice, and zest. Sift the dry ingredients together and stir into the mixture making a soft, smooth dough. More flour can be added if dough is too sticky. <NEXT_INSTR> Place dough on lightly floured surface and knead the dough three times. Separate dough into three pieces and shape into logs, approximately eight inches long. Wrap logs well in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. <NEXT_INSTR> Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Slice logs into circles, 1/8-inch thick or less and place on lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake for about 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. When baked, place cookies on wire racks to cool. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Swedish Orange Gingersnaps <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> oil <NEXT_INPUT> beef cutlets <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> milk <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> oil or shortening, for frying <NEXT_INGR> 6 -8 beef cutlets, tenderized (round or cube steak) <NEXT_INGR> 3 -4 cups seasoned flour (flour with savory seasonings of your choice or Seasoned Flour) <NEXT_INGR> 3 eggs <NEXT_INGR> 2 cups milk <NEXT_INGR> 14 cup flour <NEXT_INGR> salt and pepper <NEXT_INGR> 4 cups milk <NEXT_INGR> 1 -2 tablespoon dripping, included the cooked bits <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat about 1/4-1/2 inch of oil or shortening in a frying pan. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat eggs then combine with milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Dredge tenderized beef cutlets in flour, then egg-milk wash, then a second time in flour. <NEXT_INSTR> Place dredged cutlets into heated oil and fry until golden, about 10 minutes. <NEXT_INSTR> Turn steak over and cook for another 5 minutes or so until both sides are golden. <NEXT_INSTR> Remove to a plate lined with paper towels and allow to drain. <NEXT_INSTR> TIME TO MAKE THE GRAVY: Drain all but 1-2 tablespoons of drippings from the frying pan; leave all the cooked bits you can. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine flour and seasonings with milk, then pour into the pan with drippings and bits. <NEXT_INSTR> Continually stir/whisk the gravy over medium heat for 10-15 minutes, or until desired consistency. <NEXT_INSTR> Taste and add more salt or pepper if necessary. <NEXT_INSTR> Serve generously over each piece of chicken fried steak. <NEXT_INSTR> Sop up any extra gravy with a biscuit. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Chicken Fried Steak W/Cream Gravy <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> Wisconsin <NEXT_INPUT> Wisconsin <NEXT_INPUT> onion <NEXT_INPUT> ketchup <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> Wisconsin bratwurst <NEXT_INGR> Wisconsin beer (preferably cheap stuff) <NEXT_INGR> strong onion or 2 <NEXT_INGR> horseradish/mustard <NEXT_INGR> ketchup <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Put brats and 1/2 to 1 whole sliced onion in large kettle, cover with beer, 2 to 3 cans. <NEXT_INSTR> Boil 30 to 40 minutes until brats turn a sort of white. <NEXT_INSTR> Let sit in kettle for a minute or two. <NEXT_INSTR> Take kettle to hot charcoal grill and put brats on grill. <NEXT_INSTR> As they brown, take them off and put them back in the beer and onion sauce. Serve from kettle on hot dog buns with horseradish mustard and the works and the rest of the beer. <NEXT_INSTR> Great for summertime cookout. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Wisconsin Beer Brats <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> chili powder <NEXT_INPUT> pastry shell <NEXT_INPUT> cheddar cheese <NEXT_INPUT> shredded Monterey Jack cheese <NEXT_INPUT> flour <NEXT_INPUT> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> cream <NEXT_INPUT> green chiles <NEXT_INPUT> olives <NEXT_INPUT> salt <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 teaspoon chili powder <NEXT_INGR> 1 pastry shell (9 inches), unbaked <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour <NEXT_INGR> 3 large eggs, beaten <NEXT_INGR> 1-1/2 cups half-and-half cream <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (4 ounces) chopped green chiles, well drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 can (2-1/4 ounces) sliced ripe olives, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 teaspoon salt <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 teaspoon pepper <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Sprinkle chili powder over the inside of the crust. Combine cheeses with flour and place in crust. <NEXT_INSTR> Combine eggs, cream, chiles, olives, salt and pepper. Pour over cheese. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake at 325° for 45-55 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into wedges. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Tex-Mex Quiche <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> eggs <NEXT_INPUT> milk <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> vanilla <NEXT_INPUT> nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> brandy <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 10 whole eggs <NEXT_INGR> 3 qt. milk <NEXT_INGR> 2 1/2 c. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. vanilla <NEXT_INGR> 2 tsp. nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1 c. brandy, bourbon or rum (optional) <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Heat milk. <NEXT_INSTR> Beat eggs, sugar and vanilla. <NEXT_INSTR> When milk begins to simmer, slowly add egg mixture while beating continuously. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook over low heat until mixture coats spoon. <NEXT_INSTR> Sprinkle nutmeg over top. <NEXT_INSTR> Add 1 cup of booze if desired. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Egg Nog <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> butter <NEXT_INPUT> mushrooms <NEXT_INPUT> Milk <NEXT_INPUT> POLLY-O Original Ricotta Cheese <NEXT_INPUT> garlic powder <NEXT_INPUT> ground nutmeg <NEXT_INPUT> pepper <NEXT_INPUT> pastry <NEXT_INPUT> egg <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1 cup finely chopped mushrooms <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. (10 oz.) frozen chopped spinach, thawed, drained <NEXT_INGR> 3/4 cup shredded POLLY-O Whole Milk Mozzarella Cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 cup POLLY-O Original Ricotta Cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/4 tsp. garlic powder <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. ground nutmeg <NEXT_INGR> 1/8 tsp. pepper <NEXT_INGR> 1 pkg. (17.3 oz.) frozen puff pastry sheets (2 sheets), thawed <NEXT_INGR> 1 egg, lightly beaten <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Preheat oven to 400F. <NEXT_INSTR> Melt butter in large skillet on medium heat. <NEXT_INSTR> Add mushrooms; cook and stir 3 to 4 min. <NEXT_INSTR> or until tender. <NEXT_INSTR> Spoon into large bowl. <NEXT_INSTR> Add spinach, cheeses, garlic powder, nutmeg and pepper; mix well. <NEXT_INSTR> Set aside. <NEXT_INSTR> Roll each pastry sheet into 12-inch square. <NEXT_INSTR> Cut each square into 4 (6-inch) squares. <NEXT_INSTR> Top each 6-inch square with 1/4 cup of the spinach mixture. <NEXT_INSTR> Moisten pastry edges lightly with water. <NEXT_INSTR> Fold each pastry square over filling to form triangle; seal edges with fork. <NEXT_INSTR> Brush tops of turnovers with egg. <NEXT_INSTR> Make 2 or 3 slits in top of each turnover with sharp knife. <NEXT_INSTR> Place on ungreased baking sheets. <NEXT_INSTR> Bake 20 min. <NEXT_INSTR> or until golden brown. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Spinach and Mushroom Turnovers <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> head lettuce <NEXT_INPUT> water chestnuts <NEXT_INPUT> Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INPUT> sugar <NEXT_INPUT> frozen peas <NEXT_INPUT> mayonnaise <NEXT_INPUT> bacon <NEXT_INPUT> tomato <NEXT_INPUT> egg <NEXT_INPUT> parsley <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 small head lettuce <NEXT_INGR> 1 can sliced water chestnuts <NEXT_INGR> 1 can Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1 Tbsp. sugar <NEXT_INGR> 1 small pkg. frozen peas <NEXT_INGR> 1 pt. mayonnaise <NEXT_INGR> 2 lb. bacon, fried and crumbled <NEXT_INGR> tomato <NEXT_INGR> hard-boiled egg <NEXT_INGR> parsley <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Layer salad in order listed, beginning with lettuce and ending with parsley. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> 7 Layer Salad <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

Parmesan cheese <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. margarine <NEXT_INGR> 1/2 c. milk <NEXT_INGR> 8 oz. fettuccine, cooked and drained <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> In a large saucepan, stir cheeses, margarine and milk over low heat until smooth. <NEXT_INSTR> Add fettuccine. <NEXT_INSTR> Toss and serve. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> 15 Minute Fettuccine Alfredo <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>

<RECIPE_START> <INPUT_START> beef stew seasoning <NEXT_INPUT> beef <NEXT_INPUT> Italian-style diced tomatoes <NEXT_INPUT> mixed vegetables <NEXT_INPUT> mushroom stems <INPUT_END> <INGR_START> 1 (1 1/2 ounce) packagemccormick beef stew seasoning <NEXT_INGR> 2 lbs stew beef chunks (I buy a chuck roast and cube my own) <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 ounce) can Italian-style diced tomatoes, undrained <NEXT_INGR> 1 (15 ounce) can Veg-All or 1 (15 ounce) canother mixed vegetables, drained <NEXT_INGR> 1 (4 1/2 ounce) can mushroom stems and pieces, drained <INGR_END> <INSTR_START> Follow directions on spice packet, using the liquid from the can of tomatoes with water to equal 3 cups liquid that the seasoning packet calls for. <NEXT_INSTR> Cook in large pot or Dutch Oven over medium heat 1 hour minimum. <NEXT_INSTR> (If you didn't tenderize the meat, you may want to cook it a half hour or so longer. <NEXT_INSTR> ). <NEXT_INSTR> Turn up heat and thicken with 1-3 T flour if necessary. <NEXT_INSTR> Stir in drained can of Veg-All and drained can of mushrooms immediately before serving. <INSTR_END> <TITLE_START> Easy Beef Stew <TITLE_END> <RECIPE_END>
